name: Can't Catch Harry: White Trash Butterflies
description:
This expansion pack requires the original Can't Catch Harry game (based on the popular card game Spoons) and offers more characters with alternative rules to keep the game fresh.

The White Trash Butterflies expansion specifically includes 5 additional sets of characters from the Odd 1s Out videos (Monsters, Stranger, Riddler, Cats, and Dad) and 20 rule cards to play one per round.

These rules may affect the gameplay based on goals, point values, or actions. Once you have four of the same cards, Designed by James from The Odd 1s Out,

name: No Soldier Left Behind: Battle of the Bulge
description: No Soldier Left Behind is a cooperative wargame which puts each player into the shoes of a single American soldier. By choosing what to focus on – firing on the enemy, being stealthy, or even summoning your courage by looking at a photo of the girl back home - you test your mettle against the forces of the German army. Can you complete your mission, and bring back all your buddies in the process?
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Into The Echoside: The Shaggy Show
description:
A single promotional card only available from the Dark Carnival Games Con in 2018.

From the card's announcement on Facebook: "IT’S SHAGGGGYYY TIMMMMEEE! World Premiere: We present to you: THE SHAGGY SHOW promo card!!! DCG Con, May 11-13th, in Denver, is the ONLY place you can cop the Oracle of the Three Rings expansion for Into the Echoside, featuring the exclusive Shaggy Show Promo Card! You’ll get this exclusive card FREE with your purchase of Oracle…ONLY at the Con. Only at the DCG Con. For Juggalos, By Juggalos!"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Taste of China
description:
Chinese culinary delights are within reach of your shopping basket. You will need to be fast and quick-sighted in order to bring some home. Ready, steady, go!

After all the tiles have been displayed, the first player turns a card showing an ingredient. The players have now to find the way of a single colour leading to the ingredient before the other players do.

name: Hex up!
description:
Hex Up! contains 6 different games that will bring you 6 different game experiences.

Individual game variants:

Pack. Everyone plays at the same time, no matter the order. Players take hexes from the table, combine them on top of each other and layer them on top of the community deck in the rack. Each player's job is to quickly find a suitable hex, or suitably combine two hexes on top of each other in their hand and place it on the deck in the rack, suits up. The move cannot be corrected once it has been placed.

Land. Each player has their own topping deck of hexes (face down in front of them), with 3 hexes laid out face up in front of them, and an initial supply of chips. Players regularly rotate their turns clockwise. Once all players have run out of their reload pack and their unloaded supply of hexes, the game ends and the player with the most coins wins.

Speed. Each player creates their own top-up deck from their hexes, and places it face down in front of them. The game ends when all players have run out of hexes in the replenishment deck. The player with the most coins wins.

Bluff: The object of the game is to get as many coins as possible by collecting all suits in a player's hand. The player with the most coins at the end of the game wins.

Think. The solving team closes their eyes, the entering team stacks the assignment on the table. On command, the solving team looks at the table and views the assignment for 1 minute. The team's task is to identify which suits and in which positions are hidden on the covered assignment by placing the corresponding chips around the card. The solving team gets as many coins as they hit the correct colors and holes. In the next round, the teams' roles are reversed. The team with the most coins after six rounds wins.

Code: The object of the game is to get as many coins as possible, which a player gets whenever his personal color combination appears on the deck. The game ends when all players run out of hexes both in the recharge deck and in their hand. The player with the most coins wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly Magyarország
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Hungary.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Local de Ensayo
description:
It's your time, now you can become the author you've always wanted and set up the group you've always dreamed of for the next COAC (Cadiz's Carnival Contest). But be careful, the rest of the authors will have their mission, to annoy you and to lead a better group than yours.

This card driven game lets you get a band together to compete in Cadiz's (Spain) most prestigious contest.

This is a filler game for anyone who wants to dare to put together a group for the next COAC. You can play from 2 to 6 players and being 7 years old is enough to be able to join the game, which will last between 15 and 30 minutes.

name: Jumping Jack
description: Each player has five matching "Jacks" which are shot from spring-loaded launchers onto one of five plastic towers. The round ends when all ten jacks have been shot (you can knock off your opponent's pieces). Round score is calculated and the highest score after five rounds wins.

name: Escape Game: Das verfluchte Schloss
description:
On a school trip you visit a castle. As soon as you enter, all the doors close and you are trapped in the castle. Now you have to find the exit together.

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

name: Escape Game: Das Labor des Dr. Frank
description:
Aliens have abducted you while you were searching in space for new planets where humans could live. Now you are locked in the cockpit of your spaceship: Try to free yourself and return to Earth!

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

name: Escape Game: Abenteuer in London
description:
The legendary secrets of the breathtaking metropolis of London are finally to be uncovered. For this, you are needed as an investigator! Explore every corner of the mysterious city and solve the numerous tricky puzzles and secrets you encounter along the way. Only in this way will there be an escape at the end to pass the exciting adventure.

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

name: The Crimean Campaign
description:
The Crimean Campaign, 1941 -42 (TCC) is a strategic level two-player wargame (with strong operational undertones) of low-intermediate complexity covering the fighting across the peninsula that climaxed with the German capture of Sevastopol.

The action simulated in the game took place historically between 28 October 1941 and 4 July 1942. The first date marks the German entry into the Crimea via the Perekop Isthmus, while the second marks the end of organized Soviet resistance across the whole peninsula. Those nine calendar months are divided into chronologically varied and unequal numbers of turns. That approach allows for the convenient simulation of the ebbs and flows in the action that took place due to bad weather and logistical and command-control constraints.

The Perekop Isthmus fight, which took place from 24 September through 27 October, just off-map to the north, is not included in the game because it took place across terrain too restrictive to allow for maneuver by either side. At this scale it would have come down to how lucky the German player got in rolling his inescapably low-range and mid-range initial frontal attacks. So that episode is considered to have taken place as the last act of the Dniepr River campaign rather than the first act in the Crimean campaign.

—description from the publisher

name: Story Puzzle: Das kleine böse Puzzle
description: Help urgently needed! The little bad Puzzle was cursed in the laboratory of the great warlock Magnus Myst! By whom? It can no longer remember! Only his last memory lies scattered in 200 pieces before the children. They first have to puzzle them together! And then? Then tricky puzzles must be solved, dangerous secrets uncovered and the little bad puzzle freed from the curse. This interactive puzzle adventure is not for the faint of heart! Do the children dare to help the little bad Puzzle? For fearless children from 8 and fans the perfect birthday gift!

name: I Tre Porcellini
description:
The Three Little Pigs is a fantastic building game.
Build the houses of the three little pigs like in the fairy tale! Roll the dice to collect all the pieces of the wooden house, the brick house and the straw house. Thanks to the interlocking puzzle, learn to recognize colors and shapes and ... Always be careful of the wolf!

Each player has to build a set of houses consisting of a thatched house, one of wood and one of bricks.

It is played in turns, clockwise. If you are the smallest, you will be the first to play! The goal is to build first all the houses.

On your turn, after sorting the house tiles, roll the die and see what happens!

name: The Little Mermaid
description:
The Little Mermaid is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Flip cards and cross out 1-3 adjacent animals in the underwater world but watch out because incomplete polyominos will score you negative points at the end. Complete rows and you will get a bonus power.

About the fairy tale:
The Little Mermaid lives together with her five sisters. The youngest and most curious amongst her siblings, she explores the underwater world. Yet life beneath the sea isn't enough for her. When she falls in love with a shipwrecked prince, she makes a deal with the evil witch. She trades her voice for legs, in an attempt to win the prince's everlasting love.

—description from the publisher

name: Sherlock: Case Connection – Promo Cards
description:
A set of two promo cards giving away at conventions with purchase of the game.

Both are Thread cards; one with Forensic Proof and Cyber Proof icons and the other with Forensic Proof and Witness Proof icons.

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Rebirth Fast Forces
description:
Celebrate the release of DC Comics HeroClix: DC Rebirthwith a new Fast Forces set featuring the Justice League. DC Comics’ most powerful and prolific superhero team reunites with all-new dials and two never-before-clixed characters from the Justice League of China: Super-Man (Kenan Kong) and Bat-Man (Wang Baixi). In this Fast Forces, you will also find core Justice League characters like Aquaman, Cyborg, The Flash, and Wonder Woman!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Eddie Arcaro Bluegrass Handicap Horse Race Game
description:
An early 60's horse race game endorsed by legendary jockey Eddie Arcaro released by Transogram 1962. Released between Eddie Arcaro Sweepstakes (Lourol Enterprises) 1954 and Eddie Arcaro Riders Up (Riders Up Inc.) 1969. The game features beautiful mid century illustrated box art and colourful board graphics.

A 3 dice horse race game with an elementary betting component. The inside lanes are shorter and lane changing adds a measure of strategy and skill to the racing. The goal can be simply to have your horse win the race or add betting to win the most amount of money.
—user summary

name: Alarm
description:
Alarm! At emergency dispatch, police officers, fire constables and ambulance drivers are making ready in a haste to dispatch and help anyone in need.

But there are several crisis at once, so the different crew has to work out together which order the emergencies are resolved.

Alarm is a cooperative game, where players win or lose as a team. They will win if they succeed to solve all emergencies, and will lose if they don't manage before the deck runs out for a second time, or if the alarm is triggered in all emergencies at once.

—description from the box

name: My First Bakery Board Game
description:
Help the bakers get the bakery display’s ready for the day! It’s almost time for the bakeries to open and the bakers need to get all the tasty treats ready before the bakeries open for the day. Players take turns to find matching pairs of treats for their bakery before time runs out. Memorize where the matching treats show up and avoid turning over the clock that counts down to opening time.

In My First Bakery, kids can work together to find all the pairs of matching treats needed to get their bakeries ready while trying to avoid the clock that is counting down to opening time. For an extra challenge bakers can compete in a bakery showdown to be the first one to find all of their matching treats before the other bakers! If players can find all their matching pairs of treats before the clock reaches the last space and the bakeries must open, everyone wins!

Colorful and detailed images and settings make this story driven game a great way for kids to develop their strategic thinking, teamwork, and memory skills. Limited reading and image based play make this an easy game for kids ages 4+ to learn and play!

-description from publisher

name: Dynamis
description:
It's about God and the world and a dream of congregations. Each player directs one of eight congregations that thrives, grows and prospers: the Catholic cathedral, a national Protestant church, a classic free church, a start-up, the small-town congregation, the city church, the event church or a international congregation.
You win by doubling the worship attendance to 150 visitors, by raising all your qualities to the value 7 or by a third way - because it is about the triune God - but this is a secret and can only be experienced in the game.
To do so, the players are playing cards and roll dice.
The game is played in rounds of three phases:
Phase 1: Reflection - Draw up to five cards.
Phase 2: Use - Play up to three cards and throw dices for most of it.
Phase 3: Traditions - Applying of exisiting traditions and establishing new traditions, which give you "bonus" till end of the game(traditions cannot be abolished that easy so bonus may become bothersome later).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 易妖战记 (Yi Yao Zhan Ji)
description:
易妖战记 (Yi Yao Zhan Ji / Battle of Dynasty) is a 2-player battle game. Each player controls a different faction, fighting for the secret power of Yao. The winner will be the creator of the next dynasty in this fantasy world.

There are 4 factions in the game: “兽侠 (Beast Warrior)” can activate their units immediately after deploying. “方士 (Necromancers)” can summon zombies to fight for them. “仙人 (Celestial)” can push enemy units back when attacking. “龙宫 (Sea Serpent)” are good at healing.

Units are divided into 3 ranks: hero, elite and common. Each faction has their special ability and hero ability. You can choose the faction most fit for you.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel HeroClix: Avengers War of the Realms Fast Forces
description:
As Malekith wages war across the 10 realms, Thor and the Avengers team up to protect the earth from being conquered!

In this Fast Forces, find Avengers representing Midgard like Thor, Black Widow, and Black Panther along with Loki, Enchantress, and Executioner representing Asgard.

Fast Forces are awesome for someone getting started or looking to play a thematic team.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Project: KA-POW!
description:
A thee in one card game, featuring Public Domain Superheroes, redesigned.

The deck can be used to play three different games:


"Border Patrol" a solo game where you fight alongside Public Domain Heroes with the purpose to make five victories, in random difficulty battles.



"Warfront" a two player game where the players fight each other with the purpose to collect as many "medals of honor" as possible.



"Fighting Army" a solo game where you fight through waves of enemies and allies-turned-enemies with the purpose to eliminate them all.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Seal Of Pragon
description:
The Seal Of Pragon is a traditional-style solitaire card game that only requires a single deck of standard playing cards (with two Jokers). The layout for this game looks roughly like a five-pointed star. The goal of this game is to remove all cards from the table by creating poker hands.

A clever array of action bonuses are afforded the player for every poker hand achieved. Examples include everything from removing cards to accessing the discard pile (helping to prolong the game).

The title for this game comes from its loose backstory. As stated by the designer "It roughly involves the player being part of an ancient order trying to break a seal which will unleash an ancient evil if it is not broken before dawn."

The Seal Of Pragon was a 2013 Print & Play Contest entry.

name: Little Astronauts
description:
Discover the planets and be the first to complete your space mission!

Simply draw a card to discover a planet, and place it in the correct location in your solar system. The first astronaut to complete their solar system wins!

Children learn skills such as turn-taking, counting and strategy, and get to laugh at each other's silly alien impressions! They can also learn simple facts about each planet as they play.

—description from the publisher

name: Submarine Deck
description:
This is a card game for solo or multi-player use. The concept is using cards to enact a WW2 submarine or Wolf Pack attack on an Allied Merchant convoy.

Cards determine the size and type of ships, the hit or miss or torpedoes, depth charges, and gunfire. Cards represent damage accumulated, angle of attack, and the presence or lack of escorting warships and aircraft.

The objective of solo play is survival. For Multi-Player games, the objective is survival with the highest tonnage sunk.
The player(s) are submarine captains.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Fallen Flags
description:
Fallen Flags is a railroad-themed deck building game in which players invest in the early American railroads, lay track, and run trains with the aim of having the highest score after the game end is triggered.

Players begin with a base deck of capital, Resources (an abstraction of steel, fuel, labor, and other things needed for railroad operations), and stock in two of the game's four railroads. Cards played from a player's hand may be used to conduct Railroad Actions (laying track and moving trains) and to raise capital to purchase more railroad stock and better cards.

Fallen Flags combines the familiar deck building mechanics of games like Star Realms and Dominion with those of railroad games, such as the "18XX" games or "cube rails" games.

Do you have what it takes to be a railroad baron?

—description from designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Network and Route Building

name: Ultreia the game
description:
You finally embarked on the adventure of the pilgrimage to Santiago de Compostela and you are walking with a group of people from around the world, the Ultreier Team!

Each ultreier has a special power, but… Who will be the first to arrive to their destination? Get the cards you need to stamp your credencial while you discover the impressive monuments of Galicia, its ancient traditions and you taste the many delicacies of this region without missing out on any celebration, but… Beware! This deck is full of spells! Be careful with the meigallos or spread some mischief!

Evil eyes, apparitions, the Santa Compaña, witches, market-style octopus, queimadas...all of the magic of the Camino in one deck!

—description from the publisher

name: The Wizard of Oz Game Book
description:
This is an oversized board book with six page spreads that become game boards, including "The Yellow Brick Road," "Spider Monster's Web," and "The Enchanted Forest," loosely retelling episodes from L. Frank Baum's classic novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz. Most play 2 to 4 players, but two are 2 players only.

All six boards are competitive race games, although one is a variation on Snakes and Ladders and one a classical hex grid game.

The book includes an "electronic die" which randomly lights up in one of six quadrants (with a sound effect). Depending on the board being played, it is utilized as a d6, d3, or d2.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Catacombs Big Box Wyldlands
description:
This is the wyldlands version of the award winning fantasy, dexterity board game, Catacombs™ that bundles the base game in a big box with two expansions (the Ice Box, and Wyldlands.

This exclusive wyldlands version of Catacombs 3E (not available at retail) includes:


Four double-sided neoprene playmats instead of the game boards in the retail version of Catacombs 3E
The new “Kallax shelf” friendly extra large box and TWO organizing trays instead of the single organizing tray in the retail version
The new wall system including custom plastic stands
The fully revised and updated 36 page Reference manual
The new 40 page Tutorial manual


The four, double-sided playmats included with this set:


Campfire | Stone Altar (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Lava Tube | Root Cellar (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Mausoleum | Throne Room (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Scavewyrm Pit | Forthstron River (the playmat that accompanies the Wyldlands expansion)


Includes the components and rulebooks (where applicable) for the following Catacombs expansions, packed inside the box:

Ice Box (Elzra exclusive)
Wyldlands (Elzra exclusive)
mechanics: Flicking, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: ドラスレ アナザーワールド ドリームナイツ (Dorasure: Another World Dream Knights)
description:
Adventurers are not the only ones who will be taking on the dragon. GiantHobby presents Another World, a series of games that offers a slightly different DORASURE experience by making major visual changes to the characters who have appeared in the past.

ドラゴンに挑むのは、冒険者たちだけではありません。ドラゴンを倒すため、別の世界からやってきた少女たちが登場です。GIANTHOBBYがお贈りする、「アナザーワールド」は、今まで登場したキャラクターのビジュアルを大きく変更し、いつもと少しだけ違う「DORASURE」を体験するためのシリーズです。
mechanics: Action Drafting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: 冒険酒場 カードゲーム (Dorasure: Bouken Sakaba Card Game)
description:
This is the story of a certain Imperial City in a certain world.
Players become the owner of an "adventure bar," recruit adventurers, gather talent, solve various cases in the Imperial City, and earn fame.
Players aim to become the best tavern in the Imperial City in this card game based on the worldview of DORASURE.

これはとある世界の、とある帝都の物語。
プレイヤーは「冒険酒場」の主となって、冒険者を勧誘して人材を集め、帝都の様々な事件を解決して、名声を獲得していきます。
DORASUREの世界観から生まれたカードゲームで帝都随一の酒場を目指しましょう。

name: Карты Конфликта: Эпидемия (Cards of Conflict – Epidemic)
description:
Cards of Сonflict (Epidemic) is a "post-quarantine" independent addition to the board game about creating the funniest pairs of questions and answers. The authors collected all the most popular memes, phrases from quarantine tik-toks, Instagram tips, mistakes and human fears that were born during the worldwide Covid epidemic, and created a new version of the Conflict Maps so that you can laugh at what you experienced.

Table of Contents Cards Board Game Content:

30 cards with questions
150 cards with answers
rules of the game


The game begins with the fact that each player receives 10 white cards. In the first round, 1 player is selected - "Card Bro" of this round. "Card bro" takes 1 black card from the deck (black cards lie in one deck with the inscription down) and read out the text loudly. Each of the participants (except for "Card bro") chooses one of his white cards that seems to him the most suitable.

White cards are transferred to Card Bro, which in turn reads each option separately. We recommend that you reread the black card completely before reading out a new white card. "Card bro" is chosen by the winner, in his opinion, the option. The player whose white card wins this round receives a black card as a “ball."

At the end of the round, each player draws a new white card from the deck, so that at the beginning of the next round everyone has 10 white cards. White cards used in this round can be put down the white deck so that after a while they will return to them again. In each subsequent round, a new Card Bro is selected so that each player receives this role in turn. You yourself can choose the principle of changing “bro”: clockwise / counterclockwise, by height, age, leg size, or another sign that is understandable to all participants.

There are black cards in the deck, labeled “take 2”. In this case, each player must choose 2 white cards to form a winning combination. It is important to read the white cards in the correct order. Therefore, the card, the text of which you want to read first, you always need to put under the second card and so transmit "bro."

If you wish, you can modify the rules, for example, play without a “Card Bro”. In this case, each player votes for the option that he liked and gets the most votes with the score.

name: Heisenburger
description:
An unfortunate mishap involving a particle collider and a physicist’s lunch has led to the creation of a quantum burger. You and the other players take on the role of competing scientists from parallel realities. The only way to ensure your survival, is to make sure that most of the burger’s ingredients stay in your reality.

Heisenburger is a competitive card game for 2 - 4 players. Each player is dealt a hand of nine, numbered ingredient cards in their chosen color. On their turn, players can add ingredients to the burger by playing one of their cards, face-down. Players can challenge each other by playing a card and guessing if their card is higher or lower than an opponent’s card. If guessed correctly, the challenger replaces their opponent’s ingredient card with their own.

Some ingredient cards score bonus points, based on where they are placed in the burger. Others have special powers that are triggered when they are revealed.

At the end of the game, players score one point for each ingredient card of their color in the finished burger. Plus any bonus points awarded by card powers. The player with the most points wins the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, End Game Bonuses, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That

name: FPI Mystery: Disappearance At Wirth Circus
description:
Jules Leitzel, the star trapeze artist for the Wirth Family Circus, went missing a few days ago. People are saying she's been kidnapped, but speculation won't cut the mustard... WE NEED ANSWERS!

In the Murder Mystery Case, you'll be trying to crack the cases that the police couldn't or wouldn't- the ones your clients don't want them to. You've been recruited for your powers of deduction and induction, and we expect big things from you.

As one of our solvers, you'll get materials from our Field Agents and try to solve the case based on their notes, interviews, and what they collect from the field. Do you have what it takes to crack the case?!

Play solo or in a groups, discuss every detail, and try to solve the case without using any hints!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mean Robo
description:
Mean Robo is a competitive strategy card game for 2 to 4 players. In a round, players take turns placing Robos on the game area to target the other player’s team. Card placement determines who will blow up in the attack phase. Collect any Robos you blow up, and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Layering, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Battlerie
description:
Card drafting game set in Marais poitevin, western France.

Each player chooses a boatman at the beginning of the game and between 8-11 cards are dealt to the players depending on the number of players (including boatmen cards and journy cards).

Each round the players choose 1 card and pass the other ones to his neighbour.

Players try to find the best combinations of journey vs boatmen in their boat, in order to maximize their final score.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Humor, Nautical
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Events, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dante: Gioca con i Dannati
description:
50 cards and lots of games with the characters of Dante's Inferno! A unique deck of cards and a booklet with instructions, to play with Dante's Inferno and discover some of Dante's most famous characters: from Paolo and Francesca to Conte Ugolino, from Gianni Schicchi to Bonifacio VIII, passing through Attila, Ulysses and Lucifer himself. Each of the 50 cards represents a famous inhabitant of Hell, from the famous, such as Fra 'Dolcino, to the most unknown, such as Filippo Argenti.
Each card displays several information and category scoring points and can be used to play at least 12 different games.
In "Scontro fra Dannati" (Clash of the Damned) the first player chooses a card from his deck, chooses a category (fame, evilness, retaliation) and announce the points of his character's category; the player with the highest value wins the hand. When a player runs out of cards he's out.
The player collecting all the characters wins.
In the cooperative game "Dannati con Ordine" (Damned in Order), players start with 5 cards each and they must end all cards they have, putting them down on a growing order, two cards each turn, over five different decks representing the categories .
Players win if they manage to discard all their cards.
In "Quante Storie" (So Many Stories) each players pick a card and start telling a story and other player will follow and try to continue and finally end the story.
Other games that can be played with the cards are Guess this Card, Down to Hell, Dante's Map.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting

name: Wheat & Ale
description:
On the banks of an ancient river, they gather to grow wheat, brew ale, and accidentally start a civilization.

Wheat & Ale is a coffee-break-length non-violent civilization builder you can play with a pencil and three six-sided dice. Combine higher dice to build, and use low dice to activate buildings. Provide food and drink for your population, and build temples to improve production.

name: Codenames: Bonus Pack – Webhallen
description: 10 bonuscards for Codenames with a tech theme.

name: Gyre
description:
Gyre is a drawless connection game for two, played on an initially empty hexhex board. The players take turns placing a stone of their own color until a winner is determined.

You win by making a group with the following property: Even if you only had that group, and the rest of the board were filled with enemy stones, no enemy group would cover the majority of the cells comprising the perimeter cells and the center cell.

Gyre was invented by Mark Steere in 2015. The above is not Mark's original description, but it is equivalent. Read the original description on the publisher's web site: marksteeregames.com.

name: Animo Dice
description:
A reimagined twist on the famous classic game of Yahtzee - made simpler so even our younger ones can get in on the dice rolling fun!

Each player starts out with three cards (each card shows the faces of three random animals). They then take turns rolling all four dice in a bid to land a combination that matches any one of their three cards. The first player to manage this for all three cards wins!

Fosters:

group play
turn-taking and patience
family/team bonding


Easily understood, played and enjoyed by the whole family!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Trek 12: ArchéoTREK
description:
Trek 12 ArchéoTREK is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in december 2021.

It consists in a new player board and some tokens to play especially with kids.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric, Print & Play

name: Rage'n Glyphs
description:
Rage'n GlyphsRage'n Glyphs is a trick-taking descendant of Oh, Hell! and a cousin of Rage designed for the Glyph deck.

Bid on tricks you will take in ever-increasing hand sizes as the Trump suit changes or disappears!



Summary of PlayEach player will be dealt a number of cards for each Hand, starting with 1 card and increasing by 1 every Hand. Each player bids the number of Tricks he thinks he will win this Hand. Each player in turn then lays down a single card into each Trick. The player who played the highest ranking card of the led suit (or the Trump suit) wins the Trick and takes the cards. After each Hand, points are given for Tricks won, with bonus points given for correctly predicting the number of Tricks won. The game ends after the maximum Hand size is reached, and the player with the highest score wins the game!

________________________________________________



DefinitionsTrick = The cards on the table after each player has played a card.

Trump = The trump suit card determines which suit Trump is. Trump cards win Tricks over cards of other suits.

Follow Suit = Players must, if able, play a card that has the same suit as the first played card of the Trick.
________________________________________________



Rules of Play1) Setup
A player is chosen as scorekeeper and writes the names of the players on the score sheet. He then shuffles the cards and deals 1 to each player, this is the first Hand. After each Hand, the player on the dealer's left becomes the new dealer. The stack of undealt cards are placed face down on the table, and the top card is flipped over and placed next to the pile. This is the Trump suit card, it determines the starting Trump suit for the current Hand. If a joker is turned over, continue turning over cards until a suited card is revealed. (In the extremely rare event all the undealt cards are jokers, hearts is the starting Trump suit.)

2) The Hands
In the first Hand, each player is dealt 1 card, giving 1 Trick available to win the first Hand. When a Hand is over, the cards are reshuffled and dealt, with each subsequent Hand increasing by 1 card. So, in the second Hand, each player is dealt 2 cards, giving 2 Tricks available. In the third Hand, each player is dealt 3 cards, giving 3 Tricks available. The maximum number of cards that can be dealt evenly to the players (while leaving at least 4 undealt for the Trump suit pile) will be the final Hand.

For example: With 9 players, the final Hand will have 10 cards apiece. There will also be 8 cards undealt, in a face down pile, to determine Trump.

3) Bidding
After the players have sorted their cards by suit and rank, each player considers how many Tricks he will win this Hand. Beginning with the player to the left of the dealer and continuing clockwise, each player states their bid prediction for the Hand. The scorekeeper notes the bids on the score sheet.

4) The Tricks
The player to the left of the dealer plays the first card in a Hand. Play continues clockwise, everyone playing a single card into the center of the table. If the led card has a suit, everyone must Follow Suit, if they can. If the first card (or cards) played is a joker, the first suited card played sets the suit and all remaining players must Follow Suit.
If a player does not have a card of the suit led, he may play anything he likes, including a Trump card, or a joker.

5) Jokers
When jokers are played, they modify the trump suit. Jokers cannot win a Trick, unless there is nothing but jokers in the Trick; in that case, the first played joker wins the Trick. There are two types of jokers—four with 2 dots and four with 4 dots.

When a joker with 2 dots is played, the trump suit changes immediately. Flip over the top undealt card until a different suit is revealed; this is the new trump suit. (In the unlikely event that there is not a different suit in the undealt card pile, or if the whole pile is flipped over, the trump suit changes to the next lower suit, ranked mushrooms, hearts, diamonds, clovers, crosses, horns.) This trump suit remains until the end of the Hand, or another joker is played.

When a joker with 4 dots is played, there is no trump suit immediately. Flip over the trump suit card so they are all facedown. Only the lead suit can win a trick. There will be no trump suit until the end of the Hand, or a 2-dot joker is played.

6) Winning the Trick
The player who played the highest card in the suit which led the Trick, will win the Trick, unless a card in the Trump suit is played. If a Trump card is played, it will win the trick. If several Trump cards are in the Trick, the highest ranking Trump card wins the Trick.

Each Trick won by a player should be placed in separate piles, so it is always known how many Tricks each player has won to this point.

The winner of a Trick opens the next Trick by playing a new card from their Hand. When each player has no more cards in their Hand, the Hand is over and points are scored.

7) Scoring
After a Hand is over, each player receives 1 point for each trick they won. They also receive 10 points if they correctly predicted the number of tricks they won, unless they bid 0. If they bid and won 0 tricks, they only receive 5 points. The total number of points is recorded on the score sheet.



Game EndThe game ends after the largest Hand possible for that many players, leaving at least 4 cards undealt for the Trump suit pile. So, for 10 players, there will be 9 Hands—with the final Hand having 9 cards. 9 players, 10 Hands. 8 players, 11 Hands. 7 players, 13 Hands. 6 players, 15 Hands. 5 players, 18 Hands. 4 players, 23 Hands. 3 players, 32 Hands. (With smaller number of players, you may want to use the Skip Up variant below.)

After the final Hand is played and scored, the scores for all 10 Hands are added up. The player with the highest score is the winner!

If there is a tie, the player who scored the most points the final Hand wins. Still tied? Flip a coin for the winner!



VariantsSkip Up: For a shorter game, add 2 cards to each Hand. So, the first Hand will have 1 card, but the second will have 3 cards, the third Hand will have 5 cards, and so on. This is especially useful when playing with 5 or fewer players.

Hose the Dealer: The total number of bids may not equal the total number of Tricks available. For example, in the fifth Hand, with 5 Tricks available, the total number of bids by all players may not equal 5.

Hidden Bid: Every player records their bid on a piece of paper. When everyone has finished bidding, bids are announced and recorded by the scorekeeper. This keeps the bids unaffected by competitor's bids.

Secret Bids: Every player records their bid on a piece of paper. The bids are only revealed after the last Trick of the Hand is taken. Therefore, it is unclear during the Hand how many Tricks each player would like to win.

Shooting the Stars: If a player wins all the Tricks in a Hand, he receives 2 points for each Trick taken, instead of only 1. This includes the first Hand, with only 1 Trick available!

name: Kids Scavenger Hunt
description:
In Kids Scavenger Hunt everyone has a rip-roaring good time as players frantically search for the objects pictured on their cards!!!

Whether you are stuck inside on a rainy day — or at the park on a beautiful sunny day — this game is a fantastic way to get kids moving. Kids Scavenger Hunt is year round fun for the whole family.

—description from the back of the box

name: Turf War: Trick-or-Treat
description:
The first major expansion for Turf War features a Halloween motif. Candy is a new resource that you can buy when you're Away, earning VP and building a stash. It's a challenge to hold onto your Candy though: You never know when a Trick-or-Treater is going to pop-up. When they do, you'll need to give them Candy and score points or else deal with the consequences of whatever trick they play on you.

The expansion adds 72 cards, including monstrous Neighbors, thematically spooky yard decor, Tools, and Pests, and a ton of new Events. The expansion accommodates 2-4 players.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Square Grid, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Gela Scoglitti
description:
Gela Scoglitti game uses B-35 system rules. It depicts American landings on Gela and Scoglitti beaches in Sicily, as well as counterattack of the German Herman-Goering division.

Game was published in 33 issue of "Taktyka i strategia" magazine.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Irritatio
description:
Players roll a die and then move their pawns from their starting area moving around the board finishing on one of there own finishing spaces.
The main part of the game is using your pawns to stop other players from reaching the finish.

Kind of a more 'irritating' verion of the game Trouble.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: MixMatchies Card Game
description:
Create fanciful Matchie creatures by stacking transparent ear, wings, feet, and tail cards on top of a baby Matchie tray.

Players take turns adding body cards one at a time to the Matchie trays. If you complete a Matchie and the completed Matchie matches the requirements of a creator card, you get to collect that Matchie and the creator card.

The first player to collect three Matchies wins the game.

name: Final Act: Extra Forces Expansion
description:
These 3 new additions, part offensive part defensive are here to change things up and elevate your game. Use them early on or late in the battle, it is your call - commander.

The "Extra Forces" kit/addition to the game adds 3 more units to your tank company: 2 anti tank infantry units, and one repair/medic unit.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Элдмонт: В поисках золота (Elmont: In search of gold)
description:
Conquer Mount Eldmont and return the gold to the dwarves! For two thousand years Mount Eldmont remained impregnable… In its caves were stored tens of thousands of gold crystals, once stolen by an insidious Dragon. Gold rightfully belongs to the dwarf clans, and today they are ready to restore justice. Are you ready to join the battle for Eldmont? Then go ahead! Be the first in the battle for the treasures of Eldmont!

Your task is to collect as many gold crystals as possible in your chests. You have to play only for yourself, try to outwit your rivals — after all, it is your clan that should own the gold!

It's very simple to do this — lay out action cards and expose your dwarves. A certain combination of moves will give you gold crystals. Keep them in your chests so that your rivals don't guess how close you are to victory.

But don't forget, there is an insidious Dragon hiding in the depths of the caves. He has not yet noticed the arrival of guests in his domain and is sleeping sweetly on the golden mountain. But one wrong move, and you will fall into his clutches! Enlist the support of a Wizard, control the elements and beware of the monster.

The one who collects the most crystals is recognized as the winner of this game!

name: Feed the Shoggoth!: Morsels of Madness
description:
Morsels of Madness is the first expansion for the humorous Lovecraftian card game Feed the Shoggoth!. Morsels of Madness contains 42 new cards to use with the core game, including:

Five new types of Minions
New Cult Factions
New Artifacts
New Spells
Plus, handy turn guides and instructions on how to use the expansion!

Note: You must have a copy of Feed the Shoggoth! in order to use this expansion. It is not a standalone game.

name: Star Realms: Tournament Kit Season 3
description:
Tournament Kit Season 3

1 Limited Edition Playmat (1st place prize) with "Fighter Base" card artwork
Storage Box (2nd place prize) with "Battle Screecher" card artwork
Promo Cards


The included cards are The Ark and Starmarket.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2020: Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths Commander – Enhanced Evolution
description:
Grow and develop your creatures' powers to new heights with the Enhanced Evolution deck—bring your mutated monsters back from the dead with Otrimi, the Ever-Playful; build an army of hydras with Zaxara, the Exemplary; or gain life and strength as you take down your enemies with Cazur, Ruthless Stalker and Ukkima, Stalking Shadow.

Enhanced Evolution is one of five Commander Decks from Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths (IKO). Each includes exclusive cards tailored to that deck—pick your favorite mechanics and dive in to battle!

Battle your way through the plane of Ikoria with monster-themed mechanics that grow your creatures, build your bond, and crush your opponents.

Contents: one (1) foil oversized Commander card, one hundred (100) card deck, ten (10) double-sided tokens, one (1) deck box, one (1) Life Wheel, one (1) punchout keyword counter card
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: The Original 3-D Chess Game
description:
3-D Chess played in three dimensions on three boards (8x8x3). It uses the same number of chess pieces as FIDE rules. White sets up on Level I and black sets up on Level III. All three Levels are oriented the same way. The pieces move in the same way as in regular Chess, but the rules have been expanded to add the dimension of depth.

First published in 1967 by Alabe Crafts Inc Cincinnati, Ohio.

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Γεωγραφία – Συμπλήρωμα (Quiz Hunt: Geography – Supplement)
description: 384 supplementary questions to go alongside the base game

name: Mewy
description:
Everyone dreams of holidays by the sea. On the beach are beach houses, picnic baskets, colourful screens & parasols. Laughter is heard from the beach houses, while seagulls swoop & dive over the heads of sunbathers, watching for easy pickings from unwatched picnic baskets. 

Mewy (Seagulls) is a fast-paced card game for two players where you create an individual tableau by creating a beach, building beach huts & keeping seagulls at bay by lobbing pebbles towards them or sending them onto your opponent’s beach. Your goal is to score as many points as possible by creating co-ordinated rows of beach huts. You can score extra points from items found under pebble tokens. Seagulls score you negative points.

Players draw 3 cards each, keep one, give one to their opponent (face down) & discard one (face down). After drafting, each player has 2 cards to place in their beach tableau (following the placement rules).

Your beach tableau has 3 rows: beach huts (top), beach (middle), seagulls (bottom). No row can be over 10 cards long. Beach hut cards must be played above a beach card & seagulls placed below a beach card, so you have to collect beach cards before you can build up your tableau. Beach cards are just sand or depict pebbles. When you play a pebble beach card you can pick up pebble tokens (which you keep face down, so you don’t know the scoring symbols underneath). Pebble tokens score you VPs at game end.

Beach huts (numbered 1-15) are placed in ascending order & score VPs when in sets of 3 different colours or sets of the same colour. Mewy (Seagull) cards are worth negative points at the end of the game, so trying to get rid of them by scaring them off using pebbles is wise but it’s a balance as some pebbles are worth more VPs than others at game end.

The game & rules are in Polish but cards are language independent.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Final Adventure
description:
Send your creatures on profitable adventures, then bring them home to deliver the final blow. The Final Adventure Challenger Deck has all the tools you need to control the board.

The Final Adventure deck is tournament-ready, with 60 cards, plus a 15-card sideboard you can use to fine-tune your strategy between games.

The decklist for Final Adventure is based on a top-tier strategy, so it’s the perfect springboard if you’re looking to get back into Magic: The Gathering (MTG).

A Challenger Deck makes a great Magic: The Gathering (MTG) starter deck, powerful enough to jump right into the competition at Friday Night Magic.

Contents: 60-card ready-to-play deck, 15-card sideboard, 5 double-sided tokens, 1 deck box.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Poules Renards Viperes
description: Players place hens, foxes and snakes cards on the table in sets of at least two. When any player has a set of animals in front of them, they can then also use card to get those animals to hunt: Hens eat snakes, snakes eat foxes, and foxes eat hens. The player with the most animals in front of their space at the end of the round wins. Each animal is worth 1 point.

name: Animal Trivia Challenge
description:
"Which bird eats with its head upside down?" "Can you tell a Seal from a Sea Lion?" "Which animals are the most poisonous?" Players build their animal knowledge through three types of stimulating challenge cards—432 questions in all!

Each card is double-sided with an advanced question on one side and a beginner on the other. Players choose a level to play throughout, which helps keep an even playing field when different ages are playing against each other. Each card represents a different color and corresponds to the spaces on the board. "Know It" cards have multiple choice and true/false questions. "Name It" cards require players to identify the animal in the picture shown. "Rank It" cards challenge players to put a list of animals in order based on criteria like size, speed and strength.

Each correct answer earns a survival token—but there's a twist. Tokens are worth various point values and players keep in secret how many points they have accumulated until the end of the game! Explore your way around the board but watch out for predators, fire, poisonous berries and quicksand! The winner of the game is the player with the highest point value overall.

From family pets to ferocious predators, discover the world's animals with this game the whole family will love!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ants Picnic Party Board Game
description:
Help the ants work together to collect all their snacks before the pests eat everything in the garden! The ants are throwing a picnic and they must collect some food on their way, but they better be quick! Hungry pests are eating all the snacks and the ants must use teamwork to collect their snacks and make it to the picnic before everything is gone.

In Ants Picnic Party the ants are racing through the garden together to find their picnic snacks, but they must watch out for the pests that are eating up all the food. Players work together to move the ants by using image-based cards to find matching spaces and collect their snack tokens.

Pest cards are in the same deck of cards that the players use to move the ant characters. When a pest card is picked up, players remove one of the food tokens from the board, if all the food tokens are removed from the board before players make it to the end, then the game is lost.

If the ants collect all of their picnic snacks and make it to the picnic party before the pests eat all the food, then everybody wins!

Bright and colorful images and scenery make this a fun way for kids to learn communication, teamwork, strategic thinking, and image matching skills through play!

name: Munchkin: La Pupa e il Dragone
description:
This product is a compilation of these expansions:

Munchkin Dragons: Four More
Munchkin Dragons: Dragon's trike
Munchkin Princesses

It is currently available in its Italian edition.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor

name: Master: Trasporti Transoceanici
description:
A 1967 Italian game about transoceanic naval commerce.

Players move their ship around a map to collect cargoes from a shipping port and deliver it to its destination, collecting the transportation fees.

Movement of the ships (actually, plastic pawns) is made on a map with squares, and the speed is freely selected by the player (1 to 4 squares per movement).

Each move consumes one unit of the ship fuel reserve (up to 10 fuel units maximum), and players can only refill their fuel in a bunkerage ports. The price per unit of fuel varies from port to port. Getting out of fuel implies either paying other ships to be towed or slowly drifting away, until a bunkerage port has been reached.

If a ship moves in a bad weather zone, for each move the player draws a card that can inflict damages to the ship; upon reaching a total of six damages the ship is forced to reach the nearest port for repairing.

Fuel units and damages are recorded by turning the numbered wheels on the cardboard representing the player ship.

Available cargoes to collect and deliver are drawn randomly from a deck at the start of the game and later on during the play each time a player draws a card to check for damage. Each time a cargo has been delivered, it is immediately put back into the deck, and the deck is reshuffled.
The first player to collect the agreed amount of cash wins the game and is given the title of "Master".

—user summary

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander: Call The Spirits
description:
Call the Spirits is a 100 card Commander preconstructed deck, featured in Commander 2015 . It is bicolor white/black. The primary theme of the deck is enchantments, and the secondary theme is lifegain. The primary new commander is Daxos the Returned, the secondary new commander is Karlov of the Ghost Council, and the reprint commander is Teysa, Envoy of Ghosts.

Daxos the Returned travels across Theros in a never-ending search surrounded by spirits that are drawn to his power. As mighty enchantments enter the battlefield, the spirits he summons grow larger, leaving his enemies overwhelmed.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Επιστήμες – Συμπλήρωμα (Quiz Hunt: Sciences – Supplement)
description: 384 supplementary questions to go alongside the base game.

name: Card Game for Rebel Girls
description:
The Rebel Girls range is an empowering collection for both young girls and boys, showcasing the history and achievements of women of the past and present. We are proud to be a part of this important mission to inspire and instil confidence in our children.

In Card Game for Rebel Girls, the aim of the of the game is to collect and complete sets of Character Cards to score as many Rebel Reward points as possible. Each Rebel Reward Card requires a different team of Rebel Girls to complete the task, so players must use their Character Cards’ strengths and Wild Cards to build a squad of strong girls.

There are five categories of Rebel Girls in the game: Champions, Warriors, Leaders, Pioneers and Creators. Characters such as Harriet Tubman, the Bronte sisters, Eva Peron, Hypatia, Boudicca, Katia Krafft, Wilma Rudolph and Junk Tabei are all included. The game allows players to learn a little more about each Rebel Girl and what their achievements have been throughout history. Each card describes the characters and explains what made them special and unique.

This empowering card game is ideal for children aged six plus, and includes personalised certificates for anyone who is inspired to achieve greatness in their own lives. Whilst learning about incredible women throughout history, the Card Game for Rebel Girls also encourages players to be bold, work hard and be proud.

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Ζώα-Φυτά – Συμπλήρωμα (Quiz Hunt: Animals-Plants – Supplement)
description: 384 supplementary questions to go alongside the base game

name: Space Bumpercraft
description:
Space Bumpercraft is a game designed based on the Grid Movement mechanism. However, your opponents are not everyone else, but all your own Bumpercraft on the map.

Bumpercrafts all have limited movement patterns, and within the limited options, collisions are inevitable.

How you move your Bumpercrafts and clear the path before the movement for the clunky big Bumpercrafts is the key to victory.

Compare the points with your opponents and see who has the most valued Bumpercrafts surviving.

—description from publisher

name: WWII Commander: Volume Two – Market-Garden
description:
WWII Commander, Volume Two: Market-Garden is the second in a series of fast two-player area-based games on key campaigns of the Second World War. The simple elegance and constant player interaction of the WWII Commander games capture the tension of WWII strategy. The game system is a fast-playing introduction to war games, but mastering its tactics is a true challenge as the players take turns deciding which units to activate and where to attack and defend.

Market-Garden recreates the Allied airborne and ground offensive against the German Army in Holland in September 1944. Allied airborne divisions dropped behind German lines to hold a highway corridor across rivers and canals until ground forces could link up to cross into the industrial heart of Germany. Each player commands the opposing Allied or German forces.

The simple elegance and constant player interaction of the WWII Commander games capture the tension of WWII strategy. The game system is a fast-playing introduction to war games, but mastering its tactics is a true challenge as the players take turns deciding which units to activate and where to attack and defend.

As the Allied player, your airborne forces must seize and hold key objectives while your armored ground forces break though the German front and advance aggressively without getting cut off by German infantry and armor coming from all sides. As the German player, you must delay the Allied ground advance, trading space for time as you attempt to destroy the airborne forces behind your lines. The rules are simple, gameplay is fast and furious, and can be completed in one sitting, and either side can win at different stages of the game.

Game features specific to Market-Garden include: Airborne landings, variable weather, concentric attacks, German off-map movement, effects of polder terrain, river assaults, ferry movement.

Product Information:

Complexity: 4 out of 10 (Low)
Solitaire Suitability: 7 out of 10 (no hidden units)
Time scale: Half day per game-turn
Map scale: 5 km across per space
Unit scale: Regiments and brigades
Players: Two (also suitable for solitaire play)
Playing Time: 2 to 4 hours

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Ιστορία – Συμπλήρωμα (Quiz Hunt: History – Supplement)
description: 384 supplementary questions to go alongside the base game

name: Hunt a Killer: Empty Faces – The Mine
description:
We know you can solve a murder, but what happens when evil forces are at play? Experience Hunt A Killer in a completely new way! Try your hand at paranormal investigations with the full box set Empty Faces: The Mine. Fight against the supernatural forces of witchcraft and ancient evils to uncover the truth before it is too late.

Eerie occurrences troubling the local museum in Cooper’s Rock may be related to a devastating disaster in the town’s past. Sort through historical documents for proof of human wrong-doing, and fight against the supernatural forces threatening to overrun the town.

The Mine takes place over 5 episodes (that's 20-30 hours of gameplay total!)
Difficulty: 5/5 - Hard

Take on the investigations alone, as a couple, or use it as the centerpiece for a terrifying game night.

Immerse yourself in the supernatural world of Empty Faces. Discover clues, decode ciphers, and solve puzzles to unravel the mystery. It's like an escape room delivered to your door!

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Charmed and Dangerous: Sharpened Crowns – Booster Pack
description:
Boost your Princesses and game challenges with the Sharpened Crowns 16 card booster pack for Charmed and Dangerous: The Princess Adventure Game.

Base set required to use this booster.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Grim Dark Dungeon Master: Catacombs of the Necromancer
description:
Grim Dark Dungeon Master introduces the concept of competitive dungeon building.

In this game one player assumes the role of the Grim Dark Dungeon Master who wants to protect key areas of the dungeon to prevent interruption to the dark doings occurring there. 

Meanwhile 1 to 3 other players assume the roles of heroes, working together to penetrate the dungeon, push past obstacles, and find three key locations to purge of evil and slow, if not outright stop, the spread of darkness across the land.
 
However, neither the Grim Dark Dungeon Master player nor the hero players know the layout of the dungeon at the start of the game.  That will be determined as the game is played with both sides trying to influence the position of key rooms as they are played on the table.
 
Thus, both sides compete to build the dungeon that will most easily achieve their goals.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Action !
description:
In Action, the director is you!

Act out everyday life situations so that other players can guess them!

During your game turn, draw 4 "situation" cards and stage them as effectively as possible using the character cubes and the equipment at your disposal.

You have 90 seconds to guess the 4 situations.
Score one point for each correctly performed situation.
Also score a point if you are the player who guessed the staged situation.

After 2 or 3 rounds, the player with the most points wins!

name: Sonic Super Spinners
description:
Two players launch their spinners in a battle arena simultaneously.
Last spinner spinning wins the game.

name: Burrowdale
description:
In Burrowdale you are a family of rabbits battling to store enough food for the coming winter. Build and change routes between the fourteen burrows, trade carrots, radishes and other goods and move your rabbit workers to where the best resources and locations are, to gain the most points to make sure your burrow comes out on top.

On your turn, you can take three actions, from any combination of the following:
- place one of your rabbit workers on an unoccupied burrow;
- place one of the available resources on any burrow;
- make a trade between two burrows that have the same resource;
- change the layout of the warren network by placing a new warren card and removing an existing one;
- place your family emblem token on a warren card to score an extra point in future trades.

Points are scored through trades, depending on how many warren card that trade route passes through - so if the shortest possible route between two burrows means passing through four warren cards, you score 4 points. The winner is the first rabbit to 40 points.

-description from designer
mechanics: Resource Queue, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: The Armchair Quarterback
description:
The Armchair Quarterback is an enjoyable game of skill designed for two teams consisting of one or more players each. Object of the game-- as in professional football --is to outscore your opponent. This is done through analyzing the opposition and selecting the best play (either defensively or offensively) to counteract his play.

"All the thrills and excitement of REAL football" -Florida Gators Head Coach, Ray Graves

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Bardsung: Epic Encounters – Local Legends
description:
Containing all 38 stunning miniatures, plus Bardsung cards, an adventure booklet, and battle maps, the Bardsung Pledge will test your Bardsung party’s mettle against a host of grievous foes and give them new areas to explore.

NCLUDES:

All 38 stunning miniatures -

• Efreeti & 5 Fire Elementals (Exclusive)
• Hill Giant & 3 Boulders (Exclusive)
• Green Dragon & 2 Mangrove Trees
• The Diaemus & 3 Giant Bats
• Griffon & Trapped Messenger
• Wraith & 4 Spectres
• Owlbear & Druid
• Ghost Pirate & 3 Ghosts
• Night Hag & 3 Will o' the Wisps
• Berserker & 3 Flying Swords

Plus:

• 54 Bardsung cards
• A Bardsung adventure booklet
• Battle maps, designed to expand the Bardsung world!

name: Watches and Clocks of Hickory Docks
description:
The sun rises over the ocean, and the fog lifts from Hickory Docks. A bell chimes, and the workshop comes alive with the sound of tiny, scurrying feet. The clock mice are awake and already hard at work.

Watches and Clocks is a strategy board game of time-track management. Play a team of industrious mice that is building and marketing mechanical timepieces. Speed is of the essence...but build too quickly, and your clocks won't impress the collectors who value quality over quantity.

Take the mantle and see your masterpiece atop the newly built clock tower. Scurry to it! The world of innovation waits for no mouse.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Follow, Rondel, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Grand Theft Antimatter
description:
The United World Government has almost finished building their Warhead Antimatter Response (W.A.R) facility. Your Heist Crew cannot let that happen. Are you up for the challenge?

Grand Theft Antimatter is a groundbreaking printable escape room game that brings all the fun of escape rooms into your own home. The game is designed to be played by teens and families at their own pace, in their own space.

Players will take on the role of one of the members of the Heist Crew, and work together to steal the antimatter before the W.A.R facility goes online. Gameplay is centered on a series of puzzle cards that players must solve. Each card solved progresses the story and brings players closer to completing the heist.

Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The Warhead Antimatter Response facility is nearly online... do you accept the mission?
categories: Adventure, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2019: Mystic Intellect
description: Sevinne the Chronoclasm headlines this white-blue-red preconstructed Commander deck themed around the Flashback mechanic. Mystic Intellect includes a 100-card deck, a foil oversized display commander, 10 double-sided tokens, and a cardboard deck box.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2019: Primal Genesis
description: Ghired, Conclave Exile headlines this white-green-red preconstructed Commander deck themed around the Populate mechanic. Primal Genesis includes a 100-card deck, a foil oversized display commander, 10 double-sided tokens, and a cardboard deck box.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: The Hunger: Timoty Promo Card
description:
Timoty
Speed: 0
VP: 1
Type: Human Villager
Effect: Timoty is considered at the same time military and villager.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Race
publishers: Cranio Creations, Pegasus Spiele, Renegade Game Studios

name: Twin Stars: Moonset – Scenario #1: Destroy the Artifact
description:
A new episodic game that reimplements Twin Stars.

Each episode includes a Scenary postcard and 2 cards.

A few big updates from Twin Stars. A lot mostly in the visual side. It uses cubes, and it uses them on the card instead of using the edges of the card for tracking. Characters have skills, store items and other things on their cards. You can also gain Hide or Hunt. With Hide, you can re-roll an alert die (which is an extra die, not a die on an alert symbol), and Hunt allows you to try for an extra star.


Scenario: Destroy the Artifact

The venomous Snake Warriors have destroyed Wynx Keep in their quest to tplle anything in sight. At this point only treacherous rubble remains. Your old mentor named Redeshia reaches out and begs your party to rush to recover the evil artifact that resides there. She warns that if it gets into the hand of the Snake Warriors, the war will never end.

You need to find the artifact in the rubble and destroy it before the war advances to the point of no return.

Characters:


Korma Ranogh
Saria Balgalor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Just the Tip, dice game
description: Tipping dice challenges for 2 to 6 players. Tip just 6 sided dice, How many dice can you tip onto a small card before one falls off, Tipping dice and adding the numbers to get closest to 50 and many other challenges. A dexterity game of tipping dice from a coffee cup. Get a point for each challenge you win and get 6 points to win!

name: Cupcake Draft
description:
Chocolate, vanilla or berry frosting? Which one is the most delicious? And most importantly, which one will earn you victory?

Cupcake Draft is a fast-playing card drafting game, in which your goal is to bake different cupcakes for the picky customers.

Each game is divided into two phases - drafting and bidding.
In the drafting phase players will draft different Cupcakes. Each of the cupcakes has different flavor levels which will help with certain customers.

In the bidding phase players use the Cupcakes which they drafted to bid for the customers which give victory points.

The player with the most victory points is the winner.

-description from publisher

name: Audubon Bird Spotting Opoly
description:
Play on a beautiful nature themed game board featuring vibrant watercolor work of famous lover and observer of birds John James Audubon. Learn fun facts about key species the National Audubon Society works tirelessly to protect. Collect the most bird sightings to win!

Includes: Game Board, 6 Collectible Metal Tokens, 22 Audubon Bird Property Cards, 4 Seasons Cards, 2 Gear Cards, 16 Field Guide Cards, 16 Birder's Journal Cards, 1 Pack of Custom Money, 32 Plastic Egg markers, 12 Plastic Nest markers, 2 Dice, and Rules.

Property cards have trivia about birds on the back; Six metal playing pieces include Bins (Binoculars), Duck, Hummingbird, Heron, Owl, Eagle.

name: Battlecrest: Hype – Hero Set
description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

Hype is the last of our Year One heroes, and the last of the Year One content. Then we jump into Year Two, which is coming along very nicely. Expect another Kickstarter, a new map, a new playmat (for anyone who missed the first one), so many more characters, and most of all, it's own tone.

Components:

Hype Hero set.
Hype AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Black Stories: Psycho
description:
A Black Stories edition with creepy stories about human abysses.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game

name: Dry Bones: 4 Culturas
description:
What Does 4 Cultures Bring to the Basic Game?
Components:
4 characters for each Culture and specific skills. Choose to play as the Merchant (Arab culture), skill with jewels; Master of the stamps (European culture), skill with stamps and portals; Shaman (indigenous culture, skill with the spell and Guardian of the light Asian culture), skill with candles.

New events that you add to the base game deck, activate the camp and discover the cultural treasures, trade with the camel caravan, book your mission from the Oasis and join the wisdom of the children to rearrange the treasure deck as you suits you

4 culture boards, 7 new quests, 8 treasure cards, 4 culture tokens, 5 portal-seal tokens and 1 culture medallion.

Objective of the game:
As in Dry Bones, the objective of the game is to revive the dry bones that are scattered in the Thar desert, in the golden triangle of Rajasthan, India. The one with the most points will be the winner. How do you get the points? through completing the missions and the new way that brings 4 cultures to score, through the collection sets of cultural treasures.

Learn to play the basic game Dry Bones, Spin the seals, open the portals and conjure the spirit of the 4 winds. Add this expansion and experience the thrill of the journey.

Join this new adventure through the Thar desert, Rajastan! Will these bones be able to revive?
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Travel

name: Med andra ord: Junior
description:
The word-explaining game Med andra ord made into a child friendly edition.

You play in pairs, where one has to explain the word on the card "in other words" and the other guesses. In 45 seconds, you should try to explain and guess correctly on as many cards as possible. When the game is over, the points are added up according to the denomination on the cards. The team with the highest score wins.

name: Hunt for the Belgorod
description:
Big world oceans chart but small, fast 3-12 turn "sudden-death" game system. 15 minutes? Free print-and-play.

Russian doomsday super submarine Belgorod - it's even a mothership for little subs, although that's not in the game - is trying to get on the loose to threaten one of our coasts. Can you detect and shadow it for 4 of the 12 turns to win?

Or can it stay UNdetected for 3 turns, then ending up near one of our coasts to win?

She starts in the Arctic Ocean, and our US Navy and allied Anti-Sub Task Groups ... and a couple missioned attack submarines (Illinois and Minnesota) ... must find and ride her.
VERY good solitaire game as the Allied player. Just use the 2-side Russian pieces upside-down, randomly mix them up, and move each logically.

With 1 or more combinations of coin tosses or 50% die rolls, the Allied player's naval units attempt to detect her and then if successful shadow her from on or beneath the sea area she is in, with improved odds of continuing to do so.
3 continuous turns of successfully shadowing her wins a quick/sudden-death victory. However, if she can remain (or again become) unshadowed - whether or not she is detected by satellite - for 3 turns, the last one being in a U.S. coastal sea area, the Russian player instead wins the game.

12 playing pieces - only 1 more than SPI's Strike Force One's 11! - Belgorod and 3 Decoys and 4 Allied ASTGs and 2 SSNs and *their* decoys.

And I can attest that she and her Decoys can bedevil a solitaire Allied player at least as much as a second, Russian player could.

Applicable quotes from the film (and presumably the book) The Hunt for Red October of (Sean Connery's) Marko Ramius:

"Once more, we play our dangerous game, a game of chess against our old adversary - The American Navy. For forty years, your fathers before you and your older brothers played this game and played it well. But today the game is different. We have the advantage.

We will pass through the American patrols, past their sonar nets, and lay off their largest city, and listen to their rock'n'roll while we conduct miss-ile drills. Then, and when we are finished, the only sound they will hear is our laughter, while we sail to Havana, where the sun is warm, and so is the comradeship. A great day, comrades! We sail into history!"

And later:

"... years I have been at sea. A war at sea. A war with no battles. No monuments. Only casualties."

-description from designer
categories: Modern Warfare, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Hidden Movement, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending

name: Fashion Witch
description:
In Fashion Witch you play a card in order to dress a witch, this can be your own, a common or even the witch of another player. You can either put on clothes or replace existing clothing.

Depending on the card you played, you can have special abilities, remove another played card, switch cards, etc.

The game finishes if all witches are fully clothed or the deck runs out.

You score points depending on the secret goal you receive at the beginning of the game, for every witch dressed with the same clothes as you (shoes, dress & hat) and minus point with some cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: ワールド・ウォー3
description:
