Ships can also be captured during battle, which can lead to a military victory by elimination/stalemate. Players will continue to move their pieces around the board in an effort to win the game by scoring enough victory points, or by forcing a stalemate.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Pattern Movement, Static Capture, Tug of War

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Experten Edition
description:
The challenging expansion for all fans of the cult game STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN.

43 especially challenging categories will make even the smartest minds sweat. Fun guaranteed!

This game promotes knowledge and creativity!

The EXPERT EDITION contains an exciting variety with 43 different categories.

Examples: is made of wood, is smaller than a soccer, can grow, you do every day, is dangerous, a feeling, luxury item, piece of furniture and many more!

Innovative letter bar against cheaters.

Just wipe the letter bar with your index finger. When one of your teammates says "STOP", the letter to play with is fixed.

This XXL game block in A3 format contains 50 sheets. This provides for many extensive game evenings with family and friends.

Perfect to give away or the next vacation.

GAME PROCEDURE:
Each player receives one side of the A3 block and places it in front of them. A time is set for each round (we recommend 2 minutes as a limit). The innovative letter bar helps to determine the letter. Then it is a matter of entering all the terms as quickly as possible. There are 13 terms sought per round.

POINT DISTRIBUTION:

You can't think of a correct term = 0 points
At least one other player has the same term as you = 5 points
No other player has the same term as you = 10 points
You are the only one who can think of a term in the category = 20 points.


In addition, there are so-called FULL POST fields where you always get double the points.

—description from the publisher (translated)Die anspruchsvolle
Erweiterung für alle Fans des Kultspiels STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN

43 besonders herausfordernde Kategorien bringen auch die klügsten Köpfe ins Schwitzen. Spaß garantiert!

Dieses Spiel fördert Wissen und Kreativität!

Die EXPERTEN EDITION beinhaltet eine spannende Vielfalt mit 43 verschiedenen Kategorien.

Beispiele: besteht aus Holz, ist kleiner als ein Fußball, kann wachsen, macht man täglich, ist gefährlich, ein Gefühl, Luxusgegenstand, Möbelstück und viele mehr!

Innovative Buchstabenleiste gegen Schummler.

Wische einfach mit dem Zeigefinger über die Buchstabenleiste. Wenn einer deiner Mitspieler “STOPP” sagt, steht der Buchstabe fest, mit dem gespielt werden muss.

Dieser XXL-Spielblock im DIN A3 Format beinhaltet 50 Blatt. So ist für viele ausgiebige Spielabende mit Familie und Freunden gesorgt.

Perfekt zum Verschenken oder den nächsten Urlaub.

SPIELABLAUF:
Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A3 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Es wird eine Zeit pro Durchgang ausgemacht (wir empfehlen 2 Minuten als Begrenzung). Die innovative Buchstabenleiste hilft bei der Ermittlung des Buchstabens. Dann gilt es so schnell wie möglich alle Begriffe einzutragen. Pro Runde sind 13 Begriffe gesucht.
PUNKTEVERTEILUNG:

Dir fällt kein richtiger Begriff ein = 0 Punkte
Mindestens ein Mitspieler hat denselben Begriff wie du = 5 Punkte
Kein Mitspieler hat den denselben Begriff wie du = 10 Punkte
Dir ist als Einziger ein Begriff in der Kategorie eingefallen = 20 Punkte


Außerdem gibt es sogenannte VOLLPFOSTEN-Felder bei denen man stets die doppelte Punktzahl erhält.

—description from the publisher

name: My Very First Games: The Duck Game
description:
The animals are looking for their hats and the players can help them out. In the cooperative game, players work together to match six hats before the star tiles are turned over. In the competitive game, players try to be the first to uncover and match three hats.

—description from the publisher

name: 夢幻ちゃんズCOLLECTION (Mugen-chanzu COLLECTION)
description: The player with the highest score by lining up 10 cards with cute characters on them wins! Each character has different abilities, and the key to success in this card game is the game of tactics in deciding who to collect.

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Das Kartenspiel – Woozle Goozle Edition
description:
The WOOZELIGE special edition of the city-country full post card game!

High quality hinged lid box in cool design made by DENKRIESEN.

The principle is as simple as ingenious. Whoever thinks that Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten can't work well as a card game will soon be proven wrong.

The game is explained in no time and the fun can begin. There are no open questions and the game rounds are entertaining and exciting. Due to the 200 different categories there is always enough variety.

The official card game of STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN with 120 playing cards for an unforgettable gaming experience with WUMMS!

200 creative and funny categories will make every amateur thinker sweat. Fun guaranteed!

Through the 4 different editions, a huge variety is offered. In addition to the family-friendly Classic Edition, the child-friendly Junior Edition and the naughty Red Light Edition bring a certain variety to the game night!

Spielablauf:
So wird gespielt: Jeder Spieler bekommt per Zufallsprinzip 8 Buchstaben-Karten ausgehändigt. Nun muss jeder Spieler möglichst schnell einen Begriff passend zu einer seiner Buchstaben-Karten ablegen. Wichtig: Es zählt jeweils der Anfangsbuchstabe des Wortes und man muss NICHT aus den Buchstaben-Karten einen Begriff bilden, wie es in anderen Spielen z.B: Scrabble manchmal der Fall ist.
Es wird also spannend: Die 60 Kategorie-Karten enthalten insgesamt 200 verschiedene und lustige Kategorien:
Wer kann zuerst einen “Beruf” ablegen? Oder einen “Trennungsgrund”? Was ist mit einer “Stadt im Ausland”? Fällt dir zu deinen Buchstaben-Karten schnell ein “Berühmter Toter” ein bzw. kommt Dir sofort ein “bekannter Schauspieler” in den Sinn?
Wichtig nun: Der SCHNELLSTE Spieler gewinnt jeweils die Runde und am Ende gewinnt der Spieler das Spiel, der zuerst alle Buchstaben-Karten losgeworden ist. Durch die 10 zusätzlichen Aktionskarten wird das Spiel besonders spannend.
Natürlich gibt es auch VOLLPFOSTEN-Karten im Spiel die entweder als Joker wirken oder als kniffliger Konter genutzt werden.

How to play: Each player is randomly dealt 8 letter cards. Now each player must place a word matching one of his letter cards as quickly as possible. Important: The first letter of the word counts and you do NOT have to form a term from the letter cards, as is sometimes the case in other games, e.g. Scrabble.

So it gets exciting: The 60 category cards contain a total of 200 different and funny categories:

Who can put down a "profession" first? Or a "reason for separation"? What about a "city abroad"? Can you quickly think of a "Famous Dead Person" or a "Famous Actor" for your letter cards?

Important now: The FASTEST player wins each round and at the end the player who first got rid of all letter cards wins the game. The 10 additional action cards make the game especially exciting.

Of course, there are also FULL FIX cards in the game that either act as jokers or are used as tricky counters.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die WOOZELIGE Sonderedition vom Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten Kartenspiel!

Hochwertige Klappdeckel-Schachtel in coolem Design made by DENKRIESEN.

Das Prinzip ist so einfach wie genial. Wer glaubt, dass Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten als Kartenspiel doch nicht gut funktionieren kann wird schnell eines besseren belehrt werden.

Das Spiel ist im nu erklärt und der Spielspaß kann beginnen. Es bleiben keine offenen Fragen und die Spielrunden sind kurzweilig und spannend. Durch die 200 verschiedenen Kategorien ist immer für genug Abwechslung gesorgt.

Das offizielle Kartenspiel von STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN mit 120 Spielkarten für ein unvergessliches Spielerlebnis mit WUMMS!

200 kreative und lustige Kategorien bringen jeden Hobbydenker ins Schwitzen. Spaß Garantiert!

Durch die 4 verschiedenen Editionen, ist eine riesige Vielfalt geboten. Neben der familienfreundlichen Classic Edition bringen die kinderfreundliche Junior und die unanständige Rotlicht Edition die gewisse Abwechslung in den Spieleabend!

—description from the publisher

name: Monster
description:
Stack matching monster cards in order to create sequences of the same color or pattern and win monster tokens. A winning sequence is 3 cards aligned horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.
Be the first to collect 5 monster tokens and win the game!

name: Mabi
description:
Mabi is a unification game in which the goal is to create the largest group of your pieces possible.

Starting with the initial position as the diagram, players move one of their pieces either vertically or horizontally, one step at a time. However, if a pieces is adjacent to a larger group of opponent's pieces, that piece becomes paralyzed and cannot move.

If you can make a larger group than your opponent in the end, you win. In case of a tie, the first player to build a group of that size wins.

This game is included in Generic Board "Square".

—description from the designer

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Das Brettspiel – Rotlicht Erweiterung
description:
Discover now the official red light expansion of the STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN board game. Included are 354 wacky and kinky categories. Only playable with the original STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN board game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Entdecke jetzt die offizielle Rotlicht Erweiterung vom STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN Brettspiel. Enthalten sind 354 abgefahrene und versaute Kategorien. Nur mit dem original STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN Brettspiel spielbar!

—description from the publisher

name: Incorrect Checkers
description:
Incorrect Checkers is a game born from the wrong setup of Checkers (Draught). Although it bears the name of Checkers, there is no capture, and the aim is to reach the goal while jumping other pieces like in Halma or Chinese Checkers.

In this game, friendly pieces can be jumped over at any time, but only one opponent piece can be jumped over during a turn.

This game is included in Generic Board "Checkered" set.

—description from the designer

name: Tides: Beach Party
description: Tides: Beach Party is a free PNP play sheet, posted with permission of Button Shy Games, that allows you to play Tides with up to four players; no other components needed! Just print one of these for each player and you're good to go.

name: Марс 2050
description:
2050

Large space corporations struggle for leadership in developing the Red planet. Shuttles of competing corporations enter Mars's atmosphere. Each newcomer contributes to Mars's development to become a part of the colony and the new world. Do you think it's a sci-fi story? Nope, this is a quite real image of the future. And we must be ready for it.

You have to explore the hostile landscape of Mars and find vital resources to build your colony consisting of different modules. The player who did it first wins the game.

Each player's turn consists of two phases. Firstly, a player rolls a die to determine how much oxygen they have for the second phase. In the second phase, the player expends that oxygen on various actions, like moving a unit, exploring resources, extracting resources, attacking a module or another unit, healing a unit or fixing a module, building a module.
If you have too many of the same resources, you can exchange them in the game's reserve using a fixed 4:1 price. You can also trade with other players using the negotiated exchange rate.

The main goal of the game is to build as many modules as you can. And the gameplay looks simple - find the necessary resources and build the module. But don't forget other players can attack your modules! You have to plan your actions thoroughly and watch out for other players. Once you build a module, you receive a one-time bonus for your next actions (or a penalty for your opponents).
The game lasts until some of the players build the required number of modules.
categories: City Building, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Acting, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Marvel: Home Sprint
description:
Have fun racing around the galaxy to collect infinity stones with your 3D Marvel playing pieces (5 figures available).

You and your team need to reach Earth with more infinity stones than Thanos on his glove

In this coop game you will fight Thanos to retrieve from him the stones.

Players will throw the dice to move forward on the path to earth but be aware some steps may generate actions such as losing a stone or retrieve a stone from Thanos or fighting Thanos.
When each player reaches Earth, you have to fight Thanos a last time. Throw a dice, add your tokens’ to improve your strength and compare it to his throw, the highest can stole a stone for the other one.
When each player has ended their turn, if The Avengers own more stones than Thanos, they WIN!
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Artline: Louvre
description:
Do you consider yourself an art connoisseur? Or, maybe, you know nothing of fine arts? This game works great for both cases!

Artline is a game of associations based on gorgeous paintings from the world-famous art museums. Current edition includes 96 original masterpieces licensed from the Musée du Louvre in Paris.
During the game, the players develop a common grid of cards on the table and define common features for each row and column.

Each player starts with 5 cards in hand, and the goal is to get rid of them. One card is played per turn, and you may:

1. Just extend a row/column and draw a new card. The card you play has to fit just one feature of a row or a column. Come up with one if there’s none yet!
What could bring a Picasso painting and a classic portrait together? Let's say, a white headdress! Now all the paintings you play in this row or column must contain a person with the white headpiece.

OR

2. Play your card at the intersection and don’t draw a new card. The card you play has to fit both features of a row and a column. Think of one or even both of them!

Your aim is to get rid of cards, but you don't draw a new one only if you manage to place a card that matches both row and column features, so you have to be very attentive, come up with challenging features, and think ahead to play all your cards on the table!

-description from publisher

name: Suspicious Spuds
description:
The hilarious dinner party game! Keep your eyes peeled for the hidden signals… Will you spot the Suspicious Spuds!

The host deals a coaster face down to everyone at the table with one Suspicious Spud shuffled in (2 for 10+ players). The host then chooses a number between 1 and 3. Each player finds the corresponding number on their coaster and does the actions listed and subtly say specific words anytime throughout the dinner. As the Suspicious Spuds will not have any actions or words on their coaster, they must pay attention and bluff their way through the dinner to remain undetected.

At the end of the dinner, each player points to who they think is the Suspicious Spud(s). If the Spud(s) remain undetected, they win!

name: Insular Attraction
description:
Insular Attraction is a game about two Islands so madly in love they can't help but try to crash into each other. Two players take on the role of these islands trying to get to each other at speed. Not too fast and not too slow!

Insular Attraction is a pencil and paper game. Players choose a secret starting speed, then take simultaneous turns selecting actions, attempting to approach one another at the perfect speed.

name: Събери България (Collect Bulgaria)
description:
An educational Bulgarian game (as of 2023 only available in the Bulgarian language). In this competitive card drawing game the goal is to collect 6 cards of the same colour (4 types in total). Card trading, attacking players and encountering destructive cards by chance are also elements present in the game.

—user summary

Представи си за момент настолна игра, чрез която всяко дете може да опознае България и да научи за нейното културно-историческо наследство, докато се забавлява с приятели и близки.

Игра, която е достатъчно лесна, за да не се отегчават малчуганите в разучаване на правилата ѝ, но е толкова забавна и разнообразна, че да не омръзне и за миг.

Игра, която е подходяща за малки и пораснали деца, и може да се играе навсякъде и по всяко време.

Не е нужно да си я представяш, защото...

Тя е вече тук!

Запознай се със СЪБЕРИ БЪЛГАРИЯ.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Travel

name: Tutankamón: Aventura en la pirámide
description:
Tutankhamen is a visually fast game with various levels of difficulty for the whole family.
An adventure for intrepid archaeologists.
Will you be able to decipher the hieroglyphs and successfully enter Tutankhamun's pyramid?
Mummies, scorpions, mazes, traps, enchantments... Be careful! The pyramid is full of dangers.

In each round, a hieroglyphic card is revealed that indicates to the archaeologists the character that awards points. Archaeologists will have to be quick to cover the correct character with the palm of their hand before the rest.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game

name: Dobyvatelé jednotek pozornosti
description:
It's Munchkin-like game where players compete for points.
The points could be stolen from other players or awarded in beginning of your turn. Whoever get first 100 point win the game. All this in Mikyr's satiric universe.

Your turn comes as this.

Take one new card.
Cast a die, move the rocket token and do whatever is on the game board filed you landed on.
Play up to 2 cards.
Then next player.


—user summary

name: No Man's Planet
description:
You have come to a planet ruled by machine lifeforms in pursuit of wealth and fame.

Your goal is to secure more territory on this planet and acquire technology and information from the powerful machine lifeforms inhabiting the planet.

However, your initial strength is extremely limited. Will you rely on gathering resources and increasing your numbers? Will you enhance the performance of your drones through research? Or will you develop new weapons based on the manufacturing technology obtained from defeated enemies? But be careful not to take too long to build up your strength; you're not the only one with plans to conquer this planet...


Use time and resources to develop new workers.
Move workers around to encounter and defeat mechanical beings! Obtain technology chips.
Place workers in more areas to gain resources and fame.
Engage in combat with the enemy's workers and take over their occupied lands.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Resource to Move, Worker Placement

name: MONO censored: Bitcoin edition
description: Monopoly Bitcoin style. More or less the same as original Monopoly, but with board spaces, cards, tokens, etc. done in a Cryptocurrency theme.
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Mortal Kombat 11
description:
Vs. System 2PCG: Mortal Kombat 11 is a standalone game that can also be combined with other titles in the Vs. System 2PCG game system.

In the game, each player chooses a main character, builds a deck with exactly sixty cards, and attempts to stun the other player's main character. More than two dozen Mortal Kombat 11 characters are included.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Sanrio Characters Patapata Kururin (パタパタくるりん)
description:
Sanrio characters have arrived at the Daiso board game!
Let's enjoy board games in a cute, fun and casual way!

Turn it over, turn it over! Turn over the character card and turn your character face up a lot!

Shuffle the 36 cards and turn them face down into a draw pile.
Shuffle the 4 Sanrio character cards face down.
The dealt card becomes that player's scoring character. Secretly look at your card only.
Each player draws 2 cards from the deck.
When it is your turn, draw a card from the deck.
Choose one card and place it on a square.
Flip all cards pointed by the arrow.
You are allowed to place a card over an empty square or the back of another card. (Face down card)
When cards are flipped, flip all cards within that square. There can be at most 2 cards per square.
Hello Kitty cards remove 1 face up card from the stage.
When the deck and all cards in hand are gone, or if all squares on the stage are face up, the game is over.
Flip over your secret scoring character. The player with the most visible character wins!

name: Crime Unfolds: Pop-Up Mystery Escape Game
description: Explore a mysterious manor full of secrets through 6 Pop-Ups rooms where you will test your wisdom and detective skills. Investigate the crime Scene as if you were in a miniature Escape Room. You will be able to interact with all the objects and elements of the Pop-Up as if you were really there. Explore each Pop-Up like in an escape room, solve the case like a real detective.

name: Lucky Bastard
description:
It is a card game that is based on a traditional card game called "The Dutch." The goal of the game is to be the first player to have 3 Poulpy tokens. To gain a Poulpy token, a player should be able to discard their last card. The cards contain illustrations of Poulpy, an octopus with different expressions. Players attempt to remember & correctly identify Poulpy's expressions in order to win tokens.

Players start with 4 cards face down in front of them as their "line." On a player's turn, they must: (1) Draw and secretly look at the top card, (2) Play the card in the discard pile face up OR add it to their line & discard one of the other cards face up, (3) As an option, discard one or more cards if they believe these to be identical to the last card played. If the discard was a mistake, the player/s must take back their card and add a card to their line without looking at it. There are special cards in the game such as the "Switch" & "Peek" cards that players can use to exchange cards between other players and look at one of their cards respectively.

name: Kariuchi
description:
This is an updated version of the ancient game of the same name.

Kariuchi is a race game using four 2-sided dice (4D2). "Kari" refers to the two-sided dice and "uchi" refers to casting them. The basic game is a 2-player game, in which both players try to move their 4 pieces along the path according to the dice rolls and try to reach the goal with their pieces as quickly as possible.

The board consists of 30 fixed points arranged in a circle. Each player's four pieces are not on the board initially, but are placed in their waiting area as reserve pieces. Starting from base point 1, the goal is passed after fixed point 30. The goal is not yet reached just by reaching Fixed Point 30.

To move a piece, the player moves one of his or her own pieces along a fixed point from 1 to 30 on the circumference of the circle, as many times as the number of "kari" dice cast from a set of four dice. The player is free to decide which piece to move in each turn. When a piece stops at a fixed point 5, 10, or 15, the player can change the direction of movement in the next turn and move the piece to a fixed point on the opposite side of the circumference as a shortcut. If the piece stops at the center point "A" during the shortcut move, the player can further change the direction of the move and choose to move in the direction of fixed points 20, 25, and 30.

If a piece you have moved stops at the position of a piece you already have on the board, you can stack the pieces. All of your pieces (up to 4 pieces) can be stacked on top of each other. The stacked pieces can be moved as a single piece. You can also separate the pieces and move only the top piece(s). If a piece you have moved rests on an enemy piece already on the board, the enemy piece is removed and returned to the enemy's reserve position. If a piece lands on an enemy stacked piece, all enemy pieces are moved back to the reserve position. The pieces are then separated and become individual pieces.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 1825 Regional Kit R4: Northern Scotland
description: Regional Kit R4 can be used to extend the Unit 3 board or the Unit 4 board.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Modular Board, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: 2020: The Game
description:
Who doesn't want to relive 2020?! Right? No? Nobody??? Well, maybe if we could look back and laugh at it, right? (Or is it too soon to bring up the election? Or the absence of toilet paper? Or the inception of mandatory mask wearing?) Well...it's funny in the game, anyway.

In 2020 The Game, 2-6 players roll-and-move their way around the board, trying to acquire (read: "land on and not lose later") 270 electoral votes, FTW. As you & your opponents use some of the best movers ever made (no lie—you can BE the toilet paper!!!), learn how many electoral votes come from each state in the union & cheer each other on as you all get closer to ending the game.

They thought of EVERYTHING for this one, folks! The [Community Chest/Chance style] cards have every bit of the flavor of 2020, with a clean art style & tongue-firmly-in-cheek. If you missed it IRL, now you can finally host your own "super-spreader event" or stage your own "peaceful protest", but whatever you do, don't get sent back to quarantine! (Those dang variants...)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kritzelschlacht
description:
The merciless party game is the second game from the party fever series by DENKRIESEN and has 300 cards with a total of 900 child's play to tricky terms to doodle on board. In this game, no new "Picasso" is sought, because anyone can doodle! You can play against the clock, cleverly each against each other or in the exciting team mode. This game promises super fun, casual doodling fun for the next game night with family and friends. Thanks to the included doodle boards, the SECOND cube and foil pens for up to 8 players, nothing stands in the way of an instant KRITZELSCHLACHT.

Gameplay Mode 1 of 3 - Everyone against everyone.

The first player draws a KRITZEL card from the deck and places it in the card holder for all other players to see, without looking at it himself. The other players now scribble, as fast and as well as they can, all three terms. The first doodler who has drawn all three terms then shouts "STOP". All doodlers must then stop drawing immediately. The scribble card is now placed face down and the scoring begins. The card drawer first tries to guess the terms of the fastest doodler. Only if three terms are correctly guessed does the fastest scribbler win. For each guessed term the now guessing card drawer gets one point. If a term cannot be guessed by the fastest scribbler, the scribbler does not receive a single point in this round. Now the card drawer guesses clockwise with the doodle boards of the other players. The other players receive one point for each additional term guessed until all terms have been guessed.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das gnadenlose Partyspiel ist das zweite Spiel aus der Partyfieber-Serie von DENKRIESEN und hat 300 Karten mit insgesamt 900 kinderleichten bis kniffligen Begriffen zum Kritzeln an Bord. In diesem Spiel wird kein neuer „Picasso“ gesucht, denn kritzeln kann jeder! Man spielt rasant gegen die Zeit, clever jeder gegen jeden oder im spannenden Teammodus. Dieses Spiel verspricht superlustigen, lockeren Kritzelspaß für den nächsten Spieleabend mit Familie und Freunden. Dank den enthaltenen Kritzelboards, dem SEKUNDENWürfel und Folienstiften für bis zu 8 Spieler steht einer sofortigen KRITZELSCHLACHT nichts im Wege.

Spielablauf Modus 1 von 3 - Jeder gegen jeden

Der erste Spieler zieht eine KRITZEL-Karte vom Stapel und platziert sie für alle Mitspieler sichtbar in dem Kartenhalter, ohne sie sich selbst anzusehen. Die Mitspieler kritzeln nun, so schnell und gut sie können, alle drei Begriffe. Der erste Kritzler der alle drei Begriffe gezeichnet hat, ruft dann „STOPP“. Alle Kritzler müssen dann sofort aufhören zu zeichnen. Die KRITZEL-Karte wird jetzt verdeckt hingelegt und die Auswertung beginnt. Der Kartenzieher versucht zuerst, die Begriffe des schnellsten Kritzlers zu erraten. Nur bei drei korrekt erratenen Begriffen gewinnt der schnellste Kritzler. Für jeden erratenen Begriff bekommt der nun ratende Kartenzieher einen Punkt. Kann ein Begriff beim schnellsten Kritzler nicht erraten werden, bekommt der Kritzler in dieser Runde keinen einzigen Punkt. Nun rät der Kartenzieher im Uhrzeigersinn mit den Kritzelboards der Mitspieler weiter. Diese bekommen pro weiteren erratenen Begriff jeweils einen Punkt, bis alle Begriffe erraten sind.

—description from the publisher

name: Powerline: Sunny Island Promo
description:
Promo tile for Powerline in English and German that provides a helpful catch up mechanic for the player in last place on the Victory track.

At the end of each round: if one single player is in the last position of the VP track, they gain the Sunny Island and place it on top of the island in their player board. In the next round, they will not lose VP if they deploy workers on the Sunny Island. If there is a new player in the last position at the end of that round, the Sunny Island is passed to them, otherwise it remains where it is.

name: Dice Tiny Town
description:
Dice Tiny Town is a 1-2 player roll-and-write game using dice and a pencil.

You create a town by drawing blocks on a 7x7 map and filling them with buildings and nature. The result of three dice determines the shape of the tetromino block and the building and nature in the block.

When you draw a pentomino block, you can invite a visitor to your town. If you make the visitor happy, you get bonus points.

Aim for a high score by placing buildings and natural features and keeping your invited visitors happy.

The 2-players rule is a cooperative mode. Each player creates their own town. The active player can use three out of four dice, while the inactive player can use the remaining die to draw a nature or a star coin. Total score is determined by the sum of each town's score and cooperative bonus points.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Bingo, Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: MindMeld: The Party Game
description:
Welcome to Mindmeld, the party game where great minds think alike.

Mindmeld: The Party Game is a competitive, high-energy party game where you and your partner draw cards with key words to choose from and try to come up with a word that connects these two key words.

The twist?

You have to come up with the same word as your partner to score the most points!

Can you get on the same wavelength as your friends to lock in a victory?

Everyone at the table is playing, both with their partner and with all the other players; so if you don't match with your partner, you can still score points by matching words with another player (but not quite as many points as you would when you match with your partner).

Now for a little more detail:
1) Everyone has a partner (there is a special rule in case your game group has an odd number of players)
2) taking turns, two partners each draw a Mindmeld card (each card has a set of 5 words to choose from).
3) They will choose a word from the card and say, "3-2-1!" and shout out the word they chose from the card.
4) All players (including the partners that choose the cards) then write the word that comes to mind that will connect the two shouted words.
5) The partners that drew the cards, as soon as they finish writing their word on their erasable boards say, "3-2-1!" and every player shows their word and shouts it out.
6) Then you score the round- If you and your partner matched words, you each score three points. If you match with anyone else, you and that player score one point.

"That's it?", you ask. You bet! Like we said before, this game is as fun as it is easy to play. Young and old alike, this game scales to every age and type of player you can imagine!

Fast and fun, Mindmeld is a great filler or end-of-the-night game that players can join and leave at anytime.

Mindmeld: The Party Game. Get in sync. Be of one mind. And join the fun!

-description from designer

name: Disney WordARound
description:
From the creators of the hit game WordARound comes a magical twist for Disney lovers!

In WordAround, players try to discover and read words written in a circle on round cards before their opponents. The player who guesses it correctly gets the card as a point. The first player to collect 10 cards or the player who has more cards at the end of the game wins.

Disney WordARound is perfect for both fans of WordARound and new players to the game who can enjoy hours of playing with friends and family. As fast as you can, read the Disney word in the circle and shout it out. It may not be as easy as you think! Each game card has a fan-favorite character on the back.

The game includes 100 cards with 300 Disney-related words.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Racing, Word Game

name: Mind Reader: The Psychic Party Game
description:
A pair of players are asked the same 3 questions and answer them independently, hoping to match as many as possible. 1 match = 1 point, 2 matches = 3 points, 3 matches = 6 points. The first player to collect 13 points WINS!

Players may either select the category they want to answer questions from [and the other players will pick their partner], or they may pick their partner for the round [and the other players pick which category they answer].

-description from publisher

name: Codenames: Bonus Pack – Schweiz
description: Ten new Switzerland themed cards for Codenames.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Deduction, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Sadie Cat and Mao: Robot Gophers
description:
Sadie Cat and Mao have stumbled upon a bad robot gopher situation! With your awesome memory skills, can you help the goblin capture all 3 before they completely ruin his yard?

Sadie Cat and Mao: Robot Gophers is a dice rolling and memory inspired game. Players will place 9 cards numbered from 1 - 9 face down in a 3x3 grid. Then they will roll 2d6, which correspond to different spots on the game board. It is then up to the player to find and remember which face down card is which number. Match this three times in a row and you win!

—description from the Publisher

name: Skeletons in the Closet
description:
When Walter Hudson, a wealthy entrepreneur, passes away, each member of his estranged family expects to receive their inheritance. As they gather at the estate, they are surprised to find you, a member of the Will Street Detective Agency. Walter’s will implies there is more to his death and more to his family than
meets the eye. Can you comb through the evidence left by Walter and discover how many skeletons are in this family's
closet?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Network Explorer
description:
In Network Explorer you are the last line of defense against ruthless hackers attempting to take down the network. As a cyber security specialist, you must use your wit and strategic thinking to thwart their attacks and save the day. Can you save the network and prevent a catastrophic data breach?

—Description from Publisher

Rearrange the cards and move your die along the created node path, scoring the points along the path and collect the points. The die also doubles as a round counter for the game. And different symbols mean different things that can happen to you (points can go up, cards can be flipped etc.)

name: Onitama: Nessie Promo Card
description:
New movement card, Nessie.

This card provides new movement options for your pieces.

This card was given out to participants in the Onitama tournament at the Tabletop Scotland 2022 convention.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game

name: Kufr 2
description:
Kufr 2 is a party game that is heavily inspired by the game Activity (1990). In Kufr 2, players will try to provide others with information that will lead them to guess the word on the playing card. This is done by drawing, talking or gesturing.

This game can be played in teams or collectively - where everyone tries to guess.

The uniqueness of this game comes mostly from one extra guessing game - where guessing players must ask yes/no questions and try to figure out the word within the time limit.

Also, the game contains relatively many playing cards, which allows for a large variety and replayability.

The box (in the shape of a suitcase) makes the game easy to carry and bring to the table, making it an ideal addition to various social events.
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Communication Limits, Line Drawing, Questions and Answers, Team-Based Game

name: 三日月夜と紅茶の姫君 (Crescent Moon Night and Tea Princess)
description:
Get a lot of tea and sweets (scores).
Become a tea princess!
Flip cards from the deck to get sweets.
When pots and patrols appear, everyone takes action!
Let's go get tea faster than anyone else!
Hide from patrols quickly!

But the etiquette should be graceful.

Can you perform a given action quickly and skillfully?
It's important to know when to turn over the cards.
It's an action-type card-flipping competition game.

In addition, if you can get both the girls' favorite tea and sweets, there might be good things♪

name: Tertúlia
description:
Revolutions and appreciation for traditions, fight for freedom, for rights and the pursuit of truth: Tertúlia is a game where you will gather and get to know great thinkers, their ideas, and the events that changed humanity!

So get your cards ready, because here's another opportunity to gather friends, impress your family, liven up the classroom, and even impress on a date!

Communists, liberals, conservatives, feminists, illuminists, and Greeks: these are the schools that compete for precious points to win the game. With these thinkers in hand, you can devise strategies to publish books and stage long-awaited historical events.

But beware: the competition is unpredictable and your opponents will want to put obstacles in your way to try to score points before you. Card negotiations and alliances can disrupt whoever is in the lead...

name: Name of the Game
description:
Trivia, tasks, truths, and trick questions! The goal is to answer before anyone else does to win the award. The twist is that if you try to answer at the same time as another player, you both lose your collected white cards! Oh, and there are also these pink cards! You can't lose pink cards, so if you win them, you get to keep them forever - well, till the end of the game!

Psst... the person who thinks they're the smartest in the room almost always loses!

-description from the back of the box

name: Superlike
description:
Each round one of the players is the bachelor and the others try to woo them by selecting two good attributes from their hand, while also giving one of their opponents a bad attribute to sabotage them. When introducing themselves to the bachelor, the players also draw a "traitor" card, which tells who revealed their red flag to the bachelor.
After the bachelor has decided who they'd prefer to date a new round begins, with the next bachelor.

The cards provide funny combinations, sometimes with dark humor and shock value.

name: Sangokushi Taisen Trading Card Game
description:
A trading card game based on famous arcade card game Sangokushi Taisen.
Players in this game can use characters from Three Kingdoms period of ancient China, to fight with the opponent. The player who break all opponent's wall card and attack the opponent will win the game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Mix family
description:
On a school trip, the beaver teacher asks the pupils to get into groups of 3 as quickly as possible, but it isn't so easy when the similarities turn out to be more complex than expected.
In this update of the family game, to win you need to form families of 3 animals of the same colour or the same type of animal, but as you progress there are fewer cards and combinations.

—description from the publisher

name: Wakfu Stories
description:
A group of adventurers are reminiscing about their past exploits. Things soon get heated, and everyone’s memories are getting fuzzier and fuzzier… Can you pull yours together and tell the most glorious story? Don’t let sticking to the absolute truth keep you out of the spotlight because, after all… you’re the one who deserves to go down in history!

Earn glory by linking your memories intelligently with the other players’ memories. The player with the most glory at the end of the game wins! Each memory will work more or less well with the other memories and will reveal its storytelling potential if its installation conditions are met. It’s up to you to make your memories fit in as well as possible, right up to the very end of the story!

name: Bee Savvy Game
description:
A dynamic game where chips are moving all the time creating fascinating bee hives!

The game accurately simulates a real life beehive. The player is given a starter beehive and must plan strategically and manage the hive's resources, bee production, comb space and stores to grow the hive as strong as possible. The players must endure a chaotic and ever changing environment that is uncertain, but somewhat governed by the different seasons, diseases and man-made events.

The purpose of the game is to grow the hive and to accumulate as many SWARMS as possible without letting the hive die of starvation or run out of bees. Bee biology and seasons knowledge will give the players an edge but luck also helps.

—description from the designer

name: Shironeko Project Trading Card Game
description:
A trading card game based on Japanese mobile game 'Shironeko Project'. In this game, players can use characters from the Shironeko world to fight the opponent.
In this game, players should prepare a 40-card main deck and 10-card town deck. Town cards can produce resource which can be used to play character card. The player who makes the other player's deck to 0 will win the game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: SticX Games: Hydras
description:
In Hydras, several hydras compete against each other to see which one is the first to complete their proper heads.

Deal a random Hydra Body card to each player, who will place it face up in front of themselves. This card determines your Hydra’s type.
Each player draws 3 Hydra Head cards from the face down deck and then adds them to their hand secretly. They must also draw 1 extra Hydra Head from the deck and place it face up on one of the necks of their Hydra’s body.

At the start of your turn, draw 1 Hydra Head card from the game deck and add it to your hand.

The winner is the first Hydra to have 3 Heads matching its Body type. Once a Hydra wins, the game ends.

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: MSC Cruises Special Travel Edition
description: Explore 22 unique ports of call featured in this exclusive edition of MONOPOLY. MSC Cruises is the world's largest privately owned cruise company and the number one cruise line in Europe, South America, South Africa and the Gulf. Journey around the board and invest in our exclusive islands, ships and destinations, Roll the dice and see where this cruise around the board' may take you! Follow in the footsteps of MSC Cruises the fastest growing cruise line in the world and watch your empire grow! Make deals with your fellow players, look out for bargains at auction and remember there is only room for one at the top. This special edition celebrates the entire MSC fleet and routes. What better way to celebrate your cruise holiday than playing with your new limited edition MONOPOLY board game!

name: Climate Change: The Game
description:
Earth’s future is in your hands, but will you choose to save it?
In Climate Change The Game, you’re the bad guy. Each player in the game owns a major global energy corporation. Your goal is to crush your competitors by securing the biggest share of the Earth’s precious natural resources and supply energy to the world’s great cities. But beware, as fossil fuel emissions get pumped into the atmosphere, the Earth will be battered by floods, famine and fires, and people will point the finger of blame at you!

Strategy game with Euro elements

Some Key Elements of Gameplay:
As the CEO of a fossil fuel corporation, your primary goal is to maximise shareholder profits.
Whether the world ends in flood and fires, or whether fossil fuels are banned to usher in a clean, green economy, the player with the highest stock price wins.

ROLL
At the beginning of your turn, roll the two 6-sided dice. Every player with a power plant bordering a region that matches the rolled number picks up a corresponding resource card. As the roller, if you didn’t get a match, you still get a consolation resource card. After everyone has rolled once, turns continue until someone rolls a 6, which triggers a Climate Summit and unleashes the number of Disasters determined by the Global Carbon Footprint.

TRADE
On your turn, you may initiate trades with other players.

WORLD NEWS EVENTS
You can play 1 World News card per turn. These include the joys and horrors of the 21st century: Brexit, Bolsonaro, Trump Tweets. It's all there!

BUILD YOUR NETWORK
Expand your network by building pipelines and power stations. Each action has its associated costs which you pay by discarding resource cards.

CLIMATE SUMMIT
At the end of each round, all players get on their private jets and fly to a secluded resort in the Swiss Alps to talk about what they will do to avert climate disaster. The player who bids the most resources becomes the “Sustainability Tsar” for the next round, moves one GreenPiece to anywhere on the board to block resource extraction, increases the Global Public Opinion meter by one step and in the next round wears the Sustainability Tsar and goes first.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Negotiation, Network and Route Building, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trading

name: 梨卦如理科子の直鎖アルカン教室 (Straight-chain alkane classroom of Rika Nyurikako)
description:
梨卦如理科子の直鎖アルカン教室 (Straight-chain alkane classroom of Rika Nyurikako) is a game where players will try to build simple molecules.
In turn order, each player draws an atom card from the deck and use it to create a new molecule (if they don't have one already) or to expand it. When adding an atom to a molecule, the direction of the chemical bond indicated on the card must be followed (cards can not be flipped sideways). A molecule must be completed to start a new one and score points. Any player creating a peroxide bond (-O-O-) is eliminated from the game. Drawing a 13C isotope allows to start a new molecule even if the previous one is still unfinished. Molecules containing halogen and/or carbon atoms are worth more points.
Once the atom card deck is depleted, victory goes to the player who has tallied the most points.

—user summary

まっすぐつないだ炭素原子を骨格に、分子を完成させていきます。何やら難しそうな雰囲気ですが、カードの手を直観的につなげばOK！
大きな分子が完成する達成感が堪りません。
ただし酸素が2つ並んだ-O-O-ペルオキシドには注意して！危険な物質なので、即ゲームオーバーです

—description from the publisher

A molecule is completed with straight carbon atoms as a skeleton. It looks like it's going to be difficult, but if you intuitively connect the hands of the cards, you'll be fine!
I can't stand the sense of accomplishment when a large molecule is completed.
But watch out for -O-O-peroxides with two oxygens in a row! It's a dangerous substance, so it's game over immediately.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Filòn: Al plu guz da Livign
description:
Filòn in Livigno dialect means 'shrewd, cunning individual'.

To come out of adversity, to face hardship and turn it to one's advantage, one has to be shrewd: Livigno is precisely the fruit of technique, ingenuity, entrepreneurial spirit, a nose for business and strategies.

Filòn's goal is to stay in the game without failing. The last one left in the game is the winner! In order to win, you will have to be able to haggle, make the right investments, bankrupt your opponents and prove that you are 'Al pluz guz da Livign' - the shrewdest in Livigno. Be wise in using the 'Oscsgiòn', opportunity, at your disposal and the dynamics of the game!
mechanics: Income, Loans, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Space Trap
description:
In Space Trap, players assume the roles of four intrepid astronauts trapped within an alien vessel on the brink of self-destruction.

Space Trap is an engaging move-and-write game featuring dynamic player interactions, as they race to unravel the ship enigmas. Players strategically maneuver assistant bots across the spacecraft, hunting for crucial information that could ultimately tip the scales in their favor.

—description from the designer

name: Endangered Orphans: The Last Winter of Benny Harris
description:
This expansion comes with everything you need to beef up Endangered Orphans of Condyle Cove (2nd Edition) to make it a four player game. You’ll get a fourth-player card mat, a fourth-player orphan/ghost (Benny) pawn, fourth-player cards, more Cove cards, more Cul-De-Sacs…more, more, MORE!


This is not a standalone game. Requires the Endangered Orphans of Condyle Cove base game.**




This expansion includes all the booster packs from the 1st Edition of Endangered Orphans of Condyle Cove.**
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Rettet den Regenwald
description: In this cooperative board game, players try to guide three animals to find enough food and find shelter while the forest is gradually destroyed by deforestation, pollution, and fire. Key to success is a mix of right strategy and luck. Besides, it raises players' awareness of current environmental and ecological problems going along with ruthless destruction of rainforest habitat.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Map Reduction

name: Vengeance: Roll & Fight – Boss Baby Promo Card
description:
Gamefound Exclusive Baby Boss promo card

Title: "Boss Baby"
Health: 3
Effect: "When the Boss Baby is killed, draw a Blocker in every room."

name: エカルタ (Sanrio Characters Ekaruta)
description: Find the community tile pattern on the board before your opponents. Tiles can be in any orientation, or across multiple tiles. Find the pattern and score a tile from the board. Replace the board tile with the community tile, and draw a new community tile. If there is no matching pattern on the board, then be the first to touch the community tile to score that tile.

name: Balance Tower
description:
Players compete to place their figurines on a precarious tower based on dice rolls. The game requires dexterity, strategy, and a bit of luck. The player who successfully places all their figurines without causing the tower to collapse wins the game.

Gameplay: Players take turns rolling a die and placing their figurines on the corresponding colored levels of the tower. If the tower wobbles and figurines fall off during a player's turn, that player is responsible for picking them up.

Goal: The goal of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their figurines. Players strategically choose where to place their figurines on the tower, aiming to create a stable structure while also trying to make it more challenging for the next player. Rolling the die determines which level to place a figurine or perform other actions.

name: モンスター21 (Monster 21)
description:
A blackjack-based gameplay. Get an item card and build up your team through draft, similar to blackjack. Whoever end up the closest to 21 will accomplish the quest but be careful, going above or under can have dire consequences.

Quests have reward values in ★. First hero to accumulate 5★ wins the game!

Game exist in Red, Blue and Green versions but the rules are the same just each version has a different theme.

name: General Palmer: Railroading in the Rockies
description:
In General Palmer each player has their own slightly different board on which they build track and stations. This is done by means of action cards; players start with some in hand and draft a new one each round. Each player also plays a card each round which gives them an action and also permits a certain number of track tiles to be built. Actions can include buying trains and building stations of various types.

The cards to be drafted also determine a random event each round and a location on the boards for that event.

The right to draft first (and possibly choose the event location next round) is auctioned off.

After using their actions and building track players run their trains for revenue.

The game ends when the deck runs out. Players then score for connecting Denver to Salt Lake City and also for eight out of the ten possible victory conditions; each player knows at least one of these, but some are hidden until the end.

While the game was designed for up to five players, there are six boards and the rules do explain how to play with six if you really want to.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Events, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Escape From Site 19: The SCP-7000 Contest Pack
description:
Enhance your Escape from Site 19 experience with this brand new booster pack. Based on the theme of luck, it contains six task cards that’ll test your limits and a Thaumiel with a twist.

What will you find inside?

4 New Euclid cards
2 New Keter cards
An SCP-7000 Thaumiel card
The SCP-7000 Pack Manual
publishers: Extreme Board Games, s. r. o.

name: Weather Meeple
description:
In Weather Meeple, you take on the role of 4 competing city news teams, trying to prove themselves as the best weather team players attempt to build a weather engine that will earn them the victory!

Players will manipulate "multi use" cards to create weather systems, buy more points and complete weather forecasts.

name: Let's Get Real Bro
description:
After getting deeply embarrassed in front of a classroom in 9th grade, a 5-year period of isolation, loneliness, and social anxiety was triggered. Lacking any real tools to support myself (other than a hoodie), the following years involved doing everything in my power to hide from further shame or embarrassment.

After forcing myself into out into the world and slowly regaining confidence to take the hoodie off, a curiosity grew to better understand myself and this internal world I seemingly had very little control of.

I stumbled into meditation, soaked up any talk on psychology, explored therapy, art, men's groups, and above all - found friendships with others who shared this desire to look inward and share more openly about not only the good stuff, but also the less than ideal - our fears, pains and insecurities.

Over time I noticed that it was in these open conversations that our relationship grew. Not to mention they helped us feel a bit less alone - like we were in this together. And within the men's groups, we were paving a new way for what had been told to us as men - to do it alone, to stay strong and not show weakness.

Strangely enough, after being forced to hide myself when I was younger, it has been these moments of seeing others and being seen more deeply that have given me a sense of meaning, connection and purpose.

Ultimately, this game is a tool to create those moments - to explore, uncover, and share what makes us who we are. While scary at times (or damn near impossible), I believe that it's in this process that ourselves and our relationships can transform.

90 QUESTION CARDS.
3 LEVELS OF REALNESS.

—description from the publisher

name: Rumble Jungle
description:
In the jungle, the animals are always looking for trouble. So, get ready to win this fight, where anything goes! Welcome to Rumble Jungle!
Place matching cards to continue the rumble, if you can't, you will loose it and receive some heavy blows!

name: 막타 2 (MAKTA 2)
description:
A dragon that has appeared out of nowhere roars. The terrified king also roars. The people laugh at the king's cowardice. The king shouts that this is nothing to laugh about. The people just shrug.

"It's my fault for expecting loyalty in the first place! Yes, I'll give you what you want: honor and power to whoever brings me that fat lizard!"

The laughter dies down and tension settles in the room. Some are already gathering their gear. We must hurry! There's only one dragon!

Open one region card. Region cards must be opened from lower-level regions first. If the card you open is a monster, fight it; if it's a place, perform the actions for that place, then open a new region card.

Battles are fought by drafting dice. You use the dice you earn to equip equipment, use skills, and defeat monsters. As you progress through the game, you can use the gold and experience you earn to get higher-grade equipment or learn more powerful skills.

At the end of the battle, pass the line marker to the player who struck the last blow, and proceed with the town phase if any players are exhausted; otherwise, open the next region card and continue the adventure.

Repeat the Village and Adventure stages to grow and prepare for the Dragon battle. Dragons can be found in level 3 locations. For more information, please refer to the rulebook at the link below. Please note that this document is not finalized and the contents are subject to change until production.

name: Honey Hop
description:
Take on the role of a queen bee, guiding your dedicated bees towards victory in a thrilling quest for nectar. Strategize to collect nectar from the blooming field of flowers to turn into the most Honey Points, ensuring your hive's survival as winter approaches. ??

Honey Hop is designed for players who love engaging and strategic gameplay. With its unique bumping mechanic, you'll navigate the colorful game board, outmaneuver opponents, and cleverly solve challenges to create honey. Diversity in nectar color leads to creating more Honey Points (e.g. Victory Points). This captivating board game offers a perfect blend of simplicity and depth, appealing to both casual players and seasoned strategists.

Gather your friends and family, for Honey Hop accommodates 2 to 4 players, allowing you to enjoy the game with your loved ones. Inside the captivating box of Honey Hop, you'll find meticulously crafted components. From 20 beautifully illustrated hexagonal tiles representing the lush flower field and your hive, to the 8 adorable bee tokens, 4 player boards, 6 frame pieces, 36 nectar pieces, 40 honey pieces, 9 month tokens, 1 Calendar board, 1 month marker, 30 cards, 1 rain marker, 1 crown piece, and 1 rule booklet. Every detail has been carefully designed to enhance your gaming experience. Immerse yourself in the world of Honey Hop, where every move counts and every decision can lead you closer to victory.

Will you strategically navigate the field, collect the most nectar, and claim victory? Discover the joys of this unique and captivating board game, and let the adventure begin!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Dragon in the Hut
description:
Dragon in the Hut is an action-packed, portable, and easy-to-learn card game with a pinch of strategy, a splash of rivalry, and two drops of bluff. And dragons, obviously.

Players take turns drawing cards, trying to find dragon eggs in the forest and build an hut as a safe and warm place for their scaled companions to be born and raised.

Take an egg, put it in a hut, and keep it safe until it hatches to get a shiny new dragon.

The first player to hatch three or more dragons wins.

—description from the designer

name: Pół litra
description:
It is 1918. The Republic of Poland regains its long-awaited independence. Unfortunately, the country is in ruins. After the tragic death of your uncle, you inherit an old vodka factory. Her condition is deplorable. Luckily, the market is in good shape. Poles want to have fun, and above all drink! Your goal is to make your business successful. Attention, other industrialists want to take your place. The one who produces the best vodka wins.
Pół litra is a medium-advanced and fast (about 30 m.) "worker placement" game in a print and play format. The aim of the game is to produce the best vodka by running your vodka factory.

—description from the designer

name: Rada nad zlato
description:
Rada nad zlato ("Priceless Advice") is a semi-cooperative trivia party game in which it is important to demonstrate not only knowledge, but also good judgment of opponents, tactical skills and the art of bluffing.

900 questions await the players, divided into 20 topics - from the classic (history) to the unusual (mysteries). Players are secretly divided into two teams. Only some players will reveal their team affiliation.

Throughout the game, players will select topics and questions for their opponents (or teammates), advice them in with their own answers, and also use special effects to turn the game in their team's favor. The aim of the game is to score more points than the opponents.

name: Rolling Realms Redux
description:
In Rolling Realms Redux, players compete to earn the most stars over 3 rounds in a series of minigames. (There are 12 different “realms” included in the game.) This is a roll-and-write game, meaning that players will write on the game components using dry-erase markers.

Each turn, one player rolls 2 dice, and all players use the dice results on their realm cards to generate resources and earn stars. After 3 rounds, the player with the most stars wins!

Rolling Realms Redux is a standalone game, and it includes everything you need to play up to 6 players. It features the same rules and full compatibility with its predecessor, Rolling Realms, but with 12 new realms inspired by popular games from other publishers, a printed version of the living rulebook that will include explanations for all realms (original, new, and promo), with everything in a box designed to fit all realms ever printed.

All 12 realms in Rolling Realms Redux are 100% new and unique to this specific product.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Books of Time: Trade Book Promo
description: Three Trade book pages for Books of Time. Add these three pages to the stacks of pages for the offering before the game begins.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Magnificent Flying Machines: The Great Air Races Expansion
description:
Between the years 1903 when the Wright brothers took to the skies at Kitty Hawk and 1909 aviation advanced gradually, but nothing encourages progress so much as competition, preferably for a prize. It was in the Spring of 1909 that the first aviation meetings and races were held in locations in France which paved the way for the First International Air Race at Reims in August.

Virtually everyone in the aviation business turned up and the event fired off a series of meetings mostly held around Europe and in the USA where pilots would compete on laps of the airfields- each attempting to fly further, higher, and faster than before. Finally, by 1911, Flying Machines had the range for races of hundreds of miles between cities, across countries and crossing the sea. The era of the Great Air Races had arrived.

The Great Air Races is an expansion to the game Magnificent Flying Machines which adds in varied terrain, new weather conditions, pilots and equipment and a series of race cards that recreate the courses and races in early Aviation history.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Globetrotting: 5-6 Player Expansion
description: This expansion provides 2 more sets of player components to play with up to 6 players.
mechanics: Bingo, Contracts, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Treble: The Dinotopian Card Game
description:
Set in the world of Dinotopia (books by James Gurney), match 2 of the 3 elements (number, color, and symbol) on your 3 faceup cards to win.

The card game was included with the 1996 PC game.

name: Justice
description:
Justice is a 3 to 5-player, thematic, competitive, tableau-building game set in the same Dwarven society of Odrixia where Factory 42 is set, where players, as members of the Council of Law and Order, determine the guilt of accused criminals.

It's a trick-taking game where players utilize won cards strategically to influence the fate of suspects. With hidden scoring objectives, "Justice" presents a blend of cooperation and rivalry, culminating in a thrilling game lasting approximately 45 - 60 minutes.

Immerse yourself in this captivating universe and experience the intricate balance between trick-taking mechanics and strategic decision-making.

name: H.D.P.: Lo Que Nos Dejó Qatar
description: Promotional micro expansion with new cards. They seem harmless, but are actually forbidden in France!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dlouhý, Široký a Bystrozraký
description:
Children's game based on fairy tale "The Six Servants" collected by the German Brothers Grimm.

Dear children, do you know the fairy tale about the "Long, Broad and Sharpsight" who helped the prince to rescue the princess from the captivity of the evil wizard? The play is about the fairy tale characters' difficult journey to the prince's castle. The one who makes the journey full of obstacles and dangers the fastest wins.

Each Player represents one of the six characters. These characters are the Princess, the Prince, the Magician, the Long, the Wide and the Sharp-eyed. Their mission is to get to the prince's castle as quickly as possible.

There are two dice in the game, the first with pictures of the characters, the second a classic numeric 6-dice. Players take turns rolling both dice. The dice with pictures determines which character will progress, the second dice determines by how many square. Thus, it is very common for a player to move another player's piece around the game board.

However, if he is lucky enough to have his own piece appear on the roll, then he advances by double the number of points rolled on the other dice.

On the black squares, players progress according to the dice roll. However, if they land on a red square, they are forced to perform the action associated with that square. These actions may delay them or even return them to squares they have already passed through. However, they can make them move forward faster in certain cases.

It is up to the players' agreement when the game ends. It may be when the first piece reaches the castle. Its owner wins and the other players lose. However, it is possible to end the game after all but one of the pieces have reached the castle. In that case, we know the order of the other players in addition to the winner who got to the castle first.

name: Имаджинариум: Кассиопея (Imaginarium: Cassiopeia)
description: Кассиопея ("Cassiopeia") has 98 new illustrations. All of them are bright, cheerful and not complicated at all.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: 18ARG
description:
18ARG is a stock market and railroad building game set in Argentina where the players take the roles of railway investors and company presidents. In these roles, players try to accumulate wealth. Players do this through the ownership of shares of stock in the railroad companies. When a company earns money and pays dividends, the dividends are paid to the players owning shares in the company. As shares increase and decrease in value, so does the wealth of the owning players.

The players' wealth is the sum of their cash on hand, the current value of their public company shares, and the face value of any private companies they own. The object of the game is to have the most wealth at the end of the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Connections, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: David Sundins Dubbeltrubbel!
description:
A quick and crazy game where you need to get rid of your deck while remaining calm.

To remove one of your cards, you need to be seen and heard as much as possible to find other players that have the same card as you. When two players find matching cards, they may remove that card, but only after celebrating by running round the table while howling, shaking hand and switching places or winning a game of rock paper scissors.

But wait, even if you get rid of all of your card you still need to spin a wheel. If it stops on the wrong spot, you'll end up loosing instead.

name: Everyone's an Expert
description:
Everyone's an Expert is a fun card game with a serious touch where 3-6 players try to come up with creative (and most likely ridiculous) solutions to different global problems.

However, there is a catch. They must base their solutions on two completely random keywords found on their solution cards.

Each round one player acts as an investor, investing money in the ideas they like the best. The player with the highest total investment when the game ends wins.

—description from the publisher

name: The Magician's Curse
description:
In this unique game, the boundaries between reality and fantasy blur. Thanks to the unique combination of game materials and augmented reality (AR), you can transform any place of your choice into the magical world of wizards and create an incredible gaming experience.

Discover magical artifacts, hidden treasures and secret messages with your fellow players. You will only be able to solve the 16 main puzzles and break the ancient curse by working as a team.

name: The Quagmires of Mysterra
description:
Deep in the forests at the heart of Mysterra, a once sparkling lake has deteriorated into a swampy bog. Many years ago, an evil witch stole 5 magic gems from the Queen, only to lose them in the lake’s depths as she made her escape. Over time, the witch’s magic has seeped into the waters, contaminating them with her evil. Gnomes, long known as the Keepers of the Forest, seek to return the waters to their former glory. To do so, they must enlist the help of the fairies, building mushroom huts for them to live in. In return, the fairies will use their magic to find the gems and save the lake, restoring beauty to the forest once again. Will you be able to eliminate the quagmire and earn the Queen’s favor?

The Quagmires of Mysterra is a 1-4 player game of shifting strategies and sinking maps, involving dice, lily pads, and mushrooms! Puzzle your way through an ever-changing swamp as you beat your opponents to attract the most fairies. Only with their magic can you collect the sacred gems and restore the lake to its former beauty, earning favor with the Queen at last.

On a player's turn, they must match their available Wishing Dice with an action card in their hand. Once a card has been used, it is no longer available to play (until all discarded cards are returned to their hand via the Rest action). Then, the player re-rolls their dice to prepare for their next turn.

Actions include:

Exploring the map
Collecting resources
Building a mushroom fairy hut
Buying tools and upgrades from the market to build their engine and enhance future turns
Applying bonus fairy magic
Mirroring another player's top card
Resting to reset your hand


Points are scored for various accomplishments during the game. When the final gem has been found, all players finish the current round and end-game scoring begins. Whoever has the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Map Reduction, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Super G
description:
Super-G 2018 is the third (of four) offering in our Alpine Skiing series. Slalom 2018 and Giant Slalom 2018 are already out there, work will start on Downhill 2018 as soon as Super-G goes off to be published.

All four events are similar but different! Super-G could have been called 'Mini Downhill' but 'super' is a more appealing term than 'mini' so they went with that. The differences (from Slalom and Giant Slalom) are sufficient to require another re-think and re-design of the basic game engine, hopefully reflecting the difference in the events themselves, but that is for you to judge.

Skiers still have three Ratings, but Start is of less importance as the race times are longer, and we have added Technique to the ever-present Control and Speed. In game terms Technique is the skier's inherent ability in the approach to the turns and in the turns themselves. And because this is an in-built ability the Rating for Technique isn't subject to movement up and down during a run although there may be marginal changes for a particular Turn as part of the Performance Roll. But those changes are temporary, for that Turn only.

Because run times are usually between 60 and 90 seconds there is only one run per skier in each event. And to make the simulation as playable as possible a run consists of just six Turns, two each of Top Section, Middle Section and Bottom Section. One run rather than two helps to simulate the lessened predictability of the event and to reinforce that we let each Turn for each skier use the current Control Rating plus either the current Speed Rating or the static Tech Rating. More of that later.

Once again we have supplied Ratings for the top thirty in the World Cup tables for both Men and Ladies, plus twenty All-Time-Greats in both categories. Details of how to generate your own Ratings are included as before as are very similar solo rules using the familiar Mindset concept. Enjoy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: My Bloody Valentine: The Game
description:
Can you stop killer miner Harry Warden from reaching the Valentine's Day dance and slaughtering the town youths? As Warden stalks his way to the big Valentine's Day dance, one to four players (that's you!) move around the board collecting weapons, drawing cards, working around roadblocks, using the secret mine tunnel, and trying not to get their hearts broken. But watch out – players who land on Harry's space will confront the pickaxe-wielding slasher, which means certain death for either Harry or the player.

—description from the publisher
categories: Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Suppose
description:
In order to survive the fierce competition for survival, we repeatedly fought over territory.
Tired from the long battle, we all decided to take a moment's rest while playing a card game. Unfortunately, some of the cards are so dirty that they cannot be seen.
it can not be helped. Let's enjoy the game by supposing what the dirty card is.

name: ねこカフェ KASANEKO (Cat Café KASANEKO)
description:
This is a game where you look for the one cat that matches the theme from a pile of overlapped cat cards, and quickly grab the correct card. This is a super simple game where the rules can be understood in a minute, but it tests your observation skills, search abilities, spatial recognition, and more, as you find the correct cat and grab the right card. It's an ultra-easy and super exciting game! This new sensation of a cat card game is a contest of the keenest eyesight.

—description from the publisher (translated)

『ねこカフェ KASANEKO（カサネコ）』は、重なりあうねこの描かれたカードの中から、お題となる１匹を探して素早く正解の取り札を取るゲームです。1分でルールが分かる超シンプルなゲーム性に、正解となる猫を探し、そして正しい取り札を取るための観察力、探索力、空間認識能力などが試される、超カンタンで超盛り上がる！　目ヂカラ勝負の新感覚ねこカードゲームです。

—description from the publisher (Japanese)
publishers: Studium Mundi (スタジオムンディ)

name: Spy Guy: Zimowa Przygoda
description:
The pre-Christmas rush is already underway in the city, but Spy Guy has another case to solve! He has to stop Bert as soon as possible before he can get to his machine and use it to steal all the baubles from the city. Will Spy Guy find the clues fast enough to lead him to Bert's trail?

You take on the role of Spy Guy - a superdetective who upholds law and order in the city. Your task is to catch Bert before he reaches his machine and uses it to steal all the baubles from the town! If you manage to catch up with him - you win!
To catch Bert, you and Spy Guy must find as many clues as possible hidden throughout the city. The more clues you find, the faster your pawn will catch up with the escaping Bert. The items you need to find are shown on the clue cards.

Spy Guy Winter Adventure is a co-operative game in which you all direct the movements of the detective. The gameplay consists of a series of alternating turns between Spy Guy and Bert. The game begins with Spy Guy.
In Spy Guy's turn:

Reveal one clue card from the deck. It indicates the item you must search for on the board this turn.
Turn the hourglass as soon as the card is revealed.
You all look out for the object you are looking for on the board. It will appear in more than one place. If any of you of you manages to spot it, he places a clue marker on it.
When the sand in the hourglass has settled, the search is over! You cannot add any more markers.
Count how many wanted items you have found. Move Spy Guy's pawn the same number of spaces in Bert's direction.


In Bert's turn, look at the clue card revealed in Spy Guy's turn. Move Bert this many spaces forward (towards the machine) how many shoe marks appear on the card. Then, if Bert has not yet reached his machine, start another round of Spy Guy.

If Bert reaches the last box on the board, he steals all the baubles from city! Unfortunately, you lose. If Spy Guy manages to catch up with or chase Bert on his way towards the machine, you have successfully caught him and you win!

—description from the publisher

W Treflikowie trwa już przedświąteczna gorączka, jednak Spy Guy ma do rozwiązania kolejną sprawę! Musi jak najszybciej
powstrzymać Berta, zanim ten dotrze do swojej maszyny i za jej pomocą ukradnie wszystkie bombki z Treflikowa. Czy Spy Guy wystarczająco szybko znajdzie poszlaki, które naprowadzą go na trop Berta?
