Then the first player is chosen, and they will turn over the top card from the dig pile onto the dig site. Each item has a special power that then will be implemented. The player then can either turn over more cards, or end their turn and gather the cards in the dig site as their collection. If they turn over more cards, more powerful items can be found, but also if the same item is drawn again, their turn will end immediately and all of the items in the dig site go to the discard pile, and the player will get none of them.
Then the play moves to the player on the left, and goes on until the dig pile is empty. Then each player will count the highest number item they have and add them up for their final score. The player with the highest score is the winner.
The game is designed for 2 to 4 players, but by combining two sets of item cards the game can be played by 5 to 8 people as well. Although, since the item cards are the same as with the original Zirkhaki, the games can combine the item cards to accommodate more players.

name: Trafikspillet
description:
Be the first one to reach the school on your bike. Answering questions about road signs on the way.
Move by dice roll, get extra moves for correct answers, or maybe get lucky and take the shortcut on the pedestrian street.

name: Mister Coco
description:
A game set in the world of Blanc Manger Coco
Everyone is invited to participate in an event, except for one outsider, Mister Coco, who is invited to a different event. The goal is to find Mister Coco to earn points. In fact, Mister Coco doesn't even know he's the outsider.

None of the Mister Coco players know whether they are Mister Coco or not. Everyone is in the dark and must cleverly use object cards at their disposal to test the group of players and find common ground with those who are invited to the same event as them... Or, on the contrary, to confirm that they are indeed the outsider, Mister Coco.

name: Pentrix
description: Can you win the battle between the monster summoners? Use the five attributes of wood, fire, earth, gold, and water to summon many powerful monsters and win. Trick-taking allows you to compete with monsters that you can't compete with depending on the compatibility and combination of their attributes.

name: Mlsné medvědí příběhy
description:
Two furry friends decided to fill their pantry with the best the forest has to offer. Help the bears find hidden goodies to enjoy during the winter.

Mlsné medvědí příběhy ("Yummy Bear Tales") is a cooperative game in which players work together to beat the game itself (players win or lose together). The task of the players, who together control two pieces (so the pieces don't belong to any particular player), is to gather a supply of food for the winter in the forest using cards.

This simple children's game for children as young as 4 years old is suitable for playing with younger and novice players.

The game is inspired by the fairy tales of the same name about Nedved and Mishka.

name: Der achtsame Tiger
description:
Der achtsame Tiger is a memory game based on the children's book of the same name from Przemyslaw Wechterowicz, and players can win in one of two ways:


Search for the mindful tiger.
Search for as many different animal friends as possible.


You make this decision before each move, then if you uncover only the category for which you are looking, you can continue; otherwise, your turn ends.

Who will remember more tiles and keep their nerve?

name: Varázslabor
description:
In the wizarding school, during potion class, the students are diligently practicing how to make a magic potion that is good for every ailment. The teacher has assigned them to repeatedly recite the rhyming recipe for potion-making, but the kids tend to get confused... The one who pays the most attention and collects the most magical ingredients in their pouch by the end of the class wins!

—description from the designer

name: Cat•a•gories
description:
In this adorable game, players put a cat paw on their finger and use it to swipe lettered dice after they've yelled out a word that begins with the letter shown on the dice and fits the topic card.

Players of all ages enjoy pretending to be a cat and swiping at the foam dice.

name: Murder on the World Tour
description: The vocalist in the rock band dies on stage. Players must go through crime scene evidence and interrogation reports in order to find out who did it.

name: Echoes of Emperors
description:
Echoes of Emperors is a medieval-themed strategic card/board game.

Develop your empire's army, economy, and technologies to conquer your opponents.

Echoes of Emperors is a strategic board game where players choose from four distinct civilizations: Norsemen, Byzantines, Mongols, or Scots. Maneuver your units to explore new lands, establish settlements for economic prowess, and engage in thrilling battles. Utilize cards to activate units and technologies, shaping the destiny of your civilization. Victory awaits those who can destroy their opponent's capital or eliminate all their active units. Get ready to embark on an epic journey of conquest and domination!

The game is focused on 1v1 gameplay, but can also be expanded for more players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Worker Placement

name: UNO Friends Card Game
description:
The UNO game brings friends together with a deck inspired by the Friends television show featuring favorite characters from the series. Players still try to match colors and numbers and will want to draw 'The One Where You Draw' card with a special rule that will have opponents drawing until they find the right Friend. When down do their last card, players don't say 'How You Doin'?', they yell 'UNO!'

One for special 'The One Where You Draw' rule forces opponents to draw until they find the correct Friend.

name: Kalandozás a múltba
description:
The box contains two board games suitable for two age groups. One is recommended for children aged 3-6, and the other for those aged 7-12.

For the little ones, the goal is to collect the animals and objects necessary for the ancient Árpád-era family's life by taking steps on the game board.

The other game is designed for children who can read and write. Similarly, players need to collect the animals and objects on the game board, but here, after successfully completing tasks (letter games, drawing, gestures, speech, runes, trivia, dexterity), they can earn money to purchase the necessities of life for the ancient family.

Throughout the game, we developed children's logic, movement, hand-eye coordination, speaking skills, empathy, and creativity with seven different tasks.

The aim of this game is for our children to learn about the lives of our ancestors
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Spring Festival
description:
Chinese New Year is the festival that celebrates the arrival of spring. On this occasion, the best pyrotechnicians organize spectacular fireworks displays. As a pyrotechnician, your goal is quite simple: make an impression, and be appointed as a Master Pyrotechnician by the Emperor himself.

Complete the most beautiful fireworks display by creating a calculated succession of explosions. Give the audience a show to be remembered, have them applause, and at the end, impress the Emperor with a memorable grande finale!

In Spring Festival, each player will have to place their fireworks as best as possible to create chain reactions and explode as many rockets as possible. He will thus create compositions of shape or pattern and complete his objectives. By completing sparkles, players will win the race for applause and the finale will be the highlight of the show.

For more complexity, players can celebrate the new year by selecting one of the twelve Chinese sign cards which will give new victory conditions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Contracts, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Send Us More Japs ! ウェーキ島作戦：1941年12月11日
description: This is a game that simulates the operation to capture Wake Island, which was the only defeat of the Japanese Navy among the spectacular military achievements after the attack on Pearl Harbor.

name: Top 2000 Quiz
description:
A party game with trivia questions about music in the older iterations of the "top 2000". The game consists of 100 cards with 6 questions and answers each, a die (plain D6) for selecting the question, a bell for indicating you want to give the answer, and a pencil with beermats for logging the score,
The rules are flexible and can be adapted to the amount of time available (the winer can be e.g., the first player/ team to answer 15 questions correctly, or the one with most correct answers after half an hour).

name: Droned Dwarves
description:
Oh man, that was a party!!! This one will be legendary even among dwarves! And that young wife of your cousin Gringhli, what a cute beard she has! Lucky man. But now it is time to return home...

“Will you guys find your way back?” says Gringhli. “Wicked creatures lurk in the shadows beyond the main corridors... And you look still totally smashed. Drunk and stoned at the same time, ‘droned’ as we call it, hehe.”

“Never mind, my dude. I remember the way as clearly as my own name, which is, er... ehm... errrr... Well, farewell! And best wishes to your marriage again!”

Of course, you, a mighty dwarf warrior, would never admit you could not do something, but to be honest – you cannot remember the way back to the light as sure as you can’t remember how many beers and pipes you’ve had, not to mention kegs of mead. So, the epic memory game begins!

Which tunnel is familiar to you? Which stone wall or staircase do you remember? – Look for pairs of cards and try to avoid dangerous encounters.

Droned Dwarves is based on the classic Memory Game, also called "Pairs" or "Pexeso", enhanced with a bit of dungeon crawling. Players choose a dwarf and some starting equipment, then flip over tunnel cards. If they reveal a matching pair, the player is one step closer to escaping and winning the game. If not, they are flipped face down again. If the player flips over an "!" card, they immediately apply its effects, then flip it face down. A player is eliminated if any of their stats are reduced to zero.

—description from the publisher

name: Monster Nursery
description:
A dexterity game where you take care of all the little monsters in your nursery as best you can so they don't cry. some are hungry, others want to play or want to sleep.

In turns the active player selects 1 of the available monster tiles from the center of the table to its nursery board, trying to place it near to their friends and away from the little monsters it is angry with
Then tells everyone the icons marked on the selected tile, and simultaneously, each player tries to take care of their monsters by placing one finger of the same hand on each icon on the tiles that corresponds to the one indicated by the active player and with the other hand on the other icon to prevent them from crying.
All this while you take care of the sleepy little monsters. Some of them want to sleep and need to be carried, by placing them on your head, arm, hand, or shoulders, preventing them from falling and crying.
The player who best takes care of their little monsters will be the winner.

name: Cinema
description:
In Cinema players put together movie deals; players have hands of script and talent cards and take turns producing movies.

A movie requires a script card and three talent cards. However, a producer can't use their own script - they must choose one that is pitched by another player, or forfeit their turn. After choosing a script, the talent must be selected - the producer can make any kind of mutually-acceptable deals with other players for their talent. They can also use their own, but at a steep cost, or use random cards from the deck for a lesser but still high cost.

Once a movie is made it receives box office, prestige, and miscast cards based on how well the talent cards match the script's requirements; box office cards provide money immediately while other cards are kept hidden until the end of the game.

Once all players have had a set number of turns awards are given out for best movie overall, best movie in each genre, and worst movie, with the quality being determined by the cards won by each movie. The awards are worth money and the player with the most money wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation

name: Reazioni Emotive
description:
Each player, in turn, takes the role of the emotion manipulator, while the others play as emotion investigators.
The manipulator's task is to draw 4 different situation cards and associate secretly the emotion reaction to them, by using the emoji tokens.

The investigators' role is to guess the emotion reaction of the manipulator. Every investigator scores 1 point per each correct guess, the manipulator scores the same point as the highest-scoring investigator.
If a player scores 0 point in a round, an emoji token is selected by the losing investigator, and then all players discard the that token.

The victory is awarded to the player with the highest score when the set of emoji token of each player is made of 3 or less elements.

—user summary

A quick and fun party game, in which you will have to test your ability to empathize with other people's thoughts!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Un party game rapido e divertente, in cui dovrai mettere alla prova le tue capacità di immedesimarti nei pensieri degli altri!

—description from the publisher

name: Yo soy tu peli
description:
At a glance
A game with almost 200 movie quizzes that will make you hum, guess, act and... have a great time
It's not just a game for movie geeks. It doesn't matter if you know a lot or a little, you will love it!
Lights, camera and action... Roll the dice and read the card of one of its six different categories!
Enjoying the best B.S.O., unforgettable phrases and mythical scenes is a very original gift
A game that will bring out the best in a dinner, a few drinks or any celebration and will disconnect you from your phone for a while
If you are looking for a different type of board game, check out all our games here

What does it consist of?

Gabilondo, Urdangarín, Zubizarreta, Arguiñano; and then on the ama's side: Igartiburu, Erentxun, Otegi and Clemente... Do you know which famous movie these words correspond to? Don't worry, this game is not going to be an encyclopedia about cinema. I am your movie is a party in the form of a board game. Its mechanics are very simple: one dice, six categories, two teams eager to enjoy and a single winning team. Do you want to know what challenges you will have to face if you give this very original gift? These are the six categories:
Casting: a question and four possible answers about film actors and characters
Outtakes: Do you think you could mime The Matrix and have someone guess it?
OST: humming a soundtrack seems easy... until everyone else has to guess it
Spoiler: describe a movie with only 5 words taking into account that there are prohibited words
Cinemanía: battle of movie titles between the two teams according to the proposed theme
Script: guess which movie the phrase on the card belongs to


You can find anything! From The English Patient, Life is Beautiful or Joker to Finding Nemo, American Pie or Shrek. Every time you pass a test you will keep the card. The first team to get a card from each category will be the winner. By the way, the phrase is from E.T. the alien, my house...phone...

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: The Search for UAPs
description:
The past one hundred years has brought many sightings of unidentified flying objects. While this has often been credited to the sci-fi craze of the mid 20th century, recent sightings by respected members of the military and captured video show that something is out there that we can't quite identify. The search is on to discover and fully document this phenomena so that we may understand more about it.

The Search for UAPS is a game about this real-world search. You are astronomy enthusiasts, and you've recently seen something in your evening stargazing that you can't explain. Using your telescope, camera, and computer research, you're trying to track down this Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena (UAP) to help the global scientific community gain a better understanding of what's out there. While UAPs have been spotted all over the world, you'll be focusing on the edge of space, where it is possible that these objects might be.

Deduction fans will enjoy new gameplay elements such as variable quantities of objects, analyzing satellites, and major new twists, such as rotating orbits that result in continually changing placement and adjacency. Objects can be next to something, above it, below it, in the same quadrant from it, or even directly across from it. As the Earth rotates, the options continue to expand! Search for and take pictures of satellites, the International Space Station, or the Hubble Telescope to help you track down mysterious UAPs!

—description from the publisher

name: Sandcastle Solitaire
description:
Sandcastle Solitaire is a quick, breezy game for one player, that can be played with a standard deck of cards. Your goal is to build your sandcastle as large as possible, so it can withstand the waves when high tide comes.

Basic Turn Structure: At the start of your turn, draw anywhere from 1 to 7 cards from the deck (gather sand). After drawing cards, you must play all the cards in your hand to your castle, one at a time (improve castle). The first card must be played to a non-empty column in your castle, if one exists. Subsequent cards must played to an adjacent column to the previous card played, i.e. the column immediately to the left or right. After playing all cards in your hand, count how many columns are standing in your castle, and discard half that many cards from the deck, rounded up (tide comes in).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Ladder Climbing, Move Through Deck, Random Production, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: E' tutta un'altra musica
description:
With E' tutta un'altra musica playing games and playing music become one thing. Each player represents one of the 7 notes and must move along the keyboard on the board, from octave to octave, to conquer the other 6 which are needed to complete a scale and win a game, during which there are various fun tests to overcome.

You will have to whistle, mime or sing to make them guess an instrument or a piece of music, or you will have to answer fascinating questions about the authors and performers... and to win over the Jolly you will sing in a truly special way.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Singing

name: Barefoot to Glory!: Estigarribia's Western Chaco Campaign in 1934
description:
Barefoot to Glory is a free print & play operational simulation of the battles for the control of the Western Chaco in 1934 (when the Battles of El Carmen, Yrendagüé and Ibibobó took place); unit scale is regiment, each hex spans 10Kms from side to side and every turn covers three days.

During the 1932-35 war between Bolivia and Paraguay, Pata Pila (barefoot) was the nickname the Bolivian soldiers gave to the Paraguayan counterparts due to the fact that they made war barefoot. During the second half of 1934, the Paraguayan barefoot troops achieved one of the greatest military victories of the 20th Century in an intense highly mobile (and under severe environmental conditions) campaign under the leadership of General Felix Estigarribia.

Although the Chaco War (1932-35) is mostly known for its WWI like fighting, as the one that took place during the siege of Boquerón or the battle of Nanawa; the Paraguayan commander in chief, Gen. Félix Estigarribia, lacking the resources to beat the Bolivians through pitched battle, developed a bold approach based in wide deep sweeps, aimed at the Bolivian rearguard, isolating his foe so that he either surrendered or died of thirst.

This simulation has its focus on this particular type of warfare. Game rules implement rational mechanics for simulating initiative, intelligence and command and control in battle.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: The Secrets of Zorro
description:
California, 1840.
The legendary Zorro has been missing for months. The sad truth is that Don Diego de la Vega, the man behind the mask, has died among his loved ones. Taking advantage of this absence, the new governor has started to put his devious plan into action: he's oppressing the people to fuel his power grab in California. But he didn't anticipate the heirs of the masked vigilante — you!
Together, you must work to topple the Governor before his scheme succeeds. You'll need to step into the shoes of vigilantes, sharpening your slyness and combat skills. With guidance from Zorro's teachings and the secrets he left, you'll fight to continue his legacy of justice.

The Secrets of Zorro is a light strategy game with hidden information, some placement, many cards and combos.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: PNW: Card Games Inspired by the Pacific Northwest
description:
PNW: Card Games Inspired by the Pacific Northwest is a beautifully illustrated book of six modern games for fans of card games, board games, and the Pacific Northwest.

All you need is a deck of cards to hunt with a pod of orcas, forage for tasty mushrooms, brave the swift rivers of the salmon run, and more. Created and illustrated by Pacific Northwest locals as an ode to card games and the beauty of the PNW, these six games are a great way to dive into a world of fast and fun games with a familiar set of components:

Forage
Players: 2-8 — Complexity: 1
Explore a forest and gather baskets of mushrooms faster than your opponents in this set-collection game.
Free official download: https://tomcardgames.itch.io/forage

Trail
Players: 3-4 — Complexity: 2
Pack supplies for your journey, then hike past landmarks in this drafting and resource-management game.

Orca Isles
Players: 3-6 — Complexity: 2
Place orcas from your pod to gather prey, and collect poker hands to hunt at wooded isles in this worker-placement game.

Cabin by the Sea
Players: 1 — Complexity: 3
Build stacks of cards from the sea, the beach, and your supply. Each turn, the sea gives and the sea takes in this solitaire game.

Salmon Run
Players: 2 — Complexity: 4
Brave the chilly waters and predators along the salmon run, acclimating to changing conditions of the sea, the river, and the stream in this deckbuilding game.

Signal Fire
Players: 4 — Complexity: 5
Communicate to your partner with smoke and fire signals, moving around the ridge and valley strategically in this team trick-taking game.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Book, Card Game, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trick-taking, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly: Saint Seiya
description:
Find the Knights of the Zodiac on your Monopoly board. In this special Saint Seiya edition, inspired by the anime, rally as many Knights as possible to Athena's cause. Gain power by crossing the sanctuary to reach the cosmos before the last flame of the clock seals Athena's fate.
Draw Knights and Cosmos cards, develop new techniques through training and meet your favorite Knights.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Incohearent NSFW Expansion Pack
description:
You’ll have to wash out your mouth with soap after this one — it’s the Incohearent NSFW expansion pack! Give game night an extra adult spin with this raunchy new addition to our best-selling guess the gibberish party game, Incohearent. This expansion pack includes 180 dirty phrases to be added to the main game. It takes game night to the next level — just don’t say we didn’t warn you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Halves: NSFW Expansion
description:
The hilariously naughty NSFW expansion which includes such wonders as the "Blow / Job", "Saggy / Balls", and "Dirty / Hole" Halves cards and 4 Exclusive new NSFW Trap cards!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Halves: Punk Expansion
description: The Chaotic PUNK expansion which includes such bangers as the "Stage / Dive", "Mosh / Pit", and "Black / Flag" Halves cards and 4 Exclusive new PUNK Trap cards!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Dragon Quest: The Silver Tarot
description:
Dragon Quest: The Silver Tarot (ドラゴンクエスト 銀のタロット) is a trick-taking card game featuring characters from the NES video game Dragon Quest IV (published as Dragon Warrior IV in North America).

The game is played over five hands (or deals). Players earn points by taking tricks (winning cards) during the hand, but a Silver Tarot Card is drawn at the start of each hand to determine which cards or tricks will count as penalties to avoid. Capturing penalties causes a player to lose points. At the end of five hands, the player with the most points is the winner.

The game is extremely similar to the card game Dragonmaster with minor gameplay differences.

name: Haunted Solitaire
description:
Haunted Solitaire is a solitaire card game played with a standard 52 deck of playing cards. The goal of the game is to obtain all 4 Aces (Relics), and defeat all of the court cards (Ghosts). Cards are drawn and played in an grid (chambers of the mansion). The number cards are used to obtain the Relics and defeat the Ghosts.

The game ends when the draw pile is eliminated or you are unable to continue refilling the chambers. If you are unable to defeat all 12 Ghosts (and optionally up to 2 Jokers: "Jokergeists"), as well as obtain all 4 Relics, you lose and are trapped in the haunted mansion forever.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Intuition Game
description:
Tap your Intuition, Make your guess, and Place your bet. Enjoy the Rewards. Its like roulette, memory and poker had a baby! 35-45 min per game. Ages 9+ and 2 or more players.

Players take turns guessing which card will be revealed from a deck of 19 specialty cards. Excitement builds as players place wagers on various outcomes on a large colorful gameboard.

Through a blend of chance and skill, players who make correct guesses and wagers are greatly rewarded and the player with the most tokens at the end of the game wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Memory, Move Through Deck

name: ムーンストーン邸殺人事件  (Murder mystery Mini: the Moonstone Murder Case)
description:
A guessing contest between four detectives! How will the real mystery end?
The setting is a mansion in the American South in the mid-20th century. One night, four detectives came from England, invited by Sir Moonstone, who loved mysteries.
However, shortly after the banquet, the owner of the mansion, Lord Moonstone, is found dead. Was his death a suicide or killing someone else? If it is the latter, who is the culprit? The detective competition begins now!

Please tag along with “White Raven, Red Die” and enjoy the full-scale mystery by Kyun Yasuda and Megumi Landscape.

name: Rom Com
description:
The game that will "Have you at Hello!"

"Nobody puts baby in a corner" in this game all about your favorite movies: Romantic comedies!

Compete in teams to identify the perfect pairs, romantic one-liners and silver screen hits from your favorite gals' or date night films.

Will you say anything to earn a heart? Be the first team to earn two red foil hearts from each of the three categories to win!

—description from the publisher

name: Evacuation: Italian Edition Promo Card
description:
An Action Card, available in the Italian Edition
Action :
Spend one resource to research a Technology

name: Wedding Countdown
description:
This wedding-themed card game is the perfect gift! Each card represents a step closer to the big day, from Dress Shopping to Cake Tasting. Starting with 9 face down cards, each player replaces one card per turn trying to get sets of same cards next to one another. Each pair is cleared from your score. The lowest total score wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Root Bound
description:
Root Bound is an abstract strategy game played on a hexagonal board with a conceptual theme of two types of plants vying for control of a plant pot.

On a player's turn they place two pieces onto empty spaces on the board, subject to restrictions that prevent the pieces from forming large clumps or blobs, with the goal of cordoning off and scoring territory. Some "roots" may be cut off and die, while others may join together to encroach upon and prevent the opponent's "roots" from claiming territory of their own.

A descendant of the Go family of games, Root Bound draws inspiration from Mark Steere’s Tanbo, Michael Amundsen’s Cavity, and Michael Amundsen and Luis Bolaños Mures’s Lifeline.

—description from the designer

name: Teech for Two
description:
Teech for Two is a climbing/shedding game for exactly two players. It was designed by Larry Levy to meet the need for a two player climbing game when there were none readily available.

The goal of the game is for a player to shed out their entire hand before the other player.

The gameplay is standard climbing play. One player leads with a combination. The other player must follow and play a higher version of the exact same combination.

Teech for Two was inspired by David Parlett's "The Bum Game", which was Parlett's preferred way of playing Daihinmin.

What makes Teech for Two original and exciting is the way that it introduces wilds that are always dealt to each player every hand. With wilds available like this, many more hands are playable and it's always an exciting puzzle to figure out how to best play out a hand.

name: Entombed
description:
The Pyramid is very much alive! But unfortunately for you, so are its Inhabitants. You are Explorers entombed within the pyramid of Pharaoh Pepi l and need to discover your 4 Ankhs to reveal the secret exit in order to escape in this tactical suspenseful game.

The Pyramid Is Alive?
Yes; whilst you primarily control an Explorer, you are also responsible for controlling one of the Inhabitants, who are unhappy about your intrusion, and are trying to convert you into Lost Souls (the reanimated corpses of your fallen expedition team). The pyramid is also alive too and has an ever changing layout, thanks to the Wall Movement Spaces, which allow you to move up to 2 pieces of walls.

How Is It Suspenseful And Tactical?
The Explorer on your right is the only person to actively know where your Ankhs and secret exit are located on the map. You have to find them whilst avoiding the Inhabitants and any Lost Souls patrolling the pyramid. You can actively see where everyone is, meaning you know when you are being hunted down. Will they catch you before you get all your Ankhs and escape? With the wall movement squares, Entombed can be played with many different strategies, and no two games are ever the same. Do you go defensive and help keep your fellow Explorers alive? Possibly compromising your safety, but meaning there are less Lost Souls (and Inhabitants) hunting you down; do you go offensive? and try to open up paths to eliminate your fellow Explorers or do you actively convert yourself into a Lost Soul and try to activate the secondary win condition, where if no Explorer escapes, the Lost Soul(s) responsible for converting the most Explorers is declared the winner. Treading on a Wall Movement Space allows you to move 2 pieces of wall, allowing you to alter the pyramid layout and force your opponents to adjust their strategy.

Balancing Mechanics
Fall 1 Ankh behind and you can skip your turn to activate the Compass, which helps narrow down the exact location within your quarter of the map. Take damage and you can draw a Privilege card, which gives you a temporary advantage. Become a Lost Soul and you are still able to play as your character, albeit with a new win condition.

—description from the designer

name: Siege of Gondor
description:
A wargame from Panzerfaust Magazine #66, 1975 by John Van Devender.
This is the first game based on the Battle of the Pelennor Fieds. Few simple rules with a lot of units.

name: Stalk Exchange
description:
Enter a Growing Market!

Welcome to the Community Hedge Fund where players take on the roles of gardeners dedicated to growing flowers and profits. When the market crashes, the Gardner with the most valuable Stalk portfolio wins.

Garden shrewdly to grow your fortune.


Plant The Seeds of Investment to Grow Your Portfolio
Surround Flowers to Harvest Their Value
Trade Your Stalks at The Exchange to keep up with Trends
Collaborate With Your Opponents to grow shared investments or outmaneuver them and cause their favorite flowers to wither


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Commodity Speculation, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Open Drafting, Stock Holding

name: Raiders of the Lost Ace
description:
Embark on a daring quest to recover the lost Ace of the Covenant, while outwitting ninjas, spies, and Nazis, and putting together clues along the way.

Navigate through the shuffled deck 3 times. If you recover the Ace of Spades during the 3rd round, and collect enough cards in the game (defeated enemies, collected artifacts) you succeed! Otherwise the Ace of the Covenant has fallen into the wrong hands.

Inspired by Solitary Journey.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Jam Tarts
description:
The Queen of Hears wants to make jam tarts. Play cards beneath a row of "berry" cards (clubs). Try to make a suitable set of three to collect the corresponding card. Collect all ten berry cards to win.

—description from the designer

name: Adulthood
description:
Live your best life in Adulthood! Every turn, this game challenges 1-4 players to spend Time and Energy to generate Money, Happiness, and positive Impact. Choose a Career, seek out Experiences, find a Partner, and try to spend time on Wellness while dealing with unexpected Life Events. Featuring the art of Tim Brierly, Adulthood highlights the joys and absurdity of everyday life.

Each turn, players have to choose how to spend their Time, Energy, and Money to maximize their personal Happiness and positive Impact. Spend Time and Energy on your Career to get Money. Seek out Experiences to gain resources and Happiness, spend Time on Health to maximize the benefits of your other efforts, and find a partner to build a relationship with!

Earn your way to the top or make a difference in the lives of others! The game ends when a player's Happiness and Impact tracks meet!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Track Movement, Worker Placement

name: Inventors of the South Tigris: 2024 KS Promo Pack
description:
A set of new tiles for Inventors of the South Tigris, consisting of:


Three research tiles
Two pass tiles
Four workshop tiles
categories: Arabian, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers
publishers: Garphill Games, Mosaico Jogos, Pixie Games

name: FantasyForm: Frozen Over
description:
A heavy blizzard sits above Outland. Sudden snows and cruel winds change the landscape in the blink of an eye. Along with the cold comes new alchemical opportunities to explore.

Frozen Over is a 6-card expansion for FantasyForm. Each multi-use card, like those found in the base game, adds multiple elements to the game. Master the new Ice Form, wear the Cloak of Fog, hire a Scout to help you navigate, and more. Some of the new Encounters also allow for limited manipulation of the Ethereal Row, giving players an additional factor to consider as they race to defeat their Rival!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
description: A cooperative trivia game based on the UK's game show by the same name. Over a series of questions players try to guess the correct answers which are always numbers. Guess a number higher than the correct one and you are out of the game, guess too low and you're out of lives.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Questions and Answers, Track Movement

name: Dream Order
description:
Professional Baseball Card Game DREAM ORDER is a one-on-one competitive trading card game with a baseball theme!
Become a manager, appoint players, play against each other with your own "Dream Order", and enjoy collecting cards of your favorite players!
The center of the game is the battle between the pitcher and batter!
Predict your opponent's actions and win the game!
Players gather their favorite players to form a "dream order" and play a game.
Become a manager, appoint players, decide the batting order, and win with your own "Dream Order"!

—description from the publisher (translated)

「プロ野球カードゲーム DREAM ORDER」は、野球をテーマにした1対1の対戦型トレーディングカードゲーム！
監督となって選手を起用し、自分だけの「ドリームオーダー」で対戦したり、好きな選手のカードをコレクションしたりして楽しもう！
ゲームの中心は投手（ピッチャー）と打者（バッター）の勝負！
相手の行動を予測して、ゲームに勝利しよう！
プレイヤーは好きな選手を集めて「ドリームオーダー」を組んでゲーム（試合）を行います。
監督となって選手を起用し、打順を決めて、自分だけの「ドリームオーダー」で勝利をつかもう！

—description from the publisher

name: Cook King: Avocado Expansion
description: Put avocado on every dish to earn extra points.

name: Marble Garble
description:
Roll the colorful marbles as you magically lift them onto the playing board!

The active player chooses a challenge card from Level 1-3, flips it and places the marbles and the magnets according to the challenge card.

Use dexterity, focus and wits to tilt the board and succeed the challenge card. The 3 progressive levels and 4 types of challenges will keep your family and friends challenged and asking for more! Whether you play Marble Garble alone or frantically compete with others, action-filled fun is assured.

—description from the publisher

name: Starship Interstellar: Halley's Comet
description:
Players will be able to travel towards Halley’s Comet, with its own board with several regions to land on, waiting to be mined. The Comet will increase its resources when orbiting near planets, and the more the game advances, the more Halley’s core will heat releasing more and more precious resources.

In Starship Interstellar each player takes the role of a powerful corporation, and all of them are “cooperating” to save humanity from the disaster they themselves caused: they have to build the Starship Interstellar, hibernate in it the more people they can, and find a route to an inhabitable planet.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move

name: Prudh: The Gentlemen's Game
description:
Prudh (“Prew”) is a classic-style abstract game. It uses a 6x6 two-color board and 36 identical pieces. The color of each space determines who controls each piece. Players take turns consolidating their power and attacking their opponents’ spaces. The goal is to score the most points without running out of moves.

Prudh is a derivation of “Prudhomme,” meaning a wise, honest, or sensible man. The game has many variations and is known by many names in the Vinlant universe, but we think we’ve settled on the rules we like best.

—description from the publisher

name: Super Battle Mon
description:
Super Battle Mon is a TCG inspired game, no table needed. It is for 1 to 4 players where players battle using just 7 card decks with battles that last just 2 minutes.

Your goal in each battle is to play more of your Mons than your opponents. Use your Mons' abilities and strength to gain the advantage and take-home victory!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Jungle Party
description:
The Jungle is about to get wild with Leafy Lanterns, Furry Flutes, Coconut Coolers, Forest Fries, and more! Collect as many party cards as you can - the fancier your party, the more likely you are to charm the animal guests to attend! Plan, strategize, and compete - the host with the most (points) wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Get the jungle animals to attend your party rather than other players' parties. Each animal card is worth 2 to 7 points, depending on the combination of party cards needed to claim that animal. Squirrel DJ figures can be claimed with a set of 4 party cards that are all the same type.

Players can conduct up to 3 actions per turn, with the goal of putting more party cards into play. Party cards function as resources to match the combo specified on an animal card. This mechanism is reminiscent of Splendor and Happy City's bonus cards. In this deck 29 of 100 cards are played for special actions, which often let the player take cards from other player(s), add points directly to their party, designate someone to lose a turn, etc.

A simple filler that incorporates play mechanisms like resource set collection and card/action combos.

—user summary

name: Blik op de Nederlandse taal spel
description:
This trivia game contains 108 double-sided cards, 36 letter tiles, a notepad, a pencil, a standard D6 die and the rules, all neatly packed in a tin box.

The cards have trivia questions in four different categories:

Spelling a word
Guessing a word based on a cryptic description
Giving a synonym of a word
Giving the meaning of a word (multiple-choice).


A throw of the die decide which one you have to answer correctly to gain a tile. The tiles can be placed on the table to form words (Scrabble meets Rummikub) to gain points.

The player with most points at the end of the game (after the pool with tiles has been emptied and after subtractions for leftover tiles) wins the game.
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: Ten Dollar Words
description:
Ten Dollar Words is the auction word game where you use letters to make words to bid on letters to make more words, sometimes with the same letters! On your go, you’ll put up one of four lots for auction. Each player uses their letter tiles to make a word. Each tile has a Live side – with a dollar value – and a Dead side – without, and this determines the value of their bid. When you win an auction, any Live letters you used are flipped to their Dead side but remain in your available pool, to which you add the letters just won: you’ll always have access to them but they won’t contribute to the bid total. At the end of the game, everyone uses the letters they’ve accumulated to make one last word, and the most valuable word wins the game.

The value of a lot depends on the letters in it and their utility in making new words, but also on which of those letters entered the game Live or Dead, which letters you’re willing to flip to gain them, and how all those factors relate to the other players and their pool of letters. Tricky letters like Q and Z will double the value of your bid, while the dreaded S will subtract from your bid total – do you use it now so you can flip it to its Dead side, so it can be used without penalty in a later auction?

It's an auction game where you’re spending your resources but they’re still available, where you must spend money to make money but it’s not a matter of how much money you have at the end – you might have $20 worth of letters but if you can’t find a way to make them all fit into a word, they’re going to be worthless.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Once Around, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Spelling

name: Ether Glider
description:
Players become space merchants called 'Ether Gliders' and earn money by transporting cargo and passengers from star to star.
The player who acquires the most assets by investing that money, strengthening spaceships, and building facilities wins.

A vast map that is randomly generated for each game. Replayability is perfect with 16 types of unique abilities for unique supporters. Artwork and rich flavor text add to the space opera atmosphere. In addition, a gorgeous map is completed for each game, and products are lined up on individual boards.

Complete with solid solo play rules. This is a game that can be enjoyed by one person or multiple people.

name: Sudoku Master
description:
Who is the Master of Sudoku? 2 to 4 players can compete for this title. Of course there are puzzles for adults (100 pieces) on 9x9 fields. But children have also been thought of; they play on 6x6 fields on the back of the game board (50 puzzles). After a puzzle has been chosen, you place the starting lineup with the corresponding chips on the game board. From now on you reveal chips and try to fit them into the game board. There must be no contradiction to the Sudoku rules; i.e. no number appears twice in a row, column or square. But you can't ponder endlessly, the hourglass runs relentlessly.

When placing the chips, make sure that the marking is facing you. This is the only way to determine at the end who placed which chips. Naturally, the chips are not very clear in up to 5 orientations; it is best to look at the colors instead of the numbers.

There is a reward for whoever was able to place the most valuable chips in a complete (!) row/column/square. That's exactly the crux of the matter: Due to the placement rules, a complete Sudoku can never be created, and complete rows/columns/squares are also the exception. I advocate for the highest sum in an area, regardless of whether it is ultimately completed or not.

Alternatively, you can also play solo with Sudoku Master, but this is often difficult due to the lack of note-taking options.

Furthermore, two variants have been included that turn Sudoku into a game of chance: One is Sudoku-Lucky Number, the other is Sudoku-Dragon. In Sudoku-Lucky Number, all the number chips are distributed on the game board and you turn one chip over. If he doesn't contradict any Sudoku rules, he can stay put. However, if there is a contradiction, you have to accept it. In the end, whoever's chips have the lowest total wins. A similar process can be found in Challenge Sudoku, but it is solved better there: chips that have already been taken can be installed later in appropriate places. This means that some of the luck is lost, as anyone who uncovers more high numbers (and has to take them) has no chance of winning in Sudoku Master.

Sudoku Dragon is the worst thing I've ever encountered: you choose a puzzle and give it a clue. Again you have time until the hourglass runs through once. During this time you reveal chips that you must immediately put on the game board. For every chip already lying on a vertically, horizontally or diagonally adjacent field there is a winning chip - so up to 8 pieces at once. It's no surprise that the 27 chips are quickly gone. From this point on you take chips away from your opponents. Counting the chips takes up most of the time and doesn't allow the game to flow.

—user summary

name: La Balsa
description: Two groups of exhausted castaways crawl on a precarious raft or hang from its edges, trying to survive. There is no place for everyone, so they will have to fight to keep La Balsa.

name: Delicatessen
description:
It rotted and now you have to decide who is going to cook, or worse, who does the dishes. This is a game that will solve a couple of problems for you. Yes, a trivia game to have fun, learn and that also solves questions between your family, group of friends or people you are going to eat with.

Delicatessen is a board game with cards that is especially useful for having fun talking and laughing, with themes and questions about cooking, all in one.

With this game you bring together a group of people who want to have fun, learn or simply decide issues related to cooking, such as who is going to cook today.

This is not a classic board game with questions and answers. This is a game in which all the questions are linked to cooking. What better plan for a rainy afternoon than a cooking board game? There is no, there is no better plan. With this trivia game you will create fun memories and spend unforgettable moments, with guaranteed laughter with your friends, or family.

name: '85 Afghanistan: Graveyard of Empires – Alone In The Mountains
description:
Alone in the Mountains is a solitaire expansion for '85 Graveyard of Empires. Utilizing an updated version of the same solitaire system used in Night of Man and '65 Squad Battles in the Jungle of Vietnam, Alone in the Mountains is a boxed game that comes complete with a full sheet of counters, a new map, rules, solitaire action cards, a Player Aid Card and 6 new solitaire scenarios for playing Graveyard of Empires solitaire.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Chroni: La Bible
description:
Play at reconstructing the chronological timeline of events and put history in order! From the creation of the world to the last judgment, find 60 biblical events from the Old and New Testament. Chronicle - The Bible is a learning game in which we have fun memorizing the chronology of events gradually and durably. Ideal for the curious who want to discover or rediscover the Bible while having fun.

—description from the publisher

name: Я где-то это видел (I saw this somewhere)
description:
This is a word explanation game. In it, you will have to draw a card and explain the word or picture using words, gestures or pictures. Other players must find this item on cards in their hands.

Внутри этой игры вас ждёт шесть картин, на которых художники спрятали самые разные слова. Их вам и предстоит объяснить. Здесь нужно не просто отгадывать, а ещё искать на поле и хватать игрушку-сквиш. Чего же вы ждёте? Скорее собирайте друзей, раздавайте поля, объясняйте слова разными способами, ищите их на картинках и побеждайте!
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Zbieramy grzyby
description:
Players start the game from the corners of the board.
Players take turns rolling the dice and moving around the board in any direction. When a player stands on a space with a mushroom marker, he removes the marker from the board and draws a mushroom card. If the mushroom is edible, its card is kept. If the mushroom is poisonous, the card is discarded. In addition to the description, the mushroom cards contain the number of kilograms that have been collected. The person who collected the most kilograms of edible mushrooms wins the game.

—user summary

name: HUTAN
description:
Step into a world of wonder and natural splendor with HUTAN, an immersive family game inspired by the Indonesian word for rainforest.

In HUTAN, all players have their own rainforest patch where they will plant sprouts and flowers that over time grow into towering trees. When a habitat is created, an iconic forest animal arrives - the orangutan, the sumatran tiger, the rhinoceros hornbill, the cassowary or the sumatran rhino.

HUTAN plays over 9 rounds - and all players will have two turns each round. On your turn you take a flower card from the shared market pool and place the flowers into your rainforest. If you place a flower on top of a matching flower, you grow a tree. When an area is completed with trees, the last tree is replaced by an animal.

At the end of the game, the player who grew the best rainforest and attracted the most animals will score the most points and win.

—description from the publisher

name: Doctor Esker's Notebook IV: The Moroccan Affair
description:
The fourth game in the Doctor Esker's Notebook puzzle card game series, this decks pages come from Doctor Esker's long-time friend and companion, Abellona. Having led Dr. Esker to Morocco in previous games, she leaves behind only a mysterious book full of puzzles written in her own hand. Nobody has cracked her cryptic codes yet. Are you up to the challenge?

The game provides a deck of 82 cards which contain ten devious puzzles to solve. You can play through the puzzles solo or together with family and friends. Great for a party, a game night, or a lazy afternoon.

Each puzzle is composed of a set of cards. You can solve the puzzle by reading, comparing, arranging and pondering the messages, drawings, and artwork on the cards. Solving the puzzle reveals a sequence of numbers. When you think you’ve got it, gather the solution cards corresponding to the number sequence and flip them. If you see a message or image, you’ve solved the puzzle. Persevere to the end and uncover Abellona's mysterious discovery.

name: Cross Lords
description:
This game is a card game for 1 or 2 players launched by the famous Japanese game publisher DOMINA GAMES. Players will transform into powerful witches and engage in astrological duels with their opponents. This game is a spin-off of the "Blade Rondo" series. Players will play the game from the perspective of Veronica and other witches. Win the grand astrological ceremony and realize your wishes.
In this game, players can use a combination of card with a total number of 10 to generate a star dust, use a star dust to attack, use 3 star dusts to sublimate cards and use sublimated cards. The player who makes the opponent's life point from 20 to 0 will win the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Edition speciale
description:
Paris Match is a weekly magazine, the French equivalent of the American magazine "Life". The “Special Edition” game was designed by the editorial staff of “Paris Match”. The game mechanism is inspired by Trivial Pursuit. We move pawns on a board, we draw a card from the theme corresponding to the square, and we must answer the ten questions asked.
The six themes are:
Science, technology and health (green);
Fashion and Lifestyles (Turquoise);
Politics and political events (blue);
Culture and entertainment (purple);
Sports and adventures (red);
Miscellaneous news and love stories (yellow).
The period of events goes from 1949 until the end of the eighties.
Each time a player answers a question correctly, he earn a token in the color of the theme. On the other hand, if he is wrong, it is up to his neighbor on the left to answer, and so on until the list of ten questions on the card is exhausted. When a player manages to accumulate 10 tokens, he wins a crown of the same color, which he stacks on his pawn. The winner is the one who first get the six crowns.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Copper Trickster
description:
In Ancient Mesopotamia, no other copper merchant was more feared than the great Ea-Nasir… This is what we believe, at least.
Protagonist of the oldest customer complaining ever found, with complaints eternalized on clay tablets made circa 1750 BCE, Ea-Nasir’s skills of selling really bad copper and kicking out any messengers sent to him weren’t, to our relief, lost in time.

CharLatão is a Competitive Trick Taking Game where each player has a character with some knowledge about the quality of the copper they are disputing.

Your goal is to make the most points each round, acquiring good and great quality copper and avoiding bad quality copper.


In every round, you play multiple tricks, contesting or avoiding winning according to your knowledge about the copper’s quality.
The players have limited knowledge about the copper quality that is given to them based on their character.
Play you cards strategically, planning when you should or shouldn’t win tricks
The game ends when every player has been Ea-Nasir once. The player with the most points is the winner.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Trick-taking

name: Turbo Barbarossa
description:
This is a VERY fast, simple, playable - abstracted - Barbarossa areas game using a very abstract roster of units - infantry vs. armor - in 8 Jun41-Jan42 monthly turns.
10 German 2-dice panzer korps, 24 1-die infantrie korps, 3 1-die Romanian armies and other Axis allies group vs. 12 1-or-2-factor Russian tank korps and 24 1-factor armies. No Finns.
3 battle rounds per battle and depending on the weather with leftover battle rounds, armor can advance farther and possibly attack for for one more round.
No movement factors - terrain difficulty is simulated by just more areas in those regions - and fortress( citi)es are the only terrain affecting combat (other than a 2-unit limit attacking across the Narva River when it is unfrozen.
Airpower not specified - assumed to be implicit in the stronger armor units, although each group of 3 UnDisrupted German infantry korps get an "army"/artillery bonus shot/die on both attack and defense
.And as in many of my games, Germans have a Disruption(-recovery), qualitative advantage.
Hidden Russian units are an option to bedevil the Axis player. Strong, "Historical," or Weak armor arrays can have the Axis player intimidated by weak Russian tank units or reckless at the mercy of un-revealed strong Russian tank korps.

Although areas are just disguised point-to-points, the implications of their configuration can be far easier to overlook and downright sneaky, I've been reminded.
Estimated 90-120 minutes to play.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Moving Multiple Units, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up

name: Pataquada
description:
Pataquada is a fast-paced card game by Airton Braga, in which the players are the leaders of a group of ducks at migration time, trying to get the best positions with each new flight.

Each player has a set of ducks from the same team, with values from 1 to 9 and each with a different special action.
With each new round, a migration leader card is opened on the table, each with a special power that alters one of the basic rules of the game.
Over the course of three turns, the players will choose 3 of their ducks to place in the flight pattern, according to their numerical order. On the fourth turn, each player chooses another of their duck cards, but it will not be added to the flight pattern, only using its special power, which will try to alter the flight pattern in their favor.
If two or more players choose the same card in this phase, none of them take place.
After the flight pattern is complete, points are awarded for the positioning of the ducks that managed to avoid being in the same position as others and that managed to use the bird vacuum further ahead.
The cards furthest from the flight pattern leave the game completely and a new round begins, with some players having fewer cards due to the discarded cards.
At the end of 3 flights, the player with the most points wins.

name: Alea Elementis
description:
A simple push-your-luck game for 2-6 players featuring dice with uneven value distributions.

If you roll two different non-number symbols you bust, otherwise you get to keep going.

First to 150 points wins.

name: Cavy 'n' Cavy
description:
The cavy cards, which are turned face down, are flipped over and added to reach a target number that gets larger and larger as the game progresses. Depending on the special card, the number can be doubled, or it can be a one-shot failure.
Even if you are not very good at memory, you can enjoy the game by sharing roles in the cooperative mode and devising strategies in the competitive mode!

—description from the designer

name: Munchkin Big Box
description:
Munchkin is a satirical card game based on the clichés and oddities of Dungeons & Dragons and other role-playing games. Each player starts at level 1 and the winner is the first player to reach level 10. Players can acquire familiar D&D style character classes during the game which determine to some extent the cards they can play.

There are two types of cards: treasure and encounters. Each turn the current players "kicks down the door", drawing an encounter card from the deck. Usually this will involve battling a monster. Monsters have their own levels, and players must try to overcome it using the levels, weapons, and powers they have acquired during the game — or run away. Other players can chose to help the player or hinder by adding extra monsters to the encounter. Defeating a monster will usually result in drawing treasure cards and acquiring levels. Being defeated by a monster results in "bad stuff" which usually involves losing levels and treasure.

Munchkin Big Box contains the Munchkin base game, six expansions that were previously released on their own, and fifty new cards — more than 650 in all. Also included are a game board, a side board, standees, Kill-O-Meters, dice, other components required for play, and some stuff that's just for looks.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: No Pair
description:
No Pair is a small push-your-luck dice game designed to fit entirely on one side of a business card.

The rules are simple: roll three dice up to three times and observe the result.
If the result contains a pair, it's worth 0 points.
If the result is a straight, add the dice together.
If the result is a triplet, add the dice together and double the result.
Otherwise score the lowest die.

First player to reach 60 points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Bamse: Lek med alfabet
description: Swedish children game with two games in one. Bokstavsgömme is about placing tiles with letters on a board to get a card.First to get 8 card and one with at least one of each character wins. Ordstafetten is about finding tiles to spell a name on a card. First to solve 4 card win. Can be played on different difficulties. Everything is done with characters from Bamse

name: Master Yacht
description:
Master Yacht is played with one common roll for all players. Each player has his own set of five differently colored dice and a holder. Players are awarded a bonus for scoring early in the round.

Game uses dice of five different colors and a score pad. The score pad is used to keep track of the various combinations in which the five dice may fall and assign a value to a particular combination. The goal is to score the highest number of points by filling in category boxes with the highest point value possible (similar to yahtzee).

One player rolls the five larger common dice. The results are used by all players at the same time. There are 3 common rolls per turn. Roll the dice. Players choose which dice from the common roll will be used to build scores. Players must use the same color die and match the number to the common die of the same color. Any chosen dice are added to the player's holder. This process is completed 3 times. Between rolls, players may remove any desired dice from the holder for use in subsequent rolls. Dice already in the holder may not be replaced with a different match on the same turn as the common dice are rolled.
Once all categories have been completed, the game ends and scores are calculated.

name: Chatons & Dragons: Le Choukra
description:
Chatons & Dragons is a comic combined with a game, the first title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the tiny hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. Gameplay consists in following the comic's panels and making choices about where to go and what to do.

Stories are specifically designed for children with simplified adventures compared to the collection of "comics in which you are the hero".

In this story, young readers will assist Mo, the King's youngest kitten as he hunts for a dragon named Choukra and proves his bravery! Sneak through the woods, into dark caves, past the King’s guard while solving puzzles as you go in search of adventure and the Choukra along with Mo! Help Mo to overcome his fears as he learns the truth about the dreaded Choukra, proving to everyone just how brave he is.
categories: Book, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Discipline 〜ジェレミア魔法学校の崩壊〜
description:
The story of Discipline: The Fall of Jeremiah School of Magic begins when the school appoints a new president. With the students you train over the next three years, you must overcome the biggest crisis since the school's founding.

This expansion to Discipline: 3 Years at Jeremiah School of Magic includes 4 new students with unique abilities to add to your classes, and each teacher may now designate one student as their disciple. Instead of the graduation exam from the base game, the game now ends with everyone working together to survive four escalating trials and save the school from complete disaster.

The expansion also includes a scenario book depicting events for each class leading up to the final trial and its aftermath. This book was designed with solo play in mind, but it may also be used with more players. With the scenario book, you'll experience a stronger sense of the world of Jeremiah Magic of School.

name: Rompecorazones
description:
Original and fun game that will test the degree of knowledge and complicity that exists in your relationship and that of your friends. If you win, you are the ideal couple, if you lose you will have had a good time. The two of you answer a question determined by the dice and if you fail you will advance one square on the board. The goal is not to move forward. What we guarantee you is a time of fun.
To find out what type of question you have to answer, each pair will roll the dice. The game contains pencils and paper to write down the answers within a time that will mark the hourglass. The pawns are heart-shaped, and each pair must choose a different one. If you win, you are the ideal couple, if you lose you will have had a good time. Contains 386 question cards. Recommended for +18 years.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Original y divertido juego que pondrá a prueba el grado de conocimiento y complicidad que existe en vuestra relación y en la de vuestros amigos. Si ganáis, sois la pareja ideal, si perdéis habréis pasado un buen rato. Responded los 2 a una pregunta determinada por el dado y si falláis avanzaréis una casilla del tablero. El objetivo es no avanzar. Lo que os garantizamos es un rato de diversión.
Para saber qué tipo de pregunta te toca responder cada pareja tirará el dado. El juego contiene lápices y papel para anotar las respuestas dentro de un tiempo que marcará el reloj de arena. Los peones tienen forma de corazón, y cada pareja deberá elegir uno diferente. Si ganáis, sois la pareja ideal, si perdéis habréis pasado un buen rato. Contiene 386 tarjetas de preguntas. Recomendado para +18 años.

—description from the publisher

name: Legends of Boxing 2
description:
LOB2 is a solitaire-oriented boxing simulation using dice and charts. It is an evolution of the 20-year old Legends of Boxing with new development inspired by other Stone Mountain Press games, such as Stone Cold Hockey and Dice United 2nd Edition.

LOB2 has also been balanced based on data from LOB for Windows. More depth has been achieved with the new High Action chart, which activates certain ratings in interesting ways, bringing more twists and turns to the action. Game play has been streamlined. Twenty heavyweights have revised ratings, including new versions of Ali in the 70s, and Foreman in the 90s. Fighters are now presented in a quality, magazine-style catalogue, including a section describing why the fighter is rated a certain way in the context of the game.

NOTE: LOB2 is completely backwards compatible with 1st Edition fighter cards, with the exception of three fighters who have Mode Cost Traits (Locche, Padilla, and Hamed).

—description from the designer

name: A Wayfarer's Tale: The Journey Begins – The Lonely Isle
description:
A Wayfarer's Tale: The Journey Begins is a 1-4 player game of adventure and discovery. Players navigate their own individual maps, collecting treasure and avoiding monsters as they explore new locations. Turns are taken simultaneously as players chart their own course over 45-60 mins, racing to discover new worlds.

Experience The Lonely Isle for FREE! As an introduction to A Wayfarer's Tale, this lite version available for download. This game offers an opportunity to grasp the basics of movement and scoring, serving as a gateway into the core mechanics. The whole game fits on a single A4- or letter-sized page.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pericle: Labyrinth
description:
Pericle: Labyrinth is the second release from Long Dog games. Pericle is a bold new tabletop RPG that combines a fantasy RPG world with a ground-breaking app called Loremaster. App-driven gameplay presents the campaign, which takes away the need for a Game Master. Loremaster sets the scene with music and context, and indicates how to set up the tabletop when combat is inevitable.

In the second Pericle product but the first of its kind, embark on a perilous journey into the legendary Labyrinth of Porta, where daring adventurers face the ultimate test: a rite of passage by choice, not chance. This contained tabletop RPG plays like a board game with physical maps and dice, assisted by our Loremaster app, which acts as the game master. You and your band of heroes must navigate a gauntlet of cunning traps and monstrous denizens. Amidst the dangers lies the promise of untold wealth, a tantalizing reward to beckon adventurers.

Each journey through the Labyrinth is a uniquely generated adventure consisting of 5 encounters, ensuring endless replayability. Conquer each encounter to earn XP, loot, and prestige, empowering your heroes for future challenges. The Labyrinth utilizes the core Pericle rules and game mechanics found in Pericle: Gathering Darkness, creating a familiar yet thrilling experience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps

name: Yokai Bakasuka
description:
You become the master of an army of monsters living in the night world. Gather more subordinates than other parade, prove your strength, and become the "King of Monsters"!

"Yokai Bakasaka" is a card game in which players play against each other. Players take their turns and play their "Yokai cards" into their own parade and potentially summon "Yokai General cards" for big effect. When the "Yokai General card deck" or the "Yokai deck" runs out, the player with the most cards in his parade wins!
mechanics: Action/Event, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Building, Take That

name: サトリ (Satori)
description:
Will you become an enlightened person by trying to become enlightened? Or can we live a life without enlightenment?

Satori is a trick-taking game with must-follow, 4 suits ranked 1 to 12 (2 other special cards), and fixed trump cards. The main feature of this game is that you cannot lead with a fixed trump card (enlightenment suit). So, what happens if your hand only contains cards of the Enlightenment suit? You will become enlightened and liberated from the game and the scoring system of the game differs depending on whether you have achieved enlightenment or not.

name: Refidima
description:
Refidima is a fantasy-themed dice game based on the Korean online game Lineage. You can summon monsters to battle or obtain equipment through village events.
You can earn victory points by winning battles with monsters or occupying castles, and you can also attack and steal other players' castles.
A simple dice game where you win by scoring 10 victory points.

name: 우리사이느은 (Between uuus)
description:
A game where you are divided into two teams and try to connect or hinder the love between two people.
It was created based on the theme of the Korean webtoon of the same name.
You use one of the four ability cards in your hand and replenish one.
If one person collects a set until the cards run out, they win.

name: Patinhos de Bo'Racha
description:
In Patinhos de Bo’Racha (loosely translating to Rubber Duck Races) competitors score points with their trio of rubber ducks by moving them as far down the water slide as possible. But all the ducks in the race are identical, so it doesn’t take long to lose track of whose are whose when they start bumping and jumping each other! If you don’t take time during the race to discover where your rubber ducks are, you’ll probably end up helping your opponents by moving theirs!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Map Addition, Memory, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Race, Slide/Push, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Wild Wild Pattern
description:
In Wild Wild Pattern, you race to create a pattern in the wheel of cards before you. Do so first, and you claim one or more of those cards that will later cash in at the bank. However, if you make the right pattern, you can win the game instantly!

To set up, lay out a wheel of eight cards, then place the deck in the center of this wheel. As on a clock, a card to the right of another card is considered to be "after" that card, and a card to the left is "before". Each card features one of eight objects, one of five colors, and one of two suits.

On a turn, everyone draws a card from the deck and looks at it simultaneously. Whoever thinks that they can create a new pattern plays their card on top of another in the wheel, then identifies their pattern, such as after every red card is a gun or before every dynamite is a bullet. A pattern must include an object, and it can occur one or more times.

If a pattern is true for all instances — for example, a gun is indeed present after every red card — then the pattern creator claims one or two cards from the wheel depending on whether the pattern includes a color or a suit. If the pattern relates to all eight cards, the player wins instantly. (If the pattern is invalid, then everyone else claims a card from the wheel.)

Refill the wheel, then continue taking turns until someone has claimed at least five cards, at which time everyone cashes in their cards at the bank, earning from 20 cents to $3. If someone has exactly five different colors or exactly five of the same object, they win instantly. Otherwise, if someone has a total of at least $3, they win. If no one has this much money, play another round.

Alternatively, you can play the whoever has the least money at the end of a round is eliminated. Keep playing rounds until one player remains.

name: Junk Forts
description:
In Junk Forts, you play as kids competing to build the best fort in the junkyard. Assemble your team, trawl for treasures and defend your fort! Junk Forts is a card-drafting game for 2-5 players. Draft cards from around the Junk Heap to build your walls, fill your stash and capture flags. Get your crew together to earn bonus points, and trade in your treasured bottle caps to get the pick of the Heap!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: The High Druid
description:
The High Druid is a political game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game. Players take turns either committing a vote (a disc) to one of the seven colleges, or permanently shifting the border between two colleges by one seat. Once everyone has passed, dropping out of the game, the player with plurality in each college wins all the valid votes therein. Tied players in a college cancel each other, so in a three-player game, a 50-50 split would give the college to the third player, even if she had no votes there. Additionally, each player has a secret color to which they can play invalid votes, which will be removed before tabulation of the college. This also means that those votes are not awarded to the winner of that college. Finally, each player has a secret "fetish stone" in the inner ring. If you win the college containing your fetish stone, you win two bonus votes. The player with the plurality in final votes wins - respecting the same unforgiving rule for ties as is used for the colleges!

The High Druid is an official game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game.

name: Garbage Day: "Shut the Door!" Promo
description:
Promo card given out during the Kickstarter for the Dice Tower.

If another player plays a Mischief card in your room, flip this card. They must play the Mischief card into a different players' room. (you may not use this card's ability again once it is flipped. If there is no other player to choose they must play another card.)
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel – Sonderkarte 2007 – Arnd, der findige Knappe
description:
This is a special card for the Siedler von Catan card game distributed in special fairs usually by mr. Klaus Teuber itself.
The card name is "Arnd, der findige Knappe" what means "Arnd, the resourceful Squire" and is a special thanks to Arnd Beenen, senior producer of Catan GmbH.
The card text says: "Place a Knight over this card. Those two cards together are now a unit protect from the effects of 'Imelda', 'Bürgerkrieg' and 'Bestechung'. If the knight is removed, Arnd goes to the discard pile."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Nordguard: The Card Game
description:
From publisher's website:
Gather some friends to play as an anthropomorphized sled dog rescue team, overcoming cannibalistic strays and a landscape as capricious as it is lethal. Only your wits and your gear stand between you and certain disaster. Quick-reference instructions provide the rules in minutes, while a scalable difficulty curve provides a challenge for everyone from pups to even the most veteran sled dogs. A randomized map ensures no two missions will ever be the same.

Based on the award-winning graphic novel Nordguard: Across Thin Ice, this set comes packed with over 120 illustrations by the artists Tess Garman & Teagan Gavet, as well as four custom-etched dice.

Each game starts by shuffling a deck of Location cards and laying them out to form a different map for each play through. The team then studies this map while selecting their Character and Item cards. Each character has unique skills and abilities to give the team an edge in various areas. Various Item cards equip the team against the dangers of the landscape and its inhabitants.
