The team travels in a group and must make it from their start point at Frontier to the Destination card within a limited number of turns. Each turn, the team draws an Event card — which may help or hinder them. Your team wins or loses depending on whether you all reach the destination in time.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Exploration

name: Ave
description:
In Ave (Ah-Vay), each player represents a powerful Roman General, Senator, Noble, or Priestess battling for favor in the Emperor's court. Using deceit, backstabbing, diplomacy, or simple violence, rise to the top and annihilate your rivals.

Ave is a fast-paced competitive card game for 2-4 players.

Ave is a great game for the casual or hardcore gamer, as it's simple mechanics are complimented by a huge variety of card effects that change the game in an incredibly fluid way. Actions are played, countered, and diverted, secret cards are revealed and plans are hatched.

Combined with 8 unique character cards that give players special abilities and alternate paths to victory, and you've got a game that never plays the same way twice. This is a competitive card game in a single box!
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Scrabble: 2007 Boston Red Sox Worlds Series Championship Edition
description:
From the box: "Can you spell SWEEP? How about WORLD SERIES CHAMPIONS? America's Favorite Word Game meets New England's most celebrated sports franchise in the 2007 Boston Red Sox World Series Championship Edition of SCRABBLE. It's the same classic SCRABBLE played on a baseball diamond featuring great commemorative 2007 World Series images and stats. Baseball shaped letter tiles, some ultra fun rules and a special Red Sox World Series bonus dictionary is sure to be a grand slam!"

One of several Major League Baseball editions of Scrabble licensed and published by Sababa Toys. The most significant difference in this game is the way the board is laid out to resemble a baseball diamond, meaning the location of bonus squares is significantly different from classic Scrabble.

name: Micro Mutants: Invasion
description:
From x-bugs.it:

The first expansion for Micro Mutants, the game that brought to the forefront the classic tiddlywinks game in a completely new variant, presenting funny armies of bugs with different peculiarities and special powers, is on the way.

The expansion Micro Mutants: Invasion will feature the Samuracnids, fierce bug warriors from the Rising Sun, and the Xenomantides, charming amazons from the deep space.

name: Songs of Artha
description:
On the northern border of Elsemore, where the High Road becomes but a path and disappears into the nightly thicket of the Blackwood Forest stands an inn the walls of which remember a time of Heroes now long gone. And as the days grow short short and grim, as the cold shadows of the North lengthen once again, songs of great deeds are sang in the golden glow of an age-old hearth. Tales of woe and glory, of hope and despair await those who turn their ear to the Songs of Artha.

Songs of Artha is a solitaire/cooperative fantasy adventure card game that pits legendary Heroes against monsters and perils of the dark fantasy world of Artha. Introducing a deckbuilding-inspired deck management mechanism, diverse enemies and randomized adventures, Songs of Artha is a game for fans of exciting fantasy adventures, as well as for gamers who enjoy involved card play and in-game deck manipulation.

Live the story of every Hero alone – or combine Hero Core Sets to play with your friends - and write a saga the world of Artha will never forget.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: CATAN: Soccer Fever Scenario
description:
Soccer fever has gripped the island of Catan. You and your fellow Catanians are swept up in supporting your hometown teams. Will they win the most matches and finish the season with the championship cup?

CATAN: Soccer Fever is a lighthearted and simple scenario for the CATAN base game that's perfect for soccer and football fans everywhere. Every time you build a settlement or city, it's match day on the island of Catan. Winning soccer matches provides you with benefits, and the team that leads the league standings gets extra victory points.

Holding a soccer match in CATAN: Soccer Fever is ridiculously fun yet simple! Assemble the packaging folio into a soccer pitch and flick your soccer ball at the goalie! If it lands color side up, it's a GOOOOAAAAL! Score the most goals to win the match.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Flicking, Hexagon Grid, Trading

name: Tyrannosaurus Wrecks
description:
Tyrannosaurus Wrecks is a boardgame of dinosaur-hunting / time-traveling excitement for 2 to 4 players (also playable solitaire). This game comes with a full-color board and cut-apart counters, but bring your own six-sided dice!

Now let's rumble with the reptiles!!
categories: Animals, Book, Fighting, Prehistoric, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: 할리갈리 딜럭스 (Halli Galli Deluxe)
description:
할리갈리 딜럭스 (Halli Galli Deluxe) is identical to Hali Gali, rule wise. This means you still Flip cards to reveal fruits, and when you spot five of a kind, ring the bell first to win.

However, 할리갈리 딜럭스 contains 75 fruit cards so you can play with up to 7 players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Socken Pfeffern
description: Socken Pfeffern, a.k.a. Flying Socks, is a new indoor and outdoor trend activity. Players of all ages send socks with custom-made designs flying in a fun competition to hit the washer in as few attempts as possible. There is virtually no limit to where and how the game can be played. The washer is made from durable metal, the socks are washable, and the bean bags inside the sox are filled with high-quality pellets. Basic rules are provided but individual rules can and should be made up on the fly.

name: Way 2 Go
description:
Way 2 Go is a sensory deprivation party game for a team of 2-7 players (or two teams of up to seven players each) that promotes team play and trust, along with a lot of laughs.

The object of the game is to draw a line within a confined space from start to finish. This would be easy — except that the person drawing the line is blindfolded and must receive direction from the other players. All other players form a line and have different means of communicating where to draw the line next. A complex chain of hampered communication forms in which information is lost or misinterpreted, making the simple task of drawing a line quite challenging.

With four different tracks and many difficulty levels as well as a team vs. team variant, this party game does not become stale and can be played countless times!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Line Drawing, Race, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Coco Colecto
description:
As with all games from this publisher there are a lot (11 in this case) rules variant so it builds up from 3 to 10 years.

From the publishers website:

Life of the ladybirds is one big feast, just as long as there are enough plant lice to eat and they stay out of harms way for instance coming from the spider webs, and of course the spiders themselves.
Would you like to chase for twins, go for a plant lice hunt or race against your friends? Then come and play Coco Colecto!

The game challenges children to use their arithmetical skills to get ahead in the game(s). Although the winning strategies depend on the smart use of additions, subtractions, multiplications and/or divisions, the learning process is almost invisible for the children, since they are too busy having fun. Coco Colecto is a versatile game with different levels of learning, which all draw upon the developing arithmetic skills of children.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number, Racing

name: World Facts
description:
World–Facts is an entertaining geographical guessing game for 2-6 players aged 12 and up. Does Canada or Australia count more inhabitants? Does Rio de Janeiro or Sydney indicate a higher average temperature? And does London or Rome have more annual rainfall? These are just a few questions, where the players need to find an answer. TIn doing so it is not necessary to know the exact values, but rather to estimate and compare them in between different countries and cities. Through the different categories of questions the game offers a lot of variety and excitement.

Another special feature of World-Facts is its internationality. Via translations of all categories into 5 languages, global topics and the frequent use of symbols, World-Facts overcomes the usual focus of quiz games on just one language and culture. Thus, World-Facts is very suitable for multicultural groups as well.

name: Honnoji
description:
From the back of the box (translated):
Japan's largest coup, the Honnoji Incident, happened before dawn on June 2, 1582. Inside the burning temple, Oda Nobunaga is said to have committed suicide but his body was never found....

User description:
Honnoji uses tiles to select action locations, including movement, tile pickup, fighting, and recovery. The tiles are placed in a grid in front of the player, and the actions that happen are determined by the relative locations of the tiles.

While the temple burns, you must move your samurai through the temple, collecting treasures (tiles) and avoiding other samurai and the fire. The winner will be the player who has collected and (managed to keep) the most treasure at the end of 6 rounds.

name: Smarty Party! Expansion Set Junior
description:
From the publisher:

Now your kids can get in on the fun! The Smarty Party Junior Expansion contains 100 double-sided category cards for use with your Smarty Party! game!
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Oasis
description:
From the box:

You are Camel Drivers guiding Caravans from Home Village thru the Desert, gathering various Valuable Things to trade and sell when and if you reach The City. Along the way watch for sudden Sandstorms that can eliminate you. Also Thieves who can appear anywhere. Help each other look after all the Caravans. Discuss... plan strategies together... keep an eye out for one another. Traveling through the Desert requires care and alertness. The Storm can move quickly, sometimes almost unpredictably. Be wary, fellow adventurers, for the Dangers are many, but the Rewards are oh so great! May Allah bless your journey a thousandfold!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Who Am I?
description:
The game is played with cardboard figures, called UPUP figures.

Background:

UPUP figures lost their identities! They must find out who they are but only by asking each others questions.
Players hold two UPUP figures in each hand facing towards other players so that they can't see the identities of their own figures.
Players take turns in clockwise order and do one of the two actions:
(1) ask any one player if he/she sees any specific color OR letter in everyone's left OR right hands;
(2) claim one UPUP figure's identity (both color and letter must be correctly identified)
The player who manages to identifies both his/her figures wins the game!

name: Babes in the Wood
description:
The game consists of a 3D plan of a little cottage. There are two platforms on each side of the roof where Hansel climbs to throw down ginger.

Below stands Gretel who catches the pieces of ginger. There are six places where Gretel can stand on each side of the cottage and each side of the roof.

You can move Hansel and Gretel according to the throw of the dice. Hansel can move one platform up or down, and Gretel can move to an adjacent place on the ground. A third option given on the dice is for Hansel to throw down one ginger by sliding new tile from the bundle on the table.

Each platform of the roof consists of six ginger tiles. On the other side of the tile are one or three almonds, but there can also be a witch who can catch Gretel and force her to give up one ginger tile.

The game ends when there are no tiles to put on the roof. Whoever has collected the most almonds wins.

name: Чужие против хищника
description:
Tactical game based on the movie Aliens vs Predator: Requiem.

Alien and Predator will enter into a brutal fight.
Who will win? A ruthless swarm of Aliens, a lone Predator who came to earth to defend the honor of the clan or maybe humans who do not want to die without a murmur in the field of battle?

Each player must choose a side for which he will fight. The game is played on 2 boards divided into squares. One board depicts a city, the other the sewers . The player's must obtain their task by using weapons and equipment. The U.S. military must save the civilian population and explore technology. The Predator must kill all Aliens in order to conceal an alien invasion. The Aliens seeking to expand their hive, killing every living thing around.

The game comes with:
2 boards
40 game cards
68 plastic tokens
30 cardboard tokens
19 miniatures
Rulebook
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Caravan
description:
Caravan is a card game invented in conjunction with the video game "Fallout: New Vegas" (released in October 2010).

The game is set in the post-apocalyptic world of the video game series, and players take the role of caravan owners delivering goods across the wasteland.

Caravan can be played by 2 players using 2 standard decks of playing cards, or the special deck included with the video game.

Caravan plays a bit like a head-to-head version of Blackjack, with the objective being to build three sets of cards - or "caravans" - with the highest possible value.
You must is outbid your opponent's caravans, without being too light (under 21) or overburdened (over 26).

Certain cards - like Jacks, Queens or Kings - change the rules for building caravans, like the numerical order in which you are allowed to play cards onto your caravans.

Caravan plays in about 10-20 minutes.
publishers: (Web published), Bethesda Softworks, LLC, Obsidian Entertainment

name: Magical School
description:
Magical school: Sorcerers' apprentices begin their training.

In this game, you play the role of sorcerers' apprentices. By rolling the dice (which eyes are "white magic", "black magic", "knowledge", or "fumble" etc.), you may pass difference magic classes like "Magic Familiar" or "Astrology" which are worth points. The first player to reach a number of points is the winner.

The basic game is simple and fast. With the advanced rules, the classes you pass give you additional magic powers. For example, if you have passed the class "Chanting", it allows you to use an additional die; "Alchemy" allows you to change one die result. By using these powers, the apprentices will finally be able to learn high level magic like "Homunculus".

Contents:
31 subject cards
1 turn player's card
5 blank dice
1 sheet of dice-seals (with 30 seals)

name: Sitting Ducks Gallery Expansion
description:
This is not a standalone game. It must be played in combination with the base game Sitting Ducks Gallery (Chinese edition) by Wargames Club. The based game combined with this expansion would get a similar result of Sitting Ducks Deluxe (Sitting Ducks Deluxe)

The game comes with 88 game cards. 33 new types of action cards are introduced. 6 new duck colors are added which allow you to expand the game with up to 12 players.

[Chinese, box back]
射鴨子擴展版
在這裡，羽毛仍然到處飛！你試圖把自己的鴨子躲開對手的火藥，還是要考慮射擊對方的鴨子呢？
33種全新行動牌，令你的遊戲有更多的變化，更無盡的樂趣！小鴨牌的出現，使你護幼之心悠然而起！
這擴展更提供6種全新顏色的鴨子牌，遊戲可以同時多逹12人一齊玩了！
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Nasenbär
description:
Players try to get rid of their 6 bears. They have to put them over the right nose (right color). One nose is blocked by the Nosy Bear. If a player ends there, he can't put a bear there, but he can replace the Nosy Bear card.

First player who can place the 6th bear, wins.

name: Pizza, Pizza!
description:
Make a perfect pizza but do beware, there could be a slug or bug under there!

A fun colour and shape matching game, but unlike a traditional pizza, the toppings in this game are sometimes very unusual and yukky, which children find hilarious.

Make a delicious pizza by matching colours and shapes with the help of the Head Chef. Beware of yucky toppings and other players who want to swipe your slices!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Championship Baseball
description: This 1984 game from Milton Bradley features special TOPPS baseball cards. Those cards direct all of the action of the game. The backs of the cards feature statistically accurate batting records that have been computer analyzed into dice roll combinations. The game features stars like Pete Rose, Rod Carew, Reggie Jackson, George Brett, Mike Schmidt and 25 more.

name: Woosh!
description:
Woosh! is the first game made by Giorgio Vezzini and World oF Twilights Games.

The game is a fast and lighthearted game that deals with parachuting (even if in a funny way).

The goal is to jump from the airplane and do more points than the others by floating over high-point landing zones, or by making acrobatics, or by pushing other parachutists against each other to entangle them.

the board (the landing zone) is made by 9 cards face down, placed in a 3x3 table.
the back of the cards has a number. at the end of every round, you take as many points as the zone you are "floating" upon.

the cards of the game are used to move yourself, to move other players (for example the "Woosh!" card), to move everyone in the same turn, to attack other parachutists (like with the Condor card or the Tornado!).

The flight last 10 rounds and the last turn everyone draws 2 more cards. Some cards have a parachute symbol and other don't. the more parachute you get, the more you multiply the value of the points you take in the last turn.

In your turn you can draw a card or play a card (not both) and you can have a maximum of 3 cards in your hand.

If two parachutists are on the same zone, they entangle each other and they start "fighting", they both throw the dice and the winner pushes the other in another free landing zone, but the looser won't take any points at the end of the round. in case of draw, the one that has been moved, return wherever it was.

Fast, easy, funny with high interactivity with other players and lots of laughs with the illustrations of Angelo Porazzi.

check it out at
http://www.worldoftwilights.com

Woosh and Giorgio Vezzini will be present at Essen Fair 2009 Angelo Porazzi Games booth 30 Hall 9.
publishers: SimplyFun, World oF Twilights Studio and Games

name: 1969: Research Promo 2012
description:
This Promo Research introduces the Stock Market (Borsa).
If a player chose to use this research, he will gain extra money.

name: Football Flip Cards
description:
Two decks of cards (one for each team) representing the flip red and the flip blues are used by the players.
The sets of cards have attacking positions, for the player with the ball, and the opposite side of the cards has defending positions for the player trying to get the ball. The attacking player needs to make three successful passes past the defending payer to have a shot at goal, where a separate set of cards is used, in a rock paper scissors style to try and beat the goalkeeper. The game lasts until the decks have been used twice, representing each half of the match, and the player with the highest score wins.

name: BreakScore
description:
BreakScore - An iconic board game full of twists and turns, electrifying highs and heart-rendering crash and burns, that's great fun for board, dice and card game players, young and old alike! This is a major risk and reward game where much depends on the dice, the cards and the fickle finger of fate. No two games are ever the same ... and there is a mighty end twist that ensures that no game is over ... until it's absolutely over! ~ ideal for 2-4 game players / ages 10-adult / playing time approx 20-45 minutes.

Also included in the BreakScore game case are two bonus games;

Champ-Play - Absorbing to master, this no holds barred board game is highly recommended for cunning and competitive game players who excel at pushing their luck without going too far. Champ-Play can be pulsating and nerve-wracking ... definitely not for the faint-hearted! ~ ideal for 2-4 game players / ages 15-adult / playing time approx 20-45 minutes.

Break-Away - A race 'n' chase board game designed as the perfect lead-in to BreakScore. Easy to learn and quick to play, this is an unpredictable, non-repetitive game that can produce nail-biting finishes. It also encourages creative problem solving, rewards positive play and sharpens decision-making skills. ~ ideal for 2-4 game players / ages 7-adult / playing time approx 10-20 minutes.

name: Game of Suspicion
description: In Game of Suspicion, players try to guess the exact number of other players' hands, preventing other players from guessing the exact number of theirs. Once all the players' hands are successfully guessed by other players, that player is eliminated from the game. The player who has guessed right scores points according to the number of the cards. (i.e., if that player has four cards, and you guess them correctly, you get 4 points). The player with 15 or more points wins.

name: Maxi Zicke Zacke Hühnerkacke
description:
Maxi Zicke Zacke Hühnerkacke is a giant verson of Zicke Zacke Huhnerkacke (Chicken Cha Cha Cha) that incorporates costumes as part of the play. Children become the giant chickens that chase each other around oversized tiles to collect each other's tail feathers. Game play is the same as Zicke Zacke Hühnerkacke with the exception that the kids are the chickens.

Available as a special order item from Zoch.

This game is part of The Chicken Family of Zoch.

name: Go PoP! Presto
description: Race to pop the bubbles! Complete the challenges on the presto Cards and be the first to tap Bubblo to win the round! Players with quick reflexes, excellent eye/hand coordination and a good sense of observation will prevail in this fun party game for the whole family.

name: Kruisvuur
description: Try to get your stones from start to finish as quickly as possible. Watch your opponent as he can capture your pieces. The die decides the number of positions you are allowed to move forwards (or backwards). The first to have crossed over his 10 stones wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Het Huis Anubis: Uitbreiding
description:
Expansion for the game Het Huis Anubis. It adds 3 new rooms, 3 sets of hieroglyphs, a garden path, 3 new doors, 30 new cards and a ghost that blocks rooms.
It also expands the game up to six players.

name: Huida de Silver City: Carne Fresca
description:
En esta ampliación para Huida de Silver City, los jugadores se encontrarán con el lado más oscuro de la terrible infección que asola la ciudad.

Ahora los personajes tendrán su versión zombie, con sus propias habilidades y objetivos para ganar la partida.

Además, la cepa de la infección de Silver City ha mutado y han aparecido nuevos efectos en los zombies recientes.

¡Prepárate para correr! Esta vez la cosa se ha puesto fea de verdad.

---

In this expansion for Escape from Silver City, the players will face the darkest side of the infection that is ravaging the town.
Now the characters will have a zombie version, with different skills and objectives on their shambling way to victory.
Moreover, Silver City's infectious strain has mutated, and recent zombies show new features.
Get ready to run! This time, things are getting really nasty.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Penguin SLAP!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Penguin SLAP! is a last-man standing, penguin-slapping, family-friendly card game! Players assume the roll of penguins who slap each other with fish! (Slapping in the sense of playing a card, not physically slapping your opponents or the table) The last penguin holding fish is the winner!

The game consists of 2 decks of cards, Penguin Personas cards and fish cards. Each player assumes the roll of one of the Penguin Personas cards. These personas are comical and give them special abilities in the game.

There are 4 different colors (or suits) of fish cards. Red fish contain attack cards, yellow fish are counter-attack cards, blue fish help you draw more cards, and green fish are items and equipment. The fish cards are colored on both sides so you can see what color (or suit) of fish your opponents have, but you don't know exactly what *kinds* of fish they have. (Is that a red SLAP fish, or a red STEAL fish?) Each player also has two randomly-shuffled draw piles to choose from, so they can strategically pick which colored fish to draw depending on what's available.

Players take turns catching and slapping each other with fish, but have to be careful! Their opponent could counter their slap back to them, increasing it's power! With 4 different colors of fish you can strategically build your hand to defend or attack!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: War in the Megacity
description:
"War in the Megacity" is a two-player simulation of hypothetical near-future battles fought in metropolitan areas with populations of 10 million or more, and it’s designed by Joseph Miranda. The objective is to show the spectrum of conflict — conventional, special operations and unconventional — used in this type of fighting on the grand-tactical level. There are two sides, both controlled by a player, the Insurgent, who wants to seize control of the city. Opposing him in that effort is the Government player.

The “Infowar Index” is central to play. Each player has one, which indicates how successful he is in achieving his goals — and representing the amount of overall public support each side is getting.

Each game turn represents from two days to two weeks of ‘real time,’ depending on the tempo and scope of the activities conducted in each one. The various units represent force sizes – most either task-organized or spontaneously generated at street-level – varying in size between battalions and brigades: anywhere from about 500 to 5,000 personnel.

Megacity has a number of unusual subsystems. For one, victory in battle isn’t always reckoned in terms of physically destroying the enemy but, rather, in fighting him in such a way as to get the media’s reporting squarely on your side. Another important aspect of the game is that certain combat results cause units to get stronger, as they gain in cohesion and tactical expertise.

The system has antecedents in earlier games, in particular, Jim Dunnigan's “Chicago, Chicago!” It presented the first wargame approach to confrontations between police and demonstrators during the protests at the 1968 Democratic National Convention in Chicago. It was one of the first attempts to model modern urban warfare, albeit in a “battle” in which no one was killed though there was plenty of havoc in the streets.

Counterfact magazine #9

name: Fishing Day
description:
Hey there, little anglers! Pick up your lucky fishing line and head to the pond for a crazy game of fishing! Follow the current challenge card and use your line to catch the correct objects from the water before the yellow duck makes it out. The first player to complete five challenges wins and becomes the champion of the pond!

More than a fishing game, Fishing Day is a clever race made of color and shape recognition, deductions, and counting challenges.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Blue Orange Games, Happy Baobab, Zito! Ώρα για παιχνίδι

name: Tu Letra
description:
"Tu letra" is a quick, simple and fun word game and deduction.
Those who enjoy wordplay and are looking for something new to surprise friends and family can't help but try "Tu Letra"!

A player (director) looks at the letter he received (secret letter) and chooses the family of words the players should use.
The players in turn have to do the actions:
A) Say a word belonging to the family indicated by the director and ask if the secret letter is in it
If yes, add a card to your deck. If NO, place a card from the deck face up.
B) Try to guess what the letter is

If it is correct, the player gains one point.
If incorrect, the player must place 3 cards from his hand on the table.

The game ends when a player reaches three victory points.

Tu Letra es un juego de palabras y deducción rápido, sencillo y divertido.
¡Aquellos que disfruten de los juegos de palabras y estén buscando algo nuevo con lo que sorprender a amigos y familiares no pueden dejar de probar Tu Letra!

name: Superfight: The History Deck
description:
From Alexander Hamilton and Harriet Tubman to Vlad the Impaler, the greatest heroes and villains from human history are ready to fight in this 100-card Superfight expansion. So get ready for the most absurd historical debates you've ever had!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Dark.net
description:
The tech-future which mankind has been working towards is finally upon us! Sadly, the tech-future is not all we thought it was cracked up to be; technology couldn't save us from ourselves, and there are no hoverboards or floating cars in sight. Contrary to our hopes and dreams, four mega-corporations dominate and dictate every aspect of our lives.

In Dark.net, players intercept transmissions to gain valuable information via their data network. Players use fences to buy and sell information so they can boost their ability to gather even more information, all in the service of acquiring reputation. To boost their reputation, players will accrue credits, extend their network, hire informants, install network boosters, and make contacts. Have more reputation than anyone else at game's end, and you win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Random Production, Tile Placement

name: King's Ransom: Deluxe
description:
King's Ransom Deluxe, from designer Frank Zazanis II, is a two-player strategy card game pitting royal rivals against each other. Using the basic mechanics of Chess, there's an additional layer of strategy due to each card entering play hidden from the opposing player's view.

On their turn, each player flips a face-down card so it is face up, and then moves any face-up card. He or she then announces check, if applicable. If no check is announced, then a card is placed face down, and a new card is drawn from the deck. If you can set traps and lure your opponent into making mistakes, you might be able to snatch their King and ransom him for control of the kingdom!

This deluxe version contains all the cards in the original King's Ransom game, plus an additional 10 new piece types, 110 new cards (for a total of 160), and instructions for a four-player variation.

name: Xoliba
description:
Xoliba is a fast-paced, surprising and totally new abstract strategy game. It has no standard starting position. Instead, before each game a new starting position is created by placing game pieces on the board at random. As there are billions of possible starting positions, each game is different from the next. Because the starting position is randomized, it seldom offers equal opportunities for both players and you may well need luck to win. Sometimes you can find yourself much worse off from the very beginning; in such positions all what you can do is to minimize your loss. Do not get discouraged: Xoliba is played in matches and the next game might well be yours.

The objective of the game is to create triangles. The game is won by the player who has the biggest triangle on the board when the game ends. Moves are made by changing places of the player's own piece and a neutral white piece in such a manner that a new triangle is formed. If such a triangle contains player's own or opponent's pieces, they are captured. The game ends when no new triangles can be formed. The winner scores points from enemy pieces that have been captured. The match is won by the player who is the first to reach or exceed 50 points. Of course, it is not obligatory to play up to 50 points. If the players so wish, they can also play shorter or longer matches, for example, up to 35 points.

Equipment

7x7 octagonal board with 45 intersections (corners cut off), points, where horizontal, oblique, and vertical lines cross each other. Game pieces are 57 discs. Each disc has a white side but the colour of the opposite side varies: in 17 discs it is red, in 17 discs it is blue, in 12 it is green and in 11 it is white.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Pattern Building

name: Comparity: Around the World
description:
Comparity is a series of fast-paced, compact board games in which you compare everything in the world, from the heights of famous buildings to the box offices of classic movies.

Statistically, every other fridge in our country is decorated with magnets representing world landmarks — the Eiffel Tower, the Taj Mahal, the Colosseum, Neuschwanstein castle, the Empire State building — even if the fridge’s owner has never left his neighborhood. But now you don’t need a refrigerator to visit famous tourist landmarks! In this edition of board game Comparity, a hundred world-famous buildings, monuments, cathedrals, and even bridges are waiting for you to sort them by height and date of construction.

On your turn, you can place a card in the grid or check if a previous player placed their card correctly. If you check and the placement is correct, you must draw a 2 card, but if it was placed incorrectly then the person who played it must draw 3 cards.

The player who manages to get rid of all their cards first is the winner.

name: Alphabet Stoop
description:
Alphabet Stoop is a turn-based, word building, tile placement game that is sure to deliver fun to your doorstep! Play as a parcel delivery person dropping off packages (letter tiles) on stoops and using them to spell words.

Move your package carriers from stoop to stoop. Carriers must always move via an adjacent stoop. Drop off your packages on stoops and form words with newspapers (vowels), magazines (wild letters), and other packages (consonants). Be the first player to deliver all of your packages OR earn NINE Victory Points to secure your win! (1 point per Stoop Card you occupy and 1 point per Stamp you have).

-description from publisher

name: Sky Dice
description: Sky Dice is a dice-based dogfighting game where the planes themselves are dodecahedral dice. The game involves maneuvering your planes to the right range and altitude to line up opponent planes in your gunsights. Each plane has a fixed number of hit-points of damage it can take before being shot down and removed from play. Last player or team with planes remaining is the victor.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, World War II

name: The Joker Fun House Game
description:
A Candyland-style game where Batman, Superman, Green Lantern, and Flash try to get to the finish before the Joker gets to his goal. Each character has a different super power to help their side win.


Calling all DC Super Friends. The Joker is up to his usual tricks, and he must be stopped! Superman, Batman, Green Lantern and The Flash team up, calling on their special powers X-ray vision, the Batarang, force fields and lightning speed to dodge The Joker's gags and stop him in his tracks before he reaches the getaway car. The Fun House game board is packed with preschool play power: a wacky rolling ball, secret messages, and a launching Batarang will draw young super heroes into the action!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: BreakFast & Furious
description:
The Hungry Trucker Cafe is under new management and you’ve being hired as its chef. The new menu features all the greasy spoon favourites, as well as a few healthier dishes in an attempt to attract the more discerning clientele.

You'll need to make regular visits to the local market to ensure that your fridge is well stocked with the best ingredients. And Get all the food orders out on time, otherwise you’ll be faced with very hungry, even furious, customers!

The game uses different coloured dice to represent different ingredients. The value of a die will indicate how fresh the ingredient is and this reduces each turn.

Choose ingredients from a pool of dice (the market) to add to your fridge (a bag). Randomly draw ingredients and place them onto the cards to complete orders, avoid penalties and gain rewards. A completed order also gives you a single use special action.

Can you complete enough orders to be awarded "Employee of the Month?".

An entry in the 2021 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Courtyard
description:
From the publisher:
It is the height of the castle building era in Europe - and it is a matter of national pride that the royal couple's courtyard be the most ornate and splendid in the land.

Courtyard melds high-quality wooden components, traditional medieval themes, and simple border drawing mechanics to create a strategy game with a timeless feel.

Contains:
80 laser engraved wooden tiles
4 Player Tile Trays

name: Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 10 - Set 1
description:
Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 10 - Set 1 is a complete starter set for Car Wars: the basic rules, counters and components, and two cars. The cars are Firedemon vs. Hammer (with each have modifications). Division 10 duels allow a total of $10,000 for a vehicle. The Car Wars Turning Key included in the set is especially helpful.

Part of the Car Wars (Fifth Edition) Series.

Expands:

Car Wars (Fifth Edition)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: The Nile Ran Red
description:
The Nile Ran Red is a collection of three standalone card games set in a mythical ancient Egypt. Illustrated by John Ariosa, these card games all pit players against each other with a common goal: extending control over the land of the Nile. While all three games share a common theme and a common aesthetic, they are vastly different mechanically and no games share common components or art. With this collection of games, up to eleven players can be accommodated at once — albeit by playing different games.

•••

In Lords of the Sand, each player takes on the role of one of four different gods: Anubis, Thoth, Sobek, and Khnum. Each god has its own unique agenda and special abilities.

Throughout the course of the game, players use Units, complete their court, use special abilities, and build temple complexes. With a combo-driven card system, as cards are played, additional actions may spawn multiple abilities, but a limited action system keeps downtime to a minimum.

Lords of the Sand offers multiple paths to victory, unique card play, and various special abilities with a playing time of about thirty minutes, plus ten minutes for each player above two.

•••

In Rise of the First Dynasty, 3-5 players vie for control over the whole of Egypt as the potential leader of the mythical first Dynasty of the ancient land along the Nile.

Each player has a set of three identical actions. Played over ten Aeons (or rounds), in each Aeon each player chooses one of his action cards. Depending on the actions chosen by each other players, the player will gain actions, such as conquering new lands, blessing the lands he has already conquered, or using Edict cards to thwart the other players' plans and protect his own. Light, quick, and downright dirty, Rise of the First Dynasty plays in around 30 minutes and scales well regardless of players.

•••

In Crimson Sun, two players take on the role of leaders of Upper and Lower Egypt. Playing units of four unique gods (Kuk, Babi, Horus, and Sekmet), players build their forces and attempt to assert influence over four key structures. Players may choose to either draft decks at the beginning of the game, or use a single deck.

During the game, players use the Unit cards in a variety of ways to increase his overall strength, to use special abilities, or to secretly try to gain control over the structures. The core mechanisms of this game are pulled from a previous Small Box Games release — Bhazum — but mechanical and thematic changes have lead to a game that should be a fresh experience for players already familiar with the earlier game.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Landgang
description:
Your playing pieces (sailors) move across the city to find a pub before the police make 60 steps (Minutes) around the Board.
If the police finish the round, the game ends and you get points for every piece that is in a pub. You lose points for every piece that is still on the roads.
If 1 Sailor is in a Pub you get 6 Pt.
If 2 Sailors are in a Pub you get 2 Pt.
If 3 Sailors are in a Pub you get 3 Pt.
If 4 Sailors are in a Pub you get 4 Pt
If more than 4 Sailors are in a Pub you get 0 Pt.
For every Sailor in the streets you lose 1 Pt.

In the Box. (Tube)
30 wooden playing pieces in five colors.(Sailors)
1 rubber Policeman (from Bulli)
1 Dice W6 (3,4,5,5,6,6)
1 Board (imitation leather)
Rules
12 wooden Buildings

name: Saratoga 1777 AD
description:
(From the publisher's web site) Of all the battles in the American Revolution, Saratoga was the one that really gave the Patriots a belief that they could win—and convinced the outside world (starting with France) that the rebels were worth supporting. Take away the victory at Saratoga, and we can only wonder how much more time would have passed before the French alliance happened…if ever.

Now you can explore the two main battles of Saratoga, both Freeman’s Farm and Bemis Heights, as a growing storm of colonial militia and regulars, commanded by Gates but really led by Arnold, turned “Gentleman Johnny’s” adventure into a disaster.

Rob Markham’s design gives life to the combatants, as players wrestle with command-control, fog-of-war, and troop quality ratings that mean a larger force may actually be weaker.
The Battle of Saratoga contains:
One 11” by 17” mounted map sheet
One set of 200 die cut mounted counters
One 8 page rulebook
Two Six-Sided Dice
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Monopoly: One Piece Edition
description:
Welcome in dressrosa! The straw hat crew sneak into dressrosa and divide into three teams; destroying artificial Devil fruit factory team, escorting caeser team and securing thousand sunny team. In this special one piece edition of Monopoly, you'll visit all the characters of the Anime one piece as well as trying to get Koala and soldier over to your side! Chest and flag cards might reward you for fights against the villains or bring an unexpected surprise... Buy, sell and trade with other fans to get a powerful one piece team and win the game!


The world's favourite family Board Game brings this exciting edition of One Piece Monopoly
Choose your favourite bespoke One Piece character playing token and tour your favourite One Piece characters
Advance to Bellamy, Violet, or even Luffy - will you owe rent or reap the rewards?
Build your house and hotels and trade your way to success
The Fast-Dealing Property Trading Game is fun for the whole family


—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Winning Moves France, Winning Moves Germany, Winning Moves International Ltd

name: Dent pour dent
description:
Try to win the boxing tournament with your family. The first who uses his combined forces to gain 7 KO's wins the tournament.

A winner of the 1997 Concours International de Créateurs de Jeux de Société.

name: Middle East Combat
description:
From the insert: "Middle East Combat is a titanic battle between Iraq, the USSR, Iran, Turkey, and Saudi Arabia for control of oil resources and key neutral nations, played with basic Axis & Allies rules."

Contents:
23"x30" bright full color folded map showing region names, oil areas, factories, and capitals(Heavy stock paper)
5 unit placement cards
Ten page rulebook which covers additional rules for
- neutral nation armies
- civil insurrections
- modern weapon technologies
- USSR special rules
- game balance adjustments
- short game scenarios
- map clarifications
- 10 questions and answers from the game

The Red Pact of USSR and Iraq form one side in this war and the Triad Nations of Iran, Turkey, and Saudi-Egypt form the other side.

Victory Conditions, 1) Hold ten oil areas at the end of a full turn, 2) Hold all enemy capitals, or 3) Hold a total of three neutral or enemy capitals.

Another use for your Axis & Allies game pieces.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Brain Quest SMART game
description:
The beauty of this trivia game is that it invites players to answer questions at their own grade level! So there is none of this "too easy" or "too hard" stuff among sibblings.

Each card contains 6 questions from grades 1 to 6. Spin the spinner and answer the subject question for your grade level. The winner is the first to collect one letter chip for each subject: Science, Math, Art, Reading, The World.
categories: Children's Game, Math, Trivia, Word Game

name: Little Collect
description:
This children's game teaches the basics of set collection.

On a player's turn, players draw a card and take the corresponding action:
If the card depicts a carrot, the player adds a carrot to their player board.
If the card depicts a set of peas, the player adds a pea to their player board.
If the card depicts a bunny eating a carrot, and the player already has at least one carrot, the player adds a bunny to their player board.
If the card depicts a bunny eating a pea, and the player already has at least one pea, the player adds a bunny to their player board.
If the card depicts a fox, and the player has at least one bunny on their player board, then the player must return one bunny to the supply.

Players take turns drawing cards until one player has 3 carrots, 3 peas, and 3 bunnies on their player board, and that player then wins.
—user summary

A collection game: The little rabbits are greedy and if you want to approach them, you will first need to harvest some peas and carrots! But watch out for the fox who's on the prowl! Will you be the first to fill your board? A first collecting game to play with your Mum or Dad!
—description from the back of the box

name: Switcheroo!
description: Players try to get rid of their cards first by responding to hilarious subjects. Play a card, slap the timer, and pass to the next player...But be careful, a Switcheroo can happen at any time-changing up the subject-just when you had a great response in mind!

name: Black Hole: Space Alert Game
description:
The game is based on the Disney movie "The Black Hole". Leave the explorer craft to explore the massive ghost ship Cygnus, but Cygnus is doomed! By drawing playing cards, players must plot the fastest escape route, avoiding androids and Maximilian!

Players draw and discard action cards in order to move around the board. If no card matches the next space's icon, they discard a card but do not move. The first player to make it through the Cygnus to the Space Probe wins!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Race, Track Movement

name: Kluges Köpfchen
description: The object of the game is to generate a set of cards with the same number or a straight or flush or a combination of these, by placing a card from your hand next to a row or column of cards on the table. The more cards are in such a group, the more points you get.

name: Chess4
description:
A chess variant intended to introduce classic board games to young children. Made available as a print and play game, it has been released under public domain.

Each player starts the game with 5 animals: a kitten (pawn), a lynx and a leopard (bishops), a tiger (rook) and a lion (king). Each piece may move one square towards any direction shown on the piece, but may jump over or swap positions with allied pieces, which makes the game quicker and more dynamic. The lion, however, may only move to capture or to swap positions. If the kitten reaches the last row, it evolves (is promoted) to a lioness (queen), the strongest piece in the game.

It is a cute and colorful game, easy enough for seven years old to play but still challenging for adult players.

name: Shakkis
description: Shakkis is a Chess variant played on 7x8 grid. The aim of the game is to capture the opposing king. Each player starts with king, thirteen pawns and three cards in hand. Cards depict the different ways to move in Chess. Each turn player either moves their king according to Chess movement rules, or moves one of their pawns by playing a card. At the end of turn you draw a new card unless you have more than three cards in hand.

name: Huizhou: Confucian Merchants
description:
During Ming and Qing Dynasties, merchants originated from Huizhou were among the most successful ones in China. They built their own business empire with massive capital and outstanding business talents. In this game, each player will act as one of the Huizhou merchants, competing with opponents. Players shall send out family members to execute activities like purchasing, constructing, doing salt business, running stores, cooperating with government and increasing their fame. The goal is to achieve recognition from government and local people in the form of building archways. When a single player has built four archways, the game is about to end, and the player with the most victory points shall win the game.
—description from the publisher (translated)

徽商作為一支重要的商幫，其商業資本之巨，活動範圍之廣，經商能力之強，從業人數之多，在商界首屈一指。玩家在遊戲中將扮演一位徽商，與其他玩家競爭，玩家派遣自己的族人進行採購，建設，行商，外出行鹽，建造商鋪，官府捐贈、攀聲望，讓自己的商號得到國家和地方的認可，獲得各種牌坊。當有人獲得四個牌坊後觸發結束條件，看誰是最成功的商人（分數最多），誰將獲得勝利。

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Contracts, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Jurassic Parts: One Dino Podcast
description:
Remove up to 3 concealed tiles from the Slab and secretly look at them. You may mix them up; then return them face down in any orientation. If there are chisels on the tiles, they remain in the same placement when the tiles are returned.


This promo card was made for the "One Board Family" media team who do reviews, podcasts, etc.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Set Collection

name: Panik Pilze
description: Players score points for having the most mushroom baskets in Panik Pilze, and to make this happen players should collect as many different types of fungi as possible. Also, you might want to lay your hands on the baskets owned by other players...

name: The Sailor's Game
description:
Paraphrased from the Game Box and Rules:
The Sailor's Game's unique design encourages competition and interaction among players with different levels of sailing knowledge and experience.
New sailors and young sailors will find this a fun and effective way to learn about sailing and cruising while Rod Stephens helps them challenge their more experienced crew mates on topics of seamanship and navigation.
Playing yachts are pewter models of Sparkman and Stephens designs and the race course is the Southern Ocean.
publishers: (Unknown), Blossom Design, Edition Maritim, Western Publishing Company

name: Focus
description:
User summary:
The teams (or the two individual players) observe carefully one of the twelve fully illustrated panels, trying to find out objects which name begins with the letter chosen and writing them on an appropriate paper sheet. The panels are very complex and full of detailed images. After the time is out, the teams sum their points, gaining 1 point for repeated words and 5 points for unique words. Each object should be mentioned only once (no singular/plural differentiation), but the same word can be repeated if it represents different objects on the panel. After the twelfth panel is used, the total points are added together and the winner is the team (individual player) with the most points.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game

name: Brujas del Sabado
description:
BRUJAS DEL SABADO is a trick-taking game about feasting with four Spanish witches. The player with the most points wins.

The game is a "must follow" experience, but rather than following the suit of the first player, the card played by the second player, and that card's relation to the first card played, will determine the follow type for the round.

The suits are strictly ranked, both in strength and in point value. The winner of a trick must make an adjustment to the strength of the winning suit, and the players will each draft a card played to the trick to their score pile.

At the end of the game, players will earn points based upon both the suits collected and the ranks collected.
publishers: Yoidore Omomuki Miyatsuko (酔いどれ趣造)

name: Flight of the Boodles
description: This is a simple wargame from The Dragon magazine. One player commands the Boodles and tries to get them across the gameboard safely. The other player commands the Grumjugs and attempts to destroy the Boodles before they make it across.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: CD Adventure: Search for the Lost City
description: A game of adventure and excitement in which players compete to find the fabled lost city. Random events are played from a CD which adds to the atmosphere.

name: Inspektor Hase
description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

In Inspektor Hase, players use their rabbit inspectors to hunt down crooks – but every crook has a twin, and you can arrest a crook only when you can nab the pair of them.

How do you catch the crooks? When one of your rabbit inspectors lands in a search area, you can turn the two face-down tokens located there face up. Plop another rabbit into a second search area which turns out to have a matching crook, and you can claim the two of them. Depending on the number of players, the first person to capture three or four pairs of crooks wins.

name: Magician's Cookbook
description:
In Der verflixte Zaubertrank players are magician assistants who need to bring together the ingredients needed to complete potions – but to do this, they can use a little magic of their own to double up on ingredients they already have.

Each player has four cauldron tiles – two with slits in the top, two with slits in the bottom – that can be assembled into two cauldrons; a player also has two fireplace tiles on which the completed cauldrons sit as well as eight firestones. To set up the game, 22 magic ingredient tiles that show mushrooms, spiders, frogs and the assistants themselves are shuffled, placed into two even stacks, then covered with a "book" cover.

To start the first round, the book cover is "opened" so that four ingredient tiles are revealed (the "recipe"). Players then race to assemble their cauldrons and place them on their fireplaces; after doing so, they then rotate the fireplaces and mark the locations from which they can see the ingredients needed to complete the potion. The cauldrons tiles have mirrors on half of them, so a mushroom on one tile might be reflected in the mirror, thus giving a player two mushrooms for a potion. Similarly, a half mushroom can be made whole with a mirror.

Once a player thinks he has marked exactly the number and type of ingredients he needs, he ends the round. If he created the potion correctly, he moves his pawn two spaces on the track; otherwise everyone else advances one space on the track. Players then disassemble their cauldrons, flip over two ingredients tiles (thereby showing a new recipe), and start the next round.

If an assistant shows up on an ingredient tile, that player advances two spaces after cooking ends that round. At a certain point in the game, a mouse comes to aide the player in last place, providing all the mushrooms that player needs.

Der verflixte Zaubertrank ends when all recipes have been used or a player reaches the final space on the track. The player who advances the farthest on the track wins the game.
publishers: Drei Magier Spiele, Gigamic, Playroom Entertainment

name: Little Association
description:
The box contains three plastic animals, a rabbit, a frog and a cow. Three large "theme" tiles, the vegetable garden (linked to the rabbit), the pond (frog) and the meadow (cow). Each large tile depicts a scene containing a combination of 10 animals, vegetables, tools... For example the scarecrow is on the vegetable garden tile and the dragonfly in the pond tile. There are also 30 smaller tiles each depicting one of the things present on the larger theme tiles.

The smaller tiles are placed head down in the center of the table. The top one is returned and the children need to identify which theme the card belongs to. The winner is the first child to place the corresponding animal on the correct theme tile. He gains the small card and the next one is then revealed. If the player gets it wrong, he puts a previously gained card back under the pack in the middle of the table.

The game winner is the first to gain 5 cards or the one with most cards once all the cards in the center have been used.

name: MindTrap Geometrical Riddles: Master Level
description: Travel size MindTrap card pack what focused less on the storytelling mysteries and riddles like the classic game and more on pattern recognition, logic problems and well, geometric riddles.

name: Κόντρα 10
description:
It's a pleasant and joyful party - trivia game in which one player or team of players asks the other for 10 answers. For example 10 movies of Ppielberg, 10 fruits with one kernel, or 10 tints of blue.

Each answer (of the 10) depending on its difficulty gives the player, or team points (from 1 to 5). The player or team with the most points at the end of the game is the winning one.

name: Monopoly: Esselunga
description:
Esselunga special edition where instead of the classic terrains there are the superstores of the Esselunga chain. The aim of the game is to become a monopolist, that is, to remain the last "financier" in the game after everyone else has gone bankrupt.
On their turn, each player rolls the dice and ventures on the board, between the purchase of land, stations or companies, the payment of rents and the construction of houses and hotels, the surprises represented by the contingency and probability cards, and the reassuring withdrawal of the salary every time, after completing a tour, you pass the VIA. When a player does not have enough money or property to pay a rent or honor a debt to the bank or another player, he goes bankrupt and leaves the game. Whoever manages to best manage their finances, balancing investments with a wise availability of cash to face any misfortune, wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination

name: L'Imposteur
description:
Finding the Impostor is your primary mission...

One word each. Everyone seems convincing, but one of you is pretending to be someone else. That someone is The Impostor.

Each round, a secret word is chosen. Everyone knows what the word is, except for the player who received the Impostor card... but which player is it?

Players use trickery, deduction, or bluffing when they give their word to prove their innocence and to find the impostor.

Once everyone has said their word, the voting begins to determine which player is the impostor.
Players must rely on the team and their detective skills to successfully find the impostor and win the game.

The Impostor is a game involving matching ideas, bluffing, and guessing for a fun time with your friends.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Targeted Clues, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Raindropchess
description:
Raindropchess is a chess variant, which starts with an empty board. Card draws determine which pieces may be placed, the players decide where to play their pieces. Once your king is on the board, you can also move your pieces. Movement of pieces, capturing and game end are the same as in regular chess.

Official website: http://raindropchess.com (English)

name: MountTen
description:
In MountTen (テンガロン), players want to rid themselves of cards in hand first in order to win the round. The deck consists of green cards numbered 1-40 and red cards numbered 10-30. Players start with ten cards in hand with 2-3 players and eight cards with 4-6 players. Set the deck nearby with the top card revealed.

The start player plays any card to the center of the table. The next player must play a card at most ten lower or higher than this card, e.g., playing 14-34 if the 24 was lead. If the second-played card is lower (higher), then all subsequent cards must be lower (higher) — but also always within ten of the most recently played card. If a player cannot or doesn't want to play, they pass and draw the top card of the deck, then reveal the new top card. If all players pass in turn, then whoever played the most recent card clears the table and leads a new card.

Two exceptions:

1. If the next player in turn can play a green card exactly ten lower or higher than the topmost card on the pile (no matter the direction of play), that player can call "Mount Ten!", play the card, then clear the table and lead a new card.

2. If any player can play a red card exactly ten lower or higher than the topmost card on the pile (no matter the direction of play), that player can call "Mount Ten!", play the card, then clear the table and lead a new card.

When one player has no cards in hand, the round ends. Each player with cards in hand scores -1 for each green card and -2 for each red card; the player who went out scores positive points equal to all the negative points scored that round. Complete as many rounds as the number of players, with the start player rotating each round. Whoever then has the highest score wins!

name: The Analyst Game
description:
The Analyst Game was developed jointly by consumer psychologist Adam Ferrier and ideas company Saatchi & Saatchi. It was borne out of a realization that a) people love hearing what others think about them, and b) people enjoy having the opportunity to safely express what they think about others. The Analyst gives people the chance to understand their friends and family on a deeper level. In return you'll gain a deeper understanding of how others see you.

This boardgame (without a board!) works like this: an Analyst asks questions about a randomly-drawn subject. The Trainee Analysts must provide insightful but not obvious answers about the subject's character. The Analyst must then guess who the subject is. Points are awarded and we move to the next round. Simple ... and fun!

The techniques used in this game are used by therapists and advertising agencies when they want to gain a deeper understanding of people, why they do things and what really drives them. For example during the Bush / Gore election campaign, planning departments in advertising agencies asked people if the presidential candidates came to life as cars, what kind of car would they be? George Bush was seen as a Maserati, Al Gore was a Honda Accord. I'll leave it to you to draw your own conclusions as to why!
(Taken Directly from the webpage)

name: マストフォローソリティア (Follow-the-Suit Solitaire)
description:
マストフォローソリティア (Follow-the-Suit Solitaire) was designed for the 2019 exhibition これはトリテなのか (Is this a trick-taking game?), for games that pushed the boundary of what could be considered both a game and a trick-taking game.

It is a solitaire game where the player wins if they can run out of cards in their hand; if they do, the player also earns a score equal to the number of cards left in a deck.

The game uses a standard 52-card deck, plus 1 joker. Ten cards and randomly discarded, then the player draws 10 cards from a shuffled deck. The player may then discard any number of cards, drawing 2 cards to replace each card discarded. The player can choose any or no suit as trump.

To play a trick, the top card from the deck is flipped up and the player then chooses a card from their hand to play. The player must follow suit (or play the joker). The highest card played of the trump suit wins; otherwise the highest card played of the led suit. (The joker is the highest overall card.) If the player wins, the two cards from the trick are discarded; otherwise, the player takes the cards into their hand. Regardless of who wins the trick, the deck leads the next trick.

name: Schlafmütze
description: Schlafmütze (Sleeping Cap) is a mixture of word play and set collection and involves players taking cards from an initial circle and building up their own groups. It appears to require a good knowledge of German words, speed and player interaction.

name: Namesake
description:
For 2 to 6 players or teams.

The objective is to move around the board (via dice roll), respond (as an individual or team) to category challenges when given a FIRST name, and be the first to the end. Feels much like Pictionary and such, except if stumped by a category, you can always choose to roll and move BACKWARDS instead.

There are 6 major categories: Stars & Co., Musicians, History/News Makers, Fictional Characters, Athletes & Co., and Authors/Artists. Draw a first name card, and name someone famous in that category, with that first name, within 30 seconds!

As well, there are 'nameoff' and 'namedrop' squares. Nameoff is a back-and-forth all-play, until 30 seconds pass where neither team can name any more people; last accepted answer wins the challenge.
Namedrop is solo challenge to name (dice roll) number of famous people with that first name within the time limit.

Whenever there is any question of validity (famous? first name matches? category fits? nickname or short form valid?), your OPPONENT(s) are the judge!

name: My Precious Presents
description:
Be the first to collect 3 large silver presents! Whoever said it's better to give than to receive never played My Precious Presents! In this game it is ALWAYS better to receive. This gift exchange is anything but civilized. Mischief abounds as everyone races to collect the biggest presents. Remember to keep your eyes on your pile of presents or else you'll end up with none!

Play revolves around managing and protecting your presents while sabotaging other players efforts. There are 120 cards in the deck, so a good variety of actions, reactions and other game play is possible. You will have to pay close attention to other players' victory conditions as once they are met the game is over.

Quick easy game play attracts all level of gamers and non-gamers alike. The back stabbing and action/counter action should keep players constantly on their toes.

69 colourful foil wrapped presents create instant buzz from onlookers.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Quadrio
description:
In the two-player game Quadrio, players compete to be the first to place four discs in a row — but it's tricky to do so since the discs can move to new locations as players rotate the plastic device that serves as the playing area.

The playing field is a 4x4 grid that's overlaid with troughs on each side of it, with troughs on opposite sides of the field running perpendicular to one another. On a turn, a player slides one of their discs into a trough. That's it! Before or after inserting a disc, a player can hold the device by any of the four corners and turn it to look at either side. When a player grabs a different corner and holds the device by it, discs inside might slide in their troughs to new positions. Have you created a four-in-a-row of your discs (on one or a combination of both sides of the playing area) after taking your turn? If so, you win!

Games of Quadrio can be quick as it's hard to keep an eye on all eight possible orientations of the device. Thus, the publisher recommends playing multiple rounds, such as seeing who can first win three games out of five.

name: To jest napad!
description:
The game consists of 6 rounds. Each round represents an attack on a train carrying gold, dynamite and money. Players lead gangs raiding the trains: cowboys, Mexicans, deserters and Indians. During each robbery, players decide which members of their gang they will send to the appropriate wagons. The band that captures a particular wagon takes the items transported in it.
After the sixth heist, players will receive points for the loot they have accumulated.
The person with the highest number of points wins.

name: Boom Party
description:
Do you remember when you were a kid and went to other children's parties? Do you remember the envy when these were prettier than yours, and how you wanted to get revenge by messing them up? Well, that is the goal in Boom Party!

Boom Party is a fast game with lots of interaction between players, a game in which you have to sabotage other children's parties while trying to save your own. You get to explode your rivals' balloons, fart around, and protect your own balloons to get bonus points in this easy and dynamic fun game.

•••

¿Te acuerdas de pequeño cuando ibas a las fiestas de otros niños y niñas? ¿Te acuerdas de la envidia cuando sus fiestas eran más bonitas que la tuya y como te daban ganas de chincharles estropeando la fiesta? ¡Pues ese es el objetivo en Boom Party!

Boom Party es un juego rápido con mucha interacción entre jugadores, donde tendrás que estropearle la fiesta a otros niños mientras intentas salvar la tuya. Consigue pinchar los globos de los rivales, tírate un pedo, protege los tuyos y consigue bonus en este juego sencillo, dinámico y divertido.
publishers: Eclipse Editorial, Last Level, Taverna Ludica Games

name: Paroli
description: A quick, Rummy style tile laying game. The tiles are numbered 1 to 10 in 3 colours with points values, green +10, blue +5, red -5 and Paroli cards worth -10. Tiles are laid out in a grid on the table, columns in 1 number, rows from 1 to 10, with the Paroli taking a Joker role.

name: Mini Golf
description:
Sid Sackson created this puzzle-ful game of beating par by moving a marker over a series of cards on the table. Various cards represent the "holes" as in the game of Golf. Adjacent cards determine how far the "ball" can move.

The game can be played solitaire but if the simultaneous action mechanic is added (as Sid suggests), this game supports more players.

name: Tieren auf der Spur
description:
From the back of the box:

Looking for an animal! - Who is the first to track down the trail?
We only now it is a predator, living in the jungle, more than 2m long and has sharp claws ...

Sixty yes/no Questions, found on the gameboard, give useful hints to find the animal. Smart combining the questions, which are marked green for correct and red for incorrect, gives you great chances to win the animal card.

name: Quizwrangle
description:
From the promotional material:

"Great fun for parties.
The questions cover a maddening range of topics.
Beautifully designed with 450 high quality, easy to handle cards, non-slip counters and decahedron dice.
Trivia games have swept North America.
Quizwrangle is the only all British trivia game.
Quizwrangle will be the game everyone wants to own."

name: La Segunda Guerra Mundial 2ªParte, Frente del Pacífico
description:
The 7th of December 1941, Japanese troops without previously declaring war, launched an attack to the US NAVY, based at Pearl Harbor.

This game represents the war in the Pacific Ocean

name: Zoodlums
description:
In Zooligans card game players take on the role of zookeepers trying to find animals to complete their exhibits. In so doing, they attract visitors to make the best zoo. The game is set up with a three exhibit goals, such as "4 or more reptiles" or "3 or more rainforest animals" that are central to all players. In addition, players have a secret continental theme, scoring them bonus visitors for animals from their continent.

When the game begins, players start with a hand of three animal cards. Each turn, players can bid on a worldwide animal in the auction. Then they play a card adding it to their zoo. When a player has all the animals to complete an exhibit goal, they can form the exhibit, attracting a number of visitors.

At the end of the game, the points are tallied, and the player with the most visitors wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: Campeones
description:
(from the coverback)
English (google translation)
Live a thrilling final as never Newteam SC between and FC Muppet!
Now you can enjoy the strength of football in this board game as simple as exciting.
Deploy your strategy, use your cards and you will get amazing goals.
When all your dreams are at stake and all your team depends on you, your passion for the game will take you to victory.
Who will win? Does the tactical skill of Oliver Atom or aggression of Mark Lenders?
Fight to the last breath!
(Based in Captain Tsubasa cartoons)



No official:This game is a faithful simulation of a soccer match cartoon of the Captain Tsubasa serie.

The objective of the game is that when you finish the game, your team has scored more goals than the opposite.
Before the game start there is the choosing to play 45 minutes or 90.

The game simulates a soccer match through a square board by both player's chips from each team as the ball moves. In turn, the player controls the team through a deck of team cards where describe the skills of each player and 3 cards of injuries on opposing players (21 total cards each player).

Player's chips can injure and even have warnings by yellow and red cards.

An interesting engine ball movement from a 6-sided die on the inside of the lid of the box with directions drawn on a grid 3x3 solves the movement of the ball where a tie in points between the player's chips.


De la contraportada:

Spanish
!Vive como nunca la apasionante final entre el Newteam S.C y el Muppet F.C!
Ahora puedes disfrutar de la intensidad del fútbol en este juego de mesa tan sencillo como trepidante
Despliega tu estrategia, utiliza bien tus cartas y marcarás goles increíbles.
Cuando todos tus sueños están en juego y todo tu equipo depende de ti, tu pasión por el fútbol te llevará hacia la victoria.
¿Quién ganará? ¿la habilidad táctica de Oliver Atom o la agresividad de Mark Lenders?
!Lucha hasta el último aliento!
(basado en la serie de dibujos Oliver y Benji)

---
No oficial:

Este juego es una fiel simulación de un partido de fútbol de serie de dibujos animados de Campeones.

El objetivo del juego es que cuando acabe el partido, tu equipo haya marcado más goles que el contrario.
Previamente al juego hay que escoger jugar a 45 minutos o a 90.

El juego simula un partido de fútbol, mediante un tablero cuadriculado por el que se mueven tanto las fichas de jugadores de cada equipo como el balón. A su vez, el jugador que controla el equipo juega con un mazo de cartas de equipo donde se describen las habilidades de cada jugador así como 3 cartas de lesiones sobre jugadores del equipo contrario (21 cartas en total cada jugador).

Los jugadores se pueden lesionar e incluso ser amonestados por tarjetas amarillas y rojas.

Un interesante motor de movimiento del balón a partir de un dado de 6 caras sobre la cara interior de la tapa de la caja con direcciones dibujadas en una cuadrícula 3x3 resuelve el movimiento de el esférico en los casos que haya empate de puntos entre las fichas de jugadores.

name: Star Wars: Rebel Missions Game
description:
Set in the Star Wars cartoon time line, Star Wars: Rebel Missions is a cooperative game for 6 to 12 year olds.

Team up with your fellow Rebels in daring missions to uncover the Imperial Codes in pulse-pounding race against the clock! The electronic audio device plays an epic and ominous soundtrack as players move stealthily between the Imperial installations, using dice and card powers to sabotage their factories and thwart their plans. Evade the evil Inquisitor and disrupt the Empire before time runs out to win!

PROMOTES:
Cooperation and teamwork
Strategic thinking
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Ants
description:
The game consists in placing ants in order to create the largest area with pheromones of your color. It is a tile placement game with a piling system and ants-themed. The game is free to print & play!

At the beginning of the game, players chose who will play as brown and who will play as beige.
Each turn a player must draw a tile and add it to his/her hand. He/She then chooses one for the two tiles in his hand and places it in the game area. To place a tile, at least two of the six edges must connect to a tile already present. It is possible to stack a tile on top of others if there is no empty gap underneath (the rule of the 2 edges connection does no apply in this case).

The game ends when all tiles have been placed. The player with the largest area of his color wins.

—user summary

name: Cartzzle: Exploration extrême
description:
In Extreme Exploration, experience the expeditions of Roald Hotfrost, the adventurer imagined by the bédéhist Jérôme Jouvray. Cartzzle is a new concept of board game containing a game, a work of art and puzzles.

The box holds a single Cartzzle, an endless one you can make with both sides of the 50 cards. Cartzzles are pictures you must first piece together by laying cards on top of each other (with or without the template, depending on your dedication). Then, start again, using challenges this time! Removing cards, flipping them, and laying them elsewhere will change the picture and also allow you to meet some challenges (as example: avoid the 9 deaths on Roald’s path).

name: Big Battle
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

M K Morrison developed Big Battle over a number of years. He fine tuned it by play testing against an international chess master in New Zealand. Big Battle is a chess variant played on a 10 by 10 chess board. It has two new pieces called Princes which combine the powers of the chess knight and the Big Battle Queen. The Big Battle queen in addition to the powers of the ordinary chess queen can also jump over an immediately adjacent piece. The pawns (called soldiers in Big Battle) can move one two or threes squares; not just on their first moves but for any move. It makes for a pretty sharp end game. Almost all the pieces in Big Battle have enhanced powers when compared to their chess counterparts.
