There have been a number of Big Battle tournaments in New Zealand, including two national tournaments. You can find out more about Big Battle at the Chess Variants page or at Zillions of games. They have a script for playing Big Battle.

name: Buddel-Wuddel
description:
(from the game box)
Rig-a-dig, dig!
The cheeky earth gnomes have stolen the treasures of the moles. Mole Max and his friends drive through the deep dark galleries to get back the treasures. But the way is dangerous as the gnomes drag them out of the trams. With a bit of luck the moles can step into the next tram or be freed by Goblin Gorgan. A digging dice game with tactics.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Qwink
description:
Scrabble Brand Qwink: Quick-as-a-wink-word game. Selchow & Richter No. 29

A strategic two-player word game. Players try to make words on their own boards, crossword fashion. Both players must use the same letters as they are called out, trying to make higher-scoring combinations than their opponent's. A center divider hides each player's progress until the game is over.

name: Twelve Teepees Memory
description: In this game, players try to hide all 5 of their Indians under teepees. The Indian pawns are placed in the center of the board and surrounded by the teepees. On your turn, you look under 1, 2 or 3 teepees depending on the number you spun on a spinner. If a teepee is empty, you place one of your pawns beneath it. If a teepee is covering another player's Indian, you exchange it for one of yours and return the opponent's pawn to the middle of the board. The first player to cover all 5 of his or her Indians is the winner.

name: Marengo
description:
Simple variation of the Napoleon's Last Battles system, with optional rules for facing, simulating the French versus the Austrians at Marengo in northern Italy on 14 June 1800.

The game has an attractive 39x30cm map, 70 counters which need to be mounted, and six pages of rules in French.

The game was published in the Casus Belli special edition #7 (April 1993).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Disney WordCrossing Game
description:
From the Box:
From Buzz to Belle, The Lion King to Lady & the Tramp, have fun with Disney's Word Crossing! There are two wonderful ways to word cross across the colorful game board.

Using your word strips,
Match the letters of yout favorite Disney Characters.
Match up the pictures from your favorite Disney movies.

Word up, word down, word cross. Tinkerbell will help you spin for more. The first player to play all his/her word strips wins!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: The Cat in the Hat I Can Do That! Card Game
description:
Kids game where 3 cards are selected from a laid out grid of cards (similar to Memory) to try to find one each of the three different types of cards in order create a wacky activity.
An Action Card (such as Crab Walk, Hop, Dance)
A Location Card (such as to the window, or into the kitchen)
A card as to where to hold a foam fishbowl (such as under your chin, or between your elbows).
If one of each type of card is not drawn all three are put back (similar to Memory), and it is the next player's turn.

If one of each card is selected, the player gets to act out the activity described by the 3 cards, and gets to keep the cards.
Player with the most cards when all are drawn is the winner.

Includes a foam fishbowl, and 24 cards

name: Mapominoes: Americas (N & S)
description:
MAPOMINOES is the game that takes you to the edge of the world!

This portable game is fun, easy to learn, educational and highly addictive and makes a great present for any family member interested in geography or travel.

It’s like dominoes but with maps, as you build a map of the Americas, by connecting countries that share a common border. Stay one step ahead of your opponents, as you race to be the first player to play all your country cards on the table and win the game. Block your opponents by holding on to Mexico or Colombia or open up South America by playing Brazil. Take a boat through the Caribbean Sea to Cuba or transit by train through the USA to Canada. Try not to get stuck with Suriname, or miss a boat to the Bahamas as you watch the country cards spread across the table. The excitement builds as you have fewer and fewer cards left to play, but less space to play them in as you reach the edge of the world. (The table’s edge). Every country card is different due to their varying border connections and hence no two games are ever the same in this clever game that you will want to play again and again. Play as a stand alone game or combine with Mapominoes games for other continents to make to expand the game to cover the world. A simple game with hidden strategic depth that gives it broad appeal to both children and adults.

name: Bypass
description:
In this game, your challenge is to build or share a roadway built by others to navigate from one side of the board to the other. Drop a traffic cone to protect a route you like, or "Bypass" one you don't. Make sure to watch for other players' roadways to 'break' them up before they have a complete route. Be the first person to complete a route to win.

On each turn, play one of your roadway tiles somewhere on the game board. You don't have to play the tiles in any particular order, and your route doesn't need to be straight - but over the twists and turns it must eventually create a path joining your color on both sides of the game board. Remember that all players share the roadway system, so try not to help someone finish ahead of you. After playing a roadway tile, draw a replacement and then the next player on your left takes their turn. Only after a tile has been surrounded on all four sides, players may stack a different tile on top of it, changing the route dramatically!

name: Tables and Chairs
description:
Stack high to win, stack wide to win, just don't let the stack of furniture fall!

The game is hanging in the balance...think you can stack one more table or one more chair without toppling the pile? Then grab a piece of furniture, and get ready to play! Players take turns stacking tables or chairs any way they can, until one of them topples the pile all over! Be careful because the entire game is a balancing act! The player with the fewest toppled furnishings at the end of the game is the winner or if you'd rather, be the one to finish stacking all your furnishings first!

Some may know the game Chairs... this is incredibly similar except you have both tables and chairs, not just chairs to work with! This variation of the game "Chairs" provides new surfaces & chair shapes to stack and balance. Think you can balance that round table on the square chair with holes in it? How about putting that 3-legged chair upside down on a short long coffee table piece.

Game comes with 3 different color tables and chairs of varying shapes and sizes. Add a new play element to your game night with the game, "Tables and Chairs"!

name: Sub Rosa: Spies for Hire
description:
As the leader of a top-secret spy agency, your task is to win control of various mercenary agents in the field. Use your influence to manipulate your opponents and place your bids to win agents to your organization.

Sub Rosa: Spies for Hire is a bidding, bluffing, area control microgame. On a player's turn, they place a token from their hand on one the secret agent cards in play; that token can be placed face-down to act as a bid, or face-up to use that agent's special ability. Once all tokens have been placed, the player who has won the most bids on agents wins the game. From these simple rules, a lot of opportunities arise for bluffing, tricking and manipulating your opponents.

The base game comes with 32 variable set-ups for a 4-player game, allowing for dynamic shifts in strategy and for some unique bluffing opportunities.

name: Empatia
description:
From the publisher:

Do you think of yourself as an empathetic person? Are you good at reading other people’s feelings and emotions? Then Empatia is right for you! In Empatia you’ll try to guess what other players like, and what is not their cup of tea. Empatia is a game filled with marvelous eerie illustrations – and your task is to find among them the ones that other players like the best. You have to empathize with them to choose correctly; you have to discover why they like a given picture more than the others – Is it the colors? Shapes? The person in the middle? A cute animal? Empatia is not a game for the cold-hearted, that’s for sure!

- What’s in the box? 68 large-sized cards with illustrations; 12 cards with numbers; 6 plastic diamonds; 1 cardboard scoring sheet; 6 wooden player tokens; 36 cardboard tokens; rulebook
- Beautiful and magical artwork
- Easy-to-learn rules
- 2 game modes – competitive and cooperative

Gameplay (basic version):

Each player has 6 cards in their hands. One player will be the judge of the round and gets rid of one card of which he thinks he will not need during the next rounds. His fellow players all choose one card (or two if there are only two or three players) they think the judge will like most. The judge shuffles the cards. All pictures are then shown face up. The fellow players try and guess which two cards the judge likes most (and which of these two is the absolute top) and get points according to the accuracy of their guesses. The first player to get 30 points wins.

Gameplay (cooperative play)

Twelve cards are laid face up on the table. The first player must find a key of exactly two words (prepositions and conjunctions don't count) that matches 3 of the cards on the table. The fellow players must then try and find not only those 3 cards, but also in which order the player would line them up (from the one that matches best the key to the one that matches it only better than the 9 remaining cards). The team then gets points according to their answers.

The purpose is to get most point as a team. According to the number of points reached, you will know how well you know each other.

name: Pio's Pigeon Post
description: Help Pio get the postage right. You'll need a little luck and, above all, some good math skills to get the job done. The player who can correctly calculate postage for the most mail wins.

name: Cryptrick: New Listings
description:
Trick-taking to “buy” leads: Expansion for up to 9 players
An expansion set that allows up to 9 people to play "Cryptrick", a trick-taking game where you buy leads.
A new strategy is born as blocks that were previously obtained by only one winner can now be divided among multiple people.

name: One Against the Dead
description:
One Against the Dead is a solitaire zombie game, abstracted to use a small set of components that you probably have laying around the house.

The player places cards on the table, revealing new section of the zombie-plagued city as he moves. The card placement determines numerous things; how many zombies are added to the city, which places cannot be moved through, and where various weapons and survivors that need to be rescued are. Ultimately, the goal of the game is for the player get out of the city before becoming overwhelmed by the ever-increasing zombie force that follows and blocks the player.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Kleiner Fuchs ganz groß
description:
A Native-American themed memory game for children.

Background story: Little Fox, a young Native American wants to be as brave as his father. He is sent out on his own to complete several difficult tasks. Can you help Little Fox succeed?

Aim of the game:
Being the first to complete 5 tasks.

Setup:
The 10 Indian path tiles are placed in a circle in random order. 7 tiles show tasks. The remaining 3 tiles show the sun, moon and the wise shaman. The 28 bush tiles are placed around the Indian path (on the face-down side, they show the same pictures as the ones on the path tiles). Each player gets a teepee board that has 5 slots for bush tiles. The Little Fox token is placed on the shaman path tile.

Gameplay:
Players take turns rolling the die and advancing Little Fox the corresponding number of spaces on the Indian path. If Little Fox lands on a task tile, the active player turns over a bush tile. If the bush tile shows the same picture as the task tile, the player gets to keep it and place it on his/her teepee board. If it is the wrong bush tile, it remains face-up.
If Little Fox lands on the sun tile, three bush tiles are turned over, then the die is rolled again. If Little Fox lands on the moon tile, all bush tiles that are face-up are turned face-down again. If Little Fox lands on the shaman tile, the player gets to take a tile of their choice.

The first player to have collected 5 bush tiles (= to have completed 5 tasks) wins the game.

Variants to increase difficulty include immediately turning bush tiles face-down again, and letting only the active player see a bush tile on the moon space.

name: Black Stories: Strange World Edition
description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with strange riddle stories from all over the world.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Guess Who? Clue Game
description:
It's a Game Mashup: Two favorite brands come together to create one awesome game. This Guess Who? game has a Clue twist. The game is packed with suspense as players try to guess the suspect, murder weapon, and scene of the crime. By asking yes or no questions about their opponent's cards in the grid, they'll uncover the mystery by process of elimination. Ready to solve the mystery? Make a correct accusation to win.

—description from the publisher

name: Preguntados
description:
Preguntados is a question and answer game in six different categories: geography, history, art, science, entertainment, sports. To win, you will have to get the characters corresponding to each of the categories. Turn the wheel and chance will decide which questions you will have to answer. If you fall in the special space, you can play to get the character you choose. Test your knowledge and challenge your friends! The famous mobile app, now in board games!

—description from the publisher

name: Quorum
description:
Quorum is a humorous game about the formation of government in Italy. The map depicts the Italian Parliament and the stairs in front of the palace. Every player has two Leader pawn (with the faces of real Italian politicians from the '90s) and 4 Peones pawns. Every turn he can move two of them: Leaders move of two steps, Peones of one. A system of Attack, Defense and Special cards, everyone with a humorous comment, are used for bonus movements, stops, putting pawns under investigation and/or in prison, and so on.
When 7 pawns reach the inside of the Parliament, they can share the 7 Minister seats, that have a different point value. Each pawn counts for one vote. But if players do not agree, the game goes on so more pawn will enter and both the number of votes and candidates will vary. If 13 pawns reach the Parliament, a special procedure to ensure a government is adopted.
The score is partially open and partially secret, so not to show openly who is going to win and leave the game of alliance and bargains open. The first one to reach 51 points (usually after 2 or 3 governments) is the winner.
Since Italian election system changed abruptly just after 1993, the authors developed optional rules for the "Sistema maggioritario".

name: Monopoly Express
description:
Quick-play introduction to the classic game Monopoly. Be the player with the most money at the end of the game!

It’s all about raking in the rent by putting your tokens on as many properties as you can. But beware, any property you own can be snatched by the next player who lands there. On your turn roll, move your token, and then pay rent, buy, build or auction. When you land on any colored property space, you can build on it – even if someone else owns it. The building tokens have a number on them and they can only be played if they are the next highest token. Look out for the special die that helps build or demolish properties. Properties and utilities cannot be mortgaged in Monopoly Express. If you run out of money, the game is over. The player with the most money wins

Gameboard, 32 colored property tokens (8 per player), 8 Chance cards, 8 Community Chest cards, 2 Utility cards, 4 movers, a money pack, and a die.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Judge Dredd Miniatures Game: Block War
description:
From the Publisher's website***




Block War is the first supplement for the Judge Dredd miniatures game, adding new forces and new rules for the latest wave of Mega-City One models.
Inside you will find rules for bringing vehicles to the tabletop, for waging huge riots, invasions, and block wars, as well as new forces such as the Brit-Cit Justice Department and Citi-Def squads - all guaranteed to bring mayhem to your games!
We are constantly updating Block War, and it will always be available as a free download, allowing you to dive straight in and start playing. All forces and new rules build upon the campaign system presented in the core rulebook, allowing you to expand your games to the furthest reaches of the comic strip, past the walls of Mega-City One and into the world beyond.
May your Lawgiver always fire true!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Wildwechsel
description:
From the publisher:

The players have to collect 5 different colored discs with their animal as quickly as possible. But the animals differ from each other in their ways of walking and their special abilities.

On their journey through the woods, the animals leave tracks that are marked on the board with the special pen. If a space has been entered twice, it acts as a barrier for the next animals, because the frequency of the animals has attracted the attention of the poacher. Consequently, the field of play constantly becomes more restricted and the way more difficult.

With the game pieces, you can cause further difficulties for the other animals or clear away obstacles from your own.

Contents:
1 board
4 animals
24 game pieces: 3 double moves, 6 wolves, 7 worms, 8 gamekeeper's hats
20 colored discs in 5 colors
1 colored pen
1 die

name: Chameleon Time
description:
Welcome to sunny Madagascar! You came here to make photos of one of the most interesting creatures — chameleons! Travel the Island and keep your eyes peeled for the perfect opportunity!

Chameleon Time is a dexterity party game in which players will try to make photos of six different chameleons. At the beginning of the turn the top card of chameleon stack is revealed. The card has two features: terrain and chameleon. Players will then locate the tile with corresponding terrain and time. Time is determined by the number of already made photos, so if for example a purple chameleon by the waterfall is revealed and players already captured two such chameleons, players will need to take the tile with waterfall and two time sections. A player who has six different chameleons immediately wins the game.

name: Dino Battle: Logical Game.
description:
Long ago, in the Mesozoic era, dinosaurs dominated the Earth for many millions of years. They fought for survival in the thriving prehistoric jungle and evolved in constant battle with their own kind.

The game Dino Battle invites you to make an exciting journey into the era of dinosaurs and by choosing your own kind - lead it to dominance on the planet! Build a colony of your kind in a winning combination or don't let your opponent do it. The logic battle will not leave indifferent any player!

During each round, players take turns laying out the tiles of creatures of their kind on the board, trying to fulfill the conditions of victory. As soon as one of the players fulfills them, the round ends immediately:

Plants
They win when they manage to build a straight line vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 5 consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

Ceratops
They win when they manage to build a straight line vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 4 consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

T-Rexes
They win when they manage to build a straightline vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 3consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

Pterodactyls
They win when they lay out the 5th tile of their kind on the board, regardless of the relative position of these tiles.

name: Monopoly: España
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Official Hasbro Monopoly variant set in Spain.

Cities: Cádiz, Jerez de la Frontera, Jaén, Badalona, Elche, Palencia, Badajoz, Pamplona, Leganés, Sabadell, León, L'Hospitalet de Llobregat, Móstoles, Cartagena, Terrassa, Albacete, Cáceres, Vigo, Barcelona, Santander, Cebolla, Parla.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Market Madness
description:
A fun and easy game of the stock market. Players buy and sell stocks in blocks of 1000 shares and play Fluctuation cards that affect the value of those stocks. The wealthiest player at the end of the game is the winner. Advanced rules can be used that allow short selling, buying on margin, etc.

The approximate playing time is a guess.

This is one of Yaquinto's "album games" (same height and depth as a vinyl album jacket, though thicker).

name: Stratego: Democrats vs. Republicans
description:
The White House is up for grabs!!

It’ll take more than kissing babies and a silver tongue to win the White House as rival parties face off in this classic strategy game. You'll need all your party members aligned and in sync as you march to 1600 Pennsylvania Ave.

• Can you keep your campaign manager on board?
• Can you out-spin the Spin Doctors?
• Will your outspoken celebrity backers help or hurt your cause?
• Can your Secret Service protect your secrets and service your interests?

You'll need to run one heck of a campaign to capture the ultimate prize...

name: Animal Village
description: Animal Village is a worker-placement style game played solely with cards in which players try to cultivate both crops and sheep to score points.

name: Chaos in Gotham City
description:
In the trick-taking game Chaos in Gotham City, each player becomes a villain and attempts to cause mayhem while avoiding encounters with Batman.

You play as many rounds as the number of players. Each round, deal players 6-10 cards depending on the player count. The deck consists of 40 cards in four suits numbered 1-10, with some cards depicting either Batman or Bruce Wayne. At the start of each trick, reveal one of the fifteen location cards; the winner of the trick claims this card. Reveal the top card of the undealt cards to determine trump. Each player receives one of eight villain cards, each with a special power.

The first player in a round leads a card, and all players must follow suit, if possible. Whoever played the highest trump wins the trick and collects the location and played cards; if no one played trump, whoever played the highest card in the suit led wins. The winner leads to the next trick.

After all tricks have been played, players sum the Batman points on the cards and locations they collected. Whoever has the most Batman points (or is tied for the most) doesn't score the chaos points they collected this round. Shuffle all cards to set up for the next round.

Whoever has the most chaos points after 2-6 rounds wins.

name: Treat Yo Self!
description:
Because you deserve it! In this fast-paced game of bidding and bluffing, it pays to pamper yourself. Grab tokens, place bids, and buy some gifts for yourself. Don’t get too greedy or else you could go bust. The player that can collect the most valuable and unique items throughout the game wins. Purchase a bubble wrap dance floor, full grain leather keyboard, or even a diamond encrusted hand-mixer in this fun and light family strategy game. Remember, you are beautiful, you are fierce, and you deserve to TREAT YO SELF!

—description from the publisher

name: Lynx
description:
Be the first to find all your pictures on the board, collect the most cards and win!

The boardgame (made of several moving pieces, for replayability) depicts various every-day objects.

At the beggining of esch turn, players are dealt with three facedown cards. Each card depicts an object. Simultanously, all players look at their cards and try to spot the same object on the board, claiming each find. When one of them finds all three, scoring begins: that player collects his three cards, while the other players collect the number of cards each was able to find. Turns continue like this until one player collects (finds) 25 objects.
publishers: Educa Borras, Identity Games International B.V.

name: Doctor Panic: Promo Cards
description: A set of 4 extra patients.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Medical, Party Game, Real-time

name: Kim Possible Game
description:
From Publishers website:
Here's the Sitch… Dr. Drakken is trying to take over the world. It's up to Kim Possible, Ron Stoppable and Rufus to stop him.

Unfortunately, Dr. Drakken has hired some of Kim's archenemies to guard his lair. Drakken also has traps and moving walls ready for KP and her friends.

Be the first player to complete your mission card and defeat Dr. Drakken and you win!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tocapus
description:
The fabled gold of the Incas lures. It's going to be an exciting treasure hunt. Treasure hunters with their scouts lead us through the maze. On the way, there are several sites with many treasures to discover.
The first player who reaches the end of the maze wins and will get the main treasure.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: BrainBox: Nature
description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player one to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 or more players, ages 8+. Contains 54 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight sided die. Have fun!

Box Contains

54 picture/question cards
1 rules card
1 sand timer
1 eight-sided die
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Albi, Asmodee, Green Board Game Co., moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Mystery of the Temples: Promo Crystal Grids
description: A set of four extra crystal grids, that are added to the draft during the initial phase of the game. These add extra player powers, giving the game more variety.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Arctic Race
description:
Arctic Race is a family game of tactical racing in polar surroundings. In the game all players sponsor two dog sled teams, and the player whose both teams have reached the North Pole first, wins.

Each player is dealt a card showing the two teams that the player sponsors. The players keep their cards hidden, so the players' teams are unknown. Several players can share a single team, but only one player can have a specific combination of two teams. The board is built differently for every game out of big ice floats. Several weather hazards surround the ice track at the beginning of the game, and are moved onto the track during the game. The players are granted godlike abilities in the game, as they are allowed to move the hazards on their turn, as well as any dog sled they wish. If a hazard is ever moved into the same space as a dog sled, the dog sled cannot move before the hazard has been moved away.

The game is played by rolling two dice: a movement die and a hazard die. The movement die lets the player move a dog sled 1-4 spaces on the board, and sometimes ALSO lets the player place a crack in the ice on the board. Cracks can only be crossed by using ladder cards that the players have three of when the game starts. Without ladders cracks cannot be crossed and players have to go around them. The hazard die usually lets the player move one of three types of hazards, sometimes it allows a free choice of hazards, and sometimes the player can move no hazard at all. All this makes for a very exciting race, and an entertaining 30+ minutes.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Hidden Roles, Modular Board, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Ansagrams
description:
Ansagrams is a quiz game that tests more than just your general knowledge.

Each card has five general knowledge questions on the front and a random letter on the back. Players each attempt to answer these questions as quickly as possible, but all you're really looking for is the first letter to each answer as you need to take those five letters and anagram them into a five-letter word. Do this first, and you win the card. Be the first player to spell a three-letter word with the cards you've won, and you win the game.

name: Zooloretto: Langer Ludwig
description:
Zooloretto: Langer Ludwig is a single tile expansion for Zooloretto. It was published (together with a few small expansions for other games) in the 20 Jahre Darmstadt Spielt to celebrate the 20th anniversary of Spielekreis Darmstadt, the Darmstadt boardgame club.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player to fill his 6-space enclosure takes the Langer Ludwig enclosure from the middle of the table. Once per game the owner of the enclosure can take up to 3 animal tiles from an enclosure and place them back in the draw pile (in any order). For each tile he placed back, the player receives 2 coins from the bank.

name: We Are Dead: Zombie Mall Massacre – Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
A set of 6 promo cards that was available during the We are Dead: Zombie Mall Massacre Kickstarter campaign.

Some/all may become available in the future by the publisher but are not part of the retail edition

The cards include Mall Santa, Ninja, Cowboy, Robot, Pirate, and Zombie Hunter

These all hero cards each with their own ability:

Cory "The Butcher" Hutton - 2 damage. Infection tokens may not be played against this hero

Daniel "Dead Shot" Morgan - Stubborn. Attack card values are worth half (rounded up) this fight. Shoppers take 2 attack cards to slay

Rich Dixon AKA Mall Santa - Deals damage equal to the number of shoppers on the revealed token this fight

AJ Colombatto - This hero steals 6 points from your score (you lose 6 points)

DSM-83X "The Sanitizer" - This hero is not worth any points. All shoppers get away. Can be used during a horde attack to stop them from slaying any humans

Jocelyn The Silent Terror - You can't discard or draw cards at the end of this turn

name: Chroń Przyrodę z Celnikami
description:
In Chroń Przyrodę z Celnikami (Protect Nature with Customs Officers) the players command special groups of customs officers, whose task is to break the grid of smugglers involved in the illegal importation to Poland endangered animals and plants covered by CITES. You have to use your wits, sense of observation and vigilance to detect in the offices of customs as much as possible attempts of smuggling of illegal goods and thus discourage smugglers to their future business. Remember! On your effectiveness depends the fate of endangered animals and plants.

On a turn the player takes an officer (represented by a cube) and puts it on the end of one of several lines (which number is determined by the number of players) leading to the customs office of specific kind. In each customs office there are 6 cargo. 2 of them are revealed and others are hidden. Each player know the content of one of the hidden stacks. The players form those lines to be the first to catch illegal cargo which grants the points to the them. After four rounds of play, the player who has the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Memory, Set Collection

name: Hexenstich
description: A clever trick-taking game of faeries, witches and dwarves. Faeries represent positive points, witches negative points and dwarf cards are neutral. Highest numbered card of the type (dwarf, witch, faerie) most played in the trick wins the trick (if a tie - i.e. two dwarf cards and two witch cards - the group formed last is the type from which the winning card will come.

name: Talvisota 1939-1940: La Guerre Russo-Finlandaise
description:
Based on a system favoring the fog of war and the uncertainties of military preparations, "Talvisota 1939-1940: The Soviet-Finnish Winter War" places both players in a situation requiring them to choose their strategies after careful reflection. Maintaining one’s war morale is important, but the decisive results are mainly achieved by considering the potential actions of the other side. In the solitaire mode, the player controls the Soviet forces against a Finnish A.I. opponent. System by Lionel Liron.

Published in VaeVictis #158

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---

In 1939, faced with Nazi Germany’s expansionist politics, Stalin demands of Finland some strategic territories necessary for the defense of Leningrad. Helsinki refuses and on 30 November, with no prior Declaration of War, the Red Army attacks the Finnish territory with five armies and 28 divisions.

The strength ratio is crushingly in the Soviets’ favor with 400,000 combatants, 1500 tanks and a modern aviation against 265,000 Finnish soldiers and 20 tanks. To everyone’s surprise, the overwhelming numerical and material superiority of the Russians is broken by the fierce resistance and the bravery of the Finnish forces.

Despite a front extending from the Arctic to the isthmus of Karelia, and the offensives of mostly 3 against 1, the lack of preparation and coordination of Stalin’s forces, the extreme climatic conditions and the Finnish belligerence jostle all predictions and overturn military logic. Mannerheim’s troops employ Molotov cocktails, surprise infiltrations and an optimal exploitation of the terrain to resist the Russian giant until March. But the lack of armament and international support, the limited numbers of troops, and a Soviet surge irreversibly compel the little Nordic outlier to sign an accord on 12 March 1940.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Haunted House
description:
From the box:

'THRILLS - CHILLS - EXCITING
PLAY FOR HIDDEN TREASURE

HOOTING OWL SPINNER
SPOOKS BEHIND DOORS
HIDDEN JEWEL IN THE ATTIC...!'

This game comes in a MASSIVE 22" x 19" x 8" box. Two metal stands are inserted into the back of the game to support the house during gameplay.

Players make their way through a molded plastic three-dimensional multi-roomed Haunted House (which is almost as large as the box) using a unique owl fruit-machine type spinner that actually 'hoots' to direct movement, until one reaches the point - a secret door - where a Jewel is located. Thereafter the leader is always in possession of this Jewel.

The player holding the Jewel who is first to land on the appropriate square (by exact count) escapes the Haunted House and wins the game.

name: The Marlborough Man: Blenheim - 1704, Oudernarde - 1708
description: This simulates two of the "Duke of Marlborough's" Battles during the "War of the Spanish Succession" featuring Blenheim(1703) & Oudenarde(1708) and makes a play on words regarding a more famous cigarette maker. It has two 22-inch by 17-inch mapsheets in four sections that have to be put together, and the game's two countersheets have to be mounted and cut apart prior to commencing gameplay with these. There are plenty of Cavalry involved in these, as well as the Dragoons which seem to be in transition in Historical terms. For the price that you pay, it should be well worth the Value that you'd expect from the acclaimed designer.

name: Byzantine Chess
description:
An ancient chess variant which uses a 16 X 4 circular board. Piece movement is the same except that Queen moves only one space diagonally and Bishop moves two diagonally, jumping the first space. Additionally, two pawns blocking one another's paths may be removed (both are removed).

A modern variant by David Reynolds using the same board is known as Circular Chess.

name: Turning Points
description:
On each turn a player will place a single piece in a space on the board, lying down and pointing to an adjacent space (or off the board). If there is another piece in the space pointed to, that piece is rotated one notch clockwise (i.e. 90 degrees on a square grid, 60 degrees on a hex grid.) If the pieces just rotated now points to a space that contains a piece, that piece is also rotated one notch clockwise, and if that piece now points to a space which contains a piece… This process is continued until a piece points to an empty space or off the edge of the board. Then play passes to the next player to the left.

Rules Link

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 1st Competition

name: Daitou
description:
'Daitou' (大東) is a 2- or 3-player train game set on the Daitou Islands (大東島), Japan.

The Daitou Islands (大東島) is a group of 3 small islands in the Pacific, two of which are inhabited, and which are more than 400 kilometers away from the nearest other inhabited place (Okinawa). The islands were populated in the late 19th and early 20th century. Commercial sugar cane cultivation and fishing (mainly for consumption on the islands) are the main sources of income. In the early 20th century, a small freight train network was build on South Daitou Island (南大東島) to get the sugar cane to the harbor. This railroad network served until 1983.

In the game ‘Daitou’, players build sugar cane farms and railroads. Life on the islands is expensive, however, and the margins of profit are small. Efficiency is key. Whoever made the biggest fortune after three years wins the game.

The game is currently a prototype.
categories: Economic, Farming, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver
publishers: (Web published), Papercut Games, Print & Play Productions

name: Blanc Noir
description:
You are the leader of a team of adventurers, using special cards and scrolls to deploy your men. The goal is to get rid of your hand as quick as you can, dodging the dangers like dragons, golems and so on. Who will be the first to complete this quest?

Blanc Noir plays like a themed version of UNO as each card has a color and number, and on a turn a player can play a card matching either the color or number of the last played card. If he can't do so, he must draw a card from the deck. Cards with numbers higher than 9 have special powers, such as the standard Reverse and Draw actions, but also Scroll cards that are drawn from a separate deck and played for beneficial effects.

name: Tater Freighter
description:
Will you be the master of the Tater Freighter? The baron of the Jam Tram? The captain of the Shrimp Blimp? Or will you skip out and just Tater Later?

In Tater Freighter, players try to outwit their opponents using their vehicles to swipe the most food. The person with the most food at the end of five rounds wins.

Players take turns simultaneously. Each Round:

New food is revealed
Players choose a vehicle secretly, planning and bluffing their opponents to claim the available food.
Players reveal and resolve their vehicles. Food is claimed in ascending order.
Players collect claimed food. If multiple players choose the same vehicles the food splits. If it can't split, it remains for other players to claim.
Once all claimed food is collected, the next round begins.


At the end of five rounds, players score their earned points for the sets of food you've collected. The player with the most food wins.

Tater Freighter is easy to learn. Remember this rules rhyme and you are ready to play:

Place Eight Crates.
Reveal a Vehicle.
Lines Split Limes,
Planes Split Grains,
Blimps Split Shrimps,
Trams Split Jams,
Freighters Split Taters,
Or Later Tater!
Split or they sit.
Fill bins to Win.


—description from the publisher

name: Cartoona: Long Necks Expansion
description:
In this zany expansion, Cartoona creatures can become even stranger!

It includes six neck tiles that can be placed in-between a head tile and a front body tile. These neck tiles can be placed even when the head and body have already been connected! They can also be stacked on top of one another for some seriously long necks!

Neck tiles can also be placed on the creatures of your opponents in an attempt to disrupt single-color creature scoring, or give negative points with the "crick in the neck" tile.

Below are the neck tiles included in the expansion:

One yellow and purple dual-color neck, worth six points
One yellow crick in the neck, worth -3 points
One magenta neck with Adam's apple, worth 4 points
One blue neck with a collar, worth 5 points
One wavy magenta neck worth 3 points
One straight magenta neck, worth 3 points


Four new cards will come with the expansion including:

One "remove neck" tile card
One "steal neck" tile card
One "-4 pain in the neck" card and
One "use a neck as any leg or tail" tile card

name: Redraw
description:
Redraw is a unique social game in which you will be able to express your artistic IAM. Your task will be to paint, redraw and embellish the drawings that other players have previously created. Earn cards by guessing slogans drawn by others.

The winner will be the person who first
5 password cards.

—description from the publisher (English)

Redraw to wyjątkowa gra towarzyska, w której będziecie mogli wyrazić swoje artystyczne JA. Waszym zadaniem będzie malowanie, przerysowywanie oraz upiększanie rysunków które stworzyli wcześniej inni gracze. Zdobywajcie karty, odgadując hasła narysowane przez innych.

Zwycięzcą zostanie osoba, która jako pierwsza
uzyska 5 kart z hasłami.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Redraw ist ein einzigartiges soziales Spiel, in dem du deinen künstlerischen IAM zum Ausdruck bringen kannst. Ihre Aufgabe ist es, die Zeichnungen, die andere Spieler zuvor erstellt haben, zu malen, neu zu zeichnen und zu verschönern. Verdiene Karten, indem du die von anderen gezeichneten Sprüche errätst.

Der Gewinner ist die Person, die zuerst
5 Passwort-Karten.

—description from the publisher (German)

name: Crosshand Poker
description:
Crosshand Poker is a cross between scrabble and poker.
108 (two decks including jokers) traditional playing-card symbol tiles being played on a scrabble-esque grid board inclusive of double and triple scores.

Players draw and update 5 tiles in their rack and play poker 'hands' of tiles branching from the center of the board. Each type of hand has a different score as set out in the. Very much like scrabble except the scores are not on a per-tile basis.
Winner has most points when pool of tiles is depleted.
publishers: Holdson, Holdsworth Thos & Sons, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Fairy Bucks
description:
From the New World Games website:

A Magical Auction in Fairyland
for 2-5 Players

Once upon a time the economy in Fairyland took a turn for the worst. In an effort to raise a little cash, the King decided it was wise to open up some of Fairyland's most loved treasures for sale to the general public. People came from far and wide to buy memorabilia from their favorite stories. Some just came to profit from the favorable exchange rate and re-sale of the items.

Whatever your purpose is for bidding, use your Fairy Bucks wisely and you just may be living happily ever after.

name: Bist Du sicher?
description: Bist Du sicher? (Are you safe?) is a game about life, and the problems that come one's way. Players draw tiles, resulting in both positive events and successes, as well as setbacks. However, players can take the cash they collect to buy insurance to negate the negative effects of the setbacks. It is essentially a multi-player solitaire game, and each player has a private board to track their accomplishments.

name: Bolsa de Valores
description: This is not the same game relesead by Grow (later renamed Ações Exame). This one was released by Estrela before 1971 and is much more simple. Players buy and sell stock and try to make more money, from negotiation and from profits.

name: Mandala
description: Mandala is a deceptively simple game of set collection played on a randomly-created path of Icehouse pieces. It is an adaptation of Knizia's Tutankhamen for 5 rainbow stashes of Looney Pyramids. Players place their pawns at the outside of the spiral of pyramids and collect pyramids as they move toward the center. They score points for having the majority in any particular "set" (group of 5 identical pyramids, e.g. 5 medium yellow pyramids). The player with the most points when all players (except one) have reached the center is the winner.

name: Flieg zu mir
description:
The game is a memory game for Young and Old. You will get to know many species of local birds and trees. The players let male and female birds of the same species fly in the same kind of trees. Besides good memory, tactical skill and luck are necessary for the winner.
Each player tries to get as many bird pairs as possible .

name: High-Low Rack-o
description:
Be the first player to “go Rack-O” on each hand by drawing and discarding until you have ten cards aligned in numerical order -- either high to low OR low to high.

Deal cards to each player and they keep them in the order they were dealt but place them in a row face-up. The dealer will take the top card off the draw pile and trades it with any card in their sequence, passing the removed card to the next player for them to use. Players MUST swap the passed card with a card in their sequence. Once the card goes around the table and reaches the dealer, it is discarded and it's the next player's turn to draw a new card. Special Wild and Swap cards are also in the deck.

name: Ohne Haufen, dumm gelaufen
description:
Ohne Haufen, dumm gelaufen is a fast card game about camel caravans.

Players simultaneously try to to find matching cards to form a caravan with a certain number of dromedaries. The number of dromedaries you need changes every round and is determined by a wooden chip that is drawn. You may not have two dromedaries of the same colour in your caravan.

If a players has built a correct row with the needed number of dromedaries, he completes the row with a "Haufen" (pile of muck).

Every round the fastest player gets the chip that determined the caravans lenght. After 7 rounds (all chipes are distributed) players add up the value of thier chips, the player with the highest total wins.

name: Fortunata
description:
Game overview from the publisher

Each player starts the game with a Mouse and a Bee plus an equal share of the sixteen unique characters. Each character has a unique power which is defined on its card.

Pieces start off the board and are brought onto the board as the game progresses. The pieces maneuver, trying to grab the Gold Ring and carry it to the edge of the board. The first player to end a turn with one of their pieces wearing the Gold Ring on the edge of the board wins!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Go Fetch!
description:
Go Fetch! is a children's game from Asmodee. Players hold a cup (puppy) and the aim is to capture (fetch) the balls as they pop out of the doggie bowl. The players are in a race to capture the balls before their competition do and 3 challenge cards mix up the requirements for each round.

The goal of the game is to collect as many bits of kibble (colored balls) as you can before the other players snatch them up. To add another level of difficulty, players can also choose to only eat certain colors of kibble or only 1 piece of kibble in each color for those puppies who are on a diet.

Not only is the game fun for children and their parents but the game can also be educational as it promotes colour recognition, counting skills and hand-eye co-ordination.

The game is well constructed also with holes in the bottom of the puppy cups that allow the balls to slip into the cups when they are banged down on top of the balls.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ferengi: Bok's Marauder – Resistance is Futile Blind Booster Pack
description: This ship is one of the ships players purchase as an entrance fee to parcipate in the Star Trek Attack Wing "Resistance Is Futile" tournaments.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: The Time Pawnshop
description:
You are an item soul master. You take responsible for the sale of old goods, but in addition, you also accept the commission of others, through the information provided by customers to gradually repair the relationship damage between the owner and the items.
Occasionally there will be an old thing to come to your shop; these old things will be the identity of the soul in your shop, for your shop to bring a different scene.

name: Raise the Shields
description:
All six sectors of the province are under attack! Quick! Get those shields up now!

Raise the Shields is a print-and-play roll-and-write game of direct conflict. Seek to destroy your neighbor's cities while simultaneously working to erect shields in an effort to protect your own cities.

All players share two of the same dice while also rolling one personal die. These three dice must be assigned to three different tasks:

Work sector: Where will you work on connecting your shield generator to the power plant?
Shape: What shape will you fill in order to connect the generator with the power?
Attack: In what sector will you attack your neighbor?


Use these basic actions to erect shields, to destroy neighboring cities, and to open up new bonus abilities.

Be the first to raise all your shields or destroy an enemy city and you win the game!


In the solo mode, instead of attacking other players, you will assign damage to yourself.


—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Top Trumps Quiz: Star Wars
description:
Are you a Star Wars expert? Can you identify the difference between Episodes 4-6 & 1-3? Can you remember specific scenes from Episode 7: The Force Awakens? Travel to a galaxy far, far away and test your Star Wars knowledge to see if you are a force to be reckoned with. With 500 questions to answer, it's great for the whole family, whether you want a quick game on the go or to spend some time seeing how much you really know! With a Top Trumps twist at the end to test your memory, can you remember what you learned just moments ago?

Key Features


Quizzical Star Wars fun with a Top Trumps Twist
Entertaining educational card game loved for bringing your favourite Star Wars characters to life including questions on Yoda, Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker
500 puzzling and captivating questions that will test your knowledge and memory on the Star Wars Saga
Easy-to-carry plastic case means there are no limits on gameplay
Prepare to outsmart your opponents, discover new and exciting facts and duel your way to becoming the Top Trump


—description from the publisher
publishers: Winning Moves France, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: NAZCA (나스카)
description:
A drawing party game for 3 to 6 players, themed around the ancient NAZCA Lines.

Players each draw a picture to match a theme card.
On their turn, players cover their drawings with six "cover tiles" and reveal one square per round.

Players score points for being the first to guess the correct answer while only seeing part of the picture, and even more points for guessing with fewer clues.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Sick & Twisted Charades
description:
Charade what!? Split into teams and face off in a raucous game of charades! Guess the saucy, suggestive, and downright obscene clues in order to score. Or stick it to your rivals with challenging twists to make them suffer. Be sure to peg your opponents with the foam ball when their time is up, or they’ll never stop! This rude, rowdy party game will get your mind in the gutter and your friends rolling on the floor!

Contests: 500 Doubles-Sided Cards, 24 Twist Tiles, 1 Sand Timer, 1 Ball, Instructions.

How To Play:

1) Separate into two teams. If you have an odd number of players, make the teams as even as possible.

2) The cards have a green side and a pink side. Select which color will be used for the entire game.

3) Shuffle the Twist Tiles and create a face-down draw pile. Each team draws one tile.

4) Select which team will guess first and which player from that team will act first (the Actor).

5) Start the timer!

6) The Actor draws a card adn acts out the word or phrase.
Acting Rules:
You cannot say words or make any sounds with your mouth.
You cannot mouth any words or write any letters in the air.

7 The Actor's team shouts out guesses. When a teammate guesses the card, the Actor draws another card and keeps going.

8) At the end of the turn, collect the cards that were correctly guessed and put them in a score pile for the team. Any cards that were not guessed are removed from the game.

9) Now it's the other team's turn. Continue taking turns, alternating teams, and selecting a different actor each time.

Twist Tiles: Mess With Your Opponents

Correctly guess cards with a Twist icon to earn tiles that will sabotage the other team or give your team an advantage.

1) At the start of a turn, the team that's not guessing may choose to play ONE of their Twist Tiles. Then the guessing team may choose to play ONE of their Twist Tiles.

2) Read each played tile out loud and follow the rule written on it for the entire turn. (Rules affecting the Actor may be suspended in order to draw and read cards, but must be followed when acting out the card.)

PASS ONE CARD: These Twist Tiles do not need to be played at the start of the turn. If the guessing team has one of these tiles, they may play it at any time in order to skip a card.

3) At the end of the turn, the guessing team draws one Twist Tile for each correctly guessed card with a Twist icon on it.

4) Review all of the Twist Tiles earned that turn. Select ONE to keep and discard the rest.

5) Create a discard pile of any played or discarded Twist Tiles. If the draw pile runs out, shuffle the discard pile.

NOTE: There is no limit to the number of Twist Tiles a team can have.

THE BALL: The Timer Doesn't End The Turn - You Do!
When the timer runs out, any member of the throwing team (the team that is not guessing) may throw the ball at the Actor.

- If the actor dodges the ball, they may continue acting out clues and scoring. The throwing team has to keep taking shots!

- If the Actor is hit with the ball, the turn ends.

- If the Actor catches the ball, the turn ends, but the guessing team draws an additional Twist Tile before selecting one to keep.

THROWING RULES:

- Not in the face!
- Inf the ball misses, a member of the throwing team must retrieve the ball and return to their original seat before throwing it again.

Note: The guessing team may warn the Actor when the timer is getting low, but they cannot interfere with throwing.

WINNERS!: After all players have had a chance to act, count up the cards in each team's score pile. Whichever team has the most cards is the winner!

Note: If one team is larger, one member of the smaller team will be the Actor again, so both teams take the same number of turns. Want a longer game? Have everyone be the Actor two or three times before counting your score.

DELINQUENTS: At some point, someone is going to screw up. Here's what to do...

- If an acting rule or Twist Tile rule is broken, the card being acted is removed from the game and the guessing team cannot score it. The Actor draws another card and continues their turn.

- If a throwing rule is broken, the throw does not count. The throwing team must throw again.

- If the guessing team intercepts the ball or interferes with a throw, the turn immediately ends.

name: Space Defenders
description: Space Defenders is a tribute to the arcade games of the 1970s and 1980s. Up to four players must defend earth from hordes of attacking invaders from outer space by eliminating all of them before they reach the bottom row of the board.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Monsters!
description:
"The Battle Game of Colossal Combat"

A simple miniatures-style board game where each player takes the role of one giant monster, wreaking havoc on the city and each other.

Included in the game are a rules book, a book of character sheets, maps and various play aids, including cardboard stand-up monster playing pieces.
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Bull In A China Shop
description: This game features a miniature wooden maze that resembles a china shop. A top, painted to look like a bull is spun into the maze. The player uses a magnetic prod to maneuver the "bull" through the shop to knock over as many china pins as possible and score points. Be careful not to knock over the miniature people pins!
publishers: alfaset, Front Porch Classics, University Games, Zoch Verlag

name: Venture Forth: Pandora's Jar Promo
description: A single treasure card, given out as a promotional item at SPIEL'11 and to people who pre-ordered or Kickstarted Venture Forth.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Raven Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Collective.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Stack Attack
description:
You'll need a steady hand to attack this stack!

Roll and play your dice on the center Quake Plate!

You can build up the tower using neighboring numbers only (ie: if there is a 2 dot die as the last played, you can add a 1 dot, or a 3). So which direction should you go? That's part of the strategy! You'll want to play as many dice as you can... but not if it means the tower will topple!

Each player gets 5 dice and a dice rolling cup (everything is color coordinated, so you have a red player, orange play, green player, blue player).

Knock it over, you get no points, whereas each other player receives one point for each die they had in the fallen tower.

Get all your dice onto the tower before it topples? You get points and no one else does!

—description from the publisher

name: Lost Hedgehog
description:
Ёжик-Потеряшка ("Lost Hedgehog") is a speed matching game. Five cards form your reference: a white horse, green frog, brown bear, yellow owl, and blue elephant. Then, you will draw a card from a 40-card deck. All the cards in the deck have two of these animals of different colors on them. Your job is to find which animal or color is not represented on the card at all, and slap that reference card. You then claim the card that was flipped over. If there is an exact match (i.e. a green frog), disregard the other rule and slap that exact reference card. You then claim the card that was flipped over.

Play proceeds until all the cards in the deck have been claimed -- most cards is the winner!

name: Thronestorm
description:
Thronestorm is a game of deep strategy for two players, condensed into an intense ten minutes where each game is different and every move counts. Portable and quick to learn, it’s perfect for cafés, train journeys, and lunch breaks.

Develop your influence across a constantly shifting realm by claiming powerful relics belonging to one of ten noble houses, all while making subtle maneuvers to thwart your opponent’s plans.

Each relic you hold allows you to manipulate the position of other relics in regions controlled by the corresponding house. These areas of influence themselves change as the relics move, and often overlap with those of your opponent.

The first player to unite a matching set of four relics wins the game, but as you consolidate your power over one house, your control over the realm diminishes. Dance effortlessly from one alliance to another while quietly establishing your dominance over the realm, until your opponent can do nothing but watch helplessly as you seize the throne!

The crystal staff from the wizard’s college, an enchanted lute from the bard’s guild, the cutlass of the pirate king, or the black knight’s helm; the deck of relics consists of forty cards, each an original painting by legendary artist Sam Ballard.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Pattern Recognition

name: Shady Pets
description:
Shady Pets is a highly strategic card game that requires you to play in a most shady way as you strive to correctly guess the identity of the mystery pets. It's a little like Clue, Uno and Exploding Kittens. You have to steal, take, show, sneak peak, expose, ambush, stop other players, grab and even throw an occasional octopus at an opponent on your way to victory.

As players take turns, the game gets more intense because, just like you, everyone is getting closer to solving the mystery pets, yet who is going play the best game, collect the most points and win the game?

We think Shady Pets has all the elements that make games popular. It makes players laugh with its clever sayings and endearing artwork. It presents multiple levels of strategic play that will test your memory and deduction skills. You get to attack your opponents (in the most unusual way) and you get rewarded for taking chances!

—description from the designer

name: Over the Edge
description: Each player has seven pawns on opposite sides of a board with 31 spaces joined hexagonally. One end of the board, perpendicular to the two starting pawn rows, is a pit which players try to force their opponent's pieces into. A player can move any of his pawns provided they are adjacent to at least one other friendly pawn. A player's group can also drag away and control adjacent opposing pieces as long as the opposing piece is kept away from it's allies. Win by putting three of your opponent's pawns "over the edge" of the pit or by separating all opponent's pawns thus immobilizing them.

name: So ein Zirkus
description:
Publisher's description:

Juggling clowns which have brightly coloured wooden balls inside them move across the board. Every so often they drop into one of the holes where points can be scored.

As the clowns change places, confusion arises.

Can you still remember the colour of the last ball in that clown ?

WELCOME TO THE CIRCUS is a clever, entertaining game which equally requires good tactics, good luck and a good memory; a game for children which adults will enjoy playing too.

name: How to Host a Murder: The Wall Street Scandal
description:
THE WALL STREET SCANDAL
The Wolf Of Wall Street
Who lost the most money on Black Monday? This morning, all eyes focused on Bonds & Trage and its larger-than-life founder, the infamous and tyrannical Jon K. Bonds. Starting in the trading pits some 30 years ago, Bonds built his small firm into a financial services giant. A master deal-maker and confidant of New York money and power, Bonds has sometimes been unscrupulous in his determination to undermine his rivals, particularly competitor Churnham & Burnham.
Confidential sources inside the company indicate that Bonds may soon step down from his position. His age, 56, is not believed to be the primary factor. The U.S. Attorney General's office is reportedly investigating Bond's possible involvement in stock manipulation and conspiracy schemes. If Bonds does leave the company, his successor will face the difficult task of guiding both the battered firm and the wealthy Argonaut Fund through the Black Monday disaster.

CHARACTERS
Corey Pratt Bonds, Stockard Ann Bonds, Wirth Les Bonds, Portia F. Olio, Lolita X. Posure, Abercrombie Trage, Cassandra Antell, Robert Ublynd

name: Charków 1942
description:
A wargame about the unsuccessful Russian offensive in May 1942. This is the second attempt by the Russians to gain strategic initiative and to liberate Kharkov. The 1st unsuccessful probe had taken place in March and had been turned into a catastrophe few days later by a German operation, which broke out along the whole Russian front. As a result of this battle the Germans reached Stalingrad in autumn 1942.

The game uses rules of the "WB95" (Great Battles 1939-1945); I-go-you-go system designed for dealing with large battles of World War II. Counters represent regiments (Germans) or divisions/brigades (Russians), one hex represents about 2500m, one turn represents one day.

The game has much maneuver and is rich in dramatical moments.

name: Soccer Sonic
description: Soccer Sonic is a 30-minute, 2 to 10 player fast pace card game play in team of two. In the game, each player takes a turn to maneuver and power kick towards the goal. When the ball finally enters the score zone, offense player plays a Kick/Block (KB) card with a matching direction to score. Defense then may play another KB card with matching direction to block. Both teams continue to kick and block until (1) offense team scores, (2) defense team plays a foul card, or (3) defense team blocks successfully and begins to maneuver towards their goal. After number of deck is depleted, the game ends, and the team with highest score wins. If it is a tie, another deck will be used for overtime, and if it is still a tie, the game ends with a draw.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: CHUCHES
description:
What a fun birthday party !!! and now come the best, the piñata !!!, will you be able to catch more jellybeans than any other player ?, and the ones you like the most?

CHUCHES is a children's card game, with different game modes, where players, depending on their tastes, must collect jellybeans and shoot the actions that some of them contain. Undoubtedly this fun game with 76 cards of different shapes and sizes will delight the smallest of the house.

Qué fiesta de cumpleaños tan divertida!!! y ahora vienen lo mejor, la piñata!!!, ¿serás capaz de coger más gominolas que cualquier otro jugador?, ¿y las que más te gusta?

CHUCHES es un infantil juego de cartas, con diferentes modos de juego, donde los jugadores en función de su carta de gustos, debe ir cogiendo gominolas y disparando las acciones que algunas de ellas contiene. Sin duda este divertido juego con 76 cartas de diferentes formas y tamaños hará las delicias de los más pequeños de la casa.

—description from the publisher

name: Great Western: Harz and Bayern
description:
This is technically two expansions to Great Western, from Martin Wallace, which was published in Spielbox magazine number 92 (edition 2/2011). These two are published in Spielbox 6/2011.
It is still a railroad game, but no longer set in southern England. The game objective is still to connect cities in the railroad. As the names suggest, one side of the "board" is set in the Harz Mountains, with the players branching out from Leipzig through Central Germany. On the other side, the players start in the Nuremburg/Fürth locale, and spread out through Bayern (Bavaria).

The first magazine (2/2011) included the start player marker and chits for the entire series.

The player must provide only the dice in order to play.

name: Tric Trac
description:
A French variation on Backgammon. Over time Trictrac has evolved in le Petit Trictrac and le Grand Trictrac. Just as in backgammon players have 15 checkers, but unlike backgammon, racing plays only a small role in Trictrac.

Triktrak (Trik Trak) is a Dutch Backgammon variant. It resembles Acey Deucey more than it does French Tric Trac, but to confuse matters, it is still often spelled as Tric Trac.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sushi Rush
description:
It's time for another Sushi Rush tournament!

Prepare your chopsticks and your determination to overcome your opponents in this game of dexterity, skill and delicious sushi. In each round, players will compete simultaneously in different game modes. Master the art of focus and efficiency to become the next Master Sushiman!

On each round, players will draw a card and compete to grab the right combination of sushi with their chopsticks. Each card feature a unique challenge, be it collecting sushis of the same flavor, shape or even stacking them to build the highest tower.

Players receive honor points depending on their success and the one with the most points at the end of the game becomes the next Master Sushiman.

-description from publisher

name: Mamie Moule Maki
description:
In Mamie Moule Maki, fill up your categories in 2 minutes ! Find the best answers to odd categories and defend them from your opponents.

To play that's very simple, a player roll a 20-faces die representing 20 letters.
Everybody then have 2 minutes to find an answer starting with the letter of the dice for each category ! The answers are then submitted to the ruthless votes of the opponents !

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dans le jeu Mamie Moule Maki, remplissez vos catégories en 2 minutes chrono !
Trouvez les meilleures réponses à des catégories insolites et défendez-les auprès de vos adversaires.

Pour jouer, c'est très simple, un joueur lance un dé de 20 faces représentant 20 lettres.
Tout le monde a ensuite 2 minutes chrono pour trouver une réponse commençant par la lettre du dé pour chaque catégorie ! Les réponses sont ensuite soumises aux votes impitoyables des adversaires !

—description from the publisher
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Seneti
description:
This two-player strategy game uses the so-called Ancient Baylonian The Royal Game of Ur game as its board (8x3 with 4 squares taken out to form a waist). The name, a reference to Senet, is misleading if not downright erroneous (the Ur board was used in the Ancient Egyptian game of Tjau, not Senet). Once again, the object of the game is to prevent the opponent from having any moves by blocking and taking pieces. The designer takes full advantage of the square decorations, but I can't tell what the rules are beyond that.

Check out the beautiful board at Pharao-Brettspiele's home page.

name: Cassino
description:
In "Cassino", an Operational level World War 2 Italian Campaign wargame by Excalibre Games, the Allied player is attempting to break the German Gustav Line dominated by the famous Monte Cassino position which towered over the Liri Valley. The German player realizes he will get few new units and must send off units to defend against the Anzio operation.

The game uses division sized units. 110 counters (10 of which are blank).
Part of Excalibre's "Panzer Battles and Sieges" Series.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: N30N City RUMBLE
description:
"Without a doubt, the retro beat-em-up theme and the chosen game mechanics are a match made in radioactive heaven. -Buns, The League of Nonsensical Gamers"

N30N City RUMBLE (NCR) is a two-player "beat 'em up" card game that simulates 5-on-5 tag team combat between mutant martial artists in a radically dystopian 90s setting!

Each turn, you’ll trade for cards at a pawn shop, tag your fighters on and off the tarmac, and then engage the opponent using martial arts, super-moves, and a wide variety of items, all of which are inspired by classic arcade games. Knock out all of your opponent’s fighters until only yours remain to win the game!

Features:

38 extraordinary Fighters based on popular videogames from the 90s
44 interchangeable Brawl cards straight out of a fighting arcade game
54 unique items and weapons that belong on the street... of rage
5 additional game modes, including solo play for practicing moves
12 dice to throw across a sprawling 22x22 inch playmat
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Depths of Courage: The H.L. Hunley's Attack, February 17, 1864
description:
The H.L. Hunley's Attack, February 17, 1864. LPS / ATO minigame from 2014. Released as a sheet of paper (half board, half rules) and counters.

A solo game where the player is the captain of the Hunley, the Confederate Submarine that saw action off Charleston, South Carolina, in 1864. The goal of the game is to leave port, sink a blockading Union ship, and then return to port, without being sunk yourself. Uses a die roll to make checks (modified by the result of a card flip and the state of various elements on the board) that determine the status of the journey and attack.

name: APBA Professional Bowling
description: The APBA simulation system is applied to bowling. Professional bowlers are profiled.

name: Golden Goal
description:
Golden Goal "simulates" a Soccer World ChampionShip in which each player is a country. A player is going to play twice against every opponent. A single match consists of a few throws of special dice (with 5 black sides and 1 ball side). In addition, one can play special cards (penalty, goalie, etc...) to modify the number of goals.
This game is very convivial and is best played with 6 players.

name: Assault on Sevastapol
description:
A very basic, introductory level wargame included in the magazine "Special Edition #1."

The game is played on an 8-1/2" x 11" map and uses just 40 counters.

The subject is the German attack on the city of Sevastopol on the Crimean Peninsula in 1942.

Re-implemented by:

Assault on Sevastopol
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Bamsespillet
description:
From the box:
An entertaining game for children and adults. The first player to stomp, clap or knock on the table wins the cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Dueling Runes
description:
This is game for the Decktet card game-system, loosely based on Waving Hands by Richard Bartle. Players become wizards casting spells and trying to eliminate all their opponents. Spells need both energy runes and activation runes. Players play cards in front of them, one after the other each turn, forming their spell sequence. When a card with an activation rune is played, they choose which energy runes to use to cast a variety of effects.

Unlike in Waving Hands, the spell table is very small with just 10 spells which are grouped by the type of activation rune needed: Moons (spells directed at the caster for protection or healing), Wyrms (spells directed at an opponent, usually damaging) and Knots (more complex effects that can be played on both caster or opponents). Also the fact that you have a hand of cards and are limited to those cards for play introduces an element of hand management and randomness not present in Waving Hands.

The rules can be read at: http://decktet.wikidot.com/game:dueling-runes

There's a pocket mod version of the rules too: http://decktet.wikidot.com/local--files/game:dueling-runes/duelinrunespocketmod.pdf

name: Seii Daimyo
description:
In Seii Daimyo, each player is an aspiring Daimyo with goals to unify the shattered Japanese islands under a new, great Shogunate.

Each player has an identical set of role cards: 1 Samurai and 1 Ashigaru. Each round, players play one of these cards secretly and gain actions based on what they played, as well as what the other players chose to play.

Seii Daimyo is played over a series of five rounds. Each round, several locations are revealed from the deck, and each player plays one of their role cards face down to try to strengthen their forces and increase their control over the three islands.

name: Holmes & Watson 1890-1914: Adventures in the London Fog
description:
Description from the designer:

In Holmes & Watson 1890-1914: Adventures in the London Fog, players will roll dice and take actions so that they may solve the various mysteries of Victorian London. This roll and write adventure takes place all over the map of London, but be careful, Moriarty lurks around every corner.

On your turn, you will draft dice, use the actions of those dice, and navigate your way around the foggy streets to collect the needed evidence to solve the mysteries. If you cant move forward in your investigations, you lose.

Who will be the best investigator? Who will be thwarted by the schemes of Moriarty? Who will best Sherlock in a match of wits?

This game was entered into the 2017 Gencant Roll & Write Design Contest and received and Honorable Mention from the Judges.
categories: Dice, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based, Print & Play, Travel
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Magic: The Gathering – Vraska Scheming Gorgon
description:
Part of the Rivals of Ixalan line.
A Planeswalker deck that is ready for play out of the box, and can be used by new players as a starter deck. It revolves around white and black mana, with mainly vampires as creatures.
The leader of the band is Vraska, a Planeswalker that lends strength to her allies and destroy enemy creatures. She can also give the player's creatures the ability to win the game by inflicting damage on the opponent.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Steel Leader
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION
