The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Steel Leader is a non-authorized version of Ticket to Ride. According to Days of Wonder, Ioxi Boardgame Studio does not have license to produce this game, thus it is set apart from the official entry of Ticket to Ride.




Unauthorized, Chinese version of Ticket to Ride. Advertised as "Ticket to Ride China's version of 'Iron boss'", and "domestic genuine"; which is to mean it uses Ticket to Ride mechanics, but uses 100% original components.

Familiar game play of collecting victory points by fulfilling mission cards. Mission cards contain cities in China to connect and a reward value. Cities are linked by drawing and playing matching colors of train cards. Additional cards are required for mountainous areas or tunnel routes. Also different from other games, is the 15 card hand limit. There are an additional 10 points for the longest continuous route.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Zillionaire
description:
This game is a close relative of The Great Dalmuti and Dilbert's Corporate Shuffle. In it, each player is ranked (and seated) according to his wealth (Poor / Thin Ice / Credit Crazy / Upper Crust / Money to Burn / Rich).

The entire deck of 62 cards is dealt out, minus two cards. The first and last player exchange two cards, the next-to-first and next-to-last exchange one. The player to the left of the dealer (the Rich player) begins by playing a set of cards (quantity and face value). The following player can either play the same quantity but higher value or pass. This round continues until all pass; after which another round starts. Players rank (for the next hand) in the order in which they go out.

Score is kept for the agreed upon number of hands (no more than 10). Poor scores 1, Thin Ice 2, etc. High score wins.

Interestingly, the value 5 cards are wild in the sense that a single 5 can represent any number of fives. When played to start a round, the following player determines the quantity. The other cards are Zillionaire (4 in deck), Millionaire (4), Bankroll (3; if played on top of a Bankrupt card, cannot be beaten), Bankrupt (3; can only be beaten by a Bankroll), Bump (3; forces the player to your left to Pass), 8 through 1 (6 of each except for Fives, of which there are only 3).

name: Hovertank: Tactical Combat 2054-2115
description:
From the Rulebook:” One Rulebook, 4-Front & Back printed geomorphic map sections, 2-Charts & Tables Sheets, 1-Die (6-sided), 1-Plotting Pad, and 2 Die-Cut Sheets (1-Full & 1/2 Sheet) containing the combat and informational counters". NOTE: info in () provided by this author.
The game components provided are very professionally produced including Front & Back printed glossy counters, DEEP Bookcase style BOX, Simultaneous Movement PAD (26 Sheets, both sides printed), fair Charts (could've been thicker cardboard instead of paper), and fair Map sheets (graphics are lacking for topic). The Map sheets are WHITE overall and have 3 colors: BLACK-Roads, Towns; BLUE-Water Features, Woods; BROWN-All other Terrain. There are 4 Major Wars depicted from 2054-2115: the MOON War-2054 (4-Scenarios); the MARS Colony Revolt-2080 (4-Scenarios); the Alpha Centauri REVOLT 1-2110(5-Scenarios); and the 2nd Alpha Centauri War-2115 (3-Scenarios). There are 364 counters (RED with YELLOW print, BLUE with WHITE print) & Lots of different TYPES of units (over 30!) representing LASER Infantry, MORTAR Inf., Rocket pack Inf., Hovercraft, Hovertanks, S.P.Artillery, Spacecraft, and Forts. There are also informational counters (WHITE with BLACK print) such as ATOMIC Mine counters, Force Field markers- (ON/OFF), Rubble, 4 kinds of Wreck Types, Orbital Laser & Airstrike Impact markers, DOME, Crater, Panic, and Disruption markers plus some blank counters.
The TIME scale given is 3 Minutes per TURN, Hexes are 100m across, INFANTRY types are Platoon level, Vehicles are 3-5 per counter, and depending on what type they are. There are Complexity ratings (1-10) for each Scenario and a 4-Player Scenario:” Recovery of Alien Stardrive, 2081". On Page 15 are the Unit Organization Tables for each of the 4 Wars and their respective combatants. These depict how "Upper Echelon" units are created using the counters provided with the game, presumably for "Create Your OWN" games.

Note: The back of the box states 392 counters, but there are 364 (34 of those are blanks)
mechanics: Action Queue, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mecca to Medina
description:
Pitting player against player, the goal of Mecca to Medina is to complete a series of Trading Routes faster than one’s opponents by collecting the required symbolic resources. Combining geography and world culture into its game play, Mecca to Medina is as educational as it is entertaining. Unlike other board games, action lurks around every corner of Mecca to Medina with every roll of the dice spurring activity, even when it’s not a player’s turn.

Mecca to Medina is a new trading game designed for ages 8 and up. The game averages about 30 minutes in game play and can be enjoyed by 2 to 6 players. The objective of Mecca to Medina is to complete 4 trading routes.

Each player attempts to by trading routes by turning in the resources collected by their city. Along the way, players will find themselves bargaining and negotiating with other players to get rare resources in the game. In addition, they will also have the option of buying specialty cards like camels and caravans while trying to avoid bad events cards, which can easily turn the tide of the game.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cheesy Parcheesy
description: This is a new version of Parcheesi with a cat and mouse theme. Players race to get their four "mice" pieces around the board, up their secret passage, and onto the Cheese Feast space in the middle of the board. Like normal Parcheesi you may bump other players back and form blockades. You can also land on Cat spaces that send your mice back, and draw Cheese cards that help move them forward. The first player to get all four mice to the Cheese feast wins.

name: Super Stocks
description:
In Super Stocks three to four players compete to make the most money in stock market. The game takes about 90 minutes to complete. A 2009 Essen release, Super Stocks is an redevelopment of Fund Manager from year before.

The game play has not radically changed from Fund Manager. Players move one pawn around on a one way board using numbered tokens from one to three. Only after all players have used all of their tokens they become available to be used again. This constitutes one round, while the game is played for six or eight rounds for three or four players. Each turn the active player has to carry out the action where the pawn lands. These actions inluce buying & selling stocks in four companies, drawing an event card, or one of four more special actions.

Compared to Fund Manager in Super Stocks players have both more power to influence the stock prices and more tools to reduce randomness. There also is no need for pen & paper as Super Stocks comes with stock tiles.

name: aufRUHR!
description:
In the strategy game aufRUHR!, the players represent mayors who compete with one another while also needing to cooperate to improve the general state of a unified Ruhrstadt and to realize the most valuable projects. The overall goal of the game: Becoming the new Paramount Mayor of a unified Ruhrstadt, and bringing together the 53 towns of the Ruhr region.

The game board is unusual in that it's an irregularly shaped jigsaw. Each player can place developments on adjacent spaces and stand for election by all the players to become temporary paramount mayor. (You cannot vote for yourself.) The successful candidate gets a paper hat to wear and can reward different sorts of developments – which might affect the election next term. Players can use bribes (which score victory points for the recipients) or the threat of scandal to induce other mayors to collaborate with them. Money takes the form of coal – as the Ruhr region contains a significant coal field.

aufRUHR! was developed as a project by architecture students at the Berlin University of Art as part of the Ruhr being the European capital of Culture 2010 and was published in a limited edition in time for Spiel 2010. (Essen is one of the cities of the Ruhr.)

name: L'atelier des Chefs
description:
To all budding chefs – utensils ready, set, cook!

Either on your own or in teams, complete the challenges in L'atelier des Chefs set by the chef and become his right-hand man. Separate eggs, sabre champagne, flip as many pancakes as possible – in your hands the cards will become kitchen utensils and fine dishes. You will have to throw them, catch them, look at them, sort them, put them on top of each other...all under pressure from the egg timer! You will have to combine dexterity and ingenuity in order to beat your opponents.

Keep the game going over a hot stove with ten interactive recipe cards, concocted by the Chef's kitchen experts!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: All Is Lost to Me: Pavia 1525
description:
Hailed as the first modern battle, Pavia marked the rise of hand-held firearms as a tool of warfare. The arquebus became the bench-mark for an entire species of guns. It offered a wooden stock, shaped to nestle in the shoulder, which now meant a gun could be aimed. Politically, France’s defeat at Pavia changed the balance of power in Europe. As a prisoner, the French king Francis I wrote : “To inform you of how the rest of my ill-fortune is proceeding, all is lost to me save honor and life, which is safe …”
The game map represents the battlefield of Pavia. A hex grid has been superimposed on the map to regulate movement. Each hex represents about 200 yards. The game has 12 turns, each turn representing about 30 minutes. Each combat unit represents from 400 to 800 men or horses or guns.

The game starts with the Spanish army having arrived to relieve the siege of Pavia by the French army. Play is composed of 12 turns. Each turn comprises two identical sequences of phases, one for each player.
Sequence of play
The active player’s turn is organized into the following phases :
a) Out of command check
b) Rally
c) French Commander Initiative Check
d) Movement
e) Passive Player Reaction Movement
f) Defensive Fire
g) Offensive Fire
h) Melee

268 pawns and counters

Game design : Lionel LIRON
Original Counter Art : Lionel LIRON
Counter Design : Ton Cundiff
Box Art : Mike Mirfin
Game Board : Michael W. Kennedy

name: tsunami!
description:
In this snarky game of competitive philanthropy, you are a genius billionaire philanthropist who has modestly taken on the task of single-handedly saving humankind from an apocalyptic tsunami. Over the course of the game, you build a fleet of ships, collect rare artifacts of civilization, and recruit a team of skilled workers to your crew. At the end of the game, the tsunami hits and only careful preparation, your boundless genius, and a hint of luck will keep you afloat.

tsunami! combines snark, strategy, and easy-to-learn rules, making it ideal for both introductory gamers as well as seasoned board game geeks. The game takes place over 10-14 days (turns) in which each player strives to optimize their fleet by competing for limited resources, bidding on crew members, managing cargo, and mitigating the risk of the impending apocalypse.

Do you have what it takes to become the preeminent savior of the human race?
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: 2258 Starter Kit – Centauri
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ahead in the Clouds: Tents, Trackers and Contracts
description:
Three new cards for Ahead in the Clouds.

1 Supply tent
1 Double Sided Alternate Contract Card
1 Double Sided Alternate Round Tracker Card

New:
Add the Supply Tent to your game as an additional resource card. When its placed, it must be sunny side up, and then flips over to its back side. After it is used a second time, it is removed from the game and is no longer available. You cannot use both sides in a single turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Hancúr Párbaj
description:
A game for adults and only for adults! 18+

Expand your sex life with a little adventure.

You need to go through three zones called attraction, desire and sex. In every zone you need to draw a card, which contains something kindness for your partner. For example backrub or some gently touches.

As you are going trough the zones the cards will become more serious, and in the last sex zone the cards contain poses about... I think we all know what I am talking about it :)

If you reach the finish line before your partner, you will win, but be carefull, the one who reach the orgasm before the finish line, will lose the game.

name: Dope or Nope: Family Card Game
description:
Combine product cards together to create dope new inventions and pitch those inventions to buyers (a.k.a the judge). The dopest invention wins!

With over 265 products product cards, The opportunities to create hilarious products are limitless. This party game is a blast to play with family and friends. Unleash the hilarity and creativity of your mind!

—description from the designer

name: Kuih Muih
description:
Kuih Muih is a card game about collecting Malaysian delicacies. It is played over three stages, in which players collect cards to score points. At every stage, cards are divided into stacks. Each round, players take turns to claim a stack, then pick a card from it. Unclaimed cards are returned to the table, with players now knowing the contents of the stack just seen. When a new round starts, player order changes, and players may go for the same stack or try a different stack.

Cards score points in different ways. Usually the more cards of a kind you have the better. Some cards have special powers, e.g. allowing you to swap cards with an opponent.

name: Minderheiten Quartett
description:
This satirical card game features 60 minorities structured in 10 groups. Earlier editions are completely revised.

Minderheiten Quartett is a variant of a Quartett game, with a splash of Top Trumps and some unique mechanisms thrown in. There are two types of cards. First, the traditional Top Trumps style cards with minorities and their statistics, such as intelligence or sex appeal. Second, there are 6 Joker Cards which may change the scoring.

Every player receives 3 minorities cards and a joker. The starting player defines a category and "low" or "high". All players choose a card simultaneously. The player with the highest score chooses 2 of the played cards and puts them on his victory pile. All other players except the last one choose one card. Players then restock their hand to three cards. The game ends when one player has 4 cards of the same minority in his victory pile. This player wins.
A variant suggests to find the most discriminated person by discussion.

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Das Kartenspiel – Rotlicht Edition
description:
Hochwertige Klappdeckel-Schachtel in coolem Design made by DENKRIESEN.

Das Prinzip ist so einfach wie genial. Wer glaubt, dass Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten als Kartenspiel doch nicht gut funktionieren kann wird schnell eines besseren belehrt werden.

Das Spiel ist im nu erklärt und der Spielspaß kann beginnen. Es bleiben keine offenen Fragen und die Spielrunden sind kurzweilig und spannend. Durch die 150 verschiedenen Kategorien ist immer für genug Abwechslung gesorgt.

Das unanständige Kartenspiel von STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN mit 120 Spielkarten für ein unvergessliches Spielerlebnis unter Freunden.

150 kreative und lustige Kategorien bringen jeden Hobbydenker ins Schwitzen. Spaß Garantiert!

Durch die 3 verschiedenen Editionen, ist eine riesige Vielfalt geboten. Neben der familienfreundlichen Classic Edition bringen die kinderfreundliche Junior und die unanständige Rotlicht Edition die gewisse Abwechslung in den Spieleabend!

Spielablauf:
So wird gespielt: Jeder Spieler bekommt per Zufallsprinzip 8 Buchstaben-Karten ausgehändigt. Nun muss jeder Spieler möglichst schnell einen Begriff passend zu einer seiner Buchstaben-Karten ablegen. Wichtig: Es zählt jeweils der Anfangsbuchstabe des Wortes und man muss NICHT aus den Buchstaben-Karten einen Begriff bilden, wie es in anderen Spielen z.B: Scrabble manchmal der Fall ist.
Es wird also spannend: Die 60 Kategorie-Karten enthalten insgesamt 200 verschiedene und lustige Kategorien:

Wer kann zuerst einen “Beruf” ablegen? Oder einen “Trennungsgrund”? Was ist mit einer “Stadt im Ausland”? Fällt dir zu deinen Buchstaben-Karten schnell ein “Berühmter Toter” ein bzw. kommt Dir sofort ein “bekannter Schauspieler” in den Sinn?
Wichtig nun: Der SCHNELLSTE Spieler gewinnt jeweils die Runde und am Ende gewinnt der Spieler das Spiel, der zuerst alle Buchstaben-Karten losgeworden ist. Durch die 10 zusätzlichen Aktionskarten wird das Spiel besonders spannend.
Natürlich gibt es auch VOLLPFOSTEN-Karten im Spiel die entweder als Joker wirken oder als kniffliger Konter genutzt werden.

—description from the publisher

High quality hinged lid box in cool design made by DENKRIESEN.

The principle is as simple as it is ingenious. Whoever thinks that Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten can't work well as a card game will soon be proven wrong.

The game is explained in no time and the fun can begin. There are no open questions and the game rounds are entertaining and exciting. Due to the 150 different categories there is always enough variety.

The naughty card game from STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN with 120 playing cards for an unforgettable gaming experience among friends.

150 creative and funny categories will make every amateur thinker sweat. Fun guaranteed!

Due to the 3 different editions, a huge variety is offered. In addition to the family-friendly Classic Edition, the child-friendly Junior and the naughty Red Light Edition bring a certain variety to the game night!

How to play: Each player is randomly dealt 8 letter cards. Now each player must place a word matching one of his letter cards as quickly as possible. Important: The first letter of the word counts and you do NOT have to form a term from the letter cards, as is sometimes the case in other games, e.g. Scrabble.

So it gets exciting: The 60 category cards contain a total of 200 different and funny categories:

Who can put down a "profession" first? Or a "reason for separation"? What about a "city abroad"? Can you quickly think of a "Famous Dead Person" or a "Famous Actor" for your letter cards?

Important now: The FASTEST player wins each round and at the end the player who first got rid of all letter cards wins the game. The 10 additional action cards make the game especially exciting.

Of course, there are also FULL FIX cards in the game that either act as jokers or are used as tricky counters.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: OTLO Stones: Free Mini-version
description:
Take on the challenge of solving six completely new puzzles in this free mini-version of OTLO Stones. Punch out the tiles and cards, then set a timer to determine which of your friends is the ultimate brainiac. It's not as straightforward as it appears; the tiles feature holes and are arranged in two layers.

The game can be played on its own or by using the better tiles from OTLO Stones.

name: Circles
description:
Circles features a double-sided game board, with both games being driven by the same game-action mechanism — a player rolling a ball in the felt-covered exterior ring of the track. Place the ball in the right spaces, and you'll make good progress!

On one side of the game board, you dive into the Wild West to mine gold and silver, fight bandits, and fulfill your dream of owning your own ranch. On the other side, you visit the shooting range and try your hand at hitting various targets.

name: Соображарий Супер
description:
Who's the first to come up with something that can be used both in the Polar Circle and at a party? How many songs related to board games can you recall in 1 minute? No time to think: whoever is the fastest will be the winner!

Соображарий Супер ("Think It Up: Super") expands the Think It Up! series with a new twist: each turn, you will reveal two Categories and will try to be the first to come up with an answer that will suit them both! Quick-wittedness is encouraged, but creativity is key!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Кто первым скажет, что можно увидеть за полярным кругом и использовать на шумной вечеринке? А много ли песен, связанных с игрушками и настольными играми, вы вспомните за минуту? На долгие раздумья нет времени — отгадывайте, или победные очки достанутся кому-то другому!

«Соображарий Супер» — новая версия настольного хита для семейных посиделок и зажигательных вечеринок. Каждый ход вы будете тянуть две карты категорий и наперегонки с соперниками придумывать ответ, подходящий одновременно к каждой из них. Проявляйте чудеса сообразительности и помните — главное не эрудиция, а творческий подход!

—description from the publisher (Russian)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Schaben jagen
description:
Who will solve the cockroach problem?

In Schaben jagen, the player draws a task card, places the game pieces as indicated on the game board and takes the illustrated movement cards. His task: To move the exterminator so skillfully that he catches all cockroaches. To do so, he must play his movement cards in the correct order. He can only use each of them once. After that, all cockroaches run into a field. Sitting a cockroach in a straight line to the exterminator, he sucks them and takes them from the field. The task is fulfilled if he gets all the cockroaches before he runs out of motion cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Que Ves
description:
The players must solve a series of riddles arranged on individual cards.
The youngest player starts, one of the players took one of the cards, show it to the player in turn and immediately turn the sandglass.
If the player solve the riddle before time has expired shall place the card on his personal board, if the player do not solve correctly the card is placed in the bottom of the deck.
The game ends when one of the players solve six riddles.
Simple and easy.

name: Dragon Hordes
description:
Fantasy wargame reminiscent of "Warhammer" that can be played with the provided counters but is designed to be played with miniatures. On the world of Eorthe, each faction controls one of the magical Eorthewells; most who drink of the Eortheblood that rises from them die, but a few become magic-users. Now the Eorthewells are drying up -- what a perfect excuse to have a planet-girdling war!

Approximate playing time is totally arbitrary and will depend on army size and number of players. Maximum players is listed as six only because that's the number of factions described in the core book: Theofas (continental humans), alefs (elves), dhurgoths (dwarves), the Forgotten (humans with dinosaurs), Selicum (mixed-race islanders with sea creatures), and Swaerthan (Chaos/undead). More than six players could participate if armies were very small, if armies were controlled by teams, or if the players wanted to take a couple days off to do nothing but play.

name: Care Bears: Warm Feelings
description: In this game, players help the Care Bears stop Professor Cold Heart from freezing the hearts of all the boys and girls in town. On your turn, you spin the spinner and advance to the first empty space that matches the color you spin. If you land on a Rainbow, you place a Rainbow Chip on the Thermometer track. If you land on Professor Cold Heart, remove the top Rainbow Chip from the Thermometer. When all the Rainbow Chips have been placed in the Thermometer, players may remove and keep 1 Icicle Card (covering the the large Rainbow on the board) whenever they land on a Rainbow Space. The game ends when all the Icicle Cards have been removed. Then the players all turn over their cards and the player whose cards show the most Care Bears wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Abenteuer im Wichtelwald
description:
Despite its fairy tale theme, this is a fairly abstract game for 2-4 players Ages 8 and up. Each player tries to move their 6 gnomes from one side of the board to the other.

For setup, the trees are placed on the game board, and the gnomes are placed on their starting spaces.

On their turn, each player first moves a tree 1 space, then moves a gnome. Gnomes move in a straight line (orthogonally or diagonally) across empty spaces until they encounter an obstacle - a tree or a gnome. The gnome then does a 90 degree turn and keeps moving. If the gnome reaches its target space, and there is another gnome on it, the active player moves that gnome to another space on the board. The first player to move all their gnomes to their target space wins the game.

name: Crete
description:
Published in Strategy & Tactics magazine#18.

"Crete" is a simple World War 2 operational wargame of the German invasion of Crete in 1941.


Per creator (Jim Dunnigan):

"We needed a game for the first issue, and it had to be kind of small. I was into the origins of air-mobile ops at that time, and felt Crete would be more suitable than some of the ops Kenney and MacArthur dreamed up in New Guinea. The battle was well documented and designing it was easy."

(e-mail with Neopeius, 9-5-2011)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Viking Funeral
description:
Available for free on the IronWall Games website.

Viking Funeral makes use of decks of standard playing cards that would otherwise be disposed of. Like "Risk: Legacy" by the same designer, permanent changes are made to the cards throughout the course of play, and these changes will persist into future plays of the game using the same set of cards.

This game is played with a 52-card deck (French-suited) that you supply yourself, and a marker or pen to write on the cards, and optionally, a pair of scissors or matches or something to destroy cards with, and if available, a trash can to serve as "Valhalla".

A single card is drawn randomly at the start of a game and destroyed, but not to the point of its number and suit being unrecognizable. This becomes the "recently deceased".

Players start with a hand of cards, with the lead player playing a single card to the center of the table ("the funeral") that are either in agreement (same suit color) or start a fight (differing suit colors).

Tricks are won by playing the high card when in agreement, or by winning fights (being form the same family as the recently deceased provides a bonus in a fight). The winner takes the trick and puts the cards into that player's victory point pile ("mead hall"). Cards are drawn by the player who did not win cards for their mead hall from the deck ("the village").

Throughout play, players are encouraged to either sing the praises of the "recently deceased" or trash-talk the card, treating each suit as it were an viking family line. The game ends when no more cards are left in the village to replenish players' hands, and the game is won by the player with the most cards in their mead hall, with a tie breaker going to the player whose mead hall cards have the most wounds (as indicated by marks made to cards during play).

In true viking fashion, the game strongly emphasis that there are no ties, either during play or in calculating victory.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That, Trick-taking

name: UNO: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
description: Get ready to unleash your turtle power in this Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle (TMNT) version of UNO, dudes! Classic UNO rules apply, yet with the addition of a special rule and four corresponding action cards, players get the chance to experience all new game changing moments! This fearsome foursome of turtles works together with the Team Attack Card, which allows players to vanquish three villains from their hand! Fans of the cartoon series and movie will recognize their favorite characters, like Leonardo and Michelangelo, who are featured on the cards they play. And do not forget to yell "UNO" when you have but one card remaining!

name: Geek Me Quiz Contre-Attaque
description: A trivia box of over 700 questions and 130 challenges about TV Series, Litterature, Movies, Comics, Mangas and Anime, and Video Games.

name: Turing
description:
A pocket sized image interpretation limited communication game for 2-6 players.

The Turing test is a thought experiment. An interrogator communicates with two test subjects, one is a computer, the other a human. If once the interrogator is willing to make a determination they judge the computer to be a human it can be said to have exhibited true intelligence. Which is all well and good for the computer, but what does that mean for that human?

Welcome to Turing.

Players take turns attempting to communicate their humanity via a series of abstract images against those selected by the game. They select 1 card from between 2 and 4 (depending on difficulty level, the game randomly selects one another. They repeat this three times, then the other players try to figure out which of the sets of three cards were chosen by an intelligent being rather than randomly thrown out by the game. Successful identification allows both identifier and selector to score. The round ends when one player has scored at least five points.

The player with the most points wins.

name: Het Tom Poes Spel
description:
A card game based on the stories of Marten Toonder's Tom Poes and Oliver B. Bommel. Players have to create a path placing road cards numbering from 1 to 7 in ascending order. The goal is to reach the #7 card (Treasure "De Schat") first.

There is 1 deck of cards that all players draw from, containing the road cards and several other cards to prevent other players from getting to the treasure or assist you in your own effort to find the treasure first.

name: Madstone
description:
Wizards and creatures wander a dark land where only the strongest survive and amass large, powerful armies to conquer.
Madstone is a card game with power crystals that are collected by players to either capture or kill creatures and warriors. Capturing them adds power as they join your army. Killing them gives victory points. The strategy comes into play as each player decides when to kill and when to capture.
Players can attempt to kill or capture other players' armies, but only when darkness falls.
The game ends when the deck is exhausted, the player with the most points showing on killed creatures is the winner.

name: Wildfire
description:
From the publisher's website:

Dominoes have never been so WILD! Wildfire Domino game is the newest domino game with wilds and features a unique electronic hub which plays “fire” sounds in the background. The hub also calls out what the “wild” numbers are going to be during play. Game includes electronic hub, and unique Wildfire domino set.

name: Tricky Town
description: Board game with a trick-or-treat theme. Each player has four pieces representing members of a family (mom, dad, boy, girl), and a deck of cards used to determine movement. All players flip a card simultaneously, with order of movement determined by characters on the cards. Players move the number of spaces indicated by the number on a card; odd numbers move only one piece, even numbers can be split evenly between two pieces. Spaces on the board result in the gain or loss of treats (victory points). Players can also acquire "trick or treat" cards which can be played for extra movement. Movement is restricted by a rule that a child may never be more than five spaces away from a parent. There are short cuts that may be taken only by a parent and child together.

name: Varázstorony
description:
Varázstorony (roughly translated: Magical Tower) is a light fantasy wargame published only in Hungary.
Four races struggle for the ruling of the kingdom with the help of their mighty armies and magic: the humans, the orcs, the elves and the dwarves. The one who can collect enough power (control enough areas) and can enter the Tower with his mage will rise victorious.
Each races have different abilities in battle and have their own spells. The usage of magic is limited by the terrain. Because the modularity of the board, differently shaped and sized areas form the map.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Hexover
description:
From Publisher Website:

Hexover is a fun and fast moving new strategy game of reversing momentum. Hexover takes a new twist on play pattern with roots dating back to England is the 19th century. The play pattern, which consists of trapping and flipping opponents disks, is familiar to people worldwide who have played Reversi. The object of Hexover is to be the first player to complete a string of five disks in their color on the white hexagons on the game board, with at least one game piece being positioned on the outside row. Because of the hexagonal shape of the game board, players have to stay alert to all of directions impacted by each move. Hexover is a game of planning, positioning and rich strategy. The obvious move, may not be the best! The rules have been drafted so that there is always a winner, no ties, stalemates, or cat's games. Hand crafted from high quality hardwoods, Hexover is pretty enough to be left out on the coffee table or bookshelf to be played again and again.

name: Cat & Chocolate: Blooming Days
description: Cat & Chocolate: Blooming Days is a card game which follows the other games in the Cat & Chocolate series, only this time the theme centers on Japanese school life. Players are divided into two secret teams, with each player taking turns drawing an event card and describing how they manage to escape the situation using 1-3 item cards in their hand. All players then vote "Safe" or "Out", and if a majority votes in favor of the player's story he or she scores a point. At the end of the game teams are revealed, and the highest scoring team wins.

name: Co słychać na farmie?
description: Co słychać na farmie? ("What's Happening on the Farm?") is a fast game in which you roll a six-sided dice, then try to find the animal that appears that many times on a card. Whoever makes the correct animal sound gets the card. After the deck runs out, whoever has the most cards wins.

name: El Club de la Aventura
description:
Compilation in a box of four Spanish classic games from CEFA:

"Misterio"
The game is about solving the mysterious disappearances by a process of elimination. The winner will be the detective that manages to solve the 3 keys: "Mis" "Te" "Rio"

"Alerta Roja"
During the voyage of the merchant ship that transports barrels with radioactive residue, one of them disappears mysteriously.

By satellite, this barrel, is directed by the sea to a far away city.
Ultimatum: In 48 hours the city will be destroyed!!

The most famous secret agent searches , using the most sophisticated equipment he has. Since the barrel, being moved by computers, can transform itself into the same type of vehicle that the agent uses for his search, the search and recovery becomes an almost impossible mission.

"Imperio Cobra"
The game is a standard roll and move fare with the added twist that one of the gamers controls the forces of evil and attempts to stop all of the other players from winning

"Dagon"
In order to win the game you have to search for the “Dagon Symbol” and carry it to one of the cities. This “Symbol” is in the center of the board.

By doing this you will be invested “Kingdom Knight”.
The first one in being invested as a Knight in three different cities will win the game
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Fantasy, Horror, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: All Stars Playlist
description:
Whether you are a DJ at a party or you just want to listen to some music in your pajamas, you can always use a good playlist in each situation. In All Stars Playlist it is all about music and making the perfect playlist. Songs in a playlist of course have to match. You cannot just add any song to a playlist.

GOAL OF THE GAME
Create the perfect playlist by putting songs in your playlist that match with each other.
mechanics: Connections, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Singing

name: Cap the Hat
description: A childrens game featuring colored tokens known as "hats". Players move their hats by throw of the dice and attempt to capture opponents "hats" by moving over them and then returning them to the safety of their castle. The first player to capture all of his opponents "hats" wins. Technically a childrens game but entertaining for adults as well.

name: Trivia-Sense Cards
description:
6,000 new trivia questions, 1,000 cards in 6 favorite categories:
1 Show Business
2 World Travel
3 U.S. History
4 Literature and Art
5 Sports
6 Potpourri
Cards are color-coded for use with the Trivial Pursuit Master Game Board.

name: Ruhrtropolis
description:
Apparently a promotional game for the Ruhr Valley district in Germany. It seems that the area has historically been associated with heavy industrialization, and the game was part of a public relations effort to alter this image.

The board is divided into a hexagonal grid, onto which tiles representing land developments (businesses, industries, parks, an airport, etc.) are placed. Each space has a set of three tiles which can be placed on it, representing the uses to which the land was put "yesterday", "today", and "tomorrow". Players plan the order in which developments occur geographically, using colored cylinders to mark ownership. Each stage of development requires two player markers, promoting negotiation between players as to what happens first. Developments on a given space must be carried out chronologically (ie. in the order "yesterday", "today", and "tomorrow"). When a development is completed, the rules allow the acting player to swap markers with those of other players in adjacent spaces, subject to certain limitations, thus expanding his control over the local area. At the end of the game, victory points are awarded for each development a player controls, with the more advanced developments scoring more points.
publishers: Wirtschaftsjunioren, Zukunft für Rhein und Ruhr

name: Purdueopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The Purdue University version of the classic game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Knatsch: Das Turnierspiel
description:
Knatsch - the tournament play
for 3 to 5 players, approx.. 20 minutes.

A New Print & Play Game From Michael Schacht on his Spiele aus Timbuktu Web site.

Once in the year the king organizes a gigantic tournament. The participants argue about the favor of the castle and about the profit of castles. The player with most points of fame wins the tournament.

name: König und Konsorten
description:
It´s a little like the German game "Mau Maus" resp. "UNO".
There are four colors with 18 cards, of 5 types including the law cards. Also there jokers.
You start the game with 12 coins and every round with 6 hand cards. The game ends when one player has no more money left at the end of a round. The player with the most money wins.
On your turn you place a card on the discard pile. It has to match the color or the type of the last card. If you can´t place a card you have to draw a new one. If you can´t place it either your turn ends.
The round ends when one player has no more cards. Leftover cards cost you money and round end law cards are applied.
The law-cards help you or force other players to do silly things every turn or get a disadvantage during the round or at the end of it.
Some of the cards have instant effects on them.

box-inventory
82 cards
60 coins (gold and silver)
rules

name: Imaginiff Card Game
description:
From the Buffalo Games Press Release:

A card version of the hilarious party game now packaged to travel and move to meet the “on-the-go” demands of today’s family. The game is simple. Imagine what the other players are most like. Imaginiff your mother were a car. Which would she be? A mini Cooper? A pick up truck? A Trans-Am? or taxi cab? While everyone gets to vote, only the most popular answer wins - a great way to get to know what your friends and family really think of you!
publishers: Buffalo Games, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Sherlock Holmes:  A Game of Deduction and Suspense
description:
In Sherlock Holmes : A Game of Deduction and Suspense a diamond has been stolen and the detective Sherlock Holmes must discover who has done the crime. There is a single counter representing Sherlock Holmes and the players take turns moving it about the board.

The game is played on the board and with a deck of cards. Each cards has a picture of one of the suspects on it and there are two cards for each suspect. At the start of the game one player shuffles the cards and places one face down in the middle of the board. The remaining cards are then dealt out to the players.

Whenever a player lands on a picture of a suspect they must show any cards of that suspect. If they land on an "investigate" space they can examine a card from another player's hand. And, if they land on the "Scotland Yard" space then all players holding pairs of cards (two cards of the same suspect) must show them. Other spaces have special events on them which cause players to exchange hands and the like.

Play continues until one player thinks they know who the culprit is. They announce their choice and check the card in the middle of the board. If they are correct they are the winner. Otherwise they are out of the game and play continues until someone makes the correct guess.

Sherlock Holmes is a variant of the game Clue . The object is to figure out which card is in the middle of the board. Since there will be two cards for every suspect in the player's hands except for this one the idea is to figure out which card doesn't have a match in another hand.

This game was authorized by the Sir. Arthur Conan Doyle estate.

name: Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal: Spreekwoorden en Gezegden
description: The first expansion of the game Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal. There are 2000 questions about proverbs. The questions are divided in three different difficulties.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Akindo
description:
In Akindo, players are merchants in Japan during the Edo period. Everyone starts out with a small store, and has to do their best to make it as big as possible.

Each round in Akindo has two phases: Purchase and Barker.

During the Barker phase, the active player rolls three dice and divides them between himself and one other player. This will gain those players coins, depending on the distribution of these dice. However, depending on how things turn out, you may be forced to pay to alter the numbers rolled, so you need to be careful about assigning the dice.

During the Purchase phase, goods are sold on the east and west markets. The players bid on the goods, with the highest bidder gaining the goods.

Collecting sets of goods gains you points. The player who scores the most points wins the game.

name: Movie Plotz: The Sequel
description:
Movie Plotz: The Sequel is a standalone expansion to 2014's Movie Plotz. All new Movie Plotz cards!

Players begin with a simple plot (a simple sentence) then draw cards to modify the movie concept. With each draw, players get to redo the pitch and make it even more exciting. In the end, the final plot will be a guaranteed hit!

The game lasts for approximately 15 minutes, until all cards have been played. Depending on the rules variation that you choose to play, the player with the most points will win.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Print & Play

name: 詠み人知らず (Yomibito Shirazu)
description:
User summary
詠み人知らず (Yomibito Shirazu) is a relay style game where players collaborate to compose haiku with pen and paper. Pass around the poem and have each player add a single character until the haiku is completed.

リレー形式で協力して俳句を詠む紙ペンゲームです。詠み札を回して、一文字ずつ変わりばんこに文字を書き入れていって俳句を完成させます。

name: Chamuyo: De una!
description: Chamuyo is a storytelling game in which you have to convince the judge by looking for your best arguments defending an association of letters. You are going to have to use your best chamuyo (chatter), so that the judge gives the points to you. If you don't win for best chamuyo, maybe you will earn points for rowing it!
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Portland Occupied Zone
description:
Portland Occupied Zone (POZ) is a semi-cooperative board game where you and up to seven other players roleplay as slacker activists trying to bring about Revolution in Portland’s fantasy Hawthorne District. The objective is to transform your neighborhood from a late-stage capitalist hellscape into a slacker Marxist utopia.

The game is turn-based. At the beginning of every round new Narratives and Aktions are drawn and voted on, and the police and the Medic will take their turns. There are no discreet game stages, but the early game will likely be focused mainly on looting and burning, which builds up your characters and the POZ. The Police are quite tough, and players are unlikely to be able to defeat them early on.

When space for building has been cleared out and players have amassed a large enough arsenal, it will be time to bring the fight to the Man. The police work on a simple AI (similar to Space Hulk). They will be relatively passive early on but their aggressiveness will increase as the POZ grows.

POZ is semi-cooperative, and there are two conditions for winning:

a) The POZ must be built up, the police must be defeated, and the courthouse must be occupied. This is a group effort which benefits all players.

b) Once the courthouse is occupied, however, only the player with the highest score is the winner.

—description from publisher
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Pitagoras
description:
NUMBERS JUGGLING!
Dice, cards, reflexes and… math!

Pitagoras (Pythagoras) is a wacky party game where you have to do quick calculations.

3 DIFFICULTY LEVELS:
- replace the blue die with red or black to adjust the difficulty level to the age of the players (by adjusting the range of numbers).

Pythagoras is a great party game, but it can also be used for education.

—description from the publisher

In Pitagoras players try to gather as many cards as they can by combining the numbers into an equation so the cards give a result shown on the dice.

At the beginning of each round one player reveals 5 cards and throw two dice. Now in real time the players try to be the first to arrange the cards in an equation using the four simplest mathematical operations so the solution is the result on the dice. The first player to solve the puzzle yells: "Got it!" - and shows the solution. They take the cards used in the equation and new round starts. The player that gather the highest number of cards is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Real-time

name: On Porpoise
description:
The best dressed dolphin takes the ocean in this fast paced card game. You will be challenged by polka dots, paisley patterns and predators as you race to get rid of your cards first. Keep a look out because there are more than just sharks in this water.
Catch the cards played on porpoise and you might live to tell the tale.

Cards are divided evenly between all players and placed in face down stacks. In tge center of tge table are the three porpoise cards, the head (which needs a hat), the body (which needs a jacket) and the tail (which every well dressed porpoise should cover). All players play cards simultaneously in an attempt to match the existing clothing patterns or clothing colors currently played on the porpoise in the center of the table. The first player to play their entire card stack wins the game!

name: Corporate Pursuit
description:
From the rules:

"Welcome to Corporate Pursuit and the world of high finance. You are now an investor building a financial empire by buying, selling, and trading corporate stocks. Million dollar deals are a piece of cake because all the calculations you'll need are listed right on the stock certificates. The only figuring you have to do is adding up your fortune at the end of the game."

The game uses many real companies as the companies in which the players buy stock.

name: Yahtzee: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 edition of Yahtzee offers fans of the Marvel Cinematic Universe to engage in classic Yahtzee play or battle it out with their fellow Guardians while recruiting the help of fan favorite Groot.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Eye Guess
description:
Based on the popular 1966-69 game show, two players are shown eight answers for eight seconds. One player answers questions by giving the number covering the appropriate answer, calling "Eye Guess" is s/he thinks the answer is not one of the eight shown. A player continues to answer questions until missing. 100 points wins the game, after which the winner tries to collect prizes in an "avoid the STOP! card" bonus game.

Four editions were made, the only ones in host Bill Cullen's long career to have him on the cover. It has been rumored for many years that the Fourth Edition was later modified to use the show's final (1968-69) "Stop and Go" bonus round.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Monopoly: The Godfather – Collector's Edition
description:
From publisher page:

"Enter the world of The Godfather Collector’s Edition of MONOPOLY, where you “keep your friends close, but your enemies closer.” Buy, sell and trade your way through the most memorable locations from The Godfather movie trilogy. Buy a stake in Moe Green’s Casino or take over the Corleone Lake Tahoe Estate as you work your way to the top in the “family business.” And as you wheel and deal around the board, from the Woltz Mansion to the legitimate Genco Import Company, remember to “make them an offer they can’t refuse.”
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Termite Towers
description:
Termite Towers is the next insect-forward offering in the line after Waggle Dance. Termite Towers brings players into the world of the efficient and dedicated termites, building on the mechanics of Waggle Dance.

Players compete to complete their section of the mound first, gathering the necessary resources from the wood pile, whilst hatching new termites and training up soldiers that can help you secure the best spots.

With the wood you have gathered, you use the polyomino plan cards to construct your tower, the winner is the first player to build the required number of rows (5 for a shorter game, 7 for a longer game).

Much like its predecessor, you can also call on the help of the Queen to help you, or hinder your opponents.

—description from the designer

name: Hold-Up
description:
Elliot got out of jail and works at the gas station that belonged to his adoptive father. As a bandit, it is this place that you decide to rob ... and as much to tell you that you fall badly!

Luckily, Elliot has you in the right, and agrees to teach you the basics of the job. But before, you will have to prove yourself!

Choose the places to point, select your equipment and sharpen your skills to become the biggest gangster in the United States.

Hold-Up is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!
publishers: Delight, FoxGames, Makaka Editions, Van Ryder Games

name: Tremble, Humans! Card Game
description:
Tremble, Humans! Сard Game is a highly thematic board game in which players again take roles of alien generals, invading earth to fill their cargo with intergalactic currency – humans. Each turn of the game some cites are available for attacks and players simultaneously choose a place to attack, splitting their fleet between cites, if necessary. But one city is too small for two generals – so if there are multiple players trying to invade a city, their armies will fight and only the strongest will capture the humans! After the round, generals get support – new ships, as well as the amount of fuel will increase during invasion, making alien fleets larger. After 6 rounds and additional goals scoring the richest player wins.

Changes from board game version: no more game board, each ship grant player cubes and abilities - but no numerical value, only number of success on rolled cubes counts - not numerical values, now rewards for each city are random and determined by the deck player choose to draw from.

—description from the publisher

name: Octet
description: Octet is a rowing game. Players begin with an 8-place boat and a single rower in place number one on the boat. Each player gets 4 blocks; blocks have numbers from zero to 8 on them. A round happens in two phases: first, you can take any two of your blocks and place a man on the difference space on your boat (play a 7 and a 3 and place a guy on space 4). Everyone does this, then phase two begins: now, if you play a pair of numbers you bump the person off that spot on every boat, including your own. Then the boats move equal to the number of men on the boat. You draw four new blocks each round and don't need to use them all each turn, allowing a massive build up or bump off spree. First to the finish line wins.

name: Carapace
description:
Carapace is something like a refined fox-and-hounds: The two players have different sets of pieces, and the offensive player can always capture the defensive pieces eventually. In a game, each player plays each role once, and the player who eliminated the defense in the fewest moves wins the game.

The board is composed of rectangular spaces arranged like bricks in a wall, making it effectively hexagonal. There are blocked spaces where no one can move, and three sets of differently colored "closable" spaces - when an offensive piece is on a colored square, similarly colored squares are off limits to the defense. There are also squares numbered 1 - 3; when a defensive piece lands on one of these, the number is added to the offensive player's move total.

name: Stalk-1
description:
Stalk-1 is the first incorporation of 1/285th Scale Miniature vehicles into a boxed wargame. The game is designed to demonstrate the aesthetics of miniatures for tactical wargaming.

The game comes with 4 8x10 modular hex based mapboards and 10 1/285th scale German and Russian metal tank miniatures (from CinC). A unique movement system has one player secretly plot his/her moves, then the other player makes their moves directly on the mapboard, after which the plotted moves are executed and combat can take place by either player at any time during the execution of the plotted moves. Turret direction (and speed determined by gun size) are factors in the combat system.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pirates of the Caribbean
description: This track game, based on the theme park ride, is part of the Disneyland series of games. On your turn you roll the die and move along the track the number of spaces indicated. You may try to get a Treasure card by moving onto one of the branch tracks leading to a pirate holding a treasure chest. If you roll a number printed on the chest you take a card. Some cards show gold and are needed to win, others show Tiny (the fat lady at the auction) or a pirate in the dungeon and are worthless but are kept so that opponents don't know how many treasures you have. Landing on a peg leg pirate space forces you to lose a treasure. The first player with 2 treasures to reach the end of the boat track by exact count wins.

name: Rapid Fire!
description:
Rapid Fire! is a two-player shooting-gallery game in which the object is to knock down targets of the other player's color.

The targets - alternating in red and yellow - rotate on a circular, battery-powered central wheel. Rotating in the opposite direction are blocking pegs, which protect the targets. For younger players, the blocking pegs may be removed.

Players fire marble-like balls (also colored red and yellow to represent the owning player) up slightly inclined ramps from opposite sides of the target gallery, with play continuing until one player has eliminated all of the targets in the opposing player's color.

The whole set-up measures over three feet long when assembled. Unlike many shooting gallery games, the trick here is in the timing of the shots - finding moments when an opponent's target will rotate into view and blocking pegs rotate away - rather than in the aim.

name: Action Vietnam
description:
Published in Italy, this game comes in a large box measuring nearly 20 inches by 14 inches. Rules printed in 11 languages including English.

A 2 player game that features miniatures trying to reach the far side of the game board and capturing predetermined spaces. Somewhat abstract in application, this is a very low complexity game.

Vietnam theme is implied only by the incredibly cool game box. Rules give no other indication that this is in any way a simulation of Vietnam warfare.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gettu betur: spurningaspilið
description:
An Icelandic trivia game based on one of Icelands' most popular tv shows, the Gettu Betur trivia show where students representing their secondary schools compete for the Golden Microphone.

There are 2200 questions (language dependent) in this version of the board game which is aimed at adults.

name: Travel America
description:
Travel themed trivia game about the 50 states of America. Game length is variable, depending on the starting and ending points players decide to travel.

Gameplay from box:
"Turn over a mileage card and the adventure begins. When you land, you answer a question about the state you land in. Get it right, and you go on -- collect your money or miles, but get it wrong and you pay. If you're the first traveler to reach the destination and you haven't gone bankrupt -- you win!"

name: Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition (Polish)
description: The first Polish edition of the classic trivia game. It has 2400 questions in 6 categories: geography, entertainment, history, literature & arts, science & nature, sports & leisure.

name: Ziggurat, la pirámide del saber
description:
Ziggurat is a game similar to Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition. The winner is the fist player to get to top of pyramid.

The players must to know the answer to several categories like ´Human body´, ´Animals´, ´Food and Drinks´, ´Clothes´...

They´re seven level of difficulty in card questions and everybody have to answer in one minute limit by category.


Description: From Spanish publisher: (in Spanish)

Ziggurat, versión familar, es un juego de preguntas donde todos participan.

Cuanto más hábil seas, antes encontrará la respuesta.

Hay que llegar a la cúspide del Ziggurat, solucionando los enigmas de cada nivel, que van de menor a mayor dificultad.

Contenido:

1 Pirámide de plastico tridimensional
200 fichas con 400 enignas
1 reloj de arena
4 peones
1 archivador de fichas
1 Tarjetón y libro de instrucciones

name: Battle for Fallujah: April 2004
description:
Battle for Fallujah is a solitaire wargame modeling the first Coalition offensive against the insurgent held city of Fallujah in April 2004, designed as part of an MA in War Studies at Kings College, London in 2008-2009.

As the coalition player, you must weigh up the costs/benefits of using the readily available heavy weaponry to support your two Marine infantry companies as they engage insurgents and local nationalist Iraqis as well as locate and capture the Insurgency's leadership versus the damage to your mission by the media attention of the battle.

You, playing as the coalition, have limited ground resources, but effectively unlimited air and artillery support, must decide whether to use the heavy weapons at your disposal to quickly destroy insurgent opposition. But you must weigh up the destruction caused with the political fallout from the images of a burning Fallujah being broadcast around the world.

The aim of the game is to capture territory from the insurgency, locate and destroy centers of resistance, capture local insurgency leaders and engage enemy forces in order to regain control of the city.

The game is still a 'work in progress' so any feedback would be greatly appreciated.

name: Invaders of Mars
description:
Invaders of Mars is a board game for two or more players using Icehouse pieces set in the genre of the B-rated sci-fi thriller movie. Players take turns fleeing from a powerful alien menace bent on using them as fodder for breeding until only one player is left standing.

Rules can be found online at: http://www.eldritch.org/erskin/icehouse/alienbabies.php

name: Conflicting Kingdoms
description:
Conflicting Kingdoms is essentially a board game where you choose an avatar as your main playing character and you use it to move across the board to engage in battle and defeat your enemies.

But this is unlike any board game you have played before. It uses the unique method of deck building as used in trading card games like Magic the Gathering and Yu Gi Oh. You play the cards from your deck to build the board you play on and you also use the cards to buff your avatar and to weaken your enemies with ability cards.

name: Lucy Hammett's Fishing Bingo
description: A creative spin on classic bingo featuring original color artwork and informative facts on the back of each calling card. Suggestions for different ways to “Bingo” are on the back of the box to add interest to playing the game. Includes 6 player boards, bingo chips and 42 picture cards with an image on the front and facts on the back for freshwater fishing.

name: Fat Zombie
description:
The Zombies have come! Eat your fill of brains to become the fattest zombie. Only then will they call you King!

Fat Zombie is a funny little dice game, a game that melded two of our favorite pastimes: rolling dice and eating. Combined, they form an easy, fun-to-play game about trying to eat as many people as possible to become the fattest zombie! For once you become the fattest zombie... then you shall be King! Why King? Zombies don't care about money, political power or fundraising; they only care about brains. Not even the quality of brain eaten, merely the quantity.

So you and your friends (2-4) set out upon the grandest adventure: to eat as many brains as possible from the hapless humans! But be wary, for the humans are not without the means to defend themselves, and the fattest zombie may soon become the dead undead!

Playing Fat Zombie only takes about twenty minutes, even if you have never played the game. You and your friends are Zombies that wander the streets, looking for delicious brains! On your turn, you draw the top card of the deck and play it for all to see. You will then roll the die to see if you eat the human, if he escapes or hides, or if he kills you.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Dice of March Games

name: Majdan
description:
Majdan is trying to simulate events which took place in Ukraine in January and February 2014 during what is called an “Euromaidan”. The players create the political situation of this state on their own. Depending on their strategy, the paths of Ukrainians future may develop in many different ways. Nevertheless, it must be remembered that the moral loser will always be a faction which decided for the force solution fighting for control over districts as the first and allowing the blood to be spoiled.

The goal of each faction is to gain as many Victory Points as possible, i.e. retain the power in hands of Government and his supporters or to create a new government by the opposition.

Victory Points are scored by taking Control or getting Support in 25 districts, which differs in value. When two factions meet in one district there is a Struggle (for Support or Control). To win a Struggle, players use Cards which portrays means used to win: Masses (supporters of Government or Euromaidan), Militia, Berkut, Army, Specnaz, Media or Titushki. Cards have different values (value part of them is defined by a dice roll). For example, Media has value 5 in Struggle for Support, and 0 in Struggle for Control.

Players has several types of action to choose: get a Card, initiate a Struggle, influence a district, make an peace offer. 5 Actions made an Action Round. 6 Action Rounds makes an complete game (unless someone get to automatic victory earlier).

Majdan reimplements Pomarańczowa Rewolucja game - mechanics was slightly changed, as district values on the map. Cards was changed (new images and its quantity).

All changes were fit to the 2013/2014 political situation on Ukraine.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Pot Farm: The Board Game
description:
Your Uncle Floyd has given you and a few of your buds land to grow some recreational crops.

Inspired by the Facebook cult underground hit, Pot Farm: The Board Game is a 2-4 player competitive farming game where farmers plant high risk/high reward plants while protecting themselves from the Ranger deck. Higher payout crops need higher protection or else the Ranger might come to seize them! Using successfully harvested weed, farmers can buy unique items from a rotating Store to enhance their farms in strategic ways. The game ends when the seed bag is empty. The highest valued farm becomes the ultimate Pot Farm!

Players draw from the included Hemp bag and place crop tokens on their farm placards. Just planting on your farm doesn't guarantee the crops safety from Ranger Dick and competing farmers! Successfully harvesting plant tokens to your stash allows players to afford wacky contraptions and buildings from the rotating store deck to place on their farms for awesome combos and boosts to their production.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Munchkin Metal Pin
description:
Brushed-metal Munchkin pin, in the shape of Spyke's head.

Special rule: Each Munchkin Pin you are wearing gives you a +1 bonus in combat. After each fight you are in, win or lose, roll a d6. If you roll equal to or less than the number of Munchkin Pins you are currently wearing, remove one pin. You may not wear more than one pin of each color during any game.

name: Tremble, Humans!
description:
Have you ever tried to develop a plan to enslave the whole human race? Come to the command center! Here you are going to learn from true experts in this field—our extraterrestrial comrades.
For example, you can try your hand at the tabletop strategic simulator. Try on the alien captain’s uniform and send your squadron to attack the Earth to capture as many people as possible. Because, you know, those humans are the most valuable resource in the whole universe.
Capture people, exchange them for alien warships, fight other captains to carry out missions from alien command and thus—capture even more of these pathetic humans!

Tremble, Humans! is a highly thematic board game, where players take roles of alien generals, invading earth to fill their cargo with intergalactic currency – humans. Each turn of the game some cites are available for attacks and players simultaneously choose a place to attack, splitting their fleet between cites, if necessary. But one city is too small for two generals – so if there are multiple players trying to invade a city, their armies will fight and only the strongest will capture the humans! After the round, generals can buy support – new ships and stations are available for purchase, as well as the amount of fuel will increase during invasion, making alien fleets larger. After 8 rounds and additional goals scoring the richest player wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Sickest Witch
description:
The witches of Black Branch are on the hunt.

In Sickest Witch, you and your friends will isolate enemies and take turns attacking until you can harvest a body part. Hands, hearts, livers -- witches imbue them with magic to make themselves more powerful. Although a group of witches attack the same target, it's the witch that strikes the killing blow that gets to harvest a body part and imbue it with powerful magic. The witch with the most body parts (spells) wins.

This is a casual RPG-like game that you can take anywhere. By controlling the number of enemy cards, you can dictate how short or long your game needs to be. The rules are simple. Even if you aren't familiar with RPGs, you will pick it up in minutes.

Replayability is unquestionably high. Though this is a simple game, the tension and fun relies on the nearly limitless variables of the spell cards and dice rolls. No game will ever be the same.

Competitive yet somehow collaborative. All players are attacking the same target and no players die. It's just the best (and sometimes luckiest) Witch that wins. It's a feel good game of endless slaughter.

—description from the publisher

name: Flaggy
description:
The box contains 3 wooden dice and 48 round cards, with the flag on one side and some Country information on the other (the capital, the continent, the surface and the population).

You can play 5 different games, with which you will learn to identify the flags of the most important Countries of the world, their capital, the surface and the population.

First of all you can train yourself to recognize the flags of the world. Then you can challenge your friends to find the only flag with the symbols rolled on the dice or to put them in order based on area or population. The games are many... you do not have to know the flags, but just have a great desire to have fun and learn.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Educational, Game System, Party Game

name: World of Tanks: Rush – PzKpfw I
description: World of Tanks: Rush — PzKpfw I, a promotional card for the World of Tanks: Rush base game available at conventions and through hobby stores, features a light German tank that costs 1, provides no resources, and has a Recruitment ability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: World of Tanks: Rush – БТ-2
description: World of Tanks: Rush — БТ-2, a promotional card for the World of Tanks: Rush base game available at conventions and through hobby stores, features a light Soviet tank that costs 1, provides no resources, and has a Scouting ability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Cthulhu: The Great Old One – Deluxe Edition
description:
Cthulhu: The Great Old One (Deluxe Edition) is a quick-play card game based around the characters and mythology of the writings of H.P. Lovecraft.

In Cthulhu: The Great Old One (Deluxe), each player takes their turn in order; first drawing, then stealing, then recruiting cards, and finally playing any Pairs they might hold, as well as any one Horror or Cultist card.

Matched Pairs give 2 victory points, Linked Pairs give 1 victory point, as does any played Horror cards.

Once any player completes their 7th pair, the game ends and players count up their victory points.

If any player holds the Great Old One card, they lose the game regardless of points. However, if a player holds the Great Old One and has already played the Cultist card in their play area, they win! Otherwise, the player with the most victory points wins!

With the Horror cards and game mechanics, there are a lot of fun strategies to keep the fast-paced action going, but there still remains a luck element as well to help give less experienced players a fighting chance against players who are more familiar with game possibilities.

The Deluxe version is basically a whole new game drawing inspiration from the original, but re-implementing the system with new cards, new card types, new turn style and play mechanics, and updated card looks and text.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Panic Room
description:
A game that combines the role of werewolf and the move of a spy. the theme is a white room of nothingness, there is 3 faction in this game Villager, Hitman, and Serial Killer. Villager goal is to kill all Hitman and Serial Killer, Hitman goal is to kill all villager and serial killer, and serial killer goal is to kill hitman and all vilager.

The game play is that five people choose a color where it represent the pawns for the game. The arena consist of 36 rooms (6x6 room). The players then get the role. There is 5 role in this game

Gunner, fraction Villager. A villager that hold gun with 1 bullet if he meet serial killer or hitman he can kill them.

Ammo, fraction Villager. A villager that hold the amunition for the gunner, if he meet the gunner when gunner didnt have amunition he can reload the gunner ammo

Lazarus, fraction Villager. A man with 2 life if he died he can get revive. if he meet the same villager he can tell whether whom kill him.

Hitman, fraction hitman. A man with a gun if he meet villager other than gunner with loaded gun or serial killer he will kill him.

Serial killer, fracton serial killer. A man with a knife if he meet villager other than gunner with a loaded gun or hitman he will kill him

after the player get the role the player choose where the pawns will be placed

after that the player take turn rolling a 4 side dice. the number represent the room the player can move a room

if a player meet with another player in a room after he didn't have anymore room to move. the player that meet exchange the card and the rule of the game play

the game goes on until there is a fraction that win the game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Trick-taking

name: Karibiens guld
description: You are in the Caribbean to look for the mythical gold treasure that sank with the ship San José in 1708. In order to dive for the treasure you must find map pieces and pearls. It is a struggle for time, because there is always a risk that someone else will get the treasure. In addition, there are pirates who are interested in your money. Good luck on this adventurous journey towards the treasure!

name: Vampyre Hearts: A Trick-Taking Game
description: Raise the stakes on the classic game of Hearts in a bone-chilling twist to the trick-taking card game! With the Queen of Vampyres hiding amongst your number, her thirst for Hearts may send everyone to an early grave. Can you strike her down before time runs out? Housed in a gorgeous coffin-shaped box, this set includes a deck of unique illustrated playing cards and rules for standard Hearts play as well as expanded rules and a token for a vampyric variation that adds hidden roles and ulterior motives to the fast-paced classic. Prepare for a thrilling and bloodthirsty game night for new players and experts alike!

name: Yeti Slap
description: Yeti Slap is a speed card game where players try to get rid of their cards the fastest. Player's slap down cards on top of matches, but if an action comes up, players must be the fastest to do the action and then can slap down another card on the action card. Learn in 5 minutes, play for years!

name: RisiKo! Più
description:
Your objective is to fully occupy 3 Empires in addition to your own.

This game in the RisiKo! family of games is markedly different to the original RisiKo! as it has no territory cards, and players do not get armies based on the total number of individual territories, but instead for controlling regions, banners and castles.
