The different cards in the game act as combat modifiers: Allow for players to carry on attacks that are otherwise not permitted, get reinforcement armies, force temporarily non-aggression pacts or look at another player's cards.

The game is remarkably similar to Castle Risk. There are, however, several differences -some of them rather substantial- between the two games. Just to describe a few of them (comprehensive list here):

The game's objectives (wining conditions) are different: Total conquest in Castle Risk vs a prefixed amount of conquests (Fully occupy 3 Empires in addition to your own) in RisiKo! Più.
"Spoils"/Reinforcements are to be reclaimed, in RisiKo! Più, in the beginning of each round, while in Castle Risk this is done at the end of the round instead.


—user summary

name: Monopoly: Avatar – Nickelodeon The Last Airbender Edition
description: Imagine taking a journey through the four bending nations as a member of Team Avatar, wielding incredible powers to protect the lands from the Fire Lord! In this Monopoly Board Game: Avatar: The Last Airbender Edition, players move around the board as Aang, Katara, Sokka, Toph, Zuko, or Suki. The more properties a player can protect, the more rent they'll be able to collect. The last player with coins when others have gone bankrupt wins! Copyright 2021 Viacom International Inc. All Rights Reserved. Nickelodeon, Nickelodeon Avatar: The Last Airbender and all related titles, logos and characters are trademarks of Viacom International Inc. The Hasbro, Hasbro Gaming, Parker Brothers, and Monopoly names and logos, the distinctive design of the gameboard, the four corner squares, the Mr. Monopoly name and character, as well as each of the distinctive elements of the board and playing pieces are trademarks of Hasbro for its property trading game and game equipment.

name: Orcs & Trolls
description: Leading a orcs horde, go on a treasure hunt. Defeat the numerous traps, fight elves and dwarves and survive to all challenges set by the other players.

name: NOVA True Science
description:
From the box:

"Like the popular NOVA television program on PBS, the NOVA TRUE SCIENCE game will intrigue and entertaining science-phobes and science-philes alike. Players wander around a Big Brain Game Board and earn points by answering simple true-false questions or tougher "genius" questions. The 900 questions fall into six science categories: Life, Earth, Physics, Technology, Science & Society, and Random Access (anything goes). Players can use Brain Boost and Cross Current spaces to take strategic shortcuts. Plus, they can even bet on their opponent's science knowledge by taking an Einstein's Gamble."

Game includes Big Brain Game Board, 4 playing pieces, 200 True/False cards, 100 Genius cards, 1 die, and Rule Booklet which includes a brief glossary of science terms.

A joint effort by Aristoplay and WGBH-Boston Educational Foundation, producers of NOVA.

name: Battles of 1866: Frontier Battles
description:
One of the three games split off from the earlier Battles of 1866: Frontier Battles project from APL, this game covers five different smaller battles from the Austro-Prussian War. These battles are... Trautenau, Soor, Nachod, Skalitz, and Gitschin.

This game uses the same system as War of the States: Gettysburg, 1863 and War of the States: Chickamauga & Chattanooga which is similar to the Rome at War and Eagles Of The Empire series as well. In this game, the units are Prussian, Austrian, and Saxon infantry brigades artillery batteries, and cavalry regiments. The pieces are moved around topographic maps of the various battlegrounds. Combat is resolved using by rolling a number of dice equal to the total combat strength of units involved in combat, with hits scored on a result of 6.
mechanics: Action Points, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Murder at Mardi Gras
description:
It’s Mardi Gras in New Orleans and the Krewe of Midas is holding their annual masquerade ball. As you would expect from the most exclusive and elite Krewe in New Orleans, it will be an evening of gowns, glamour, gossip, and MURDER!
Old scores are settled and family secrets are exposed when Pierre DuPre, the King of the Krewe, is murdered. The party guests must work together to determine who strangled the Mardi Gras King with a priceless vintage necklace!

Did the Magnolia queen and her Cajun fiancé conspire to kill the old man and inherit his millions? Was it Pierre’s young wife he brought home from Las Vegas? Did his lawyer or his personal chef kill him to pursue wealth and power? Was it his next door neighbor, the eccentric Gothic novelist? Perhaps it was the French maid who knew too much about the eccentric millionaire of the Garden District. There might also be a vampire and a swamp witch joining the party!

Get your costume together, put on your Mardi Gras beads, refill your Hurricane glass, and help solve a Big Mystery in “The Big Easy!”

Game Includes:

Everything you’ll need to play a 2-3 hour dinner party game
• 10 Party invitations (8 in more recent versions)
• Secret clues
• Party Planner Booklet
• Nametags
• 10 Player’s Booklets (8 in more recent versions)
• Dinner menus & recipe

name: Battle of Honey Springs
description:
Honey Springs is a DTP game by LPD Games, designed as a mini-game introduction to their Battles of the American Civil War series. Honey Springs covers the largest Civil War battle in the Indian Nations and features major Indian forces on both sides, and the 1st Kansas Colored Volunteers, the West's premier Black regiment.

DTP Components are downloadable PDF's.
• 1x 8 1/2x 11" map
• 1 Game Reference card
• 12 p. illustrated color rules booklet with historical commentary & bibliography.
• 54" 9/16" game pieces, representing combat units and status markers

The game is also available on Cyberboard

Deluxe Honey Springs, with die cut counters, an 11x17 map and tabloid printed rules, in a folio folder, is available from the publisher.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Hollow Trail
description:
In Hollow Trail, you become pilgrims on the long-for-gotten road to salvation. Your goal is to place cards controlled by you (servants)on selected locations and gain points. But the trail vanishes in your steps, so it´s up to you, if you´re willing to sacrifice your servants by placing them on those doomed places.

There are 4 actions in player´s turn:

Send - You’ll start every turn with 5 Minions in your hand. When you take a Send action, choose one of them and place it below the leftmost card of the trail. Mark it with a token in your color.
Travel - With a Travel action, you advance one Minion along the trail to the right. Your Minion can take a number of steps indicated by its speed
Fight - With a Fight action, you can attempt to slay or turn an opponent’s Minion. Choose one of your Minions at that same location. Your Minion is the attacker and your opponent’s Minion is the defender. Specify whether you will fight with strength or willpower.
Conjure - Each location along the Hollow Trail holds magical power that can be unleashed by those who know its secrets. To take a Conjure action, your Minion and its location must have a matching type. This type determines the type of spell you can Conjure.


Contests
Hollow trail is a positional game. To score, you need to send your Minions to a particular location. The locations that allow players to compete for points are called Contests. The Contests are not resolved until the scoring phase (every 4 rounds) so it’s not enough to gain the dominant position – you must hold it.

Scoring phase
After each set of 4 rounds, there is a scoring phase, as indicated by the timing track along the top of the scoreboard. The following things happen in this order:
1. Guardians attack. Resolve Guardians from left to right.
In the example below, the Guardian attacks the location to its left, turning the red Minion into a Lost Minion.
2. Score locations from left to right.
In the example below, the red and blue players are tied at the first location, so each gets 2 points. No one gets points at the second location. The red player could have scored 5 points at the third location, but red’s Minion was turned, so no one scores. Both players at the Campsite score 1 point.
3. Old trail vanishes! Remove the first three locations and all Minions there. Cards go to their respective discard piles. Slide all remaining cards left.
4. If any of the remaining locations is still face down, turn it face up. Guardians revealed this way do not attack, but give Guardians and Obstacles their resistance tokens and replacement-option cards, as usual.
5. New trail appears. Shuffle the deck corresponding to the next part of the game and deal out 3 new locations face down.
At the ends of part I and part II, the first three locations in the trail are removed. The Minions at those locations have a chance to glean magical essence for their players, but they don’t survive to the next part of the game. In general, it’s a good idea to get at least one Minion to the second half of the trail so you aren’t starting the next part of the game with nothing.
6. The leftmost card of the trail must not be an Obstacle or a Guardian. If it is, replace it with a random Contest from the same deck.
7. All players may now discard any number of Minions from their hands and draw back to a full hand of 5. In this case, all cards must be drawn randomly from the deck.
8. Advance the round counter and determine a new starting player. The player in the worst position gets to go last. This means the starting player is the player to the left of the one with the fewest points. If players are tied for fewest points, the one with fewer Minions is worse off. If there is still a tie, break it randomly.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Planets
description:
In the future, the human race has used up all of earth's resources. Now they must mine the moons of distant planets to gain Resource to support their fleets. The mining corporations fiercely defend their territory while try to push other corporations out of their way in the search of Resource.

Planets is a free print-and-play game focused on turn-based tactics.
Your goal is to capture planets, grow your fleet, push back the enemy forces and capture their home planets. The size of your fleet depends on how well you capture and control territory.

During the game, the players recruit ships, capture planets to gain resources, build defenses on captured planets and deny territory from the enemies.

The game comes with a few modular rules that can be stacked or left out of the game. These rules include Environmental effects, Commander units & Discovery that hides the planets and moons until visited.

All you need to play this game is a printer, scissors, some glue or tape for the discovery rules and a die for the environmental effects. All the files needed to create your own maps, commanders etc. are available.
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: BOL (Balls Of Light)
description:
BOL (Balls Of Light)
English Rules are available from the game page.

It is a funny race among "Balls Of Light" that may take the form they prefer and gain mad extra powers if they pick up the Energy Ball you can place in the Circuit. Very simple and interactive. Declare a number, roll two dice. If your score is equal to or greater than your declared number, you win your bet. You then double your declared number and you can move your BOL on the circuit a number of hexes up to that number. If your score is lower, you lose your bet. You can move up to the score you obtained.

Apply all variants available in the rulesheet and on website at your will!

BOL have plenty of imagination: invent and propose new variants to other player: if a majority of other players like them, play them! Bump other Balls, gain extra charges, move right behind the leader with the teleport... and have fun!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Takamatsu: The green pagoda
description:
Expansion to Takamatsu

The green pagoda is placed on the lowest Shogun beside the game board, doubling the value of that card.

name: Tricky
description:
A Dutch game.
Each player controls a mobster gang consisting of one Boss and 20 members. A player can win if all other bosses are eliminated or by occupying one side of the board and playing the appropriate card related to that side.

Players have the option of either moving or cashing money:

Pieces can move on foot or up to four can move faster by car. When either one of the gang is on a "Take a card" space, follow that instruction. Cards can be good, or not really, at times. When stopping at a space occupied by rivals, a shootout occurs. A six sided die (two blank sides, two times one and two times two) is rolled until only one gang is present in the square. Players eliminate whatever they roll, a blank being a miss.

After placing the boss on the board all gang members and cars have to be purchased. Money can be cashed if playing pieces occupy squares in front of nightclubs or restaurants. They can gamble by rolling the die if they occupy one or more casino spaces. Most money is made when a gang succeeds in smuggling a barrel of alcohol from the owned brewery to one of the bars.
Controlling the police comes in handy as well.

The board consists of a grid with streets and blocks divided in a North, East, South and West side.
The gangs come in six colors. Bosses are depicted with a portrait while gangsters are black silhouettes. All have a nickname and no two are alike.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Masters of the Universe
description:
He-Man and Skeletor race to be the first to Castle Grayskull.

One player starts at the bottom right of the board and the other at the bottom left and their objective is at the top of the board on the center of that edge.

Players take it in turns to place tiles which construct a maze of paths. The players may extend their own path or reroute their opponents path. Tiles with characters from the TV show can be used to block a path.

Ages 7 - 14
categories: Fantasy, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: If You Had to Choose ...?
description:
If You Had To Choose...? A FANTASY GAME ABOUT PRIORITIES TM

If you had to choose... would you rather (A) be breathtakingly beautiful but have to go to prison for five years, or (B) always be plain looking but never go to jail?

If you had to choose... would you rather be stuck in a one room cabin for two weeks during a severe snow storm with (A) George Bush, or (B) Michael Jackson?

If you had to choose... would you rather (A) always be extremely rich but never meet the person of your dreams, or (B) never make more than minimum wage your whole life but find true love?

If you had to choose... would you rather (A) be famous but die at 58, or (B) always be anonymous but live until 98?

If You Had To Choose...? A FANTASY GAME ABOUT PRIORITIES TM is a party game for ages 16 and up that really makes you think but in a fun way. As the millennium unfolds it is evident that people are searching for more depth and meaning in their lives. If You Had To Choose...? is a soul searching game that helps people discover what's really important to them and to others by asking thought provoking questions about their priorities and values in life having to do with love, money, relationships, spirituality, etc. But it does this in a fun and humorous way using fantasy which allows people to enter into totally imaginary situations. People want to escape their everyday lives and If You Had To Choose...? lets them.

Players will predict (by betting with chips) how others will answer and then attempt to persuade them to change their minds in intense discussions. Players, through answering, predicting, persuading and discussing will have eye-opening revelations about themselves and others and also have a great time in the process.

CONTENTS: Instructions, 660 questions, 330 cards, 20 marker cards, 200 chips, 1 sand timer

For 2 to 10 players ages 16 and up.

name: Speedy Eddy
description:
From the Blue Orange Games website:

Somewhere in a secret vegetable garden, a few intrepid snails are preparing for the most exciting race of the year. Taking turns, roll the dice to help your snail progress. Watch out for mole holes, dodge flying carrots, and beware of the strong winds as your snails may lose its shell! Without a shell on its back, your snail goes slower so use the two dice with a touch of ingenuity to get a shell back on your snail and your snail back in the race. And win the famous Speedy Eddy Trophy!

name: Monopoly: John Deere
description:
Presenting the John Deere Collector’s Edition of the world’s most famous board game, MONOPOLY. Get rich quick while buying, selling and trading the most admired and monumental equipment throughout the history of John Deere, one of the most revered agricultural, construction and forestry equipment manufacturers in the world.

Celebrate the entrepreneurial spirit of John Deere, the man who created an American legacy over 165 years ago, while you strive to own his enterprise and enjoy the world’s most popular board game, MONOPOLY. All components, including 6 collectible pewter tokens of the Model “B” Tractor, Model “B” Tractor, 9620 Tractor, L110 Lawn & Garden Tractor, 650H Dozer and John Deere Plow, are sure to please all John Deere fans and collectors.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tack Game Authoring System
description:
Tack™ is a deck of playing cards and a game authoring system. 14+ different games have be designed with this system. There are three games included. The publisher encourages people to invent games that meld numbers, colors, symbols or other combination. Each card has six Types in a simple and functional face. These playing cards also have many melding opportunities and some of the best melds use addition or subtraction as the goal for collection.

The Tack™ deck is suitable for playing new games unavailable to a regular card deck. Regular card games including Crazy Eights, Oh Hell!, Texas Hold 'Em, Poker, Hearts can be played with this deck.

Each tuck-box has rules for three original games ( http://www.gameyex.com/rules.html ) and comes complete with all the tools needed to author new games.

The quality of this deck is good and feels best after it has been worked a few times. Printed on 14pt German card stock with a glossy finish, it pleases both the eye and the mind.

Online Play

http://www.gameyex.com/games.html (against AI)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Chronology Junior
description:
Chronology Junior: A Card Game for All Time

Players build a time line of cards. Each card contains a event and the year in which it occurred. Players begin with one card each, which is placed face up in front of them. On her turn, a player is read an event from a new card; the player must then indicate the position on her own time line where the card should be placed. If she's correct she places the card in her own time line; if not, the next player gets an opportunity to win the card. The first player with seven cards wins.

Cards from other Chronology games can be added to increase the number of combinations and the level of challenge.

name: Yin & Yang
description:
Could you turn the universe equilibrium on your side ? Find out in the simple and fast paced card game.

To win the game, using your cards you need to be the first player to reach the perfect balance: to have exactly 3 white stones and 3 black stones in front of you. But beware, other players will mess up with your plans, and some cards could even affect the rules ("à la" nomic).

name: Inspector McClue: Death by Chocolate
description:
From the back of the box:

Everyone's a suspect when murder is on the menu. And with a Classic Detective Murder Mystery you have everything you need to serve up the perfect murder dinner party. First the invites, you choose which of your friends play which devious suspect and invite them to come along as that character. Then the shopping list, menu suggestions and recipes. Plus of course...a really tasty murder to solve. It will be drop dead fun, and by the end of the evening, one (or more) of the suspects, your 'friends', will be caught out as the murderer!
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, Specialty Board Games, Inc., University Games

name: Yvio: SpongeBob Schwammkopf Krosse Krabbe Express
description:
Translated from the publisher's site:

Nothing beats the fresh Crab Burgers from Mr Krabs' Krusty Krab!. In order to deliver those burgers in time to the customers of Bikini Bottom, Spongebob®, Patrick, Squidward, and Sandy® have to hurry. This is possibly the world's fastest boardgame, where the players compete for the title "Employee of the month"! Only the fastest player making no mistakes can win!

Up to four players have to deliver their orders to the correct locations in time and must make sure that no other players steal their orders from under their noses!


successful adaptation of the animated series
(German) original voice talents from the TV series, cool sounds
up to four players fight simultaneously


Works only in combination with the Yvio board game console.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Arriala: Canal de Garonne – L'esprit de Riquet
description:
First mini-expansion for the game "Arriala, canal de Garonne".
The expansion only contains the figure of Pierre-Paul Riquet and the rules.

In the beginning of the game "Riquet" is placed on the village "Montauban".
"Riquet" can be moved by the active player, so "Riquet" can help with the construction of "Canal de Garonne". He's considered as a worker and follows the basic rules of occupying a place on the canal.

The active player can:
- move "Riquet" one time from one village to another village,
- use some of his actionpoints to move "Riquet" one or more places on the canal.
You can't move "Riquet" to the vinyards or the structures by the canal and you can't use cards to move "Riquet".

When a section of the canal is completed with the help of "Riquet", the active player may choose which colour Riquet is to be considered.

source: free translation of the official rules
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Divinity
description:
The New Catholic Catechism Learning System.

(from the back of the box)

Designed for Roman Catholics.
The Catholic Catechism Learning System was created by religious educators as a teaching tool for the home, the parish and the classroom...and it's here for you NOW. Your family (youth over ten years old and adults) will forever enjoy learning and sharing their Catholic faith.

The questions and answers contained in this game were composed by a Catholic theologian and inspired by the Catechism of the Catholic Church. Ask your religious education director about the unique advantages of this family learning system for reinforcing knowledge of the Catholic faith!

name: Family Vacation
description:
Your family wants to have the best vacation ever! Your goal is to visit various cities and famous attractions all over America to increase your family’s happiness and collect bonus points. The player with the highest score at the end wins.

In Family Vacation players each have four family members and a car. A turn consists of moving your car one space. Each family member has two random interests (such as Golf, History or going to the Beach). When your family visits a space corresponding to an interest they have, your family gets happier. :) Every time you travel on the road, it's boring and your family loses happiness. :( While trying to make your family happy, you might also want to visit bonus attractions (such as the Statue of Liberty and the Golden Gate Bridge). Once a space has been visited, it is no longer available to other players. Some spaces require the drawing of a card, which can be good or bad. Maybe your family will stop for a snack, or perhaps someone will have to visit the bathroom – right now!

In addition to your car, each family has one Plane Ticket which allows quick travel between any two airports. Just make sure you plan for the long drive home!

Once your family has had a good vacation and you are satisfied with their level of happiness, you can head home and lock in your score. Players may head home at any time as long as they have visited at least one of their target destinations. Once one player has gone home, a countdown begins; all other players have seven turns to make it home. Players who are home score bonus points while they wait for the last few turns to wind down. In the end, you'll compare notes – that is, scores – and see how your vacation stacks up against everyone else's. Who has bragging rights for this year?
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Plutonian Poker
description:
Plutonian Poker is a set collection game for 2-6 players that uses Looney Pyramids. Players claim pyramids from a shared pool, building scoring combinations with their claimed pyramids. The twist is that you are not allowed to rearrange your claims once you've made them, making the more complicated and valuable sets riskier to achieve.

Rules here: http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Plutonian_Poke...

name: Morphology Junior
description:
From the Kickstarter Page

Morphology Junior takes all the fun of the "original" game and adapts it to younger players (target age: 8+.) In order to move their frog-pieces from the "Start" lilypad to the "Finish," Morphologists must put on their creative thinking-caps to build words like "bike" and "snow" using the 35+ game pieces provided (see below for details). The game mixes some "original" Morphology rules like "Everybody Play" and "Pick 5" with some new adaptations, including "Morph" (where the Morphologist becomes a piece in the game) and "Ribbit, Ribbit" (where the Morphologist can make noises to help his/her teammates guess the right word).

....

In Morphology Junior, players form into up to 4 teams. Each team gets a delightful plastic team frog marker to mark their place along the lilypad themed game board.

After deciding if the players will use the easy or hard sides of the clue cards (or perhaps kids use easy and adults use hard?) the first team to play chooses their first Morphologist who will create the word on the card from a collection of bits including colored cubes, a black string, glass baubles, wooden planks and little wooden 'people'.

In basic play, the Morphologist is a puppeteer and cannot spell out words or symbols, make any sounds other than a small amount of grunting and encouraging for guess feedback, and cannot interact directly with the pieces. The rulebook gives the example of 'toothbrush' and how the Morphologist can't pretend to brush their own teeth but they can brush the teeth of the little wooden figure.

Some of the lily pad spaces can change this though. Everyone Plays allows both teams to guess what the current Morphologist is building. Interception allows an opposing team to guess if the current team doesn't guess correctly by the time the timer runs down. Morph! allows the Morphologist to be a piece as well, so go ahead and brush YOUR teeth! Pick 5 forces the Morphologist to choose just 5 props to use after looking at the word. Pick 5 + 1 however allows the opposing teams to choose the 5 props and the Morphologist gets to add just one more prop after reading the word. And finally there is Ribbit! Ribbit! where the Morphologist can make noises!

Correct guesses allow a team to move their frog to the next lily pad. First team to get their frog to the final lily pad wins!

name: Fin Finaud dans la cuisine
description:
Discover a new way to play a trivia game!

You don't need to have great knowledge to score points; just be smart.
Each player has question cards in his hand.

Your turn:
- Choose one of your questions.
- Choose who will respond and how you ask your question.
- Predict what the result will be (success or failure, for example).

If the chosen players or respond as you expected: you earn points.

400 questions, 6 ways to score points: no need to be a sage to win!

In this first chapter, Fin Finaud takes you to the world of cooking and food in Quebec and elsewhere.

name: Scooby-Doo Fright at the Fun Park
description:
Game description from the publisher:
Jinkies! Can you help the Mystery Inc. gang save the fun park from the spooky ghoul? Whoever figures out where the ghoul is hiding, wins!

Kids will enjoy using the Ticket Cards to make their way around the game board trying to find the ghoul. As they move their favorite Scooby-Doo character mover around the board, they will use the Mystery Decoder to find the answers they need to win the game and save the fun park! They can keep track of all of their clues with the Mini Maps and Wipe-Off Markers.

name: Quirky
description:
Quirky is a fast-moving, quick-thinking, fun, question and answer, bluff and banter game for family and friends. It is not like a conventional fact-based quiz - in this game you decide the answers.

On your turn you answer against a 40-second sand timer and, if you don't know, try to convince others that you do. Younger players compete on equal terms as quick wit and cheeky confidence are more important in the game than knowledge.

You win the cards you answer, unless your answer is challenged, then the winner of the challenge keeps that card and steals another.

If you can't answer you don't pass - you roll the QUIRKY die for a chance to win the card anyway, and if you lose you can choose who it goes to.

A distinctive feature of the game is that many of the answers will vary according to who is playing, when and where.


For family and friends aged 10 years to adult
1152 questions
Game time recommendation 30 minutes, but you can decide that too.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Romulan Drone Ship Card Pack
description:
Prototype 02 is a Romulan drone class ship. As a card pack, it comes with cards, token and a dial.

It is a part of card pack wave 1.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: mei-mei-tantei
description: 名謎偵探 (Mystery Detective) is a fast-paced competitive logical deduction game for 3-8 players. A suspect, a motive, a weapon, and a location are chosen at random from a deck of cards, then players take turns interrogating each other for information about each of the aspects of the crime (by taking a card of the chosen type from another detective). When one player thinks they have the solution, they compare their answer with the hidden cards. If they are correct, they win! However, if any part of their answer is incorrect, the game continues and the foolish detective is eliminated.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Set Collection
publishers: Blue Hour Games, Sharp Point Publishing

name: UNO: Star Wars
description: Uno Star Wars edition. This edition comes with a special “Wild the Force card”. When you play the special card, choose another player and then choose a color. the chosen player must show you their hand and if they have at least one card of the chosen color, they are forced to draw two cards. If they do not have any cards of the chosen color, they suffer no penalty and play continues in current order with the chosen color. If this card is turned up at the beginning of play, the person to the left of the dealer chooses the color start begins play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Magic 8 Ball: Magical Encounters Board Game
description:
Welcome to Magical Encounters!

With the Magic 8-Ball as your guide, embark on an epic adventure! The object of the game is to work as a team to collect four crystals around the board and bring them to the towers. But you need to watch out! Gadworm the dragon will hover over the castle to catch you! Work together as a team and Magic 8 ball will guide you throughout your journey.

On your turn, you roll a die that will give you two numbers; one for your movement and one for the dragon. After you move first, you either pick up the star token that could be a crystal or a useful item along the way or get the encounter! Encounter cards will give you the situation and two options you can choose for your action. After you make the decision, it’s time to consult the Magic 8-Ball! Based on what answer you get from the Magic 8-Ball, you will face different results. At the end of your turn, don’t forget to move Gadworm the dragon based on your dice roll.

—description from the publisher

name: 300: Thermopylae
description:
Battle between the Hellenes forces and the invading Persian forces in 480 BC.
It is a little print and play game that uses components of "300: Earth and water" for a short battle game. This is an assymmetrical dice rolling game with a map, as a Persian you will try to advance to encircle the enemy, as a Greek you have to eliminate all the opponents.

name: Schlängeln
description:
In Schlängeln, players try to lure colorful striped snakes from behind the bushes to sic them on bullies who stole their snacks.

No, that's not right. They want to lure snakes for their own internal satisfaction – well, that and the ability to win the game. To call the snake forward, they must properly guess the color of the snakes through good memory and the right questions. Whoever attracts the most snakes wins the game.

The game is played with twenty cardboard snakes. Each snake has three coloured rings (separated by black rings). At the beginning of the game, each player receives three snakes, which they hide behind their player screen (the bush), with the snakes' heads sticking out underneath the screen.

Now, in turn, the players get to ask one other player for a color. That player then has to respond based on the snakes behind the screen:

If the player has one or more snakes whose first coloured ring behind the screen has that color, the player responds with "Yes!" and pushes those snakes forward from under the screen, so that the coloured ring becomes visible to the other players. The asking player may now ask another question.
If that is not the case, but one or more snakes do have a ring of that color that is further behind the screen, the player responds with "Later!"
If no snakes have a ring of that color, the player responds with "Bad luck!"


If a snake is completely pushed out from under the screen, then the asking player gets the snake, and the player whose snake was pushed out takes a new snake from the supply and places it behind the screen. In this case, the asking player's turn ends.

Twice during the game, a player can use a magical flute, which allows them to direct a question for a color to all other players instead of just one.

The game ends when all the snakes have been lured from the bushes. The player who has collected the most snakes wins.

name: Perspective: The Time Line Game
description: Which came first--the beginning of construction on Notre Dame Cathedral, or the printing of the Gutenberg Bible? Test your historical perspective with Perspective. Two to eight players try to place event cards in chronological order in four categories: Ancient, Middle, Modern, and 20th Century. If you think one of the other players is "out of order", challenge them. Flip the question cards to reveal the dates on the back. If you're right, you get to give that player one of your cards. When all of your cards are played, you win! A fun way to impart historical knowledge and a frame of reference. Contains 100 basic set cards, 100 master set cards, board, custom die and rule sheet.

name: Demontowers
description:
In Demontowers the players are warlords in a fantasy land whose identities are secret. They try to conquer some of the so called demontowers to win the game, and at the same time try to guess which lords the other players are to gain certain advantages over them. You can also reveal your lord to start a revolution in which a certain race defects to your side, so that winning is easier, but you have all the other players against you at this time.

The original Game version is only suited for 2-4 players. A 5- or 6-player-game is possible with an expansion, which comes with additional character-cards and all the other necessary stuff except for the missing dice-sets for the additional players.

name: Kingyo
description:
In Kingyo, you have to catch as many Kingyo (goldfishes) as possible, matching the colors of the dice.

The Kingyo cards are laid out around the 5 dice. Players can divide themselves into teams as they wish. Each player takes a Bowl card to place the Kingyo cards they will catch.

One player rolls the 5 dice, then all players simultaneously try to catch the cards with Kingyo that match the colors of the dice, announcing the colors of the Kingyo caught.

Some cards have bonuses in addition to the Kingyo:
If you catch a Dragonfly, roll all 5 dice again.
If you catch a Hornet, each opponent must discard a card from their bowl.
If you catch a Scoop, you can immediately take any card.

When you think it's no longer possible to catch Kingyo cards with colors that match the dice, catch one of the special "Medaka" cards. The game is over for you, but other players can continue to catch cards if they find any. Be careful because there is one less Medaka card than the number of players...

At the end of the game, players score 1 point for each Kingyo and 4 points for the Medaka card in their bowl. In a team game, only the team's bowl with the lowest score will count.

- description from designers
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching, Team-Based Game

name: Pròxima Obertura
description:
From the English rules:

"The players try to open shops with the most extensive range of products, in the most attractive location. At the end of the game the player who has stocked and located their shops best and given them the most effective business drive is the winner."

This game was created and produced on the occasion of the Year of Commerce Barcelona 2006.

Awards

2007 Premio Jugamos Tod@s
publishers: Ajuntament de Barcelona, Impuls Comercial XXI

name: Plunder!
description:
Plunder! is a fast-paced card game with a lot of "take that" action. Your goal is to steal treasures and pirate crew members from your fellow pirates by playing cards to attack other players and to defend yourself from attacks.

The game has a simple card-playing mechanic at its core, but outside of your turn you can play reaction cards. These influence cards played by other players. Play them at the right time, so you can benefit from the other pirates' actions!

name: Gruselrunde zur Geisterstunde
description:
Just in time for the witching hour, the vampire, the witch and the headless butler have arranged to meet in the ballroom of the villa Schauerstein — but why has the mummy shown up here? And where is the witch?!

In Gruselrunde zur Geisterstunde, players first construct the villa, placing the walls in the box, then sliding cardboard characters on their cardboard "wands" through some of the ten slots. This villa then has a light placed inside it before a roof is added. Each round, a player is challenged to place two characters into the center of the villa. This player moves two of the wands so that the characters inside the villa are pushed forward; she then peeks through a peephole to see whether she's correct, and if so, she gains a scoring token after other players get to verify the characters. After a player collects her third token, finish the round so that everyone has the same number of turns. Whoever has three tokens wins!

Gruselrunde zur Geisterstunde includes a variant in which each round the active player is challenged to place three characters in the center of the villa (instead of two), and opponents guess whether or not this player was correct. After the active player pushes in the character wands, each opponent secretly places either a "yes" or "no" token in hand, then they reveal them simultaneously. If the active player was right, she gains two scoring tokens while each opponent who guessed "yes" earns one; if she's wrong, then each opponent who guessed "no" earns one token. The winning threshold in this variant is 8-10 tokens, depending on the number of players.

name: Monopoly: Collector's Tin Train
description:
Monopoly collector's edition tin train box contains:
numbered gameboard for authenticity
train banker's tray and railroad track title deed card holder
full color chance, community chest and title deed cards
wooden houses and foil-stamped wooden hotels
illustrated monopoly brand money
8 metal tokens with velvet pouch
2 dice
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Knights of the Zodiac Collectible Card Game
description: A collectible card game based on the Knights of the Zodiac animated series. Players try to defeat their opponents knight cards in battle or "take control of" field cards to amass 20 victory points and win a "contest". The first player to win two contests wins the game.

name: Abordagem
description:
Abordagem - Pirates, Privateers and Carracks filled with gold.
(Carracks were the first proper ocean-going ships in Europe; large enough to be stable in heavy seas, and roomy enough to carry provisions for long voyages. They were the ships in which the Spanish and Portuguese explored the world in the 15th and 16th centuries)
All the thrills of XVII century sea navigation.

The players must safely pilot three Carracks from the "Dolphins Bay" to the "Rocks Port", choosing their path through perilous waters filled with pirates and outrunning the other players privateers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hvězdokupy: Hra plná hvězd
description:
Hvězdokupy: Hra plná hvězd (Czech for "Star Clusters: A Game Full of Stars") is an abstract logical game for 2 to 6 players. The players of this game become astronomers trying to find a given constellation. The goal is to be the first player to find the given constellation.

The game is played on a shared 10x10 grid board, which represents the night sky. Each player is assigned a unique constellation to look for on the board. During the game, players take turns to place stars on the grid based on dice rolls. The number rolled on the dice shows with how many stars the currently placed star must neighbour. The dice is 8-sided and each number is part of a pair, so the player may choose between 2 different results. The first player to find/construct their given constellation among the stars wins the game. Shared victories are possible.

A remarkable feature of the game is that the major game pieces glow in the dark, making the game suitable for playing at night, which contributes to its theme.

name: Goldraub in London
description:
Components of "Gold Robbery in London" include 1 game board, 37 sector cards, 12 tip cards, 1 search block, 6 wooden pawns and 1 marker. The game seems based on the work of Edgar Wallace (1875–1932), author of more than 150 detective and adventure novels. The numbers on the hexagonal board correspond to those on the sector cards. Tip cards either say "false tip" or "gold bar". Each player receives a copy of the police gazette, one of each of the two types of tip cards and three sector cards.
Each player tries to find out what cards the other players have. Landing on a space, the player asks and if players have the corresponding cards, they show the positive tip card, otherwise they show the negative card. Each player also gets to find out what the player to their right showed. When someone feels they have located the exact place where gold has been hidden, he can interrupt the game and see if he is right. If correct, he gets a huge bonus, but if wrong takes a major hit to his score.

2 years later described in Reinhold Wittig's SPIELECOLLECTION No. 1 Spiele zur Schatzinsel (1988) as "Versteckt und Entdeckt".

name: 1886 Loures
description:
Game created and produced for the City Municipality of Loures
This board game is for 2 to 6 players, from 8 years old. It begins a few decades before Loures became a municipality. Each player, at each turn, must contribute to the wealth of Loures developing natural resources and preserving the patrimony of the villages around.
The game ends in 1886 (when Loures becomes a municipality). The player who better enlarges the trade with the neighbour zones, better protects the patrimony, better grows rich due to the fruitful lands of Loures wins more points and will become the first Mayor of the City Municipality of Loures
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Unfold: Victim of the Pyramid
description:
My name is Venona. A few days ago, I could n’t even imagine that I, an orphan without kith orand kin, would have to challenge fate itself. Everything changed overnight when the Prophetess declared that the will of the Great Gods demand a sacrifice to continue looking out for the welfare of tribe. And, alas, my beloved Oxiteca was chosen as the sacrifice! As I have nothing left to lose and I decided to defy the gods and venture into the sacred Pyramid, where the ceremony will take place, to save my beloved. What dangers await me on the way and, more importantly,what secrets do these ancient walls keep?

Victim of the Pyramid is an exciting cooperative adventure that fits into a small envelope. Dive into the other-worldly atmosphere of this tabletop adventure and help Venona go pass all trials that the Great Gods have prepared by solving a variety of puzzles. Will you be able to save Oxiteca and not become a victim of the Pyramid yourself?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Questions and Answers
publishers: Alley Cat Games, Delight, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Grand Prix Manager
description:
A formula one motor racing game developed from Ravensburger's Grand Prix.

There are no copies of the game left, but the designers have agreed to upload the rules and board scans for anyone interested in making their own kit.

name: Melvin The Looney Gooney Bird Game
description: This is a children's dexterity game that features Melvin, an electronic plastic bird with a big open beak atop a long flexible neck. To begin, place Melvin on the floor in an open area. Each player takes a colored stick that matches the color of 5 worms. The 20 rubber worms are placed on the floor 5-10 feet away. Melvin is then turned on and he begins jumping, turning, and flapping his wings causing his neck and head to wobble around. The players then rush to pick up a worm using only their stick and then drop it into his mouth. The first player to "feed" him all 5 of his or her worms is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic

name: Unterwegs in Deutschland mit dem Zug
description:
The players travel through Germany with their trains. They have to visit specific cities, answer master questions there, and encounter events in between. Movement allowance is defined by answering trivia questions of all sorts. Several joker cards help on difficult questions.

If a player currently doesn't have a destination card, he gets one; correct guessing the city from its description allows a first move in its direction.
On later turns, the player has to answer a trivia question; depending on the difficulty level chosen, a correct answer gives 2 - 6 movement points.
If he encounters a random event space in between, movement stops, and he follows the directions on the event card.
When he reaches the destination city, he has to answer a master question (multiple choice).

The first player that has encountered at least 3 events and correctly answered 3 master questions wins the game.

name: Tintenherz: Das Würfelspiel
description:
A thrilling and entertaining dice game according the big movie event. Get the support of Mo, Meggie and Elinor to prevent from Capricorn.

The cards are always changing sides. Not till then the right combination is rolled by a player a second time points can be saved. But if you risk too much you get negative cards which can reduce the points dramtically.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cold War Rummy
description: The two-player card game Cold War Rummy was inspired thematically by Twilight Struggle and mechanically by Mike Fitzgerald's Mystery Rummy game series. In the game, each suit represents different geographical areas that players are trying to score, in addition to China and the NATO/Warsaw Pact alliances. Action cards allow players to manipulate their hands and the cards they control. The first player to score 100 VP wins.

name: Carnaval Festival
description:
The theme is based on the darkride "Carnaval Festival" in "De Efteling", a theme park in The Netherlands. The ride is similar to the "It's a small world" ride of Disney fame, but with more red noses.

In the ride you visit the Netherlands, Belgium, the Rivièra, Paris, Great Brittain, Germany, Switzerland, Italy, Japan, China, Alaska, Africa, Mexico and Hawaii. In this game you visit Volendam, Paris, Alaska, Germany, Italy and Africa.

The puppets from Carnaval Festival are hiding out in these six places. For each place there is a cardboardbox that's hiding at least four puppets. The game is a memory game for players of all ages.

The player who collects their pairs of puppets first wins the game.

The players have to "ride" around the board one step at a time, searching for matching pairs of puppets, and bringing them back to START before searching for a new pair. During the game the players have to take surprise cards that will help them further or set them back.

The quickest player with the best memory and the most luck will win the game.

name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Size Doesn't Matter
description:
A single promo card expansion for Ca$h 'n Gun$, selling through Geek Store.

Exchange your gun for the Shotgun.

From now on, you can either aim at one player, or between 2 players.
If you aimed at only one person you play as if it you had a normal gun.
If you aim between 2 players, both are threatened by your gun. If you reveal a bullet (“Bang!” Or “Bang Bang Bang!” take a wound marker for each target and flip them. If none of the markers shows a wound, your old shotgun is jammed. Nobody is hurt and you take your Bang! (or Bang! Bang! Bang!) card back, and throw away one of your remaining “Click” cards instead.

Revealed: Before any round.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mafia, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Deer Lord! For Fame and for Game
description:
Expansion to DEER LORD!. This dual expansion is all about stealing the spotlight, so play with EXTRAVERTS who don't mind being the center of attention.

Contains two expansion sets BROADWAY and GANGSTA.

name: Le Neckbeard
description:
A game about poor hygiene and social skills!

Collect and play Neckbeard cards that have Skills, Ego, Intellect, Appearance and Sustenance on them to match and meet the standards (numbers and colours displayed on the side of waifu cards) of as many waifus from the waifu deck as possible and save them from other unworthy players to win WAIFU points!

Give Responsibility cards (like "Going outside" and "Actual Girlfriend" )to other unworthy players to distract them from fulfilling their waifu's needs!

And watch out for CHAD CARDS! Chad will still steal your cards like he steals your girl in real life!

FIRST to 3, 5 or 7 (or however many you want to save) waifu points wins.

Makes a great gift and works well as a subtle hint that your friend may need a shower.

May the best Gentlesir or M'lady win!

—description from the publisher

name: World of Warcraft Unshackled: An Escape Room Box
description: Will you escape the dangers of Azeroth? You have 60 minutes to break free of the chains that bind and the evils that threaten the World of Warcraft®! Play as honorable members of the Horde and the Alliance and overcome obstacles before time runs out! Stop the spread of Professor Putricide’s plague of undeath in his bizarre laboratory, dodge devilsaurs in Un’Goro Crater, and restore order to Karazhan before the tower collapses! Featuring three different scenarios with three difficulty levels: easy, medium, and challenging. Will you be unshackled? Or will time seal your fate?
publishers: 404 editions, Ediciones MasQueOca, Panini Games, Titan Books

name: Graveyard
description:
The game takes place at an ancient graveyard, where an evil cardinal is awakened from the dead, and has cast his curse on the graveyard. A secret occult brotherhood has hired a bunch of explorers to have the curse lifted, and the cardinal sent back to the underworld. Occult priests will help you, under way, but are you strong enough in the belief that you can succeed, and if you have luck. The mission will not be easy, many explorers have entered the graveyard, but never come out again.

Now you and your friends get the chance to fight evil, dare to work together at the graveyard, knowing that you may not escape alive, and only one of you has the chance to win.

If you dare, then let's play....
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Targeted Clues

name: Skeleton Island
description:
While taking a stroll on the beach of a skull-shaped island, you catch sight of a strange piece of paper sticking out the stand. Your curiosity leads you to dig in the sand with your hands, and you discover a golden coin and parts of a map that you piece together. What if the map leads to Captain Willain Kidd's fabulous treasure...

In Skeleton Island, players try to piece together treasure maps and find gold coins by digging in the "sand" – more specifically, by digging in the sand-decorated cards. To set up the game, someone takes the deck of 49 sand cards, splits them in half, turns one half face-down, shuffles the two halves together, then swishes the combined deck around on the table to make a pile of sand.

Each turn, a player takes either a standard turn or a piracy turn. In a standard turn, the player takes one "free" card – that is, a card not covered at all by any other card – and looks at it. The player can keep the card, or return it to the edge of the sand pile and draw a second card, which she must keep. (If only one or two cards are free, the player can close her eyes and blow on the pile to spread the sand.)

Players are searching for gold coins, which are valuable on their own, or halves and quarters of a treasure map. The first player to hand in a complete map of one of the five colors collects the island card of this color, which is worth five coins.

On a piracy turn, the player removes any three cards she's collected from the game, then either takes two consecutive standard turns or swipes any card from an opposing player.

When all the islands have been claimed or all the sand cards removed, the game ends and the player with the most coins wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Pirates, Travel

name: Qui-Quitanda
description:
It's time for the fair! Call your friends and create the best fruit bags!

In Qui-Quitanda, work together with other players to organize your fruit bags, forming sequences (horizontal or diagonal) to earn points.

However, this task will not be that simple: with a variety of colors and scents that would make anyone's mouth water, it's up to you to decide: improve your current bag or start a new one?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Chegou a hora da feira! Chame seus amigos e monte as melhores sacolas!

Em Qui-Quitanda, trabalhe em conjunto com os outros jogadores para organizar suas sacolas de frutas, formando sequências (horizontais ou diagonais) para conquistar pontos.

No entanto, essa tarefa não será tão simples assim: com uma variedade de cores e aromas que deixaria qualquer um com água na boca, cabe a vocês decidirem: melhorar a sacola atual ou começar uma nova?

—description from the publisher

name: Word Fight
description:
From the publisher:
In Word Fight it's your turn all the time!

The word game fever is all over the world. If you like Scrabble, Word Feud and Bananagrams, you'll love Word Fight: The
word game without any downtime.

Word Fight takes it to the next level. All players play at the same time. Through three rounds of 5 minutes, it becomes more challenging. The loser will guaranteed call for a rematch. And that takes no longer than 15 minutes!

Gameplay:
Each player receives their own 9x5 squared board, and an extra space for 7 private tiles. In the middle of the table, all the letter tiles are placed face down. When the 5 minute timer is started, all players reveal their own 7 tiles, and can play these on their own board. They can make words as they want, using the same rules as in Scrabble. Letters already placed may not be rearranged. When there is room for letters on their board, new tiles may be drawn from the face down pile in the middle, or other players discard pile. Players may discard unused tiles face up, snd others may take these as needed.

When the time is up, all players count their used letters. 1 point for each placed letter, 5 points for 5-letter words, 10 for 7-letters and 20 for 9-letter words. For each letter in an invalid word, -5 points.

This goes on for 3 rounds. The second round adds a challenge. 4 face down tiles are placed on each players boards, decided by the player with the least points. They are blocked. The third round, these tiles are turned face up, and must stay where they are.

The winner after 3 rounds is the one with the most points in total.

name: Alarm
description:
Bodo Boxo and his colleagues from the detective school, the sharpest watchdogs in the world are trying to protect Lord Schlotterderry’s treasures.

Players try to plunder opponents safes while protecting their own. So the player who possesses the most stolen treasures at the end wins. Be careful, however: some safes are secured with an alarm system. And this barking, vicious alarm system is called Bodo Boxo!

The game contains 110 cards, consisting of 80 treasure cards, 20 safe cards and 10 plus/minus cards.

From the 20 safe cards, 15 cards show on the back the picture "Boxo Asleep Break-in Succeeded" and 5 cards show the picture "Boxo Awake Pants Torn."

The 10 plus/minus cards are not played. They are used only to keep plus and minus scores separated.

Each player gets all treasure cards of a color. The player then shuffles his treasure cards and puts them in a facedown stack on the table. Now each player uses the 4 safe cards: 3 with the picture "Boxo Asleep Break-in Succeeded" and 1 with the picture "Boxo Awake Pants Torn." to put his treasures in the safes. Players turn over the top 4 treasure cards from their stacks and put them in the middle of the table, side by side so that all players can see their values. Each player covers his 4 face-up treasure cards with a safe card, with the safe picture face up, but with the values of the treasure cards still visible. One of the safe cards is "hot," because it shows Bodo Boxo with a scrap of pants on the back. Each player decides which of his 4 treasure cards will get the "hot" safe card. The players cannot tell which of their opponents? treasure cards is "hot," since all safe cards look the same from the front. The first player then tries to break in to a safe. If the card from the safe shows BOXO ASLEEP then the BREAK-IN SUCCEEDED and the player takes the stolen treasure card and puts it facedown under his plus card. If the card shows that BOXO is AWAKE then the Boxo bites the player tearing his pants so the player gets caught and the value of the card from that safe is deducted from his score. The alarm has startled Lord Schlotterderry. He immediately attends to the remaining safes. The robbed player immediately puts all his treasure cards that are still in safes under his plus card! Now, the next player going clockwise takes a turn. If a player is not able to plunder because he is the only one with unopened safes, he must forfeit his turn. Play continues with each player taking his turn.

Each player then replenishes his safes for another round. The game continues until 4 rounds of safe cracking are finished when each player adds up the values of his collected treasure cards. The plus points are added and the minus points are subtracted. Whoever has the highest score is the winner.

Play 4 rounds are played. In each round, the safes are first filled with treasures, which one can plunder as long as he dares.
publishers: AG Müller (AGMüller), ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Rhino Studios

name: Spicks and Specks: The Board Game
description:
Based on the hit ABCtv music quiz show

Come together with family and friends to test your music knowledge. Sing, dance, scribble and shout your way through a non-stop hit parade of musical trivia and hilarious tasks. Spicks and Specks - out of the box and into your loungeroom - the music quiz that hits you with it's best shot!

Aim of the Game:
Spicks and Specks is your chance to come together with family and friends to sing, dance, scribble and shout. Take on a hilarious hit parade of musical trivia and tasks and reach the Final Countdown before the other team beats you to it!

Setting Up:
First, players must split up into two teams. Teams may consist of as many players as you like but must have at least two players in each. Position the game board where all players can reach it.

How to Play:
Each space on the board corresponds to a question category (see: Categories) and states whether the opposing team asks the playing team a question or ifthe playing team chooses one of it's own members to ask their remaining team mates. Used cards are returned to the bottom of the deck.

Play moves in a clockwise around the board, one space at a time. For each correct answer, a team may move forward one space and answer the next question, up to a total of three spaces in one turn. A team's turn is over if they correctly answer three questions in a row, or if they answer a question incorrectly.

If a team fails to correctly answer a question asked by one of their own teammates, the opposing team answers correctly, they move the playing team back one space on the board. Play continues as normal.

If a team is stalled on a certain category and answers incorrectly three turns in a row, they automatically proceed to the next space on the board at the start of their next turn.

Cards:
There are five types of cards that correspond to the coloured spaces on the game board.

Winning the Game:
The first team to make to the finish space wins the game.

Categories:

Know Your Product:
The opposing team reads out the four different choices of genre. The playing team selects the genre of the trivia question they would like to answer and the opposing team reads the question aloud.

Sir Mix'n'Matchalot:
The opposing team reads out three artists and clues to three interesting facts. The playing team must match the artists to the facts.

Medley:
When you land on a Medley space, you get to choose a question to answer from any category on the board.

Cover Versions:
A player from the team draws a picture (in silence) representing the song title on the question card. The other team mates must guess the correct answer from the picture.
Note: You can't include letters or numbers in your drawing!

Mondegreens:
A player from your team reads out the misinterpreted song lyrics on the question card. The other team mates must guess the song title.

Word Up:
A player from your team reads out the random words on the question card. The other team mates must guess the song title.

Musician or Serial Killer:
The opposing team reads out the name from the question card. The playing team must then guess if the person is a musician or a serial killer

Cover or Original:
The opposing team reads out a song title and artist. The playing team must decide whether that song was an original or a cover version of another artist's song.

Common People:
The opposing team reads out the names of three musicians. The playing team must identify what the three musicians have in common.

Two Little Words:
A player from your team looks at the name of a musician on the question card and then says two single-word clues to their team mates (the words in the musicians name are not permitted). The other team mates must guess the musician.

Substitue:
A player fromyour team sings a song from the question card, substituting the lyrics of the song with words from a book, magazine or from the games rules. The other team mates must guess the song title.

Final Countdown:
A player from your team asks the other team mates a music trivia question. If the playing team answers the question correctly the move to the Finish space and win the game!

taken from the rule book of the game
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Once We Moved Like the Wind: The Apache Wars, 1861-1886
description:
Their names are virtually synonymous with the long conflicts with the native indigenes of the American West. Cochise, Victoria, Chato, Geronimo. These great war band leaders all come from the various tribes of the Apache, and the Apache Wars dominated the attention of the US government in its westward development for the critical 25 years from the American Civil War to the final capitulation of the natives of the area.

What the Game Looks Like:

Once We Moved Like the Wind covers these central conflicts of the American South West. The game is played as a series of turns, each of which follows a sequence of play that begins with determining how bad a provocation results in conflict for the turn. The provocation level determines the forces each player will have for the turn and their general placement on the map. Next the Apache player moves the Apache forces and then the Army Player moves the US and Mexican forces. Combat may then occur between opposing player forces that share a location. After any combat is resolved, victory points are counted up and the player with the most for the turn earns one increase in victory level on the Victory Track. Play then repeats for the next turn to the end of the game when the player with the higher level on the Victory track is the winner.

Central to the game is that the playing pieces are all wooden blocks with the information about each particular piece only on one side and hence hidden during play from the opposing player until action occurs which must reveal particular blocks. And not all of these blocks are actually opposing forces. For the Apache player in particular, many playing pieces each turn will represent rumors of Apache actions and forces which the Army player must chase down to determine if they are real or false. Similarly, for the Apache player, not knowing which Army pieces represent which forces means not knowing if an opposing group is small enough to attack and win, or is in reality a force big enough to hand out a devastating defeat.

Once We Moved Like the Wind is played on a 22”x 22” mounted game board with a scale of about 14 kilometers per centimeter or 22 miles per inch. The terrain represented is divided by a number of features. Overall the area is divided into 4 large Territories: the Arizona Territory & the New Mexico Territory in the US and the Sonora Territory & the Chihuahua Territory in Mexico. Dividing up all of the Territories, and often crossing their borders, are the Areas. These represent sections of land of differing types between which the players move their forces.

Product Information:
• Complexity: 3 out of 10
• Solitaire Suitability: 5 out of 10
• Time Scale: 3-4 years per turn
• Map Scale: Areas covering parts of Arizona, New Mexico, Texas, Sonora and Chihuahua
• Unit Scale: A wooden block represents an Army Troop or Apache War Band
• Average Time to Play: <2 Hours

—description from the publisher
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Walkabout
description:
A hike in the Australian Outback

Players must construct the landscape. Roll out the board and place the bits on the board. Advanced players may add other objects, like dry moss, other animals, or stranger things.

Each player projects themselves into the game board in a spot. He imagines himself in that position at a certain facing. The object is to report his position on the board.

He does not speak but instead draws a sketch of what he sees on the notepad. The sketch is marked with his name.

The sketches are all then turned up. Each player takes the little maps of the game board and locates each player on the map. Also draw an arrow to indicate the facing.

Speed is good. The first player to slap his guess face down gets bonus points.

name: Four-Letter Frenzy
description: An amalgam of Scattergories and Spoons. Players are given four cards, and must pass one and draw one until someone has a four-letter word that fits the category drawn at the beginning of the round. When someone grabs a beanbag signaling he or she has a word, everyone grabs for one. When someone is caught six times without a bag, the game ends, and whomever has the most points wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Fais pas l'âne
description: This is a French game, from a French editor. The game itself consists of 96 cards, a rule booklet and 2 booklets with stories of donkeys. It's a bit like a mix of Rummy and Uno, with special-cards, where you have to make actions like yell like a donkey, or exchange your hand with another one. Point of the game is to have a certain (variable) combination of cards. Nicely illustrated!

name: Dogfight
description:
In Dogfight, each player has three eight sided dice which are rolled in turn. Dice "capture" other dice based on number and location when rolled on the table from behind a line.

Dogfight was originally conceived as a collectible dice game called Zodiac in which twelve unique characters were composed of sets of three custome 8-sided dice. The idea of characters made from dice was later restructured and published as Button Men. The original client decided not to buy Zodiac, and it was revamped as Battlin' Dice for another uninterested client and later printed as Dogfight in the Origins 2000 preregistration book. It was included in Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack.

name: Empire Campaign System
description:
[From the box description]
The Empire Campaign System is a complete strategic-operational simulation of the Napoleonic campaigns and is intended to tie in with the Empire 3rd edition operational-tactical miniatures rules. The Empire Campaign System is designed so that the strategic-operational phases of Napoleonic warfare are played on a map and the actual battle resolution is primarily represented by miniatures.

Expands:

Empire (Third Edition)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Älpler-Stafette
description:
In Älpler-Stafette, players race through the Alps to deliver milk to the cheese maker. Dogs and ibex impede progress, and other players will push and shove to steal your milk. The player who delivers the most milk to the cheese maker wins.

Re-implemented by
Astérix et les Romains

name: Reds & Whites
description: A free historical card game simulating the Russian Civil War. One player is the Red/Communist, the other player is the White/Tsarist.
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Top: 3
description: Triangular backgammon for three players (with a variant for two). During the game, one player with three or more pieces out of play can became "the killer", with special rules.

name: Mini Bridge
description:
Minibridge

From wikipedia.org, the free encyclopedia.

Minibridge is a simplified form of the complex card game contract bridge designed to help newcomers and children learn the game.

Like Bridge, Minibridge consists of four players, who play opposite and with their partner. Each player is dealt thirteen cards.

The auction process is more simple than bridge. Each player counts the number of high card points he has (4 for an Ace, 3 for a King, 2 for a Queen and 1 for a Jack) and states the number of high card points. The partnership with the more high card points then has to play the hand. (If both partnerships have the same number of high card points, the hand is thrown in.) Of this partnership, the partner with the more high card points becomes the declarer. The partner with the fewer high card points becomes the dummy and lays out his hand. (If both partners have the same number of high card points, the one who states his high card point count first is the declarer.)

The declarer then looks at his partner's hand and decides what suit he wants to be trumps (if any), and whether to be in game or to take part score. In part score he must make 7 tricks, and in game he must make 6 tricks (assumed) plus 3 for no trumps, 4 for a major suit or 5 for a minor suit.





Trumps

Partscore

Game



Clubs

1

5



Diamonds

1

5



Hearts

1

4



Spades

1

4



No trumps

1

3




The game then continues per bridge with 13 rounds of cards.

The scoring system is also simplified.

name: Partini Mixers: Fast and Fabulous
description:
An evening of fast and fabulous fun for you and your friends comes in every box of Partini Mixers! Pass out the coasters and play the three fun games at random. In Fab Fiction you'll try to tell a tall tale using the words a teammate gives you. Been There, Done That is a friendly game of Truth or Dare. And in Word Curb you try to get your team to guess the secret word by giving them just a few one-word clues. Break the ice at you next get together with Partini Mixers - Fast and Fabulous!

Partini Mixers - Fast and Fabulous can be played by itself or mixed in with your Partini game (sold separately).

name: Capek
description: In Capek, you are a young apprentice engineer working for the most prestigious robotics company in the world: Capek. To end your first year, you are given the task of building your own robot. This is what you've been working towards all year. All the long days spent repairing old service bots will finally pay off. Each year only one apprentice is accepted to carry on their studies at Capek, and work alongside the industry greats. Will you be the first to finish your robot and claim the prize, or will you be left scurrying about the factory floor as you watch your dream slip away?
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: bOOLeO N-Edition
description:
bOOleO N-Edition is a card game which combines strategy card play with the concepts of Boolean logic. Players must race to resolve an initial binary number to a single specific bit. This is accomplished through the use of logical gates.

Why is bOOleO N-Edition fun?
bOOleO N-Edition stretches your brain by using the fundamental concepts of Boolean algebra, specifically teaching you the concepts of Boolean operators/logic gates. Using the four different types of gate: NAND, NOR, NXOR, and NOT; you strategically build your logic pyramid, carefully watching the movements of your opponent, anticipating how your next move could destroy their pyramid. The pace can be lightening fast, the tension can blow your mind.

Integrates with:

bOOLeO

name: Littlest Pet Shop Mall Madness
description:
From the Publisher:
It's a pet-lovin' adventure at the mall! Welcome 4 new pets to your LITTLEST PET SHOP and hit the stores to find them some fancy gear. Look for big sales -- but be careful not to totally max out. Will you buy your pet pup a designer leash at the Glitter Pet Jewelry Store, or purchase your monkey a banana peel mask at the Feline Fine Bath Shop? Buy your pet six items and reach your final destination first to win!

Includes gameboard, electronic console, 4 exclusive Teeniest Tiniest LITTLEST PET SHOP pets, 4 purple pawn stands, 30 plastic check marks, play money, 10 shoppers, 4 bank cards, 4 shopping lists, 1 clearance sign, 2 sale signs, 3 clear pawn stands, 8 treat tokens, 1 storage tray and instructions.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Hello Kitty Collector's Edition
description:
From USAopoly.com:

Hello Kitty brings a sweet style to America’s favorite board game in this special Collector’s Edition of the MONOPOLY game. Enter Hello Kitty’s world as you buy, sell and trade locations in her hometown of London such as the Bakery, the Music Theatre, the School Library, Playground and more. A must-have for Hello Kitty fans of all ages.

Six collectible tokens include favorite Hello Kitty items such as her Bow, Three Apples, Milk Bottle, Lunchbox, Fish Bowl and Teddy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: The Op Games, Winning Moves Germany

name: Rhyme Out!
description: Players take turns drawing cards from the box and reading three clues aloud. The other players try to be the first to answer with three rhyming words that match the clues. For example "1) a home, 2) a rodent in your home, 3) a girl's dressy shirt." Answers: "House, Mouse, Blouse." First player to say the correct answers in order wins the card. First player to collect 10 cards wins. Be careful: Some cards are "steal" cards enabling the player who wins it to steal a card from another player. The 300 included cards have an easy side including an optional hint that can be read to the players, and a harder side with harder clues and no hints, for a total of 600 questions.

name: Dem Yeti wird's zu bunt
description:
A game about colors for small children. The Yeti wants to color up his white surroundings - fortunately, he discovers a color lab.
The game consists of tiles which have two colors on one side and the color you get when you mix the two on the other. These tiles are laid out in a circle (2 color side up) and the Yeti is placed onto one of them. The players then take turns rolling a die. On a result of one, two or three the Yeti moves forward the respective number of tiles. Then the player has to say which color is on the other side of the tile. If wrong, nothing happens. If correct, the player takes a token of the color s/he named. If the result is a star, the player can place the Yeti onto any tile. The first player who gets three tokens of the same color or four all in all is the winner.
Advanced rules suggest to flip the tiles around and let the kids name the two colors necessary to mix the color they see.

name: Rocket Jockey: Space Port
description:
SETUP: After you create the face up cargo draft pile, place the Space Port tile next to the maneuver deck on the opposite side and turn over the top maneuver card in the deck and place it on the Space Port tile.
