FUELING: Whenever you draw a card, you may exchange one card from your hand with the maneuver card in the Space Port. You may have a maximum hand size of 6.

MID-GAME SCORING VARIANT: Place a marker in front of the first player. When the mid-game scoring is triggered, each player is given the opportunity of an equal number of turns. New cards are not replenished in the planetary display, but each player is allowed to continue to make any available deliveries until the player to the left of the starting player finishes their turn. Now continue with the mid-game scoring as normal.

name: Carrrds!
description:
In Carrrds!, players compete to gain ownership of the most shreds of a torn up treasure map that leads to the pirate treasure. Each turn, you may ask another player for a piece of a certain map. Each map piece can be identified by a certain symbol such as a hook or a key. Carrrds! becomes extra fun when you throw in the action cards: swords, guns, parrots, voodoo dolls and flags can all be played to introduce an element of chaos and unpredictability into play. There are even unique pirate cards such as the rogue, the gunslinger, and the voodoo lady.

Carrrds! is flexible. You don't have to use all the cards. The easiest way to start playing is to just use the island cards, swords and guns. Voodoo dolls, flags, parrots and pirate cards offer some additional gameplay options for intrepid pirates.

Expansion: extra action cards
Included in the deck are some extra action cards: the pirate flag, the voodoo doll and the parrot. These special cards allow you to interrupt the normal game flow even further. But watch out, the game could get pretty complicated!

Expansion: pirate cards
Also included in the deck are six unique pirate cards. Each player gets one pirate card that only they can see at the start of play and places it face down in front of them. You can then use your pirate card's ability at any point during the game to surprise another player.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory, Pirates
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – The Collective Month 1 Organized Play Borg Cube and tokens
description:
Comes with the following for use with the "First Contact" scenario as a part of Month 1 of "The Collective" organized play tournaments:

1 Borg Cube (ship) Token with unique stats (6/0/8/8)
8 Resistance Tokens
4 Hidden Movement Tokens
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: Table Golf
description:
In Table Golf you transform your dining room table into a 9 hole golf course. where you flick cards down the table to try to get them into the hole.

At the beginning of each hole the players build the hole that they are playing on by flicking the hazards onto the course. there are Three hazards in this game the Water Hazard, the Sand Trap and the Rough. Each hazard has it's own way of testing your dexterity with the Golf Ball card.

Each Hole you select a weather card and that card effects how you play that hole. It can be use your non-dominate hand or flick the Golf Ball from a foot above the table.

At the end of the game the player who makes the ball in the hole consistently is considered the winner.

name: Love Season
description:
From the designer:

Love Season is a card game about Little bunnies' love affairs.

In this game of chase you are a little bunny trying to go home but bunny girls find you so cute they won't let you go away.
For 3 to 6 players from 8 years old and up (works best with adults and teenagers ;) ), this game can take less than 20 min to play. It can go faster once you know it well and can end up in 5 min.

The rules :
Cards are divided in two categories. The one you can play during your turn for scoring, and the one you can play every time to any players, the bunny girls (attack) and the defensive cards to escape.

The first that reach 7 jump cards and reach a rabbit hole card win. But, while you jumping around, other player can send you bunnies that catch you and block your progression.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: Tallinn: The Supporters
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 for Day 19.

Includes 15 supporter tokens (5 monks, 5 merchants, and 5 knights)

Each player receives 3 face down supporter tokens.

Once per game, each supporter token may do one of two things:

a) In phase 1 "Choose Card Secretly", put one or more of supporter tokens face down to the right end of your display. Reveal the tokens together with your card in phase 2 and place th tokens on the card you just played. Those supporters have the same effect as a person in a shield on your cards during a contest. Thus you count them to evaluate whether you beat the other players and they have to count them for your display when evaluating if they beat you.

b) In phase 3 "Contest", you may use or more previously unused supporters. Put these supporters face up below your display. These supporters are only relevant for your own contest. Other player who initiate a contest ignore you supporters and only count the persons on your card to evaluate if they beat you

In phase 4 "Draw a Card", you must remove all used supporters from the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Zpocalypse 2: Wasteland
description:
Description from the publisher:

As the sun sets on another day of defending the Burbs, you can't help but ask yourself, "Is this all there is? Are we truly doomed to live out our days in this suburban purgatory?"

Players brave enough to venture out beyond their white picket fences and take to the highway in Zpocalypse 2: Wasteland, an expansion for Zpocalypse 2: Defend the Burbs, will find themselves greeted by mutants, bandits, mad scientists, and more.

Featuring a four-part campaign adventure, new survivors, weapons, locations, craftables, and terrain, the Wasteland expansion adds hours of blood curdling fun for the whole family.

name: Vertium: Shadows of the Complex
description:
Soar Space Force
Captain John Brooks: Log 2373-9

The Complex crushed all opposition on Earth, the Moon, and Mars, and banished the remaining rebel factions to Pluto and Charon. We established our makeshift colony on Charon and explored the region. We discovered the Royal Martian Federation (RMF), the Hielo, and the Myst; and made contact.

Although historical rivals, we worked together to survive the frigid conditions, stockpiling resources and launching probes across the Milky Way.

One probe returned compelling data from the Copernicus System in Quadrant 1. Coper has a yellow dwarf star and an intriguing group of planets. A dazzling radioactive element, that we named Vertium, was discovered. Our physicists think it could heat our colonies, and upgrade weapons and armour.

As word spread, the rebel groups bolted for Coper. The fragile cooperation evaporated. Each faction is now out for itself - claiming planets and mining Vertium. The stakes are clear: for whoever controls the Vertium will control Coper and perhaps the galaxy.

Brooks out.

VERTIUM is a quick and tactical space colonization game for 1 to 4 players. Players are faction Commanders directing their Captains to claim planets and mine the powerful radioactive element Vertium.

As influential moons orbit the colonized planets, additional Vertium is gained. However, you'll have to be wise and courageous, because your rivals have their eyes on your spheres and resources.

Prepare for conflict.


There are 2 expansions included as well as SOLO rules. **



Expansion #1 - NEW DISCOVERIES:

A new discovery has been made in Coper! Some planets contain a different radioactive element: Gelbon. Combined with Vertium, it powers a planetary weapons system named CUBE (Cubic U-Beam Emitter).

Expansion #2 - SHADOWS OF THE COMPLEX:

Through traitors and spies, the dreaded Complex has learned about the Vertium and tracked down the Rebels in Coper. The Complex has dispatched a squad of giant killer robots (aka the Titan) to eliminate their adversaries once and for all. To stand any chance of survival, the Rebel factions will have to lay aside their differences and work together.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Ramodis
description:
Sun has set and the farm is immersed in silence and tranquility...
Everyone is waiting in the farm: guard dogs, flock of sheep and hunter wolves... Everyone is waiting for another night party!

Ramodis is a Persian reimplementation of "Nobody but Us Chickens!". A funny card game based on bluffing, mind reading and gathering the most sheep at the end of the game!

All players hold the same cards consist of sheep, wolves and a dog! Each round players choose a card from their hand which simultaneously they reveal. If all sheep, nothing happens. If some play a wolf they gather all the sheep, and if some play wolf while some play dog, the wolves discarded and the dogs gather all the sheep. At the end of 9 round players count their sheep and score them.

name: Einhorn Glitzerglück: Freunde-Quartett
description:
Glitterluck and her unicorn girlfriends are playing Quartets today! Who wants to join in? With a little concentration and the right amount of luck, you can collect four of the same cards to form a quartet. The reward is a cloud crystal. Who can collect the most cloud crystals?

-from the publisher's website

It's a family game in which the player must collect 4 identical cards to form a family.
It takes place in the wonderful land of the unicorn.

Contents: 32 Quartets cards, 6 cloud cards, 8 cloud crystals, 1 set of instructions.

-user summary

name: Black Stories: Killer Ladies Edition
description: How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party. This version of the black stories refers to mording women.
categories: Book, Card Game, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
publishers: Gen-X Games, Kikigagne?, moses. Verlag GmbH, Reflexshop

name: Lajka
description:
Lajka, the astronaut dog goes on an expedition. It meets interesting space creatures, explores the Planet of Doggy’s Treasures, then arrives to the Planet of the Space Worms, where it can meet colourful worms.

Help Lajka, roll the dice and colour the space creatures, dog’s toys and the space worms!

The game Lajka is indeed three different, stand-alone game for diferrent age-groups. Players in their turn roll four (coloured) dice, and than use the result, to colour their sheets. In "Space Critters", (for the youngest ones, above 3 years) you try to find all the matching colours on your critter-sheet. The one, who's finish it first wins the game.
In "Doggy's Treasures" (for the middle ones, above 5 years)you should use your thrown coloures to make the shapes (drawn at the bottom of the doggy's sheet). The shapes worth different stars, the goal is to reach 12 stars. The one with the most stars wins the game!
In "Space Worms" (for the older ones, above 8 years), you have to make unicoloured worms, leading from one designated point to another one. You earn point after the area, your worms enclose, for stars you've collected (wich can also be used during the game to have certain actions), your longest unfinished worm, and the coloures you used. When someone finishes his/her second worm, the game ends, and the player with the most points win.

name: Math Rush: Fractions, Decimals, & Percents
description:
Think fast in Math Rush, a totally thrilling cooperative math game that will make your heart race and your head rev. For three rounds, up to five players must balance strategy and speed, properly sequencing fractions, decimals, and percents before the timer runs out. Crunch the numbers in a hurry and rack up more points; make an error and miss your goal. Whether you beat your high score or not, it's more fun that you calculated.

Math Rush is a timed, co-operative card game for 1-5 players who race to complete sets of matching cards in the right order.

In Math Rush: Fractions, Decimals, & Percents, the cards show fractions, decimals, and percents that must be played in ascending or descending order, meeting the requirements of the goal cards (such as "Decimals Only").

—description from the designer

name: Atlanta Campaign: The Death of Dixie
description:
In the summer of 1864, Union forces engaged the Confederate Army in a series of battles in Northern Georgia, with the goal of destroying the Confederate Army of the Tennessee.  In doing so, the Union Army ultimately captured the city of Atlanta, an important industrial and rail center, thus setting the stage for Sherman's "March to the Sea" and the end of the Confederacy in the Deep South.

In this update of Don Lowry's classic design, players may choose to engage in four shorter scenarios or fight the campaign in its entirety.  Leaders play an important role in the battle, and a unique combat resolution system introduces realistic uncertainty to the system.

—description from the publisher

name: Head Spin
description: Head Spin is a lively new family game. Quick fingers and minds race to crack the color code and dial it in on their fidget spinner. The first to get their spinner on the landing pad with the right color combo wins the round!

name: Verses
description: Verses is a party game in which players play song cards to match moment cards, hoping that their song is voted best in that round.

name: 12 Seekers
description:
In 12 Seekers, players fight to grab the right gems from a line laid out at the start of play — but which gems are the right ones will be determined during play itself!

To set up, lay out the 39 gems in a line. Players then alternate playing a seeker card to claim gems. The game includes twelve basic seekers without special abilities and seventeen seekers with abilities; use twelve cards in a mix that seems appropriate to you. The game includes four types of "turn rules" and twenty types of "game rules" to provide more variety in set-up and play.

name: Pappsatt
description:
Oh no! The zoo keeper is sick today! Who will feed the animals?
Good thing you’re here - grab a feeding bucket and let’s get cracking!
But which animal gets which food? Does the penguin get a nut and the squirrel get a fish? And in where exactly does the lion live?

A combination of memory and roll-and-move game. The players take turns in clockwise order. The player in turn rolls the die, and moves forward or backward. If he lands on a bucket symbol, het gains more food (if he has free hands - the meeples can only hold two bucktes each). At an enclosure door, he opens it (reveals the hidden animal), and feeds it if he has the right food (for example, meat for lion and crocodile). A wild symbol allows to move to any free space.

Game proceeds until one player manages to feed five animals, and is declared winner.

The rules contains a variant for childrens of age 3, with open enclosure doors (removing the memory aspect).

name: Myth: Stalkers Captain Pack
description: The Myth: Stalkers Captain Pack consists of two stalker captain miniatures identical to those included in the base Myth game. Stalkers lead the crawlers and move around the tile more easily than other monsters, ideally injecting heroes with formidable poisons that can quickly kill even the most stalwart soldier.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Sabuca
description:
Sabuca is a word game that uses a rummy style of play. Unlike most games though, each player must form words and then scramble them in the hope that the opposition can’t figure them out. The twist to Sabuca is that any player can stop the action at any moment when they think they have the goods!

Sabuca is a tricky little word game that is made all the more difficult by the time limit and ability for other players to end things before you are ready. This lends the game a frantic, tense feel and this is something that will likely be favored by the word smiths out there. The nature of trying to unscramble other player's words adds Sabuca a level of depth as it almost forms a game within a game.

name: Il Gioco dei Telefilm
description:
"The first game on tv series with over 700 questions, categorized in different epochs and difficulty levels.

Verify your and your friends' telefilmic knowledge, choose your favorite period, use your knowledge to answer and try to avoid that your opponents can score lots of points. "What's the nickname of Richie Cunningham's sister in Happy Days?", "Which color is Starsky and Hutch's car?", "What's the name of Locke in the series Lost?".

The mechanics are very simple. The scoreboard identifies the type of questions that participants will have to answer. You have to choose the type of TV series and the historical period in which it was broadcast. They range from the dawn of television to the very recent Game of Thrones. However, this is not a simple Trivial Pursuit quiz because from turn to turn one of the players will cover the role of director and will have to "bet" on some possible answers.

The first person to the end of the scoring track, wins.

name: Hero Town
description:
The city is attacked by Super-Villains. Let's call the Superheroes for help. But before you have to find their accessories. A "Super" memory and cooperation game where teamwork will win you and save the world.

Description

In Attack on HeroTown, players are the incarnation of the city's inhabitants who will have to summon superheroes to protect their city from the attacks of the infamous super villains.

Equipment
- 24 cards Equipment
- 12 cards Super villains
- 6 cards Superheroes
- 1 city map card
- 6 building cards double sided
- 1 rule

Goal of the game
Protect the 6 building cards from the city until the end of the game.

Setup
With two players, each receives 12 cards Equipment that they dispose in a rectangle of 4x3 cards face up.
With three players, each receives 8 cards Equipment that they dispose in a rectangle of 4x3 card faces up.
With four players, each receives 6 cards Equipment that they dispose in a rectangle of 2x3 cards face up.

Then players have to memorize it and have to flip them down.

Install the City building cards in the center of the table. Place the 12 Super-villain cards in a mixed pile and the six superheroes on the table next to each other face up.

Principle
At the beginning of a turn, two super-villain cards are revealed. These super-villains fear one or two superheroes. Each player returns one or two equipment cards depending on the number of players to attempt to summon a superhero with the two required equipments. If this superhero is the one corresponding to the super villain, then he’s discarded.

Game Tour
At the beginning of a turn, two super-villain cards are revealed. With two players, each player returns two Equipment cards. With three players, only the first player returns two. The other two players returns one. With four players, each one returns one.
Once all cards are returned, they can be discarded to summon one or two superheroes. If they are the one correspond to the super-villains, they are discarded.
If a super-villain is discarded for a second time, then a super power is applied: players can check one of their Equipment cards.

Conditions of victory and defeat
If a super-villain is still present then, he attacks the building. Flip one building card on fire side.
If he stays in the next turn, he destroys a second one. If two super-villains are present then they each destroy one part of this building. If a third comes in then the game is lost. It is also lost if all Building cards have been flipped.

The game is won if at the end of the last turn if a building card is remaining.

The merit of victory can be assessed according to the number of remaining tokens.

-description from designer

name: Tell Me Without Telling Me
description:
Introducing Tell Me Without Telling Me, the viral trend now an adult party game! Prepare for laughs as you try to get your team to guess the word on the card without breaking 1 of 3 rules:

Show Don’t Tell - no words allowed, let your body do the talking
One Syllable: only words with a single syllable. This would work, but this *wouldn’t* work
Freestyle: Any words are fair game, just not what’s on the card. Whether it's a Person, Place, Trait, Thing, or NSFW, you’ll have to think quick about how to "tell" your team before the time runs out! This game is for teens and adults ages 18 and up, and we advise playing with family and coworkers at your own risk. Grab your favorite people and play #TellMeGame ASAP.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Targeted Clues

name: Gangster III: Le pouvoir
description:
Description from the publisher (translated):

The Godfather is back and he is hungry for power! He now targets the highest authorities of the city: the town hall. That is why he commands you to embark on the most fantastic election campaign ever and to elect you mayor of the city. To be elected, you must be the one who accumulates the highest number of votes.

Visit every corner of the city, even the least recommendable, and recruit members within your party. But to do this, you will need a lot of money. Try your luck at the clandestine casino. Do work in black and go through the town hall to receive your fair share of the cash.

All the means are good to achieve your goals and deceive your opponents: corruption, brown envelopes, tricks, rigged polls, and more! But be on your guard! Beware of corrupt officials who also want their share of the cake, some journalists who could abort your illegal transactions. Avoid being arrested ... because there are still some honest people in this corrupt city.

In your turn, roll the dice, advance the number of spaces indicated and apply the effect of the space on which you arrive.

Your objective: Collect more votes than your opponents.

Description from the publisher:

Le Parrain est de retour et il est plus que jamais affamé de pouvoir ! Il vise maintenant les plus hautes instances de la ville : la mairie. C'est pourquoi il vous ordonne de vous lancer dans la campagne électorale la plus rocambolesque jamais vue et de vous faire élire maire de la ville. Pour être élu, vous devrez être celui qui accumulera le plus grand nombre de votes.

Visitez tous les recoins de la ville, même les moins recommandables, et recrutez des menbres au sein de votre parti. Mais pour ce faire, vous aurez besoin de beaucoup d'argent. Tentez votre chance au casino clandestin. Faites du travail au noir et passez par la mairie pour recevoir votre juste part du magot.

Tous les moyens sont bons pour parvenir à vos fins et tromper vos adversaires : corruption, enveloppes brunes, magouilles, sondages truqués, et plus encore ! Mais soyez toujours sur vos gardes ! Méfiez-vous des fonctionnaires véreux qui veulent eux aussi leur part du gâteau, de certains journalistes qui pourraient faire avorter vos transactions illégales. Évitez de vous faire arrêter... car il reste encore quelques personnes honnêtes dans cette ville des plus corrompues.

À votre tour, lancez les dés, avancer du nombre de case de indiqué et appliquez l'effet de la case sur laquelle vous arrivez.

Votre objectif : amassez plus de vote que vos adversaires.

name: Plinko
description:
Plinko debuted as a reward for contestants who earned their chance to be on stage during the January 3, 1983 broadcast of the American version of “The Price is Right.” It has been adapted into a board game.

Players take turns quizzing each other about the prices of merchandise based on the various quizzes from the television series. Every correct answer earns the player one chip. At the end of the quiz, each player gets to drop their chips into the Plinko board where they may be worth $10,000 apiece!

The unit uses 3 “AA” batteries which activate lights, music, and sound effects but are not necessary for game play.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Tribound
description:
The object of Tribound is to be the first gamer to get 6 of 30 pieces across the board to your opponents home and stopping the other gamer to do this. Two dice control which piece can be moved.

This game has English and German instructions, first published in U.K.

name: Colony Delta: Earth vs. Sigma Draconis – A Colony World in the Balance
description:
From the box: "Colony Delta simulates the events on a colony planet equidistant from Terra and Sigma Draconis, two space traveling races. It involves colonization, conflict, and the quest to build a stable colony with security." The box contains rules, cardboard 4-color map, and 300 die-cut counters.

The map covers the whole world of Colony Delta, with entry boxes for Terra and Sigma Draconis pieces arriving from the home worlds, turn marker strip, and victory point tallies. Units in the game include colonists, peace keepers, hovercraft, aircraft, submarines, spaceports, shuttles, workers, soldiers, turtles, domecraft and Capellans (the natives). Development of Colony Delta is mostly by farming and mining, with reinforcements, combat, and weather also featured. Colony Delta can be played using Basic and Advanced game rules in the rules booklet.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: UNO: The Simpsons – Treehouse of Horror
description:
The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the TV show The Simpson's Halloween Specials Treehouse of Horror.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Witchcraft Card - Can be played to counter a Draw 2 or Draw 4 card. Can also be used as a wild card.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Planet Busters
description:
A game of interplanetary warfare where the goal is to destroy all of your opponent's planets. This is done with Planet Busters, a powerful weapon carried by certain types of spaceships.

Components include a hex mapsheet, ten and six sided dice, and an assortment of counters. Common counters include Resource counters, Planet Buster counters, and the 84 Ship counters. In addition, each player has Fleet counters and Planet counters in a unique color.

There are twenty-one ship types in the game. Players build new spaceships by expending Resource counters. Resource counters are earned by controlling planets.

name: Pub Quiz
description:
Fancy yourself as a trivia king or queen? Find out who the brainiest bar-flies are as you enjoy a traditional pub quiz - in the comfort of your home.

If you're a quiz whiz then this is the game for you. Great general knowledge and quick thinking are what counts here, and if you and your fellow players want to be crowned pub champs, then team work is a must! Be ready to notch up points in the quick fire rounds then blast the opposition in 2 blistering bonus heats. So get your thinking caps on - and the drinks in!

name: Numerix
description:
Numerix is an abstract strategy game, in the same kind of vein as chess, draughts or tafl. There is, however, a certain amount of chance involved in the game. Your pieces will not always be able to move exactly as you want them to. The game requires a certain amount of strategic and tactical skill, combined with an ability to play the odds and to adjust your plans rapidly to a situation that can swiftly change if you don't have the numbers you need. Sometimes the dice will go against you and it becomes a
case of simply trying to consolidate your men into a strong enough position to survive, sometimes they will go your way and allow you to do precisely what you want. In short, in this game you must learn to make do with what you have, and work with it to succeed.

The game is also particularly suited for variation, using new board layouts, playing with dominoes instead of dice, or many other possible variations.

The game is freely available to anyone who wants to play it and you are entirely free to make your own sets.
Tied To A Kite Games make wooden sets, which will be released at the UK Games Expo 2009.

The rules and board may be downloaded from the publisher's website. (see the publisher's entry (above) for the link.)
publishers: The Game Crafter, LLC, Tied to a Kite

name: Power Lines
description:
Power Lines is a tile laying game for PiecePack in which players take turns placing tiles from a communal pool. One player is attempting to create rows, columns, or diagonals in which there are a majority of matching suits, while the opposing player is doing the same except for matching values.

When the 4x4 grid has been fully filled in, players score points for rows, columns, or 4-tile diagonals in which they have the largest matching set.

Although originally designed for the PiecePack game system, Power Lines is playable with a standard deck of playing cards.

name: Nine Lives Card Game
description:
Cats are running loose through the city! There are nine different breeds, five cats each, each with their own personalities. Rescue as many cats as you can, but try not to get scratched!

NINE LIVES is a fast game of trading, bidding, and clever tactics. Each round, all players bid a numbered card from their hand. High bids use special powers first, which can force trades between players. Then, low bids get first choice of cats to rescue, which is key scoring victory points and winning the game. Score points by rescuing the majority of a breed, rescuing any cats of a rare breed, and finally one point per scratch... but only if you have the *fewest* scratches!
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Number
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Trading

name: Monopoly: Roosendaal edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Roosendaal, a city in the Netherlands.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Da Clash!
description:
Each gamer plays with 2 fighters, on a wrestling ring divided in 9 zones.

Da Clash! is fast and fun, but you’ll need reflection and tactics if you want to make your opponents bite the dust.

Stretch, warm up, roll the dices… and no, unlike in other games, a 1 and a 2 are not weaker than a 5 or a 6.

Every dice is precious and can be used in different ways:

-you can activate your fighters and determine their initiative,

-launch Special or Bonus Attacks,

-create combinations to earn Zen or Rage tokens…well, if you win the bet.

-or fill your Superpowa gauge a bit more…

On the other hand, the two sources of power of a fighter: the Zen and the Rage tokens can be stocked and will allow you to make your fighters faster, more resistant or aggressive…And if you have enough of them, you’ll even be able to launch your fighter’s Superpowa to inflict him a 3-Hits Combo!

But stay watchful even if you have almost reduced his Tonus Points to zero, you could be punched in the back... everything's allowed in Da Clash!

name: På spåret: Vart är vi på väg?
description:
From the publisher's website:

Play in teams and challenge each other just like on TV! Both teams competes at the same time and has to react to pictures, clues and facts for them to solve as quick as possible. Who will win - First Class or Coach?

name: Tipping Point
description:
Have we found your Tipping Point? The high stakes quiz game the whole family can enjoy. Based on the highly popular TV game show, Tipping Point combines general knowledge questions and answers with nail-biting unpredictability.

Compete as teams or individuals. By answering questions correctly, players win tokens to drop into the electronic table top tipping point machine. Which of the four drop zone do you think will give you the biggest payout?

As the machine slides back and fourth, let your token fall and see whether that will start a chain reaction. One single correct answer could trigger a cashcade that changes everything!

Which team can amass the most counters to go forward and compete in the final jackpot round?

The show presented by Ben Shephard originally aired on ITV1 from 2012 until 2014 then on ITV since 2015.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: 1941: What If? An Alternative History Wargame of a Second Winter War
description:
1941: What If? An Alternative History Wargame of a Second Winter War is a low-to-intermediate complexity two-player alternative history wargame that’s also easily adaptable to solitaire play. It allows you to investigate the parameters inherent in the situation in Central Eastern Europe, at the end of 1940, had the Bulgarians decided to ally with the Soviets instead of the Germans, which historically they considered doing. Long story short (see the support article elsewhere in this issue), the result would’ve been the Second War’s eastern front erupting half a year prior to its historic start date under both natural and manmade conditions vastly different than pertained at that later date.

Each hexagon on the map represents 45 miles (73 km) from side to opposite side. Each turn represents a half a month of ‘real time.’ Each unit of maneuver represents an army or corps or ad hoc equivalent of those sizes of units.

The Soviet (a.k.a. “Soviet/Allied” or “Allied”) player commands all the Soviet units in the game along with those of Bulgaria, Greece and Britain. The German (a.k.a. “German/Axis” or “Axis”) player commands all the German units in the game, along with those of Turkey, Slovakia, Hungary, Romania and Italy. Yugoslavia starts the game neutral and out of play. Its government is leaning pro-Allied, however, and it will likely join the war on that side during the course of the game. When/if that occurs, the two Yugoslav-Croatian (4th and 7th) armies will either disintegrate, their soldiers dispersing to their homes, or join the Axis while the rest of the Yugoslav armed forces fight in the Allied side.

The orders of battle contain pretty all the units present in these armies at this time within this theater of operations. The Germans are only missing the non-mechanized corps they had garrisoning their western conquests. The Turks are minus the three corps they kept in their Caucasus and Syrian border areas. Similarly, the Soviets have everything they had available historically in the regions of the USSR lying west of the Urals, north of the Caucasus and south of the Arctic. Their reinforcements are based on what they put together during the first three months of the historic war in the east. Their Independent Coastal Army wasn’t organized historically until soon after the start of Operation Barbarossa; however – given the geo-strategic circumstances of this might-have-been war and the fact the resources needed to organize it already existed at this time – it was only reasonable to include the ICA as a starting Soviet unit.

name: Rozprávkari
description:
Rozprávkari is a card game based on fairy tales created by Slovak writer an folclorist Pavol Dobšinský. The game aims at sparking the interest in Slovak folklore and literature in younger generations by using various fairy tale references in form of a flavor text or illustrations on the playing cards. The game itself can be used as an amusing educational tool, as the scoring mechanism is supposed to make younger players practice basic mathemataical operations.

The game represents the fight between good and evil. The folklore villains decided to steal all the stories in which they have lost their fight. Players try to defeat these villains and rescue the stolen fairy tales. The goal is to collect all parts of as much fairy tales as possible, using 'wish' cards and 'doucat' tokens.

The game was crowdfunded in 2017.

name: Kinder-Rommé: Bauernhoftiere
description: Kinder-Rommé: Bauernhoftiere is a rummy game.

name: Clever Keys
description:
There’s treasure in the old castle! Players take turns inserting keys into the game board. If the keys are inserted in the right slot, they unlock the secret chamber and reveal valuable gemstones. Every additional move either lets the player get richer – or lose everything. The player who collects the most gemstones wins.

This push-your-luck memory game uses a unique box and board construction to provide hundreds of combinations for the "locked" areas of the board.

-description from publisher

name: Op Zoek Naar... Lutjebroek
description:
Try to find Dutch places. It's a Dutch topography game.
Every player starts with four chips. There's one card with a city name placed on the table. The player gets a card and places the city above or under the card on the table. If he/she thinks the city lies to the north of south of the city already on the table. Or the players places the card left (west) or right (east) on the table.
Other players can correct the player who has played the card. The player who gave the correct answer gets a chip from the other player who placed the card.
After 15 cards everyone counts his/her chips. The player with the most chips wins the game.

"Op zoek naar Lutjebroek" is the Dutch version of Ausgerechnet Buxtehude.

name: Vaults: Deadbolt
description:
Deadbolt is an expansion pack for the Vaults card game. With Deadbolt 2 – 6 players compete to become the richest Crime Lord. On their journey to the top they recruit professional safe crackers with various abilities and skills.
Every good crew needs their specialized tools. But if things go wrong, it is always smart to have a getaway car nearby.

New vault cards offer many exciting options. Sometimes it is wise to leave the loot in the Vault and use classified information to further your cause.

With Deadbolt you are guaranteed more combos, more tactics and more fun!
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Crimea
description:
The campaign in the Crimea in 1941-42 was more of a siege than a fluid Panzer action, since only one German Panzer Division actually took part in the battles. Yet, the employment of assault guns by the Germans and the later devastating effect of the 22nd Panzer Division made the use of armor an important part of this campaign."

The game uses brigade and division sized units. 100 counters.

Part of Excalibre's Panzer Battles and Sieges Series. Other games in the series include: Caen 1944, Sidi Rezegh 1941, and Cassino 1944.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: All-Pro Baseball
description:
Tactical baseball game. The defensive player chooses one of eighteen pitches on the plastic selector device. The offensive player chooses “steal”, “high swing”, “middle swing”, “low swing” or “take” on the device. The door of the device is opened to reveal the result. The device tells the players where the ball landed if the ball was hit. Standard baseball rules apply.

The game has the endorsement of Major League Baseball.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Scuba: Blue-Ringed Octopus Promo Pack
description:
This promo pack for Scuba adds the Blue-Ringed Octopus to the game.

Contents:

4 Blue-Ringed Octopus cards

2 Blue-Ringed Octopus tiles

1 card with rules
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Super Mario Kart: The Card Game
description:
Description from the back of the box:

Super Mario Kart - The Card Game!

A fast running card game, players cannot reach the goal before items such as bananas and shells jam your kart and prevent victory! Mushrooms and Stars help you get in first place and achieve victory! Two game modes are included with this game! Grand Prix and Battle Mode!

In the Super Mario Kart Card Game, there are two games you can play: Grand Prix and Battle Mode.

In Grand Prix, players use numbered movement cards as well as item cards to navigate through the pack of racers from the back of the line to the front of the line. When players play movement cards, the numbers are compared to determine placement of one's kart in that round. However, players can also use item cards to assist themselves or hurt other players in their quest to win the race!

In Battle Mode, players are equipped with three balloons (like the video game) and players must manage their hand as well as anticipate the moves of other players to try and outmaneuver their attacks while landing their own. The last player with balloons is the winner!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Tour de France
description:
The game consist of 5 "rounds" (or rather 5 different stages in the tour): 1 team trial, 1 time trial and 3 regular stages. Each stage, there are points to be won for individual cyclists as well as for the team. The player with the best overall score after 5 stages wins the game.

Each player has a team of 3 cyclists, which he moves by means of cards (he chooses 1 of 4 available hand cards, and then draws a replacement).

On the board, there are spaces where the player has to draw 'risk' cards - these can be beneficial, but also baneful.

name: Limpeh Says
description:
Description from the publisher:

Limpeh Says is a card game for we the citizens of Singapore, containing 550 unique, localised cards revolving around the culture we've built here in our little country.

Guided by the ideology of being 'morally wrong but politically right', it includes topics from food, to National Service, and everything else in between.

The game is as simple as it gets. Each round, one player draws a Red Card. Everyone else answers with their best white card. The funniest combination wins.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Isis
description:
A beautiful solid-wood game that uses a reproduction of an Ancient Egyptian game's components (board and pieces; unfortunately, this game's original ancient rules are lost) and adapts them with thoroughly modern rules.
Players maneuver neutral pieces into a position where they can be personalized, and then try to maneuver the personalized piece onto one of two throne spaces to claim victory.
How much a piece moves depends on how many pieces there are in its section of the board.
A perfect information, non-random game, it becomes very tense with several players as the consequences of your move take several turns to become clear.

name: My Dog Can Do That
description:
From the description on the back of the box:

"My dog can do that is an antic-filled race to Hollywood for the whole family. Yes, including the dog. The fun begins when you select a trick card such as: doorbell dash, Mexican hat dance, synchronized walking or any one of the 72 tricks included. Then you have 30 seconds to get your dog to do the trick. If you like to play with your dog and you can think on your feet, you'll have a ball."

There's also a notice on the back of the box that says: Dog Not Included

name: Palaver
description:
It is a cooperative game. Every Player has 8 playing pieces. 4 of them are speed markers. Object of the game is to group 8 playing peices round so called palaver-places. As every player has only 4 stones in play everybody needs a partner to win. Stones may move 1 space in their first turn. you can change speed every turn by one (up or down) Max. Speed is 3.

Nice game for people who like it cooperative.

Was originally released in a tube.

name: Oups das kannst du auch
description: What's OUPS doing? OUPS had a dream. During his dream, his twists and turns created odd figures and forms. Sometimes he looked like a figure eight, sometimes his legs and arms were crossed. When OUPS awoke, he immediately tried to re-create the same moves again and felt full of energy afterwards. OUPS then decided to travel the world, telling children of his dream and demonstrating the movements. Then he learned that more and more children suffer from attention and learning problems. Can you follow the movements?

name: Cross-Eyed
description: You have tiles that you flip over, and they show a pattern made up of Xs and Os. You also have a deck of cards, showing those same patterns. Shuffle both. Now, you have to make a match, all while working under a time limit.

name: Manassas
description:
Wargame covering 1st Bull Run in the American Civil War.

The game includes one rule pamphlet, one play aid with charts, one organizational card, 240 die-cut counters and one map.

Scale is 0.6 miles per hex, brigade level units and two-hour turns.

This game was eventually produced by GDW around 1977. Manassas is a brigade/regiment level simulation with 220 counters. Movement is simultaneous, and combat is by step reduction, with a slightly odd system in which each unit is accompanied by a marker showing current strength. There are night disengagements, weather, supply and military formation rules. from (The Comprehensive Guide to Wargaming by Nicholas Palmer, 1977)
publishers: Game Designers' Workshop (GDW Games), Historical Simulations, Ltd.

name: Cavalry
description:
Cavalry is subtitled "an exciting and tactical game based on historic battles between US Cavalry and Apache Indians." The game is published by Epoch Co Ltd as part of their World Wide Series.
The box art shows three 7 year olds enjoying a game, the two boys involved are wearing appropriate headgear to denote which side they are on, while the spectator girl is either providing encouragement or a offering a tip to one of the players.

The board represents the desert and is laid out using a square grid, but what give the game its flavor are the fixed plastic mesa that rise out of the game board providing irregular terrain features. The mesas (as well as Fort Apache and the Indian Camp) end a pieces move and cannot be jumped over.

To win you must capture your opponents flag. The playing pieces are miniature cavalry and Indians. The cavalry force comprises of 12 men and 3 Gatling guns and are placed in predetermined starting positions on the board. There is 1 cavalry captain that can move any number of squares in any one direction, 7 cavalry men that move like rooks in chess, 3 Gatling guns that move like a chess bishop and 4 guards that move like a chess king. The flag cannot move.

The Indian force mirrors their Cavalry opponents with 1 chief, 7 archers, 3 rifle men, 4 guards and 1 emblem.

The number of pieces a player can move in a turn is determined randomly by a spinner built into one of the mesas. Depending on the spin a player will be able to move either 3, 2, 1, or none of his pieces.

There are also two player aid cards that assist players in remembering how their pieces move. The rules are printed on the inside cover of the box lid and the box lid is also marked "made in Japan".

name: The Hottest Race in the World
description:
This six player game is an upgraded version of Formula 1 Fever, which allows gamers to experience the thrills of F1 racing in the comfort of their own home. Gamers have the choice of competing in a single race or the entire F1 championships playing on the different race tracks similar to the actual F1 Championship.

Each player (driver) has an identical deck of movement cards, which also represents their fuel, so if at any time during the game they run out of cards, they are out of the game!

Before the race, players are given 12 construction points to customize their cars according to how they think it will race best on the track selected (the basic game comes with 2 tracks - Malaysia & Japan). Players can choose from better:
- Acceleration (1 point).
- Braking (1 point).
- Cornering (2 points).
- Special features (3 points).

The race is over 3 laps, and players begin with 5 cards from their deck, and 3 "Event" cards (which introduce elements such as rain, safety car, etc).

Each round, players starting with the race leader:
1) Decide if he/she wishes to play an "Event" card. The effects take place immediately.
2) Must play 1 "Movement" card and MAY play 1 other card (Acceleration, Braking, Cornering or Special).
3) Players then move their cars according to the modified score of their cards.

As in real life, players have to really plan how to negotiate the corners, where penalty points in the form of tire wear is imposed if players pass the corners. Essentially, players who land on the corners receive no penalty.

Players also have to plan tactically when to make their pit stops, and whether they take a short one (just top up petrol), or a longer one (where they also change tires).

In the end, players who manage their resources well, take risks at the right time and plan their pit stops well will emerge the winner!

name: Spuk im Schloss
description:
This game should be played in darkness. Every player gets a certain number of fluorescent cards into his hand and has to pass one of these to his left every round. Whenever one player collects a set of four equal pictures he calls the end of the round.

Points are scored for ending the round and for ghosts which can be either positive or negative, depending on the ghosts' face which can not be recognized in darkness.

name: BGG: The Board Game
description:
Become Geek of the Week - a game for 1-6 players.

A spoof of the famous boardgamegeek website, this is a playable game for 1-6 players, where you acquire GeekGold, Thumbs and Popularity in an effort to become Geek of the Week. Choose one of six roles: Contributor, BGG Admin, Troll, Lurker, Game Designer or Chatterbox. Featuring everything you've always loved about BGG, including microbadges, reviews, session reports, geek lottery, and much more!

name: Eurobabble
description:
From the publisher's site "Eurobabble is the ludicrously silly party game of gentle self mockery, stereotyping our European cousins, and whether you speak any foreign or not is almost irrelevant. In fact, the less you understand, the funnier it is. It’s also ridiculously simple:

Can you say in an Italian accent “We have ways of making you talk”?

What is the answer to “Quel est le nom du stade national de football anglais?”
Can you impersonate a children’s television presenter in the style of a Dutch person.

And which is the German word for swimming trunks – Badehose; Schwimmelpanten; Unterwassertrunken
Correct answers win country flags – the first player/team to collect all six, wins.

It’s as simple as that. Guaranteed to make you laugh out loud and sure to make any party go with a bang…….or should that be with a boem, boum, bum, boma, paf or rätt.
".

name: Trivial Pursuit: The Vintage Years Edition (1920's – 1950's) – Card Set
description:
1920's to 1950's - Card set, For Use With Master Game
This is a card set expansion for Trivial Pursuit with the following categories:
•Products & Progress
•Sports and Leisure
•History
•Personalities
•Entertainment
•Wild Card
From G.I. Joe to Joltin' Joe, from Black Thursday to Billy Sunday, this handy card set will test your memory for things and times past. If the 30 years from Lindburgh to Eisenhower are the ones you and your friends remember best, then this is the edition for you!
Use it with any TRIVIAL PURSUIT Master Game to add thousands of different question in these categories: Products & Progress, Entertainment, History, Personalities, Sports and Leisure, and Wild Card.

No. 6016
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Warhammer: Forces of Fantasy
description:
A box set of three books containing additional rules and scenarios for first edition Warhammer:

Volume 1: Forces of Fantasy
Volume 2: Fighting Fantasy Battles
Volume 3: Arcane Magics

These include extended rules for fleshing out Warhammer armies, more battle rules (particularly for various levels of unit organization), and rules for the use of magic in the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Elfstedentocht
description:
The 'Elfstedentocht' is a Dutch event were ice-skaters try to complete 200km along 11 cities.

In this game each player gets a control-card representing his/her color.
Each player gets 7 'rijders-cards'. With the rider-cards player can skate the distance needed between two cities or rest. When a player reaches a city, he/ she gets a stamp on the control-card.
Players recieve along the way 'Skrik-crads' (alarm-cards). With these cards the player gets an advantage or disadvantage.

The first player who skated 200km wins the game.

name: Elves & Shelves
description:
Elves & Shelves is a free, print-and-play auction game for 2 to 4 players. Thematically it follows on from Warehouse Elves, with which it shares some components.

The toys have been brought in from the warehouse and placed on the sorting shelves. Your job as the sorting elves is to collect them according to the children’s Wishlists.

The game is played over 3 rounds of single-card blind bidding (tied bids cancel out). At the end of each round, scoring takes place. The player with the highest score after the third round is the winner.

Winner of the 2010 Christmas Print and Play Game Design Contest

name: Scrabble Book Lovers
description:
In this classic word game, players use their seven drawn letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. Each word laid out earns points based on the commonality of the letters used, with certain board spaces giving bonuses. But a word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word. This leads to slightly tactical play, as potential words are rejected because they would give an opponent too much access to the better bonus spaces.

The perfect edition of Scrabble for the Book Lover! Bonus points are awarded with the use of any author name, book title, or literary character.

name: Il Campionato dei piccoli Geni
description:
Trivia game with more than 5000 questions. Subjects of questions: Science, art and entertainment, English, geography, history, literature, general knowledge, mathematics.

3 rounds. In the first round all players answer questions, making points for a correct answer. In the second round, players face off in pairs. The fastest to book answers the question posed by opponents. Last round the player make a question to his left player, changing player until each player has placed a question. The best two player go to final round made by 10 other questions. The winner will be the player who correctly answers the most questions placed.

Contents:
1 board
8 pieces
32 cards
462 cards
Rules

name: Trapping the Ogre
description:
Trapping the Ogre is the sixteenth game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

The Leipzig battlefield saw the Coalition units battling to seize the only practical line of retreat open to the French, and if successful, trapping them for a truly "Napoleonic" style victory in reverse.

Trapping the Ogre is a mini-game, postcard sized. Rules at the back, map front and 16 double sided counters along the sides.

The game is a hex and counter game where troops are activated though a standard deck of cards: black activates French units, red Coalition. How many and all is determined by the specific card.

Combat is resolved by comparing combat strengths of the units and drawing cards from that same deck. Whenever a joker is drawn, the turn is over, the deck is reshuffled and a new turn begins.

Player who controls (occupies or last to occupy) Star hex (J7) wins the game.

This game is part of a series of postcard games about the battle of Leipzig, which can be played individually or combined into a single game called A Bridge Too Few (for this you will need an article published in the 2013 Against The Odds Annual):
13) Marschall Vorwärts!
14) "A Matter of Honor, Sire"
15) The Nations Assemble
16) Trapping the Ogre

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Gavroche Independent Expansion Pack
description: This ship is one of the ships players purchase as an entrance fee to participate in the Star Trek Attack Wing "The Collective Month 1" tournaments.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: ZtoZ
description:
Those that laugh last...are probably zombies!

ZtoZ is a survival party game where you and your friends are seated at a table surrounded by zombies. You'll need to read a card while impersonating a zombie in order to survive.

The catch, is that zombies have no sense of humor. Anyone laughing, smiling, giggling, grinning, or displaying any signs of mirth (or a bad zombie impersonator) is eaten.

Eliminated players join the zombies around the table and spend the game making zombie noises and "helping" find the non-zombies at the table.

Last person remaining at the table wins.

name: Bomarzo: The Pegasus
description:
Additional deity card for Bomarzo, exclusively available during the crowdfunding campaign.

The Pegasus grants its victory points to the player who gathered most Characters in his village and provides the unique ability of moving cards placed by the Dragon under the deity cards, making the end scoring a bit more unpredictable.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Időfutár
description:
Based upon a popular youth fiction book.

Be part of the story, work alone or co-operate with your team and build the time machine!
At the start of the game, every player gets a secret role card, which determines the team the player is part of. During the game, the players have to deduce who their partners and who their opponents are. The goal is to find as many parts of the time machine as possible. It's not enough to find the parts though, the teams have to defend their findings as well, because it's possible to steal items from other players.

During the game, players use their action cards to move the characters on the board. These cards have different possible actions based upon the location of the moved character on the board. These characters can find and pick up parts of the time machine, and the player who moved the given character gets the part, which is essential for winning the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Presidente
description:
Presidente is a quick, fun game where the smartest presidential candidate wins. It puts the player in the role of one of the candidates , who will do anything to win this presidential election, including using various dirty tactics against his opponents. Luckily, the victims can use the newspapers they own to spread the truth and walk away clean.

Not everything has to be achieved by cheating. You can also win elections cleanly, working honestly, achieving an impeccable political career, performing marches and other activities.

Instructions: Every player has a hand of 5 cards, which he replenishes from the deck after every play. On his turn he will play one of the cards in his hand. Usually he will play them in his own tableaux in one of three piles, votes (orange), money (green) and influence (purple). The person with the most votes at the end of the game is the winner, but you will need money and influence to be able to play the cards with the most votes. Sadly, the cards representing the strongest money and influence have the whiff of corruption about them, and if an opponent sees corruption in your tableaux, he can use the press to strip you of said money/influence.

Game ends when all cards have been played.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Astraios
description: Astraios is a constellation themed tile laying game. Players try to use tiles from their hand to make completely enclosed areas on the board, which are then claimed with a player piece, earning them points equal to the stars on the enclosing path. The game ends when tiles run out, or when one player has played all of their pieces.

name: Mystery Homes
description:
Mystery Homes is a cooperative deduction game for 3 to 5 players, about 30 minutes play time.

The criminal lurking inside the players performs the crime during the night time (while the other players closed their eyes), then all the players cooperate and investigate the crime.

If the mystery is unraveled within the time limit, the "innocence" player wins, If it is not unraveled, the "criminal" player is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Traitor Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Red Out
description:
Red Out is a rock-paper-scissors like game where each player has only five cards: black, white, black skull, white skull, and red skull.

The red skull beats the other skulls. The skulls beat the same color without a skull. Any other combination is a draw. Players reveal cards at the same time, putting aside any cards in a drawn match, until someone wins.

Because draws are common, this is more than just RPS with a different skin - it adds an element of keeping track of what your opponent has left to play.

—user summary

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Tink Camp
description:
This add-on includes:


9 Miniatures: 1x Loot Tink, 4x Psycho Tinks, 4x Shotgun Tinks
All game cards needed to play
Bounty scenarios


-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Forest Friends
description:
Mia Mouse and her friends play hide and seek in the forest. Look through the peep holes in the forest and help Mia Mouse search! Wasn't there just a rustle behind the tree? And there are footprints in this puddle. Who could they belong to? Maybe Ronja Deer, Suri Dormouse, and the rest of the gang in the dense leafy undergrowth?

Discover Free Play and Details
In Forest Friends your child can engage with the game materials during free play. Play along! Discover the pictures on the game materials together and talk to your child about them. Ask your child what they recognize and encourage them to name things. Talk to them about which animals they have already seen or heard in the forest. And just like that you're already role playing with your child.

Game 1: Little Forest Explorers
One child gets Mia Mouse. Read out a task. The child searches for the solution. Sometimes the correct answer is visible on the outer walls, sometimes only through the peep holes. If the child can't find the correct answer, help them. Once the child has found the solution, they receive a star and place it in front of them. Mia Mouse is passed on to the next child. It's now their turn. The game is over once all 5 stars have been collected.

Game 2: Play Hide and Seek
Before starting the game, everyone may look into any two holes. Every child tries to remember which animal is where. Whoever was last in a forest goes first and moves Mia Mouse one animal tile forward in a clockwise direction. The child names the animal that they see on the tile. Now it's time to think about which hole they can see the animal through. They choose the hole they think the animal is hiding in and look through it. If right, the child can take a star from the starry sky as a reward. The game ends when all the stars have been taken from the sky. The children now stack the stars they won on top of each other. The child with the highest star stack wins.

name: RouYouJin
description:
"RouYouJin" is a fairy tale-themed game.

Now, in explaining the features of "RouYouJin", let's explain the outline of the play of this game, not the text of the 9 types of villager cards.

First of all, the goal of the game is to increase the number of victory points and have the most. Victory points are sheep or gold.
1 sheep is 1 point, 1 gold is also 1 point, but if 1 sheep is converted to gold, it will be doubled to 2 gold.

Set the order card and the villager card and put them out on the back.
First, turn only the order cards into a table and arrange them so that the number on the left is small and the number on the right is large.

The rightmost villager in the row becomes a wolf.
Villager cards other than wolf are turned face up.
The number of society is written on the villager card, and if it is greater than or equal to the number of society on the left villager card and less than or equal to the number of society on the right villager card, the villager card is in the correct position.
Villagers in the correct row will trigger effects based on their role.
Some villagers have text effects even if they are not in the correct position.
As a result, you can collect sheep that are victory points, convert sheep into gold, or steal other people's sheep.

To win the game, your villagers must be in the correct position in the line.
It requires a high degree of reading on your part and a bit of luck.
The reason is that you need to combine the order card in your hand and the three villager cards well.
Aim for the front of the line, or for the back, or whether your plan will succeed... it's all up to you!

That said, it's basically an orthodox card game.
It is almost impossible to get lost in the play itself!
The slightly complicated rules and the short playing time of about 20 minutes will give you the joy of playing a dense game!

In addition, although it is basically an interpersonal battle with 4 to 5 people, it is fully equipped with rules for 1 to 3 people including automatons. Therefore, it is a game that is not easily influenced by the number of players.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Colorful Serengeti
description: Serengeti is a quick-perception game with colorful illustrations for smaller children.

name: Jukem Football (Second Edition)
description:
Run it in for 7, connect on a Hail Mary pass, or win the game on a last-second field goal in this fun, fast-paced, addictive card game.

​Jukem Football is the fun and competitive card game that makes every day a football day! Run, pass, and catch your way down the field, but be careful of your opponent's defensive cards that can wipe out your entire drive! Use your math skills, luck and strategy to defeat your opponent.

Setup: Choose a player to be the dealer. The dealer shuffles the deck, then deals four card face down to each player. The dealer places the remaining deck face down in the center of the play area to form the draw pile, then turns the top card face up beside the draw pile to start the discard pile. The other player takes the first turn and players then alternate turns.

On Your Turn: Replenish your hand to five cards. You can replenish from the draw pile and/or the discard pile, but you can only draw one card ( the top card) from the discard pile per turn. Make one offensive play (if you can) each turn to build your scoring drive. Ann offensive play is either a RUN card or a PASS/CATCH card combination. If no cards in your hand are playable, discard one card of your choice face up on the discard pile. This ends your turn.

Offensive Plays: Build your drive by placing offensive cards face up in front of you in a line, from left to right. The most common offensive plays are RUN plays, and PASS and CATCH combinations. There are also some special offensive plays that will add yardage to your drive. You may play any RUN card face up in front of you on any turn to gain the number of yards shown on that card or play a PASS and CATCH combination cards. To make a PASS and CATCH play, first play a PASS card, then play a CATCH card showing any number of yards within that range.

Scoring a touchdown: To score a touchdown, you must have exactly 100 yards on your drive - no more, no less. Each touchdown immediately ends your drive and scores seven points. As soon as you score a touchdown, stake all of your drive cards in a pile and set it aside to record your score. This ends your turn. On your next turn you can begin a new drive.

Defensive Plays: On your opponent's turn, after your opponent made an offensive play, you may play a defensive card to slow down or even stop his/her drive. These include Holding! Sack! these stop your opponents drive, while the Fumble and Picked off cards end your drive.

Half Time: If you draw the last card from the draw pile, you make as many plays as you can from your hand on that turn. After you've run out of plays, have been stopped by a defensive card, or have scored a field goal or touchdown, the half is over. Shuffle all the cards and play the second half the same way you played the first half. The player who did not deal in the first half deals in the second half.

How to win: When the second half ends, the game is over. The player with the most points wins. In case of a tie play again until a player scores either a field goal or a touchdown. That play wins the game!
publishers: Flying Pig Games LLC, Haywire Group

name: Skip-Bo Breakers
description: Skip-Bo Breakers imports Card Games: Climbing concepts into the Skip-Bo brand, familiar to the U.S. market. The traditional Skip-Bo cards are replaced by 64 plastic tiles, shaped like sideways chevrons, and rather than trying to simply sequence their cards, a lead player plays a set of cards: a single tile, a pair, running pairs, or a straight. Then, subsequent players may play the same type of set, or play a "breaker" — analogous to a bomb in traditional climbing game vernacular.

name: Spoils of War: Singing Donkey
description:
Artifact card worth 8 points.

Card text: "Whenever you talk, you must sing. If another Viking catches you talking instead of singing, you must give him this card!"

This promo was a reward given as part of the 'Man vs Meeple Season One Kickstarter'.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: The Castle
description:
Heroes, prepare for adventure. The Evil Lord of the Black Marches has kidnapped the daughter of the King. A reward of 1,000 gold pieces has been offered for the rescue of his Princess.

The Castle is a game of fantasy adventure that is easy to set up and fun to play. Players control various characters in a search for the means to rescue the Princess. To rescue the Princess, you must fight the evil creatures inhabiting the Castle and find the keys to open her Cell.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: Golden Gate
description:
Open up that Golden Gate! Its up to your wits, and a little bit of luck, to make the right plays and pile up the points.

Set down cards in number order. A yellow card means you take a chip out of the Golden Gate. Here’s where you show off your skills…can you place them at the right times to get the best chips? Or will the opportunity pass you by? And don’t get stuck with red cards, or you’ll lose chips.

It’s a fast, friendly showdown for the gold with the fine craftsmanship and colorful designs you’ve come to expect from Blue Orange Games.

name: Black Stories: Bibel Edition
description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with stories from the Bible.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Hyakke-Yagyo (百鬼夜行)
description:
"Yokai" is a class of supernatural monsters, spirits, and demons in Japanese folklore. Some are malevolent and others are mischievous, or occasionally a few of them even bring good fortune to those who encountered with them. The name of the game, Hyakki-Yagyo (百鬼夜行), meaning one hundred Yokais' night parade, is based on a popular style of lore where people get together and take turns to tell Yokai (or ghost) stories one by one. When the hundredth story is told, it was believed that a real Yokai is summoned and appears in front of the folks.

In this game, players are Yokai storytellers. But you tell your own Yokai stories by collecting different and beautiful Yokai cards and place them as separate sets based on their suits and numbers. In each round, each player take turns to draw from open Yokai cards into their hands and place a set of cards (for example, four cards in sequence with the same suit, three cards of the same number with different suits, etc.) Each set of cards represents different ghost stories. A game goes until one of the players score 10 points in total by repeating rounds, just like Yokai stories goes on and on all through the night...

name: Inning-A-Minute Baseball
description:
This baseball game uses 8 dice to derive results of each at bat. Different possible outcomes (walk, home run, ground out, etc.) are on the faces of each die. Six of the dice are always used and are placed in a cup (not provided).

The offensive player then selects one die secretly from a set of four dice, each representing a particular strategy for that at bat (Swing Away, Power Swing, Make Contact, and Stay Back.) The results on each die are in keeping with what would be expected from the chosen strategy.

Simultaneously, the defensive player chooses one die from a set of four that represent defensive strategies (Overpower, Induce Grounder, Induce Fly, Pitch Around) and adds it to the cup.

Once all the dice are in the cup, they are rolled. The result that is most common is the result for that at bat. There are, of course, rules for breaking ties. There are also strategy options on offense and defense that can affect the outcome.

name: Stones River: Turning Point in Tennessee
description:
From the Decision Games' website:

The Blue & Gray classics are being updated with a slight change in scale to 352 yards per hex, an updated game system that treats unit differences more accurately, and a combat system that includes step losses.

The Union Army of the Cumberland had been pursing the Confederate Army of the Tennessee after the Battle of Perryville, in October 1862. Throughout November the Confederate commander, Braxton Bragg, had misinterpreted that pursuit as an effort to capture Chattanooga; so now he halted and deployed his troops northwest of Murfreesboro, Tennessee, so as to safeguard the road junction there. Thus the Confederates sat and awaited their pursuers for a month. When the Federal army arrived in late December 1862, the Confederates launched a surprise attack near Stones River.

Stones River utilizes the all-new Musket & Saber Combat System, which presents a simple yet accurate portrayal of warfare during the American Civil War. The combat system is intuitive, including all the details that characterized battle during the Civil War while also simulating the unique aspects of 19th century warfare. Units can become weakened and rout; attackers can pursue, and the fortunes of war can intervene at any time. Cavalry can rip open enemy lines and shred fleeing units, and reserves must be ready to plug holes or secure a line of retreat.

In Stones River a new Combat Results Table emphasizes playability while also simulating the lethality of the rifled musket. Leaders accelerate the action, replicating the importance of their presence during battle, and supply lines require players to protect their logistical trains. Winning a battle will depend on deployment, maneuver and massing firepower, as well as the strengths and weaknesses of each particular army.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Horror Movie Edition
description:
Perfect for thrill seekers and know-it-alls alike, TRIVIAL PURSUIT: Horror Movie Edition is a must-have for any game collection. Just when you thought it was safe, both specific details and multiple choices await to attack based on films such as Jaws, The Exorcist, The Hills Have Eyes, and A Nightmare on Elm Street. Whether your best bet is on a variety of slashers, bloodbaths, or mutants, test your wits on the titles that keep you up at night with TRIVIAL PURSUIT: Horror Movie Edition

Stand alone "wedge" box of horror-themed trivia. Contains 600 questions on 100 cards and a six sided die representing the categories of question.

Categories: Monster, Gore/Disturbing, Psychological, Paranormal, Slasher, and International.
categories: Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Look In!
description: The hexes of this game are not the board. The pawns are hex - shaped. This game is about reflection. In every pawn is a little mirror.

name: Fields of Glory: Napoleonic Scenarios for Shako Rules
description:
Fields of Glory presents 18 scenarios for Shako's Napoleonic rules.
These battles are:
Castiglione, 1796
Rivoli, 1797
Bagration´s Battle, Austerlitz, 1805
The Russian Guard, Austerlitz, 1805
Halle, 1806
Medina de Río Seco, 1808
Vimiero, 1808
Medellín, 1809
Raab, 1809
Raszyn, 1809
Albuera, 1811
The Grand Redoubt, Borodino, 1812
Utitsa, Borodino, 1812
Liebertwolkwitz, 1813
Montmiriail, 1814
Plancenoit, Waterloo,1815
Wavre, 1815
With every scenario, the troops, the distribution of them among a diagram and the victory conditions are displayed.
Also included are some rules clarifications and changes from the original rulebook.

These scenarios work with:

Shako: Rules and Army Lists for Napoleonic Wargaming
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Moo!
description:
A children's game which can be played two different ways. In both games 12 tiles are set in a square and each player places their cow on the first square. The objective is to get your cow around the square. The colored milk bottles are set up in the middle of the square.

In the version called The Cow Goes Moo, each player takes turns rolling the color die and trying to knock over up to five bottles, but not more than five or they will lose their turn. The player gets to move their cow one space for each fallen bottle which matches the color rolled on the die.

In the Big Cow Poker version, before each roll, every player secretly chooses a color card. The roller knocks down up to five milk bottles and each player gets to move a number of spaces equal to the number of fallen bottles which match their card.
