categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Farming

name: Team Work: Mathematik
description:
How's this supposed to work again? What happens when a team of two explainers are supposed to describe a concept but can only say the sentences together? But it gets better: the players can't discuss what they want to say ahead of time and must build the sentence while alternating words! A good time is guaranteed because the rest all try to figure out what the concept is at the same time. Who will have the most points?

This set of Teamwork "Mathematik" covers the topic mathematics.

Expands:

Team Work Original

name: Caractère
description:
Caractère is a French game based on what the players think about each other. All the players must simultaneously choose the name of a player as an answer to a question — most of the time, it's a "who is the most... ?" type of question.

There are 3 different kinds of cards :
- Grey "Mélo" questions applies to everybody, and one can choose is own name as an answer
- Red Duo questions applies to everybody, but one can't answer his own nam
- Blue Ego question are about the active player only ("Am I rather likely to do this or that ?")

name: Risky Business
description:
Risky Business is a quiz game with a healthy dose of bluffing. The goal is to correctly answer as many questions as possible. However it is also necessary to stake your answer at the right time.

The game is played in rounds of five questions. All players bet money in each round. The player that can give the most correct answers and at the same time dares to stake it all the way will win the pot. The players are only aware of how many questions they have answered correctly themselves which means bluffing is a critical part of the game. Players can also use action chits to gain advantages over their opponents which lends the game an extra level of strategy.

In spite of the game's English title it is only available in Swedish.

The game was nominated to Årets spel 2009 (Game of the year 2009 in Sweden).
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Questions and Answers

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Empress Arachnia Promo Card
description: During any player's turn, Empress Arachnia may take (-2) damage to raise the strength of any weapon (being launched by any player) by a number equal to the roll of the d6 die.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Flash & Furious
description:
A quick paced game where players are seated around a battery powered electronic timer device. They collectively decide how many rounds to play (the rules don't specify a number). A reader then picks a card from the category deck and reads a category of things that the players must all name. Repeating a thing already named means you are out. The reader is final arbiter of disputes.

The device has a color for each player and once the reader presses the start button, it randomly flashes a color (lighting up their light and playing tense, accelerating music). That player has a few seconds to name something from the chosen category. The time shortens as play progresses. If the player can't name something before the timer flashes the next light that player is out. Once someone is out they press their assigned button and the timer stops. The reader gives the player who just went out the category card. A new round then starts.

Once the predetermined number of rounds are completed, the player with the fewest cards is the winner.
categories: Electronic, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Labyrinth: Magic of the Ancients
description:
This expansion adds spells to base game. All heros can use eight spells after they get enough Power points from special tile of labyrinth.

For ages people believed that the Magic of the Ancients had left with Them.
The most powerful spells were thought to be forgotten forever…
Things turned out differently, though. The remains of this unthinkable power are still here.
And they still fill the Labyrinth built so many centuries ago!
Heroes who shall discover magical springs and seize their power…
shall also gain dominance over time itself and learn to use it as no one has done before!
However, that’s not all! Thanks to the power lying dormant inside the Labyrinth
the Chosen shall be able to bring fallen heroes to a life of servitude.
There is also “Change of Destiny”, the most potent spell of all, waiting to be released.
It can ruin plans of many heroes fighting for immortality!

name: A Weaver in the Forest of Wyr
description:
You are a Weaver of Wyr, responsible for herbal medicine and magic spells and potions. Your garden beneath the trees of Wyr grow the flowers and herbs you need for your craft.

In the time of harvest you set out to gather what you will require for those you care for. You have a day to harvest all you will need while trying to stop the mischievous Keiju from causing havok in your Garden.

If you can find the right combination of flowers and herbs to satisfy them, they will consider you a friend and move elsewhere.

To Win:
The goal of the game is to harvest all but one of the Nature cards from the Garden and entice all the Keiju to leave.

Setup:
Shuffle the deck of 8 Keiju cards and draw 4 of them. Remove the others from the game. Place these 4 drawn Keiju on top of the pile of 44 Nature cards and shuffle this deck of cards and lay them out face up in 4 rows of 12 cards each This area is the Garden.

Leave room for 5 cards below these rows. This area is the Basket.

You will also create a discard pile - the Harvest - during the game.

To Play:
You may choose one of any two matching cards from any of the rows if your choice is: two adjacent cards within the rows, sharing the same suit or number OR if there are exactly two other adjacent Nature cards between the pair you are choosing to remove one of (Note: A Keiju card may not be one of these in between cards).

Only one of these two cards is chosen and is then placed either in the Harvest or the Basket. Each time you remove a card from a row, slide any cards to the right or left of the removed card to fill in any gaps across the rows. Cards are moved from the bottom rows upward or the top row downwards as a gap is filled.

The Harvest - This is a discard pile, you will receive one point for each card in this pile at the end of the game.

The Basket - Instead of placing cards in the Harvest you may place a card instead in one of 5 card ‘piles’ in your Basket. Cards in your Basket are used to entice the Keiju in your Garden to leave.

Keiju must be removed in numerical order, lowest to highest. If, at any time, cards on top of the piles in the Basket match a request as shown on the next consectuive numbered Keiju card in the Garden, you may remove that Keiju to the Harvest where it is worth 10 points at the end of the game.

The four or five cards used to bribe the Keiju are then removed from the game and will not score any points. Keiju do not have suits. They will form blocked areas in the rows of cards which can affect how you remove the suited cards.

As you play cards to the Basket you will cover up previous cards played there, which can then only be revealed once they are used to entice Keiju.

Scoring:
At game end you will receive:

1 point per Nature card in the Harvest.
10 points per Keiju in the Harvest.
Any Keiju left in the Garden are -5 points each.
Any Nature cards left in the Garden are -1 point each.
Cards remaining in the Basket count neither for nor against you.

This game can be played with a traditional card deck.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Luxastra: il Gioco da Tavolo
description:
From tabletop to YouTube and back! Luxastra finally has its own boardgame: with an easy, yet deep gameplay, you too can become a true hero of a faraway fantasy land. Play alone or up to six players, choose between the six protagonists of the Luxastra Fist Season: each of them has its own tableu, cards, powers... and every one is unique!

In this cooperative adventure game, you move around the city of Fatumastra together with your allies. You will need to find the dreaded Portal of Corialus to defeat one of the many bosses included in the box. To do so, you move tile by tile, facing many obstacles, traps, and enemies and you use your cards to attack, defend, assist your allies and try to pass as many trials as you can. You must be fast: each turn, the enemy Menace might increase... and when it reaches 20 the game is over! Try not to do it too fast, though: being too tired makes you vulnerable, and even one fallen hero will mark the end of your adventure.

May the Raven King be with you!


Dal tavolo alla Rete e ritorno! Luxastra ha finalmente il suo gioco in scatola, l’apice di una lunga collaborazione tra InnTale e Fantàsia Edizioni, firmato dall’autore emergente Gianluca Horton, e in esclusiva assoluta.

Un’esperienza semplice ma coinvolgente, giocabile in solitaria o in gruppi da due a sei giocatori, dove ciascun partecipante può diventare un vero eroe. Scegliete tra i sei Personaggi Giocanti della Prima Serie di Luxastra: ognuno di loro ha la sua plancia, i suoi poteri, il suo mazzo, e tutti quanti sono assolutamente unici ed iconici.

Usate le vostre carte per attaccare, difendervi, curare i vostri alleati e volgere i combattimenti a vostro favore. Ma non dimenticate che le vostre forze non sono infinite, e che restare senza energie durante il combattimento potrebbe rendervi la vita difficile, visto che non potete fermarvi.

Ad ogni turno, dovrete cercare di farvi strada per la città Fatumastra, sempre di corsa tra le sue vie labirintiche. Tra vicoli ciechi, orde di nemici sul piede di guerra, artefatti nascosti nei luoghi più imprevedibili, mentre la Minaccia continua a crescere e la mano invisibile del Fato cala su di voi.

Non c’è tempo da perdere! Perché una volta che la Minaccia raggiungerà il valore massimo, il destino di tutta Delphes sarà segnato, e voi non potete permetterlo. Radunate i vostri amici, sedetevi al tavolo da gioco e accettate la sfida.

Che il Re Corvo vegli su di voi.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Party & Co Family
description:
With Party & Co Family, you can imitate, draw, squirm, answer original questions and conquer the funniest challenges. Have fun with the new Party & Co Family: a party for the whole family!

The game can be played in teams (maximum 3 teams of 2 or more players) or with maximum 3 individuals. Divide the players into teams. Choose which side of the game board you want to play with: the normal course takes about 50 minutes. The short trail is about 25 minutes.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Leo: The Mirror
description: With Leo: The Mirror, once per game one player may use the function of the mirror. Immediately after turning over the path tile onto which Leo moves, the player also turns over the tile that is located one step closer to the starting bed. Then the player chooses on which of the two tiles they want to place Leo and checks whether the clock hand needs to be moved. After using this function, the mirror is turned face down and cannot be used again in this game.

600 is a Yahtzee-like dice game played with six regular dice.

Players are trying to earn the highest score in 18 rounds in 4 categories: Numbers, Rungs, Clusters, and Patterns. On their turn, a player rolls all 6 dice up to 3 times and then enters the result in any free row. After 18 rounds have been played, the player with the most points wins.

Included in Reiner Knizia's book Dice Games Properly Explained.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection
publishers: Blue Terrier Press, Elliot Right Way Books

name: QBits
description:
From the Publisher's Website:

'QBits' is a new innovative mathematical board game designed by young people for young people. It incorporates the four basic principles of maths (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) in a format that is quick and easy for players of all ages and abilities to learn. Without even realising it, players are continually doing maths in a fun way throughout the game. Younger or less able players can play using smaller numbers whilst older or more able players can play using higher numbers, once familiar with the rules this becomes a tactical game which even teaches prime numbers.

Game Includes:
Game Board
50 Numbered Plastic "Qubes"
Cloth Holding Bag
Score Pad
Pencil

name: Same, Same, But Different
description:
We're no strangers to accidentally saying inappropriate things in totally casual situations. That's why we created Same Same But Different, the party game of double entendres! Setup is simple: Players draw a Safe" Card and a "Risky" Card, and compete to find the funniest phrase that suits both situations. For example, what's something you can say during sex and also during a driver's test? Answer: it's HARDER than you think (get it?).

Adults Only: This game contains adult content and was created for ages 17+. There are some things you just can’t unhear. Trust us on this one.

—description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Louisiana Tigers
description:
First game in Richard Berg’s “Civil War Tactical System.” Company-level ACW at 25 yards per hex.

Focused around the opening moments of the 1st Battle of Manassas.

The heart of the system is in commanding the companies, issuing orders actively (not reactively), and determining what your units actually do when given orders. Do they follow their commanders? Can they even hear them? Do they form line of battle, or do they fall prone? Do they Hold and Volley Fire, or do they recklessly Charge?

name: Käse Kaos
description:
In this skill game the children try to fish just the pieces of cheese with a spoon from the cheese box. As a reward, and as a salvation from the mousetrap, you get a prize mouse - and with six mice in your color you have one victory in his pocket.
But beware: If a cat is revealed the mice are rescued quickly.

On his turn a player rolls a dice. All players look at the picture on the dice. Then the first player calls "Say Cheese". Now all players grab their spoon and try to catch the cheese parts on the picture. The first player who collects all parts of the picture gets a mouse. When a player collects 3 mice, he is the winner.

Contents: 24 card mice, 36 pieces of cheese, 3 dice, 4 plates, 4 spoons;

name: Reverse Charades: Holiday Edition
description:
Reverse Charades: Holiday Edition, an expansion pack for Reverse Charades, consists of 220 cards that feature holiday-themed words.

Game play remains the same as in the base game, with players divided into two teams. On a turn, all but one player on a team give charades-style clues to that one person left out, and that person guesses as many words as possible in sixty seconds. After each player on both teams has had a shot at guessing (and both teams have had the same number of turns), the team with the most words guessed wins.

name: Piwne Imperium: Polskie browary i puby
description:
Extension to Piwne Imperium board game, named „Polskie browary i puby” (Beer Empire: Polish breweries and pubs). It is a deck of cards that contains 15 recipes from small and medium-sized regional and contract breweries. These breweries are located in Poland, and they create Polish „beer culture”.

In this deck you will also find 10 pub cards, that show real, special places on the Polish beer map where you can enjoy a good beer and spend time with your friends.

This extension also contains 30 new challenges and events cards, 12 of which were created in collaboration with those who supported the Beer Empire project at Wspieram.TO, a Polish crowdfunding platform.

With these cards added to Beer Empire, you can move in the realities of the Polish beer market, were you can meet interesting breweries or take the challenge for pubs, which are really places worth knowing.

Many of the event or challenges cards often refer to the situation we have seen in our home market - sometimes funny, sometimes serious, and sometimes unusual and unprecedented.

Add this expansion to Beer Empire and have fun, discovering trivia and elements of the "Polish Beer Market."
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Dice's Zoo: Fleas Invade
description:
This small expansion contains 12 red dice (with 2 traps, 2 Fleas and 2 Zoo Keepers on each die), which are mixed in with the base game dice.

Fleas can be played alone or together with other animals. When played alone, Fleas are smaller than Earthworms in size; when played together with other animals, Fleas are counted as the animals they are played with.

If there are already Fleas in play, a player who then puts out other animals with a larger body size on the playing surface will get all of those Fleas in play.

At the end of the game, each Flea side that faces up counts as 8 deduction points.

Administrators cannot be put out to play.
Immediately after throwing your own red dice, for each Administrator side that faces up, you get to choose one target white die (which can either be from your own collection or from any other player’s collection) and turn it to any side you desire to have face up. At the end of the game, each Administrator side that faces up counts as 9 deduction points.
publishers: Kuraki Mura B.G. Studio, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Till Dawn: Kickstarter Promos
description:
The 'Till Dawn' backer kickstarter exclusive promos pack includes the following:

- the Nosferatu character card + voting cards [4],
- one card for the Hunt deck [Chuck Norse - Vampire Slayer],
- two cards for the Power deck [Hunter Hunted + Vast Wealth],
- one event card [Betrayal Alliance],
- a Sun/Moon standee token for the Night Track [replaces the glass bead].
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Christmas Monster Box
description: The Munchkin Christmas Monster Box has room for two thousand Munchkin cards, various Kill-O-Meters, a Level Playing Field or two, Dungeons, Seals, and more. To get you started, it includes six Munchkin promotional bookmarks and twelve Munchkin promo cards.

name: Eye Catch
description:
You need to keep both eyes open to do well in Eye Catch.

Each turn, a player will reveal one of the cards from the top of the shared deck. Each card features an animal and a colored background. If three cards face up on the table show the same color or the same animal, the first player to yell "Catch!" collects those three cards. A player can also "Catch!" three cards that among them show two colors and two animals (i.e., one card matches the color of a second card and the animal of a third card). If players yell at the same time, remove the cards from the game; if someone mistakenly yells "Catch!" when no such catch exists, that player returns a captured card to the deck. When the deck runs out, the player with the most cards wins.

Alternatively, players can start Eye Catch by revealing two cards, memorizing them, then turning those cards face down. On a turn, a player reveals three cards, whether from the top of the deck, from those already face down, or a combination of both. If the player reveals a catch, they keep those three cards; otherwise they turn the cards face down and the next player goes. Again, when the deck runs out, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Heart and Brain: The Party Game
description:
Party card game by the creator of the Heart and Brain comics (aka The Awkward Yeti).

Channel Heart and Brain to defeat your friends in this easy-to-learn ultimate party game! From completely bizarre to extremely logical, this game has it all: trivia, challenges, voting, truth/dare, scenarios/responses. Play Heart and Brain-themed cards and win corresponding game pieces by performing tasks, voting correctly, having the funniest answers and winning challenges. The first player to earn 3 Heart and 3 Brain game pieces is the winner!

description from the designer

name: Next Goal Wins
description:
Next Goal Wins is a fast-paced, strategic game of team building and head to head football rivalry.

Each player drafts a team of seven footballers from each of the classic positions - Goalkeepers, Defenders, Midfielders and Attackers - to take them through a league in which they will play a head-to-head match against each other player of the game. A win is worth three points, a draw worth one point and loss gets you nothing. At the end of the league, the player with the most points will be crowned as the champion.

In a match, both players will put forward a squad of four of their players from each of the positions. With three attacks each, it's up to each player to pass, punt, dribble, cross and ultimately shoot or head the ball past the opposing player's goalkeeper with their attacker, decided by stat-to-stat comparisons aided by the roll of six-sided die. Win the clash to move the ball forward, but lose and your attack will be ended by a block, tackle or save and the ball given to the other player.

Outside of matches, pick up event cards to alter the landscape of the game both inside and outside of matches - sometimes in your favour, sometimes not - and patch up weaknesses in your team makeup by transferring new players in.

Beware, to finish at the top of the league it'll take talent and luck!

—description from the designer

name: Just Like Mama Used to Say
description:
Bless your heart. This game utilizes the tried and true party game recipe of one person judging the cards ya’ll put down as an answer for their prompt, just like Cards Against Humanity, except you’re not gonna blush playing this with Mama (or the preacher). The theme is right there in the title as you are completing phrases your southern mama might say, like “He was sneakier than a mega-church preacher at Pappy’s hidden moonshine still.” That’s the example printed on the box. The prompts the storyteller puts down are all comparative phrases (yellow cards) and the submissions are all pairs of things (red cards) and locations (blue cards).

If the storyteller likes your submission, you keep the yellow prompt card and win once you’ve collected five.

It comes with 540 cards, but 40 of those are blanks, so you can go ahead and quote your mama for later.

name: Sakura Heroes
description:
Who will master the challenges of the magic mountain?

In Sakura Heroes, you face dice tasks that become more and more difficult as you advance. Collect flowers and lucky charms to complete the challenges. Everyone rolls their dice at the same time and tries to get the right symbols with their dice as quickly as possible in order to advance to the next level. Collect the most valuable diamonds on your way to the top of the magic mountain to be crowned the heroic victor!

name: Swords & Spells
description:
Rules for Large-Scale Miniatures Battles Based on the Game Dungeons and Dragons
Development by Dave Arneson and Rob Kuntz.

Swords & Spells is a medieval fantasy miniatures taple top that can be used as a stand alone wargame or in conjunction with D&D. It uses a dice-less combat resolution system. Attackers' weapons are indexed vs. defenders' armor class resulting in total damage vs. that stand of miniatures.
publishers: Tactical Studies Rules (TSR), Wizards of the Coast

name: Purzelspinne
description:
[From Publisher] The spider kids want to climb up the belly of Spider Mum. Be careful - otherwise Spider Mum slips through the web and all the spiders will fall off! A piling game for 2-5 skillful players.

[From Submitter] Quality produced wooden game of stacking spiders on a mother spider mounted on a web which is a genius web of elastic bands. The game is highly playable by both kids and adults as well with equal fun.

name: Battle for Midway: Decision in the Pacific, 1942
description:
Battle for Midway is a large scale air-naval simulation of the naval action between Japanese forces attempting to invade and seize Midway Island, and the American air, naval and land forces dedicated to holding it at all costs.

Counters representing American and Japanese aircraft, ships and troops maneuver across the maps, searching for the enemy while attempting to remain concealed themselves. When the enemy is located, intense efforts are devoted to his destruction, and to the achievement of strategic objectives.

2 Maps
480 die cut counters
Rules
Deployment sheets
CRT player aids
Large ziplock package format

The game looks very playable. Being initiative based there is no certain way for a player to set a concrete strategy and so must respond to weather, turn order and the mystery of where the enemy task force is.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The Battle of The Metaurus Northern Italy 207 BC
description:
From the publisher's website:
"As people think over the actions of Hannibal in the 2nd Punic War, many great battles come to mind…Cannae, Zama, Trebia, Lake Trasimene…

Yet, Creasy chose The Metaurus as the decisive battle for the entire war. How can that be? Hannibal was not even there!

But his brother was there, in command of an army sent to reinforce Hannibal and give him the strength and stamina to finish off the Romans. By this time (207 BCE), the Romans were mostly avoiding head-to-head battles with Hannibal, and he mostly lacked the cavalry strength to force them to fight where he wanted them to. When the Romans intercepted messengers Hasdrubal sent to alert Hannibal to his arrival, they realized how critical it was to keep the brothers from joining together, and rushed an overwhelming force to surprise and destroy the new army. And won.

Now, see if you can change or maintain the history.

The Romans have numbers and overall troop quality on their side. Hasdrubal has a wide range of troops, from crack heavy infantry and light cavalry from Africa to poor quality Celtic levies. And, they have the superior position. The game calls on both players to “do better” than their historical counterparts. Richard Berg’s design emphasizes morale and the importance of getting troops to execute the right commands.
The Battle of the Metaurus includes:
One 11” x 17” mounted game-map
200 die-cut mounted counters
8 page Rules Booklet

Part of the TPS "Decisive Battles" series

That means straightforward rules, key insights into the history behind the game, and designs aimed at one-session conclusions and high replay value. "
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Chivalry
description:
Set in the Middle Ages, Chivalry is a family game in which you can play as a knight apprentice who strives to get a higher rank and honor his family. By visiting every corner around the kingdom, you will gather knight spirits to enhance yourself and make yourself well-prepared for future challenges. In the end, the player with the most knight virtue will be the knight exemplar and bathe in the praise and applause of the crowds.

Briefly speaking, there are three actions players take in Chivalry: Rest, Patrol, and Promote. Rest is the phase for knights to stay and prepare their equipment and supplies, while Patrol is the phase to gather everything you need in the kingdom, or go to castle to get reward from the King. The most important phase is Promote, which symbolized your conquering of the trials and earn yourself knight virtues to elevate in the knight rank. Whenever a knight being promoted, there will be extra bonus for him to manifest the nobility. The game ends when any player collects the designated number of knight virtues, and the one with most virtues wins this game.
mechanics: Command Cards, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Rondel, Set Collection

name: Duel of Wands
description:
Casters have long used magic to settle their disputes, often with disastrous effects. Over the years, these duels developed into the codified contest of skill and cunning that we have today: the Duel of Wands.

In Duel of Wands, which is set in the world of the Kids on Brooms RPG and which contains rules for use within that game, players attempt to prove themselves the superior caster by slinging spells at each other to try to remove their opponent's psyche and win the duel. Don't grow too confident in victory because between rounds, the loser can study and improve their spells!

—description from the publisher

name: Watchmen of Destiny: Bloody Mercenaries Expansion
description: They are savage, dangerous and covered in blood, but if you give them their money, you are on the safe side. Mercenaries are totally unique new cards that are different from the watchmen. Mercenaries can help you economically, they can harm your opponent and they activate global events! This expansion brings you a different strategic element and it offers new options. It also spices up and dramatizes a 2-player game. (Artwork is not suitable for kids and those who don't have stomach for it.)
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Battle of Britain
description:
Genuinely Britain's finest hour, help defend the south coast of England as swarms of German bombers cross the Channel and target our defenses. A large board has a hex grid, basically showing the French coast and the Home counties, divided into a sector for each player, with airfields and AC-AC, and a spinner to direct the Luftwaffe randomly. The player pieces are a base unit, to show fuel remaining, card stock for the plane, and a stalk with a sprue to control the height of the aircraft. You have 2 actions, to move and change height. Land to refuel, run out and you crash, get behind a bomber at the same height to bring it down. First to knock down 5 wins.

"Tally ho, Ginger, chocks away!"
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Schnipp-Trick
description:
Penguin bowling...try to shoot the wooden penguins off their floes, well to be more exact try to shoot away the floe beneath the penguin without the penguin falling over.

Just a moment ago, the small wooden cone was standing on its target. A well-aimed shot with the puck, the disc is gone, the cone stands dutifully on the tabletop! The law of inertia makes it possible and of course the skill of the shooter.
At the beginning of the game "all toes" stand on their round bases. The target shooting can begin.
Whoever shoots the pedestal out from under a cone without it toppling over, may collect the freed cone. If the cones tumble, the shooter goes empty-handed. The players take turns flicking until the red cone with the most points is collected.
SCHNIPP-TRICK is an amusing and exciting game of skittles.
The smoother the table, the better the puck slips!

—description from the SCHNIPP-TRICK (translated)

name: Oro Nero
description: Covering the board, the players must, through auctions, try to buy up oil pools and then take advantage of them to become the richest player at the end of the game.

name: Lucky Sock Dip: Spin Cycle
description:
Game description from the designer:

Washday! Baskets full of socks are waiting in the laundrette, but what's this? The sock monster has mixed everything up again!

Which sock belongs in which basket, and where are the coins for the washing machine? Only if you look accurately and are fast enough can you bring order into the sock chaos of Lucky Sock Dip: Spin Cycle and win the valuable monster coins.

name: Workaholic Liver War
description:
The players have all arrived at the company as new employees, full of ambition and eager to work hard in order to dominate the company and rise up from a nobody to a somebody thanks to the admiration of others.

But to rise like a phoenix and transform into a dragon at the company, as everyone wants to do in Workaholic Liver War, you'll need to gain the cooperation of your colleagues while taking good advantage of your personal skills and random events inside the company walls. Experience in-fighting, develop a fantastic career, suffer from a burst liver due to all the stress and pressure, and ideally in the end get everyone else to bow to you respectfully...

name: Carrot and Stick
description:
Carrot & Stick
Will you be Naughty or Nice
The race build your own world has begun and you have victory in your sights but how will you convince the people to follow you will they get the Carrot or the Stick. This is an easy to learn, versatile and creative card game of bribery, threats and weirdness. Lead your island to dominate other island with adorable assistance or devastatingly creative cruelty.
The game has 3 modes of play:


Party Play where players compete directly against each other to win followers the player with the most followers wins using bribery and blackmail or weirdness. This hilarious card combination game is easy to learn, always original and fast to play, perfect for casual gamers and ideal for pub play with family or friends.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tricky Wave
description:
Big and little turtles meet on the beach, all ready to swim out into the great ocean as swiftly as possible. But that wild wave, «Tricky Wave», swirls everything around and again and again, it washes the big and little swimmers back to the beach. Only the sly ones in their turtle shells overcome the waves, enjoy the chance to freeride them and boldly guide the other turtles into the ocean. Off we go!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Große und kleine Schildkröten treffen sich startbereit am Strand und wollen schnellstmöglich in das weite Meer hinaus. Doch die wilde Welle „Tricky Wave“ wirbelt alles durcheinander und spült die kleinen und großen Schwimmer immer wieder zurück zum Strand. Nur diejenigen, die es faustdick unter dem Panzer haben, überwinden die Wellen, genießen die Möglichkeit des Mitsurfens und lenken frech andere Schildkröten ins Meer. Los geht’s!

—description from the publisher (German)

name: Port Arthur
description:
Port Arthur is a strategic simulating the land campaign in Manchuria fought between Russia and Japan, 1904-05. Individual counters representing infantry divisions,and cavalry and artillery at lower levels, maneuver on a map depicting the lay of the land in Manchuria, with units engaging in combat while seeking national objectives.

Port Arthur is a companion game to Tsushima, which covers the naval campaign of the Russo-Japanese War in similar detail. Both games were available in a single package, The Russo-Japanese War, which contained the combined game rules.

Contains:

rulebook
240 counters
1 map


(source: the rulebook introduction and user's description)

name: Magors Lesezauber
description:
This game is only playable with a tiptoi, a 'smart' pencil with an integrated mp3 player, that reacts when you point it on enabled products like this game.

In this game the players have to solve tasks given by the tiptoi, by pointing the tiptoi at the right pictures, letters or words on the game components.

The games designed to help kids get more familiar with letters. Some sample categories of tasks given by the game:
- Find two pictures, beginning with the same letter
- Decide if a given letter is part of a given word
- Construct a word out of a few given letters
- Find a picture with the right rhyme
- ...

The game has 3 difficulty settings, and is a good way to familiarize kids with their letters, who are still struggling with reading. Once their reading skill has reached a decent level, this game will get boring.

name: Zero Seven
description:
Zero Seven is a psychological quiz game where you need to answer correctly the questions that mostly begin with the words «How many...». Any answer must be a whole number from 0 to 7, and the players bid for the number they consider correct with a combination of their number cards so that their sum equals the estimated answer. The players can’t use bidding cards they’ve placed as bets before, so they have to plan carefully which cards they should keep and which ones they are ready to sacrifice to get the full hand back. There is also an “Elementary!” rule which allows to profit from all other players answering correctly. Most of the times the winner is not the one who reads a lot of books, but the one who is the most cunning!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: The Fred Perry Wimbledon Game
description:
Game Components:
A 45 card Stroke Pack.
A 14 card Service Pack.
A miniature Lawn Tennis Court
A wooden tennis ball.
Summary cards (4) for selecting cards to be played.
Rule Book.

From the Rulebook:
Wimbledon has been devised by lawn tennis experts as the first ever realistic lawn tennis card game. The scoring and object of the game are exactly the same as for a real game of tennis. The rules as to which shots can be played are based on the principles of tennis as played by good players.

name: Hastings 1066
description:
As the Saxons, you command this crucial battle for control of your land! You fight off the relentless Norman attacks as they seek the victory that would begin centuries of French-speaking kings and nobles controlling all of England.

Two players battle each other by aligning their cards that represent their units into battle columns. Your choice of battle formations will decide who wins the field that day. The Saxon player's army is led by Harold Godwinson (King Harold II). While the Norman's army is led by William of Normandy, later known as William the Conqueror because he was lucky enough to survive and win the battle. Will you be so lucky?

The object of the game is to force the enemy to flee or wipe them out.

This game uses a “virtual board”. Two “sides” of the board are supplied, which helps players visualize the central area of the board where the game actually takes place. The players’ troops (cards) outline the shape of the board.

The battle takes place on a grid divided into six columns and seven rows. The rows are shown on the “side” pieces.

The battlefield for each side has 3 opposing sectors and each sector has two columns. You win by breaking two opposing sectors.

If all break in the same player’s turn, Saxons win! You gain a “Major victory” if you also kill the opposing leader and yours is alive. It is a “Minor victory” if your leader is dead, or if both leaders survive.

Game Components:
Box
Rules
1 Die
16 wooden cubes
2 Game Board Sides
2 Leader Pawns
55 Cards broken down as follows:
20 Saxon Unit Cards representing Housecarles, Thegns, and Fyrds.
20 Norman Unit Cards representing Cavalry, Archers, and Infantry
15 Battle Event Cards

Complexity: 2 of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 2 of 10
Playing Time: 30 minutes
Players: 2
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Takayama
description:
Takayama is a dexterity game to play alone or with unlimited players. The goal is to build the highest mountains by stacking the various pieces of wood, measuring them and summing these measurements to reach 100 cm. The first player to reach 100 cm or more wins.

Each player builds his mountain during turn by turn. The smallest player starts. In front of him, he places the base of the mountain (wooden board) and the tokens with the symbols facing down. He randomly turns a first token, takes the piece of wood with the corresponding symbol and places it on the wooden base. The player has the right to place it on the position he chooses, but only on the edge ! This is the first part of the mountain.
Next, he turns a second token, places once again the corresponding piece of wood on the previous piece and continues to build his mountain. The player may, at any time, decide to continue or interrupt his construction. If the player is satisfied with his mountain, he stops, measures its height and writes down the score. The next player can start. If, on the other hand, the player continues and his construction collapses, his score will be zero for that round and the turn of the next player begins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Stacking and Balancing

name: Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 5 - Set 2
description:
Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 5 - Set 2 is a complete starter set for Car Wars: the basic rules, counters and components, and two cars. The cars are Stinger vs. Firecracker (with each have modifications). Division 5 duels allow a total of $5,000 for a vehicle. The Car Wars Turning Key included in the set is especially helpful.

Part of the Car Wars (Fifth Edition) Series.

Expands:

Car Wars (Fifth Edition)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Goal Pro Soccer
description:
From the site:

Goal Pro Soccer is a dice/chart/fast action card simulation of Pro Soccer. With this game, you can replay current MLS teams or English Premier League teams or seasons from the past. Witness such greats as Pele, Franz Beckenbauer, Clint Mathis, Landon Donovan, Carlos Valderamma, Sir Stanley Matthews, Johan Cruyff, Gordon Banks, Cobi Jones, Robbie Fowler, Michael Owen, Fabien Barthez, Tim Howard as they take the field on your tabletop. Play classic matchups such as the recent World Cup Final between Germany and Brazil....can Ronaldo repeat his two goal performance or can Oliver Kahn shut out the Brazilians and take the prize back to Germany???? Or replay the whole tournament and see if longshots such as Senegal, South Korea or the US can go all the way.

All the action is here....from the shots and goals, to highlight saves, to the fouls and bookings to corner kicks and a few wild events that make "The Beautiful Game", the most popular game in the world. A game should take no more than 25 minutes once mastered and a whole tournament can be played out in a matter of a few weeks. Most of all, the game is FUN!!!

Several months of developement plus over 50 playtest matches insure that Goal Pro Soccer is one of the most accurate simulations on the market.....best of all.....the price of the game???

It's FREE......Just download the components, print it out on cardstock and you have yourself a game worth playing for hours. It is FREEWARE so if you enjoy it, pass it along to another soccer fan or sports tablegaming buddy.

name: Rithmomachy
description:
Highly complex early European mathematical abstract game which illustrates the number theory of Boëthius. Played by intellectuals and mathematicians between the 10th and 16th centuries and used as a mathematical teaching method.
Rules varied considerably. Rivaled Chess as the premier intellectual game during its heyday.

In 1985, a "modern" game variant basing on the base elements, called Rythmo, was published.

Online Play


Boardspace.net (real-time, AI option)


Mobile Apps

Boardspace.net local multiplayer or online, IOS
Boardspace.net local multiplayer or online, Android

name: 200 Jahre Montgolfieren
description:
"200 Years of Hot Air Balloons" commemorates the bicentennial of the 1783 first balloon ascent by the Montgolfier brothers.

The board is circular and divided into ten concentric rings. Twenty-four "spokes" combine with them to form a grid. Players each have a wooden balloon which shows its altitude by stacking it up, insecurely it seems, on small wooden disks. They also receive at start four ascent cards and four descent (gas bottle) cards. A wooden arrow on a disk at the center shows the current wind direction.

Players move by rolling two dice, a special one which describes a change in wind direction or a requirement on the player and an ordinary one which gives the amount to move. There are actually three games in one, all centered around getting a balloon to a specific location, the first two based on real life balloonist games: a chase or "fox hunt" and a target race. The third scenario describes a race to the center of the board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trade In
description:
You start by buying a car at the dealership.

- You can get insurance, buy extras or get a road service plan at the time
- There are five different car models to choose from every time
- You buy at list price, sell at book value or trade up at the upgrade price

You "drive" the car around in any direction, just obeying basic traffic rules.

- You can choose to move forward, at normal or high speed, or go in reverse, on every play
- You can pass other cars or make "U" turns, where permitted
- You can park your vehicle at home or at the dealership and skip your turn to play
- You try to steer clear of accidents, because they cost you money and you may get traffic tickets
- You try to avoid tickets for speeding at the police station or the school zone

You try to make money, save it and reinvest it.

- If traffic allows, you can drive home every time you need to collect money from business
- You avoid the risk of getting traffic tickets that will cost money to clear
- You can buy insurance for your car to protect you in case of accidents
- You can buy extras, or upgrades for your car, to increase its resale value
- You can get a road service plan so you don't have to pay for repairs along the way

You trade your car up, whenever you can afford it, or down whenever you need the cash.

- You can stay with an older model and wait to buy the latest model at list price, paying in a lump sum
- Or you can pay the upgrade price and get a step-up upgrade as soon as you have the money
- Or you can also sell your car for the book value and buy an older model to get cash

You win when you are the first player to drive home the latest model car!
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Negotiation, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Touché-Coulé infrarouge
description:
This latest evolution of the antique Battleship game (the French name would translate as "Infrared Battleship", I guess) seems to be available only in France, Belgium and French Canada so far --I've yet to see an English version.

The two Battleship display boxes have been replaced by full-fledged computers with an infrared link. The game features sound effects, it talks, it recognizes vocal commands. (I'm not sure if it can be networked to play with more than two --too bad if it can't!) Besides the standard Battleship rules, it allows advanced twists like scouting planes and the like --all made possible by the electronic referee.
publishers: MB Giochi, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley

name: Sail Away
description:
A game of yacht racing, and an interesting precursor to 3M's Regatta. Sail Away was possibly designed by Howard J. Mullin as he is listed as the copyright holder on the game board.

Sail Away is played on a board resembling a nautical chart overlaid by a square grid. The game includes six metal yachts numbered 1 through 6. The yachts lean to one side or the other according to their tack. The yachts are moved across the map using the intersections of the grid lines.

Movement is governed by a spinner which has an inner and outer circle of results - one circle for the upwind leg, and the other circle for the downwind and crosswind legs. In addition to the bit of luck injected by the spinner (reflecting the vagaries of the wind), there is also a slight chance for misfortune - two small spaces on the spinner allow for a player to lose a turn for having a man overboard and two turns for capsizing. The rules also cover blanketing effects by windward yachts toward leeward yachts, tacking, and jibing.

The course is somewhat fixed in that the wind direction is always the same (southeast) and there are three course markers designated on the map. However, there are four different courses that may be run: counterclockwise around the triangular course described by the three markers, clockwise around the triangular course, around course marker 2 and back, or around course marker 3 and back. In addition, players may choose to race one lap or multiple laps.

name: Fluster
description:
Fluster: Parker Brothers Cross-up Word Game

Each player is given a pad of game sheets, each sheet containing two 5x5 grids. Each square of each of the grids contains a number from 1-25, randomly distributed. Each player, in turn, calls out a letter and a number. All of the players then write that letter in a square with the given number, in either the left or right grid, attempting to create words in the grids. after the grids have been filled, the scores are tallied, with each valid word being worth 1 point per letter.
